Reviews.Title: “will never go back, not up to marriott standards”
Reviews.Author: stregis_11
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week using my timeshare for a convention, the hotel is located in a good location my issue was the staff and the studio rooms. There are two wings, the newer ones and the older ones. The older ones are really in need of renovation. Very run down, we had 5 rooms so we had a little of everything. The 2 bedroom rooms in the older wing are much better I think it's just the hotel studio rooms get much more use. The new wing was decent, beds are the best part of this hotel which is a very big plus. I rated this a two instead of a 1 only because a manager after he lied to me allowed me to pay for a half day stay after he told me someone was checking in. Then he tried to give me a guilt trip telling me that I was responsible for having his next guests wait for their room. Un real! I was lied to on 3 separate occasions by the front desk staff, I asked for a late checkout and to extend my stay a couple of more days. in all 3 cases they told me someone was checking in, when I offered to pay they said no problem and all of a sudden these rooms were no longer booked. Amazing, This hotel has a mandatory 8:30am bang on your door policy to make sure you're awake and out by 10am. we had 5 separate rooms and we checked in and out throughout the week and in every room this happened. If you must stay here get the one or two bedroom

Reviews.Title: “Everything Beat Expectations!”
Reviews.Author: thetravelingfamily12
Reviews.Content: Our family just returned from a 20 + hour drive home from Marriott's Grande Vista in Orlando. Normally I would not be writing a review of my stay so soon, but this resort deserves a great review right away. We stayed in a rennovated 3 bedroom lockoff overlooking the lake and the accomodations were superb! The grounds are absolutely beautiful and the staff works extremely hard to keep them that way. Every staff member we encountered was friendly, helpful and kind. As they would pass in their little golf carts they would seeminly go out of their way to offer a wave or hello, helping us to feel welcome. The pools, fitness center, scheduled activities and resort all beat our expections! If you are wondering if you should stay at Marriott's Grande Vista, wonder no more, you will not be disappointed. The resort is set back off of busy International Drive in a secluded quiet area. The location is very convienent to Disney, Universal and most all Orlando has to offer. We had the unit for a full seven days and only left the property one day to visit a water park, otherwise we just relaxed and enjoyed all the ammenities of this wonderful resort. My family only had one complaint, the taste of the tap water, nothing a couple cases of bottled water couldn't cure. Give Marriott's Grande Vista a try, you will be pleased, if you enjoy great timeshare accomodations on beautiful grounds.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely and Very Welcoming to Family of Six”
Reviews.Author: mst2cute
Reviews.Content: When I walked in I got friendly faces and smiles, like these people love their jobs or either some greats actors either way I knew I was in a good place cause of great vibes I could feel. A SMILE GOES A LONG WAY. ROOM was in great condition. Pools were fun. Kids loved this place. It was very homey for them the environment nice people good clean fun. We plan on returning soon this time we will definitely make a note to give ourselves 2 days extra just to enjoy the entire resort. GREAT CHOICE FOR PEOPLE WHO ARE LOOKING FOR A GREAT VACATION WITH GREAT SERVICE. stayed three nights and wished we had stayed a fourth but our room was already booked for the extra nite our fault. Go enjoy this place you'll get your money's worth!

Reviews.Title: “Favorite Place while in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: Lexe32
Reviews.Content: This is our 3rd visit to the Grand Vista and will definitely go back. We were in Bldg. 87 which was close to one of the pools but not to the exercise room. Staff is very accommodating. We stayed in a one bedroom villa for a week and have no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Paul M
Reviews.Content: I visited the Grande Vista a few months ago and stayed in a villa with my girlfriend. Every single one of our needs was met with open arms by the staff here. Along with the beautiful views you will find tons of shops as well. All around it is a great facility but as noted in other reviews a car is necessary to escape if need be. No kids for us but if you do have children it has facilities to keep them occupied as well, i.e. pool. hottub, games, etc. Will be coming back!

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation rental!”
Reviews.Author: SCP60745
Reviews.Content: I rented a timeshare at the Marriott GV after staying in the hotel the previous year. This is a wonderful venue. Well kept grounds, lovely pools, and the units are well maintained. Orlando is busy and hectic but it is always good to return to the MGV after a long day. Decent restaurant on premises (Nick's Grille) and close to everything. Great spot for families and friends!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, beautiful property”
Reviews.Author: JMJ024
Reviews.Content: We have been to this property 5 times. The location is convenient to Disney, Sea World and Universal. The 2 bedroom suites are convenient for families. The Nick Faldo 9 hole golf course is beautifully maintained and wraps around the property. There are main pools and 2 smaller pools. We are MVC owners, but keep coming back to this property because of its resort-like atmosphere compared to other places we have stayed in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific stay, perfect for our family”
Reviews.Author: suesyd
Reviews.Content: The 2-bedroom villa provided more than enough room for our family of 5. We had a king bed in our room, and the kids shared the second bedroom on another king bed and a pull-out (large) couch. The long couch in the middle living room also pulled out, as well as there was an extra day bed in our bedroom, so we also had plenty of space for friends who visited overnight. Our bedroom had a large jacuzzi and sink attached to the bedroom, then another separate bathroom with sink, shower and toilet. The second bedroom had an attached small kitchen, including sink and fridge, as well as its own separate bathroom with sink and tub/shower. Both bedrooms also had their own balconies, which looked out over the parking lot. This was unfortunate, but what it was overshadowed by the fact that our room was in the main building of the resort, which made it very easy for me to go down to the on-site store to pick up in-the-moment needed items like coffee, noodles for swimming, anything you'd need. It was very convenient for us. The layout of the place was important too. You walk in to the villa and there's the kitchen. It's attached to the living room, including a large tv. To the right of the living room was our separate bedroom and bathroom, and to the left was the kids' room and bathroom. It was SO nice to have such a huge space to stay in for the week we were there. At night we (parents) could hang out in the living room while the kids enjoyed a movie in their own separate room. We would definitely go this route again. Also, the proximity to SeaWorld was perfect. Given that SeaWorld offers a free ticket for every one-day ticket bought, we could pretty much come and go throughout the day if we wanted since it was so close to our villa. The Disney scene was close enough for us to have enjoyed it while we were there, but also far enough away to enjoy our own space when we weren't. February weather was great too. A great time overall!

Reviews.Title: “Great Property”
Reviews.Author: lhs1
Reviews.Content: Always stay at the Marriott Grande Vista when coming to Orlando. Close to all major attractions but a car is needed. There is a room type and area of the property to accommodate everyone's liking. The main pool area and actiities for children and families, pool bar and cafe in another area, golf course bordering rooms. The Marketplace and Pizza shops have all the extras to supplement your visit, and Nicks for great food. The staff is very helpful and the property is immaculate. When there are many guests the pool chairs do fill up quickly and you may not be able to have a parking spots right in front of your building. But we all could use a little exercise, yes?

Reviews.Title: “Amazing, family-friendly vacation”
Reviews.Author: Etobicoke_Family
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week's stay and found this resort had all we needed. The suite (a one bedroom) was huge, clean and modernly furnished. The pools were in great condition, spacious, and a hit with the kids. Our kids loved the indoor play structure. The on-site activities offered something for everyone. And the location was perfect for our needs -- close to SeaWorld and close to Route 528 which connects to the Airport. The staff was friendly and always helpful. Unlike some other reviewers, we knew that booking a suite with a full kitchen means we had the option eating in. (The review that complained about buying groceries made no sense, IMHO.) That said, we frequently ate pool side, or take-out, or at Nick's Grill. All were excellent. We have stayed at many different hotels and resorts in Florida and other U.S. holiday destinations, and Grande Vista is at the top of our list. PS - We had a ground-floor unit close to the reception area. An excellent choice. We can't comment on the reviews that say the poolside units are noisy, but that would not be surprising.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for families!”
Reviews.Author: northgrrl
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at this resort, we were primarily using it as a rest stop from our other activities in the Orlando area and found it in a good location for this purpose. The pool was also open until 11, so we were able to theme park it all day then have a relaxing swim when we got back. The gym was well equipped, but pretty crowded. Nick's Grill was a great place for a nice meal. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The Verdict is Still NOT In !”
Reviews.Author: NYC_Pat_C
Reviews.Content: My next door neighbor is a Time Share owner at this property and gave me and my family a week stay at the Grande Vista. We stayed a few days in February. I LIKED the Grande Vista but didnt LOVE it. Maybe its because Im not a complete fan of the whole "time share" thing. Who really wants to go away and still have to grocery shop, cook and clean behind themselves. For me, vacations mean being on vacation COMPLETELY ! We stayed in a 2 bedroom suite and traveling with kids...things get messy pretty quick. With that said, i called the front desk to request that the room/s be serviced and the housekeeping kindly told me that there was no one available to clean the room and she would try to put it on the list for tomorrow or the following day. WOW !!!! 2 days to get some service thats a bit excessive. I also found everything to be too far from our building (Building 87). The hotel boasts of all these pools and restaurants and activities and EVERYTHING is so far. I was hestitant to let the kids go the pool or store because I really couldnt keep an eye on them so it was either I go with them or them waiting until I was ready to walk with them. Also everything did look new in the rooms..i.e bedding, appliances,furniture but we did find some of the spare sheets/linen in the closets to be DIRTY ;-( And the so called 90 minute presentation.... it lasted FOREVER.... I really dont think the hotels should ask people to do this... IF I LIKE WHAT I SEE WHEN I STAY THERE I WILL SEEK YOU OUT TO GET IN ON THE ACTION.. I dont need someone ramming the property and everything Marriot Vacation Club has to offer down my throat when the hotell really isnt all that it could be. I think if I wouldve paid for the hotel stay...my overall rating wouldve been poor versus average.

Reviews.Title: “We love the Grande Vista !”
Reviews.Author: bear43
Reviews.Content: We had been at the Grande Vista with my son, daughter-in-law and grandchildren( 4 and 2) in 2010. Although it was one of the coldest winters ever in Florida, we had some pool time but the kids were thrilled to have the Maze and plenty of room in the villa to spread out when we weren't at a park.We were lucky enough to have warm weather and the(now) 6 and 4 year old spent alot of time in the water. It's just perfect for familes and my wife and I had some great grandparent time while their parents spent some relaxing time at the poolside bars. Everything about the Grande Vista was perfect for our needs.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time at Grand Vista”
Reviews.Author: PSU85
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week at the Grand Vista and I was very pleased with the property. In the interest of full disclosure, I am an owner there but had not been there in probably 6 years. I was very pleased to see how well everything is being maintained and the overall condition of the property. The landscapers were out every day cleaning up leaves and pruning bushes and trees. Our unit was very clean when we arrived and everything in it was in very good condition. All the staff that we came in contact with were extremely pleasant and helpful. Even though the weather was a little cool, my son enjoyed the pools and hot tubs. The on-site store is wonderful and very fairly priced. The location is excellent - easy access to the I-drive attractions and only a few minutes to all the Disney areas. I would highly recommend the property to anyone with or without kids.

Reviews.Title: “Orlando Oasis”
Reviews.Author: ayuh
Reviews.Content: Well maintained/managed resort. Enjoyed multiple pools(lap,recreational,wading,jacuzzi),fitness facility over looking lake,games,volley ball,just walking around the lush grounds was pleasant. Complementary USA Today, on site small store,outdoor grill areas,gated parking,tennis, small rental boats and golf. Shared 3 bedroom/3 bath with two outside areas and fully equipped kitchen. Clean. Flat screens x4. Could have(and in hind sight should have) easily lazed around here for entire vacation stay and passed on the 4 theme park days.(ok, Harry Potter was neat....but that's another review). Large property.

Reviews.Title: “Whether a Runner or not; you'll love Marriott Grande Vista”
Reviews.Author: Briggsie99
Reviews.Content: If you are planning a trip to Disney World; consider staying at the Mariott Grande Vista. It gives you the option of sitting by the amazing pool, using the paddle boats, golfing, awesome kid's game room, beautiful 2 bedroom units overlooking a beautiful lake and more. We find you usually don't want to spend everyday at Disney World or Universal Studios. We like just hanging out and guys usually play golf. The days we go to Disney or Universal; it's a short trip and basically the Vacation Club is close to everything. It's a great place and we are planning on going back in 2013 for the Disney Marathon. Our whole family is going again. A couple of them are doing the Goofy Race; which is 1/2 Marathon one day and Full Marathon the next. Frankly if you run Marathons; Disney is the best we have found!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: rich8453
Reviews.Content: Beautiful grounds. Great place if you don't mind dogs being walked with pooper scoopers and it is NOT a smoke free property. The 2 bed 2 bath vacation club villa was very spacious and comfortable. The pools were clean and well maintained. The staff was very friendly. Overall it was very clean. As a Marriott VC owner, I have stayed in more than a few. This rates quite high as most do. Nick's Grill on the property is pleasant and pretty good but overpriced. The place is great for golfers with a golf course next door which some of the rooms overlook. No swim up bar and no real good places to eat on the premises. Try to get a room overlooking the lake as what location you have makes a difference. It was really nice and conveniently located. Overall I preferred the Grand Ocean in Hilton Head and certainly my home resort in Aruba but if you are going the Disney route, this is a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not Up to Par”
Reviews.Author: choicepursuits
Reviews.Content: As a very frequent Marriott sleeper, this property fell below my expectations. The biggest problem was with check-in and accounting after my stay. Staff in both departments made major errors on my bill - assigning my room to another person and assigning another person's room to my credit card. I was overcharged $2200, had to make contact to get a credit. It has taken me 3 weeks to get a copy of the correct invoice for my stay. As a business traveler, I'll never stay here again because of the poor attention to financial details.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice but no room service...”
Reviews.Author: ChrisNCarly
Reviews.Content: We booked a one bedroom for 2 nights in Bldg 81 on the 4th floor. Our view was amazing....right between the lake and pool! The room was very clean and recently renovated! Had a full kitchen with anything you would need to make a meal...we saw they had a cookie sheet so we were able to make cookies one evening! The pillows and bed were not the best so I would recommend bringing your own pillow for sure! The only down side was there was no room service....the only thing was a pizza hut on site or you could go to one of their restaraunts and get something to-go. We did eat at the pool side cafe one evening and it was very good. There were a ton of activities planned throughout the day for kids and adults...we did not have time for those because our trip was to visit the theme parks. For the rate of $145 (florida resident) it was a GREAT value!

Reviews.Title: “Love this resort”
Reviews.Author: AmyKMinnesota
Reviews.Content: Just finished a week at Grande Vista and loved it. I've stayed here many times in the past and have yet to have a bad experience. Room location is a big deal to me. I call a few weeks out and cross my fingers. We were arriving late so I phoned before I left home in the am. I spoke directly with the room coordinator, she couldn't give me an actual room number but assured me I was getting close to what I wanted. We checked in about 9pm and I got the exact room I wanted. I was shocked and had to call thank the coordinator ASAP. So if you take the time you can generally get what you want. I like bldg 79 because of its proximity to the west village pool. There are newer refurbished bldgs but I enjoy the west village. I enjoy this property and stay here each year.

Reviews.Title: “A Disney Vacation”
Reviews.Author: nyrxman
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently took a Disney "vacation" with my daughter and granddaughter. During the planning process we looked at several options; staying at a Disney property, staying in a local hotel, or using Marriott Vacation Club's new destination points program to stay in a time share near the Disney properties. We opted for the last option for a number of reasons. While staying at a Disney property package is probably the easiest option because it includes all the transportation to and from the Disney properties, it is also the most costly, which is big negative for most families. Another negative is that if you do not take a Disney package, you cannot have access to the Disney meal plan, which is extra but pretty good. So if you want to pay handsomely for convenience, then taking one of the Disney vacation packages is the way to to. We decided to stay off site at the Marriott Grand Vista, which is basically part of the Marriott Vacation Club timeshare properties. We chose a two bedroom suite. The property and physical layout is similar to many other MVC properties, although it seemed to me that the second bedroom (the "lockout") was somewhat larger than others we've stayed at. The kitchen working space seemed a bit smaller, but that did not bother us because basically all we had was breakfast every day in the room. What was a little disturbing was the description of the hotel on MVC Web site. One of the major reason we chose this site over some others in Orlando was the hotel's emphasis about being close to Disney and other attractions. Be be fair, it was very close to Sea World (which was basically down the road and where we spent one day), but getting to any of the Disney Parks on a "Park Hopper" ticket required a car ride of approximately 10 minutes without traffic (which during peak hours can get pretty backed up). But since we went the second week in February, the traffic wasn't bad. I figured that the cost savings of staying at the timeshare was worth the inconvenience of driving and parking at the Disney properties every day (parking is $14 a day and you are only charged once regardless of how many Disney parks you visit in one day). The timeshare and many activities and a golf course, but to be fair we used it primarily as a hotel and did not use any of its facilities, which bummed us out a little bit because the grounds were very nice. In fact, we talked about possibly visiting Orlando again without the family and stay just for the facilities at the time share. We found though that many of the people staying here were "Disney tourists" similar to us. Another tip if you are going to stay outside of a Disney property is to shop around for a car. Since there was four of us, we figured we needed a decent size car for all the luggage going to and from the airport. But while traveling to and from the Parks, you really don't need that size of a car, which was a dilemma for us. So I settled on shopping around for a smaller size SUV that could handle four suitcases comfortably. What I found was amazing. I started off finding an SUV for $640 a week with everything included (e.g. tax, and all the other tons of surcharges added to rental cars). As I continued to shop that price dropped from $640 (at Avis) to $245 all in from Enterprise, which I thought was a pretty good price for the 9 days we were there. Staying off Disney property with a car has another advantage in that you can visit a number of other sites and amusement areas at will. With a Disney package, since you spend much more for your vacation, you feel almost obligated to use all of the Disney facilities, which quite frankly after a while can get a bit tiresome. We had a great time and this timeshare property delivered a comfy homelike place to stay for the 9 days we were there. I would easily recommend it to any family visiting Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Just the Right Everything!”
Reviews.Author: Sydneygirl22
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our stay at this property! It was just the right distance from Disney and Universal. Not much traffic coming or going. The property was clean and very comfortable. Nice mattresses on the beds which is needed after spending 8 -10 hours at Disney and the other parks daily! The furniture looked and felt new...nice color scheme. Our property had a beautiful view of the lake and fountain. The walk way to the pools is always spotless and the areas around the pools were the same. The pools were clean and so enjoyable for the young anf old alike. Having a pizza parlor onsite was so nice after a long day and the ice cream parlor finished the day off with smiles for all. We did go to the arcades with the kids and as an adult, I even enjoyed it. As for the gym, didn't get to use it this time but I did see many that seemed to be getting a good workout at different times of the day and night. Did not use their spa either this trip. Had a great meal at the onsite restaurant which was walking distance. I would pick this resort to stay at again without hesitation!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Africa55
Reviews.Content: I really did not know what to expect when I booked this hotel, but could not have been more impressed!! We booked a one bedroom villa, which is a must for anyone staying with kids! We had a separate bedroom, bathroom, living room and fully equipped kitchen - with washer & dryer! Everything was new and clean. The location is outstanding - 10 minutes to Disney and 2 minutes to Sea World. About 5 minutes to the Convention Center and great restaurants. This hotel is incredible value for money, the service is great and by far the best Marriott I have stayed at!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: sunflower7777
Reviews.Content: Very nice, clean resort with all the amenities one needs for a family. Not the closest to Disney but not too far either.

Reviews.Title: “Two Thumbs Up!”
Reviews.Author: steady
Reviews.Content: My family of five stayed here for 4 nights over President's Week. We are not Marriott Vacation Club owners, however we are Marriott Rewards members. We took advantage of a Marriott Rewards offer of 20% off their Leisure Rate (normally $309 per night) for a rate of $247 per night. I came upon this property on Tripadvisor. We have relatives in Orlando and have stayed in numerous places over the last twenty years. And this one is a keeper!! We drove through the entry at 11:00 PM after a late flight. In the dark, the place looked beautiful. Check-in was swift and the man at the desk was very friendly, giving me a map of the property and explaining many of the things that the resort offers. The Grande Vista is huge - it has lots of condo type buildings that are six stories high. We had a 2 bedroom villa and it was lovely. It had a master bedroom with king-sized bed, jacuzzi tub and separate walk-in shower, 2 sinks with granite tops, own screened-in lanai with table and 4 chairs, flat screened tv and chaise. It also had a second bedroom with two queen beds, tv, own lanai, and beautiful bathroom. It also had a nice updated kitchen with granite tops, stools, dining area with table and 6 chairs, and lovely living room area with tv and sofabed. The place was clean, nicely decorated, and super quiet. We were given toiletries each day and a complimentary box of Tide to use the stackable washer and dryer. Because we were paying a nightly rate we received housekeeping (making the beds, tidying, swapping out the towels, etc.). I think it may be different for the timeshare owners. The place is a walker's paradise. They have a nature trail that is 1.9 miles that I used one morning. Another morning I just walked around the massive grounds. The property has 4 pools - we used two and they were both very niceand had ample lounges for the guests. They also have grills for guests' use - gas and charcoal. We had lunch at the pool one day and found the food to be good quality and priced reasonably for a resort pool. We also ate at their restaurant (Nick's Grill) twice. We had a great breakfast with omelettes and Belgian waffles one morning. We also had dinner and it was great (we weren't expecting it to be that good either) Service at the restaurant was fabulous too. They have tennis courts, a basketball court (my son rented a free ball for a while), boats for rent (pedal and motored), a Butterfly Garden, a Spa, etc. We also went to their on-site ice cream store once. The resort was located just off International Drive, near Central Fl Pkwy and close to SeaWorld. We found the location to be convenient for Disney and Universal Parks. They gave me a free gift that I never claimed because I was afraid of the timeshare sales pitch. But no one ever hassled us about that and it was nice. So, to sum it up, from a person who has traveled to Orlando a lot, this place was wonderful!!

Reviews.Title: “2nd stay at Grand Vista”
Reviews.Author: DonnaMari525
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd stay at the Marriott Grand Vista. We were here in July of 2011 and absolutely loved it. We had a 2 bedroom villa in July and it was very clean and updated. We loved the grounds and the pools so much too. We just returned from our 2nd stay there and were a little disappointed. It was not quite as good as our stay in July. We had a very late flight and arrived at the resort after midnight. Check in was smooth and easy, however once we drove to our assigned room, there wasn't a parking spot to be found anywhere. We drove up and down, back & forth and finally found a spot 4 buildings away. This was horrific. We now had to drag all our luggage 4 buildings down and 5 floors up (yes, there is an elevator) This was the only time parking was an issue. They were repaving the parking lots so this is what caused the issue. To start out with, we had a 1 bedroom this time around. We again asked for a refurbished room. The front desk told us it was refurbished in 2008 so we figured it would be fine. The room was okay. It was much more worn looking than our room in July and not quite as clean. The countertops were not clean to the touch and the bathroom sink was gritty and had soap scum in it. Obviously, this did not make me happy as I felt that I had to clean before I unpacked. For some reason, we were given a handicapped equiped room and the bathroom shower had bars and a seat in it. The shower leaked all over the bathroom floor as there was nothing to stop the water from spilling in the bathroom. The shower had no lip on it at all and the shower curtain did absolutely nothing so everyday we had to roll up pool towels before we took showers to avoid the entire floor from becoming soaked. This was a real hassel as we were constantly dealing with large soaked bath towels. Everything else was fine in the room. I do really enjoy the Grand Vista. The grounds are beautiful, the pools are outrageous, however this time around my room could have been better. I would definitely return to the grand Vista.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: traveloholic345
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful long weekend at Grand Vista. We really enjoyed the villa, pools, golf and the kids maze! It was a tough decision to leave the hotel and go to a theme park after 2 days in a row. Kevin is a very kind gold instructor and was patient and great with the young children. We can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Nice renovated rooms. Very spread out, housekeeping is an issue”
Reviews.Author: E_Panama
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grande Vista for our disney vacation. We were 2 families, 4 adults and 4 kids under 8. Luckily we had read that we needed to ask for renovated rooms, and we got one. Our two bedroom unit looked brand new, the furniture was very modern, the beds were very comfortable. This was one of the only two-bedroom villas in Orlando with two kind beds, which made all the difference cimpared to queen or double beds,. The hotel was close to everything (if you have a car), and we usually left early in the morning and came back late at night. A couple of issues. First, the housekeeping service lacked a lot. When we got in the room, we actually found a pot stash left by the previous guests, in the top shelf of the kitchen (we threw it out). Then, the third day we came back to the room, and our room (the king bedroom of the two-bedroom unit) had not been made at all. They actually said that because the door was locked, they didn't come in. Mind you, the main door of the unit was open and the connecting room was open. We asked for fresh towels. Then the next day, the room was made, but there wasn't a sing towel in the bathroom! And we also had other issues later on. The convenience store was good enough, we got all the basic groceries there. But hte cafeteria was a very basic counter with a small menu to choose from. Not that great. Finally, you really need a car at this hotel. Just going from your room to the lobby could be a 15-20 minute walk, and the shuttles to the parks would be difficult to schedule around. Overall, for a large family, it's avery good place to stay, although look out for housekeeping issues. And ask for a renovated toom.

Reviews.Title: “Best Marriott Vacation Resort in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: ld5472
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Grande Vista three times now as well as 3 other Marriott vacation club resorts in Orlando. Grande Vista is by far my favorite resort. The only bad thing I can say about this resort is that it is enormous so depending on where you stay it can be a hike to the main pools and food/bar areas. That being said this resort is beautiful. It is clean, up to date and well maintained. Everywhere you go you pass by multiple hotel employees going about their duties, all who are very polite. The pools are gorgeous and have some fun stuff for kids, but quite areas to relax as well. Okay I guess I can say 2 negative things, because of all the Marriott resorts I've stayed at in Orlando this is the only one without a playground?? It does have a huge indoor climbing area called The Maze, similar to what you might find at a chukee cheeses. Itâ€™s a great way to entertain the kids if the weather doesn't cooperate. The resort amenities are also beyond what most of the other Marriott resorts in Orlando offer. They have a sit down pool bar and grill where you can actually go and be served lunch as opposed to other timeshares which offer a "take out" type option at the bars. You can also eat at the pizza hut/fast food area that is for quicker less expensive meals. The resort also has a sit down indoor rest. which I can't comment about since I never ate there, but again something the other resorts don't offer. There are activities for kids, but not a ton. There is however plenty to keep them entertained throughout the days. The resort itself is just beautiful, clean and family friendlyâ€¦.exactly what you would expect from a Marriott. I will certainly be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: ktdimples
Reviews.Content: Had a great time here. Copa Loca Bar was fun; kind of pricey, but I guess for the area prices were in line. Ate at Nick's Grill for breakfast. It was delicious and price was very reasonable. Room was clean. Bed was kind of hard - wish we could have been closer to a pool, but the walking was good for us.

Reviews.Title: “What A Great Resort!”
Reviews.Author: vacationsamany
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Grand Vista Several times and love it! It's a large resort so ask for a water view. We had six rooms and all of them was perfect every room looked brand new! They are always updating this resort so not all towers were available but we had rooms in three different towers and not one complaint. Copa Loca has really great food! We watched the superbowl outside right at the pool it was fun, even when it rained, they brought out towels for everyone! Bartenders and servers all want to make sure your having a great time. Drinks reasonable food was also priced right. The gounds are spectacular, groomed perfectly. Two Large pools very clean, sauna outside next to pool was also nice. Small sandy area for volleyball was also fun to hang out. Faldos golf course is the best exective course in the country. Leave your clubs at home the rentals are the best you can find. They equip you with balls, tees everything to make it a fun afternoon. Staying on property gives you a discount too. Nicks was also really good. Not to stuffy but you can dress up if you want to and still fit in. Ask about the nightly fish specials both times they were great!

Reviews.Title: “Great resort”
Reviews.Author: Creeker2010
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at the Grand Vista and we were very pleased. We booked a 1-bedroom suite through Interval International. The suite had a full kitchen, stocked with dishes, pans and cooking utensils, and spacious dining/living room. The separate bedroom/bath (with whirlpool tub) worked well for sleepers on different schedules. The grounds are just gorgeous, maintained beautifully, with lots of room for walkers/runners. Spectacular views of the lake, golf course, swimming pools et. wherever you go. There's even a beach - well, a patch of sand next to the lake. Nice gym with modern equipment, on site restaurants, groceries, and (of course) bars. If you're a go-go-go vacationer who likes to video chat on your cell phone while riding a zip line over an active volcano, the Grand Vista won't satisfy you. Our objective was to read a few books, soak up some sun, and explore the Orlando area so it was perfect for us. Some of the issues cited in other reviews sounded familiar: the TV is difficult to use, the wifi connection occasionally stops working, probably due to overloading. But you really have to work hard to find things wrong at this resort, and the occasional annoyances are quickly overwhelmed by the many things that are just so darned good. We'd return to Grand Vista in a hearbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful”
Reviews.Author: PrincessPro
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a business trip and had a large suite (living room, kitchen, separate bedroom). It was spotless, ever so comfortable, and my only complaint is that I wasn't able to stay longer! Beautiful property, great service at check-in, and exceptional care by the manager when we had a minor mix-up with rooms. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “The Old Lady is wh at she once was!”
Reviews.Author: dsmken
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Grand Vista every January, or February, since 1996. We are now completing a four week visit during which we have been in four different apartments. Several of the apartments have foam mattresses which are too large for the fitted sheets, or is it the other way around? In any case the sheets come loose from the mattress in a night or two. Marriott has, like most hotel chains, adopted heavy comforters for their bedding which are much too warm for tropical climes, unless you turn the thermostat to 68 degrees, or lower. If you do this you might wonder why you are coming to Florida. Marriott claims to be going green so you may wonder why they don't encourage less air conditioning??? To save paper (or money) they have dispensed with daily delivery of the 'USA Today' directly to the rooms. Instead, they require that we trek to the main office, which can be as much as 0.3 miles distance. However, during the first two weeks of my stay they were out of papers by 10 AM. almost every day. A visit with the management resulted in them holding a copy in the office just for me. Too bad about the others who have not made special arrangements. We have had several visits from the maintenance personell regarding the use of the TV sets. They have installed fine flat screen TVs with DVD players; but after a year still do not have instructions for their use in their "Vacation Experience Guide". Their suggestion is to call for instruction! As a topper, the TV's channel guide does not include the new HD stations, therefore you have no idea what's playing! Marriott has not yet figured out how to provide a good night's sleep for an adult on one of their convertable couches, at least for a good sized adult. It's little wonder. As couches they sag in the middle and are extremely difficult to sit in, or get out of. During this four week stay we have also experienced doing without the only elevator for a day. We've had two toilets stopped up by normal useage, had a telephone replaced and reported lights burned out. (Do you begin to share our concern for the aging of the facility and lack of attention to interior maintenance?) From a positive viewpoint...... The location is excellent, the grounds are beautiful and well maintained. The lake is pretty, as is the golf course and the Tuesday evening entertainment with the dueling piano's is great. It's just a shame that Marriott is losing sight of being a provider of a comfortable residence.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort , but not perfect.”
Reviews.Author: Caniac
Reviews.Content: This is our 4th visit to the Grande Vista. I am writing this review from our villa. I know many reviews have been written and although the resort has a Wow factor upon arrival, the reviews should be better, one would think. Marriott just needs to make a few changes to give this resort a better showing at Tripadvisor. We are Marriott owners at two other resorts and so this was a trade. We tried to get into Cypress Harbour ( our favorite) but no room there for this week. I like this resort very much but have not had the same consistent service from the staff as at Cypress Harbour. That is what gives this resort a lower rating. It mostly comes from the front desk upon ck in, spending on who you get. I called 3 months ago to put in my request for the building we wanted.....we like to be near the Copa Loca outdoor poolside restaurant. Any of those buildings will have a panoramic view of the lake with the fountain or the pool. You need to look at their map. This time we requested the newest building, #77, or #78, right next to it. We thought it would be nice to be in the newest units, thinking they would be in the best working order. We own 2 bdrm units at our other resorts so that is what we requested. The agent at the front desk was very nice and saw my request on the reservation asking to be in either #78 or 77 and ABOVE the 2nd floor in order to have great views of the lake. She said she had a lakefront unit for us on the 2nd floor. I asked if there were any units above the first floor.....she then promptly put us on the 5th floor upon the 2nd request.....great.....you just have to ask twice, I realized to get the upper floor. Our 2 bdrm villa was beautiful upon arrival, but there was a strong smell of fresh paint and we had to open the patio doors to air it out. The building had recently undergone a soft goods renovation. Building 78 next door is undergoing a renovation right now, so there is occasional noise from hammers and workers hauling things or power washing. the view is spectacular from our terrace, so no complaints there. The difference between buildings # 77 and 78 are the second bedroom suites. They do not have the lock off feature. They do have a balcony. The biggest problem for us are the new mattresses Marriott is installing in the units when they refurbish. They are VERY hard and no pillow tops or memory foam as in the past. Also, the pillows are way too soft...no choices of pillows as before. The 2nd thing is that they no longer deliver a USA TODAY newspaper to your door each wk day morning. they told me that in an attempt to go "green", they are only offering the newspaper at the front desk now or in their Marketplace store. I understand this, however, this is a very large property and a long walk for some people, especially seniors. My suggestion to them would be to at least have a newspaper stand by each elevator . Minor issue: the hand towel racks in the bathrooms are placed too low on the wall so that the towels drag on the counter. The safe is not working...needs a new battery or something. So we take our valuables with us each day, based on other reviews I have read of room theft. Also, the master bathroom shower door does not shut properly....I mention this because on our last trip here, we had the same problem in a different bldg. Other than the above issues, the resort is lovely and so much better than staying in a hotel. the location is so convenient to Disney parks , Sea World and Convention Center. Would I stay here again? Yes, but it would not be my first choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Grande Vista!”
Reviews.Author: WillyT61
Reviews.Content: The Marriott Grande Vista is a wonderful property in a great Orlando location. A central location that is between Universal and the Disney parks, it is literally outside the gates of SeaWorld. Although this is a Marriott Grand Vacations property (timeshare) I got a great rate as a Marriott Rewards member. Not being an owner did not limit our stay in any way - we were welcomed and able to fully participate in all activities. My only regret is that we had planned so many theme parks activities we were unable to spend a lot of time here. My 9 year old son enjoyed every one of the 5 pools - my wife and I enjoyed spending an evening at the poolside bar listening to the Dueling Pianos entertainment (while our son was swimming). Other things not to miss include the Bonfire on the beach, and the old fashioned Ice Cream Parlor (in the lighthouse). Truly a wonderful time for the entire family!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: Jabei
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week with the intention of using it as a base to go to the theme parks. The location is perfect for all the attractions...we had a three bed apartment and the accomodation couldn't have been better. The staff were great amd it was handy to have a little shop on the grounds. Although we really only slept there, we had a walk around one day and the pools seemed nice - the bar was basic but fine and the little cafe place seemed ok. Not sure they would be worth a 5 star review if we had spent more time there but it was perfect for what we wanted. A massive plus was free wireless internet.

Reviews.Title: “How I'd spend every summer vacation...”
Reviews.Author: liliribs
Reviews.Content: Some family had a few extra days of their timeshare here that they weren't able to use, and offered it to us. This resort went above and beyond our expectations. We had a a one bedroom suite, with an adjoining room. I could go on and on about how I loved this place, but I'll just stick to the basics. The rooms themselves were very spacious and clean. There was a full size dining table, and the kitchen was fully equipped for any culinary experiments. We were very glad to have a washer and dryer after the heavy summer rainstorms we were caught in. The bed was amazingly comfortable, and I really loved the giant whirlpool jacuzzi in our suite. The separate bathroom/shower was huge! I should also mention that our suite overlooked the golf course, which was a wonderful view. We took advantage of our patio every morning. Overall, the rooms were very comfortable, open and clean. The actual resort grounds were very vast. There are three different pool areas, and we played at all of them! This resort is very family friendly for all ages. There were kiddy pools that our 1 1/2 year old paddled around in, as well as splash pads and fountains for the non-swimmers. The best part was even though the property of this place is HUGE, there was still a pool right outside our room. Very easy access. And some are a lot less crowded than others. We would go swimming pretty early, and often found we had the entire pool deck to ourselves. It is about a 10 minute drive to Disney, and close to all other attractions. There are plenty of shops and stores within minutes. Overall the location was great. To sum things up, wonderful resort with lots of activities and recreation, great rooms, great service, nice location, all around an awesome place to stay while on vacation. I told my husband I could spend the rest of my summer vacations there!

Reviews.Title: “Great weather great week”
Reviews.Author: JamesJayne
Reviews.Content: What a great home base if you are going to hit the local parks. Sea world is practically next door and there are always a ton of things to do for the kids.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't want to leave”
Reviews.Author: SpringZephyr
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 2 bedroom for one week in Dec. It's a great place to stay. It's a huge resort. Most of the block face the golfing green. We had a view of the green and the lake. I had a few quiet mornings in the balcony. There is a lift to the 4th floor where we were, which is a blessing. We had stayed in other apartments before where we had to walk up, which was no joke with luggage. The apartment is well equipped. It does show some signs of age. But it is well maintained. Unlike the other review, we had no trouble with our wireless internet at all. We were at Building 90, Villa 520. Top floor. It's a quiet block at one end of the resort. December is a good time to go. Weather was great, t-shirt weather. And you don't have the summer crowd.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: Douglas55
Reviews.Content: I love the location of this resort. We stayed for one week in a 3 bedroom unit. The furnishings are definitely above average, my problem would be with routine maintenance and housekeeping. The fan in one of the bedrooms looked and sounded like it was going to fall off, electrical outlet in kitchen didn't work, the door going out to the smaller balcony was off track and hard to open and close. the shower in one of the bedrooms needs some work. I think housekeeping is limited to the amount of time they have to spend cleaning a room, it was obvious someone had spilled a coke on the wall near the bottom the baseboards and it was NASTY, bathroom doors and walls just need to be cleaned a little. It is other wise a great resort and would stay here again. I do find it hard to believe that this is the only unit with little problems, MY BIGGEST COMPLAINT WIRELESS INTERNET, our unit was right above the main check in and the wireless Internet was TERRIBLE.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for Disney or Seaworld”
Reviews.Author: mslater65
Reviews.Content: My wife and I ( we are seniors) spent a week at this resort in January. The resort is huge with a number of buildings, 4 or 5 pools, 9 hole golf course, a couple of restaurants, BBQs and plenty of parking. There's a choice of 3 bedroom, 2 bedroom and 1 bedroom accommodation all with a full kitchen and washer/dryer....or hotel room accommodation. The rooms are well appointed with cutlery, dishes, glasses etc so eating in is an easy option if you feel like it. Our 1 bedroom unit was around 900 sq ft and included two flat screen TVs. The resort is primarily a timeshare facility so don't expect regular maid service unless you want to pay extra. The resort is 5 mins from Seaworld, 10 mins from Disney and 20 mins from the airport. We would definitely return and would consider staying here with our extended family and granchildren.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort”
Reviews.Author: Ozad7880
Reviews.Content: Beautiful resort in all aspects that one would have in a vacation experience. With a family of six, we shared the 3 bedroom suite. Very comfortable and balconies in two rooms. The only downside is that with all the things to do in Orlando, we didn't spend that much time at the resort. This is definately the place to spend two weeks instead of one. As time is so precious, it is not worth the 125 dollars they will give you for a sales presentation. We are Marriott timeshare owners but stayed here through and Interval Exchange.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: aberdeen2009
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mariott Grande Vista from December 30th, 2011 to January 6, 2012, and enjoyed a large 2 bedroom suite. The furniture in the unit was of above average quality (as in most marriott properties). Comfortable beds, comfortable sofa-beds, fully equipped kitchen, several flat screen TVs, well manicured grounds, lots to do on the property including swimming, tennis, paddle boats, etc. Although we did not participate in many of the activities due to our pre-arranged schedule, on all of the elevators, and around the property, there were postings of the daily activities that the guests could participate in. The resort is located within walking distance from Sea World, approximately 15 to 20 minutes from Universal Studios, 25 minutes from Disney World and many other attractions around the Orlando, Florida area. There are several restaurants on the premises (we did not visit any). Right outside of the property (which is rather huge), one can take the local bus (#8), and also another bus straight to the downtown area including the Convention Center. A major Premium Outlet (for shopping) is located exactly within a 10 minute drive from the resort. We had visited that resort many years ago and will definitely return (if possible).

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: shadowace
Reviews.Content: We stayed here January and had a great time,the place was very clean and is located close to everything they have nice clean pool areas and lots of walking areas I would recomend this place to everybody that asks.

Reviews.Title: “Want to feel special?”
Reviews.Author: IVBandit
Reviews.Content: Surround yourself with the beauty of this world class resort. Architecture, landscapes, pools, and hot tubs galore. There is something for everyone here. The rooms are spacious and comfortable. This is the first hotel or resort where I had difficulty filling up the drawer space! Swimming, golf, tennis, Bball, table tennis, pool, paddle boats, kyacks, fishing and an indoor playground for the little kids. Conveniently close to all the theme parks as well. And an exceptionally friendly staff. I truly felt like royalty for the week. My family can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “They want to Do manipulate”
Reviews.Author: lalchile
Reviews.Content: Not worth staying , bathrooms specially potty are dirty, smelly , no cleanes , staff r not that cordial , With the name of Marriott I will put it as a poor . Ask any service , the charge is ready for it. I am disappoint with Marriott . GREAT NAME POOR SHOW

Reviews.Title: “A good place to stay for a family Disney Trip”
Reviews.Author: cseanmc
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the first week in January in a 2 bedroom suite that was booked through our timeshare with Interval. We were a family of 4 with 2 small kids and the two bedroom suite gave us plenty of room. We were on the 6th floor in a newly renovated room in building 79 which overlooked the big swimming pool that also had the outdoor bar called Coco's. The room essentially was a one bedroom suite with an adjoining door to basically a normal type hotel room. The "hotel room" had a king size bed and a fold out couch. It also contained a mini-fridge, coffee maker and toaster. The bathroom was quite small and I would not recommend anymore that 2 people stay in this if you get a basic hotel room here. The connecting 1 bedroom suite was quite large. There was a jacuzzi tub in the bedroom room with a dressing table and the bathroom was large enough for 2 people to get dressed in. It had a large living room with a couch, 2 chairs and a dining room table big enough to seat 6 people. The kitchen contained a full size refrigerator, dishwasher, toaster, microwave, coffee maker, oven / stove top and a washer and dryer. It had basically everything you needed. We basically used the kitchen to make breakfast and pack a lunch for the parks, but there were plenty of utensils and cookware to make dinner. I believe they had a few grills downstairs as well to use. Both bedrooms and the living room had flat screen TV's with some HD channels. We had 2 patios, one of which was screened and the other was not. As several other people said, there is no maid service, but there is a place to take out the trash and it isn't too big of a hassle. They do provide one packet of soap for the washing machine and a couple for the dishwasher. They also have a couple of paper towel rolls and maybe 2 trash bags. We used all of this and had plenty but if you are spending more time in the room you may want to buy some more. The resort itself is huge. Building 79 was across the lake from the main resort so the only time we went to the main area was to check in and check out. We did swim in the huge pool we overlooked the last 2 days in the afternoon. There is a great shallow kids area that is about 2 feet deep that had toys that sprayed water so you young kids can have a place to play safely. We ate at Coco's which is the restaurant / bar at the pool the first night. Typical bar food and it was ok. They do have an outside bar there that has 5 or 6 beers on tap and TV's to watch sports on. For Sunday night football they had a huge inflatable TV they broadcast the game on by the pool. We also at one night at Nick's which is the golf course grill. We bought a $50 groupon for $2. The food here is pricey otherwise. The steak was great and the fish was decent. It was also kid friendly which is a plus. The resort is near the outlet mall off International Drive. It basically is right around the corner from Sea World. We spent our time at Disney and Universal and it was about equal distance to both (15 minutes give or take). Its a perfect location for visiting those two parks. There is a CVS and grocery store nearby (we didn't visit either one as we flew into Tampa and drove over and stopped in Lakeland to do our grocery shopping). We didn't really find any other good restaurants close by...one of the reasons I do not like Orlando is everything is a chain there it seems. I did have a couple of minor issues that most people have already mentioned. The internet service is so spotty. I stay in Marriott's all the time and this has to be the worst wireless service I have experienced at a major hotel. Some days it worked and others not so much. They should be embarrassed. The beds are hard. I really didn't mind it and we were so tired at the end of the days from visiting the parks it didn't matter, but if you have to have a soft bed, then forget it. Not sure when they updated the rooms why they did not do anything about the beds. The one last thing that was annoying was karaoke night at Coco's. We overlooked the pool where Coco's is located and they had the speakers for karaoke turned up quite loud. It was a beating. Thankfully they turned it off at 10 pm because we had to get up and run the Disney Half Marathon the next morning. Despite the above issues, I would stay here again. My decision is basically because of the room size, the amenities in the room and the location of the hotel. Overall for the amount of time we spent in the room we had a good experience. Its a great place for families.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place”
Reviews.Author: Dave1071
Reviews.Content: Talk about nice. The rooms are exceedingly comfortable with the nicest bed I've every slept in away from home. Very clean all around. The five pools are amazing. The staff is great. Definitely coming back...actually already put deposit down for this july.

Reviews.Title: “Girls Weekend!”
Reviews.Author: Momonthego08
Reviews.Content: Stayed here Tues Jan 3-Jan 6. I have stayed here before with my family and we decided to have our girls' weekend here! Check in was a breeze, room was clean and on a high floor (as requested). Our view was fantastic and right off the elevator (you do experience SOME noise with the room being directly near the elevator but it was minimal and didn't bother us at all). The weather was a bit chilly but the pool was heated to the perfect temperature so we were able to enjoy the pool (even in Jan in FL)! The hot tub was fantastic and also heated to a perfect temperature. The grounds are beautiful and very clean. The hotel is also gated so ONLY authorized personnel and guests are allowed on property (which for women traveling alone or with small children is a HUGE deal). If you leave the property you will need your room key to gain access back onto the facility however if you forget your key they will let you in (with proper ID). The property is rather large and you may have to drive to certain destinations (pool, golf course, etc) but that again was a minor inconvenience for us. They have a gift shop, restaurant(s), ice cream shop, Starbucks and other such amenities that were extremely convenient for my friend and I. For the price we paid we were extremely pleased with our accomodations. I will be back over Spring Break and the summer with my family! I LOVE this place!! The ONLY thing that is a little inconvenient is the check out time (10am). Most hotels have a check out time of 11 or 12 but with this property being SO large and having SO many rooms this again didn't bother my friend and I. If you want a hotel that is kid friendly (pools, ice cream shop, paddle boats, etc) yet also adult friendly (golf, poolside bar, Starbucks, restaurants, etc), convenient to all Disney attractions and overall a great place to stay no matter what your needs this is the place for you! Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place but probably won't go back”
Reviews.Author: jarod181
Reviews.Content: The best things about this resort are it's location, beautiful grounds and great pools. I stayed for a week from Jan 1-8th and enjoyed my stay. Most of my issues were with my room which was economy size - the phone line was dead and wasn't fixed by the time I left, internet was always cutting out after 15 minutes and the noise was quite audible from neighbours despite them just speaking at a normal volume. The bed was quite comfortable, HD tv was nice and the balcony view was terrific. If you're travelling with a family it's an ideal location to get to Disney and other attractions.

Reviews.Title: “cant wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: doddsy69
Reviews.Content: only had the pleasure of 2 nights here but its a great resort we had a 2 bedroom unit 2 king beds best nights sleep ever. it really is hard to describe how good this place is without seeing it for yourself all the pools looked great we used the one at our end but the main one looked amazing location is good 5 mins from idrive and same from the outlets. we hope to make it back here next xmas

Reviews.Title: “very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: WoodbridgeShopaholic
Reviews.Content: my name is david and i am 8 years old this was are first time at grande vista and it was a nice stay there are four pools but we only went to two we also went to the park Epcot that was about 10 minutes away very nice stay at grande vista

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: JetsMan
Reviews.Content: My family and I (4 people which includes 2 college age kids) just spent a couple of days in a 2 bedroom villa. We are not members of the Marriott Vacation timeshare club and stayed there as regular hotel guests. First off, the villa was very nicely furnished and the beds were very comfortable. We checked in on 1/2 and out on 1/4. Those two days were extremely cold for the region and the tempature dipped below freezing during the night. The climate control worked great and kept the room at a consistent cozy temperature. Although they claimed that Building 86 was recently updated, the appliances looked somewhat new, but somewhat worn. They did worked well. When we checked in, we were provided with a gift and were offered a credit in exchange for the pleasure of attending a 90 minute presentation. They called us once more, to "check up" on us making sure all was well, but we again declined the 90 minute option. The grounds were well maintained. We did not take advantage of any of their facilities as it was just to cold and we ate at the Parks. The Marriott service was great as if we had any problems, they were very quick to address; additional towels, and spraying for bugs. We did see a couple of giant cockaroches in and around the room. They supposedly spray between each different guest spray, but the 2 that we saw I guess were resilient. Nice place and would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “The place we call home”
Reviews.Author: AlbertInvasion
Reviews.Content: We've been staying at MGV each year since we bought our timeshare here in 2004 and whilst we have the option to exchange and stay elsewhere, we have no wish to do so. We truly love this place, and each time we stay we come away with a fully rested soul and wonderful memories. Apart from the exceptionally high standards of maintenance, accomodation, grounds, facilities and customer service; MGV has a unique atmosphere that we love. The layout of the grounds are extensive, with nice walks and a beautiful setting. There is a nature trail as well as a stroll along the lake that forms the heart of the resort. This place has to be experienced to be understood. Having seen Marriott's other timeshare resorts in the Orlando area this one wins hands-down for its exclusivity and overall feel. There was a need from time to time for maintenance to attend our apartment to fix a problem, whether with the lights, the toilet or simply to provide a missing kitchen item. Service was always fast and accurate. People who have left poor reviews based on things not being right should ask for it to be put right rather than suffer in silence and then complain afterwards. I cannot recommend this place highly enough. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: UGADawg83
Reviews.Content: We've owned a week at MGV for around four years. We use the property every other year and have never been disappointed. Our most recent stay was three nights while in the area during the holiday season. The weather did not permit the use of many of the outside facilities but as usual the villa was clean, modern and comfortable. The staff was helpful but not obtrusive. The fine accommodations make always make visiting Orlando more enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Grand!”
Reviews.Author: mocatlady
Reviews.Content: The reasons we keep returning to Marriott's Grande Vista are that the grounds are well manicured and absolutely beautiful with rooms that are spacious and decorated with the Floridian influence. There has never been a poor view, no matter where you stay and with several pools located throughout the resort, every room's location is grand. Amusements parks are within a short driving distance as well as several restaurants. There is also a fantastic mall for mom's amusement. Grande Visa is one of the most beautiful places to stay and offers a haven from the outside world.

Reviews.Title: “Did not live up to our expectations”
Reviews.Author: brophycat
Reviews.Content: We planned a vacation trip to FL to visit inlaws, and stayed four nights at Marriott Grand Vista in exchange for hearing a presentation about the Marriot Vacation Club. The location of the resort was great, close to everything, with plenty of parking, but we were put in a recently renovated building, and the room still smelled of fresh paint. The air duct near the ceiling blew dust and debris all over the television, and the bed, and I ended up with a sore throat from the poorly vented ac. We were in a single suite-and the room was not big enough to walk around in; the bathroom was extremely small-the door was inches from the vanity counter top when it was opened. We really enjoy most Marriott properties, but I feel the outward appearance did not match the quality of the room. The room did have a balcony that looked out onto the golf course, which was nice. But the sliding door came off its track when we tried to close it.

Reviews.Title: “Great place and very convenient”
Reviews.Author: barleycorn1
Reviews.Content: Stayed four days while attending the Cap One Bowl. Accommodations were really nice and overall resort is beautiful. Very central to all the parks and other attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place!”
Reviews.Author: jccns
Reviews.Content: Have been going to MGV for several years. Excellent experience. The renovated rooms have made the MGV a much better place then it used to be. Good for Marriott for making investments to making the MGV a better place for its owners and customers.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful trip and excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: mssmweiss
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a one week stay at Marriotts Grande Vista. We arrived on Christmas Day and our condo was ready early. Check-in was smooth and then we went to the owner's desk. We purchased Disney tickets and off we went. The condo itself was a 2BR, 2BA. It was very nicely decorated and had a full kitchen, walk-in pantry, stove and oven, dishwasher and washer and dryer. It was recently remodeled and in excellent condition. The staff was excellent and very responsive to any needs. The Copa Loca bar and grill was very good and we liked the pool in that area overlooking the lake. The activities were fun and seemed to offer alot of different things. We went to Disney and the location was great. Sea World was very close (less than one mile) and Universal was close also. Unless you pay extra, there is no daily maid service for timeshare owners. This did not present any problems as you could always get clean towels. Great time.....especially if visiting the amusement parks.

Reviews.Title: “The resort is beautiful, but do not expect hotel type services.”
Reviews.Author: RemitnceMn18
Reviews.Content: Our extended family stayed here during our Christmas break; unfortunately, since I did not make reservations until the fall I was not able to reserve a 2 bedroom condo unit as I usually do. Instead, I could only reserve 3 separate hotel type units, which was fine. The rooms were big enough for our families and had the amenities to make our week comfortable: each room had a microwave, small refrigerator, toaster, coffee pot with coffee, small sink with detergent, dinnerware, utensils and towels. The rooms were clean, orderly and we had a great view of the lake in the center of the resort. The swimming pools were clean and warm for December (luckily we had 75 degree weather all week!). The staff at the resort were generally friendly and knowledgeable: the ladies at the Pizza Hut cafÃ© were very nice and accommodating. Thanks for the extra plates, napkins and cheese so we could have a picnic in our room! The lady that worked at the sweet shop on Christmas Eve was awesome as well. She made the perfect ice cream sundaes! The gentleman at the boathouse dock was awesome as well! Thanks for getting us into the boats so quick! The resort is beautiful, but do not expect hotel type services. Everything was close to perfect for our stay, but we did have a couple of minor issues. I needed to print out a couple of forms from a USB flash drive that I brought, but the Grande Vista does not have a business center. They have two computers in the lobby connected to a printer, but you have to pay to use the computers and the USB ports were blocked so they could not be used. The second issue is that we needed housekeeping services mid-week during our stay and were told housekeeping would cost us $25. The only other issue is check-out time. Normally in a Marriott hotel, Courtyard, etc., the check-out time is 12:00pmâ€¦ not here. The check-out time is 10:00am and at 8:00am we had a knock on our door from housekeeping checking to see if we had left yet. We did not visit the golf course or the restaurant on-site as we were generally at the parks in the evening. This was our second stay at Grande Vista, we will most likely stay here again and I would recommend other families to stay here as well.

Reviews.Title: “Awful service, dirty room and roaches in the bathroom”
Reviews.Author: leonardomrc
Reviews.Content: Pros: - The rooms are condos/villas very well equipped! - The locations is great! Right in the middle between Universal Studios and Disney World and just a small distance from Sea World. - Excellent bed! Excellent sleep quality. Cons: - They didn't allow us to do an early check-in. They said the room was being cleaned before we could check-in. - The check-in line took ages and they didn't allow us to check-in because the reservation was on my father's name even knowing that we are timeshare owners. We've never had a similar problem on other Vacation Club hotels! - The room was VERY VERY FILTHY! There was women's hair all over it. We found cockroaches in the bathroom drain and the jacuzzi was fille with black pieces of dirt. They also didn't clean the washing machine's filter making our clothes come out covered with dirt. I have never seen this on a Marriott's hotel! - The in-room safe didn't work. I would truly reccomend to make a reservation on another Marriott Vacation Club hotel/villa in Orlando. There are plenty of them there!

Reviews.Title: “great resort just needing some attention to detail”
Reviews.Author: Gushuetravel
Reviews.Content: A beautiful property that is in need of some fine tuning. Elevators are dreadfully slow, there was a paperclip holding together a part of our window treatments, fan didn't work in one of the bathrooms, lightbulb not working in one of the bedrooms, one phone had wonky volume issue, wireless had awful connectivity, spa had scratchy, paper-thin robes that were too short to cover your whole body. Even with all of those nit picky issues we will return as the grounds are lovely, location is nice, club house restaurant is a delicious quick option for meals, and the resort overall is well set up for relaxation. We will continue our family tradition to visit this resort as the other timeshare properties aren't as well matched for our needs.

Reviews.Title: “So much to do here!!”
Reviews.Author: Lisa V
Reviews.Content: There is so much for the entire family to do right here at the resort there is no need to leave! The activities staff is wonderful and keep the whole family entertained! The food at the cops loca is great, the pool is a great way to relax while your food is being prepared! The main village pool is always the warmest one on chilly days! We had a smaller pool near our building which was never crowed. Our kitchen was missing a few items but they were replaced a few hours after we reported it.

Reviews.Title: “Great except for the beds!”
Reviews.Author: hliss
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough good things about this resort. Facilities are beautiful, and many great activities for families, most of them free or very low cost. The room itself was attractive and in good repair. My only problem with this resort entailed the extremely rock hard beds. Reminded me of beds I stayed in when in Italy. So uncomfortable that a my husband and I could not sleep, so unfortunately, despite the rest of the resort being great, we will not return. The most important part of any hotel or resort stay is getting sleep (in my opinion) and if I can't get sleep, then no matter how beautiful the grounds, or how lovely the condo, there is just no point in staying there. It is really surprising - most hotels these days, even lower end hotels like Hampton Inn, tend to have really comfortable beds, so we were really shocked. Then again, I haven't stayed in a Marriot in many years. Think I won't be in a hurry to stay at another Marriot any time in the near future...

Reviews.Title: “Paradise”
Reviews.Author: J W
Reviews.Content: I've been to many destinations and have stayed in luxury hotels and resorts. You have to take my word that this place is like paradise. No one in my party wanted to go home. Will definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “This resort has it all”
Reviews.Author: Capemalia
Reviews.Content: We exchanged into this resort through Interval International. Our first week was in the one bedroom in Bldg. 90. The room was adequate for 2, but a little short on storage. We overlooked the 6th hole on the golf course and really enjoyed our week. The staff is super friendly and very eager to please. The Marketplace has a good selection of fast food and basic groceries. Our stay was for the week before Christmas and the resort is very full, but you can't really tell, it's quiet and seems very family friendly. The Nick Faldo golf institute is on the property and it's a fun 32 par 9 Hole course, great for beginners and/or serious golfers. $35.00 after 1 PM, and play as many holes as you like. The staff here is also great, you can store your clubs for free or rent them. There are lots of activities for families, kids and adults. And it's close to all the Disney action and almost next door to Sea World. We have stayed at Vistana Villages and Hilton International Drive in the past and so far this resort is the best of all, especially if you are a golfer. The only reason I did not give this 5 stars is that the unit we stayed in needed to be refurbished, it was very tired looking. Our second week will be in a studio (Yikes) and I will review that next week.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasurable but not without aggravation!”
Reviews.Author: Shawty A
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 1 bdrm villa, bldg. 88, 5th floor, overlooking the 7th hole of the golf course. Accommodations excellent. We were first time visitors and no one at the resort reviewed anything with us, so we found ourselves "exploring" more than usual. At check-in we were surprised by things not being as we had been told by Marriott's customer service. No problem, the desk clerk worked with us and was very friendly. We were invited to attend a 90 min presentation in exchange for $100 gift card, which turned into a 4 hour hard sell. We did however receive the $100 gift card, but not after much aggrevation. In reviewing our bill the night before checkout we discovered a duplication of charges approximating $350. No problem, the desk clerk admitted the error and refunded the money to our account. On Saturday, our check out day, we decided to obtain a final bill with a zero balance given the earlier incidence. Good thing we did, because when we got back home yesterday and checked our bank account we discovered that Mariott had re-charged our account for the funds they had already refunded to us as a result of their first error in accounting. Now we are having to work with our bank in denying the charges as well as Marriott to get them to once again fix their mistake. While we had a wonderful vacation and the accommodations being beyond expectation, losing 4 hours of one of our days to a '90 min presentation' and having to stay on top of the resort's accounting dept. put a real damper on our stay. Our advice to future visitors: don't believe everything Mariott's customer service tells you, check your bill at least three times, get a final bill before checking out (they'd prefer you just drop your room keys in a box and leave), and check your account when you get home. Check, check and double check. Otherwise, have a wonderful stay at the Grand Vista Resort.

Reviews.Title: “pre-christmas Disney trip”
Reviews.Author: Renee I
Reviews.Content: We used a time-share voucher to visit Orlando last week. Our stay was wonderful! We had a large suite. The family/kitchen/dining area was a nice size and had everything we needed. We stayed in a newly remodeled suite, and it was beautiful. It was tastefully decorated, unlike many of the "beachy" lanai-style resorts in the area. The suite itself was smaller than some of the other suites we have seen in orlando, but it was MUCH larger than a regular hotel suite. It is important to note that we were visiting Disney World. We did not take part in any of the resort entertainment offerings. We weren't even there enough to thoroughly appreciate the rooms! We never needed additional service (thus the 4 star rating.) We would definitely consider staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “Comforts of home.”
Reviews.Author: papame
Reviews.Content: You have to clean your own room and take out the trash just like at home. But that's a vacation villa. Our two bedroom villa was big and comfortable, although the padding on the bed was a little to hard for me, everything else was great. Utensils, plates, washer, dryer all the amenities of home. Grounds were beautiful and well kept. Service got a 4 only because its pretty much self service your own villa. But the staff was very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “perfect getaway”
Reviews.Author: njredroze
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in a 2 bedroom from 12/3>12/10 with our timeshare.This is one of our favorite vacation spots.The Grande Vista is accessible through a gated entrance .We were welcomed by a pleasant staff.Everthing was decorated for Christmas ...beautiful! Our room was on the 4th floor overlooking the golf course.The villa was well equiped and spacious.Furnishings well clean and modern with flat screen TV's.The bedsooms were private and comfortable with balconys.We enjoyed the main pool and the children loved the kiddie pool.
