We also ate poolside and had reasonably priced delicious selections.This villa has everything you could want without leaving.Traveling around this area is easy with attractions nearby.Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend for family stay in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: kmh73
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a 3 bedroom unit in November. Great location, close to parks, restaurants, stores, etc. Property had everything we needed for a 4-night stay...full kitchen for eating in, washer/dryer, restaurants with yummy food, game area for kids, watercraft rental, two great pools with pool bars, spacious balcony overlooking the lake w/fountains. Our unit was immaculate and quiet, as was the property itself. Would definitely stay here again when visiting Orlando. We had a full itenerary and really would have enjoyed an extra day to hang by the pool. Only downside was check-in; unit wasn't available until well after posted check-in time.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay over the holiday weekend.”
Reviews.Author: Linemon
Reviews.Content: First time here after staying recently at the Hilton Grand Vacations on International Drive and being in the family of a owner at Sheraton Vistana Resort LBV, my wife and I were very impressed. Check in was a breeze, as we were placed in building 100, 4th floor which overlooks the practice green, driving range and clubhouse of the nearby golfcourse, facing south, so that you get plenty of sunshine on your porch and in the room. We reserved and received a studio unit with a king size bed and a efficiency kitchen (microwave, coffee maker and small fridge) with a fold out couch. Bathroom was good sized and well lit with a pleasant shower head spray and height. There was good channel selection on the flat screen tv, including high definition channels. In the closet was a large (big enough to hold a laptop) safe. The HVAC was easy to use and cooled well, aided by the ceiling fan. The downfall of the room was the hard as a rock foam mattress. We can't say anything about the pillows because we've learned to bring our own. We would've been better off sleeping on the pullout couch (we all know how comfortable those are). The grounds are well kept. There are numerous pools around the property, but we used the main one behind the main office, since we walked there from our building. There is a pool bar here, next to the overpriced store (but is good for forgotten items), the Pizza Hut/chicken stand and ice cream shop. But we found the better restaurant (Copa Loca) was across a nice bridge walk across the lake by buildings 79 & 84. The pool water was warm, but seemed to fluctuate day by day, but the hottubs were inviting. Pool towels were supplied in your room or can be gotten near the pools. Paddle boats could be rented to check out the lake. Be sure to stop at Nick's Grille, in the clubhouse building for a meal. We had breakfast outside, in the warm sun watching the golfers get going for the day. The breakfast was very good and had a good selection. They also offered lunch and dinner, but we didn't partake it either of them. Resort was a couple miles south of the Seaworld area, with either access to the north to the Bee Line or I-4 and the toll road (417?) to the south. Security always seemed to welcome us back when we returned, and we will return in the future again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely resort, nice fitness center.”
Reviews.Author: robin_culver
Reviews.Content: I'm normally a BUDGET traveler so this resort was a real treat. I spent a week in a 1 bedroom villa and it was a lovely place to be. The accomodations had plenty of room and the kitchen is full sized and well equiped. Everything was very clean and well maintained. Bed was extremely comfortable. Staff was very pleasant at check in. I was a "guest" of the owner and was only asked two separate times if I was interested in a timeshare presentation and when I said no they respected that and didn't push for me to change my mind like so many resorts do. My only complaint is the Marketplace was way overpriced and one of the items I purchased was stale. When I looked under the price tag I found out it was outdated. I would definately go back if the opportunity presented itself.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: penguingrlm
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Marriott's Grande Vista for 7 days through the Thanksgiving Holiday. Stayed in a renovated 2 bedroom villa. Everything was perfect. Staff are very accomodating and friendly. The location is great, just a short drive to many areas we wanted to visit. Will continue to chose the Grande Vista for future visits.

Reviews.Title: “nice Marriott timeshare in a sea of timeshares”
Reviews.Author: LilMsFoodie
Reviews.Content: Huge timeshare property that is well maintained. Most complaints you see will be someone expecting a full service resort and this will never be one. Amenities are nice but not high end resort quality. There will be many many kids. Hey, this is Orlando. This is not where you would go for a romantic weekend. We like the golf at the Faldo institute and the adjacent Grande Pines course.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay - would definitely stay here again”
Reviews.Author: dwhaley86
Reviews.Content: As an owner of a Marriott timeshare (Shadow Ridge), I was disappointed to read the negative reviews that have been submitted. I am referring to the 1 star reviews. My family and I stayed in a 2 bdrm unit for 4 nights over the Thanksgiving holiday. There were several small issues that were not up to what I would consider the Marriott standard. Basically the appliances were not matching. The stove was a coil burner type which only three worked, not the flat top stoves that I have seen and used before in other Marriotts. The microwave was a counter model that took up valuable counter space. The resort has a indoor play area which is nice but it is restricted to 52" in height. While my 6 year old could play, his 8 year old cousin could not because she was a 1/2" too tall. There are not any outdoor play areas that will allow kids from about 8 to 12 to play. Teens have the arcade and table games. My biggest complaint was how hard the master king bed was. The two queen beds in the second room were much more comfortable. The unit was clean and quiet. The resort was pretty full but we did not hear our neighbors either next to or above us. Since we were cooking the Thanksgiving meal, we needed additional cookware. A call to the front desk and we had what needed in about 10 minutes. Overall, I think the resort is is nice, they just need to update the appliances, change out the hard mattresses, and provide an outdoor play area to accommodate the larger kids.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort”
Reviews.Author: MommaMel
Reviews.Content: My family of four stayed at this resort the Friday after Thanksgiving-Sunday. The resort is beautiful and has alot to offer. We stayed in a 1 bedroom villa. The kitchen was fully equipped and I was able to make a great dinner Saturday night! Our only complaint was the bed. The bed was the most uncomfortable bed I have ever slept in. It was like a rock, the pillows were either too big and hard or too small and squishy and the bedding was like sandpaper. If the sleeping was better I would have a 100% review of this resort. We loved the pool area and the indoor kids playarea. The golf course is amazing, my husband and oldest son got in a round of golf Saturday. The marketplace is very convenient and also has Starbucks (BONUS!).

Reviews.Title: “Village inn - restaurant”
Reviews.Author: StevenMBittner
Reviews.Content: This marriott is great. It is very close to a great diner/restaurant called the village inn! They have great food. A large amount for a low price for breakfast lunch and dinner. Go to the village inn!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice room; limited activities, food options”
Reviews.Author: cathynWindsor
Reviews.Content: Let me preface this review by saying we stayed for a weekend after spending three nights at Hard Rock Hotel Universal Studios. Our first day here there was a torrential downpour that lasted for more than 24 hrs straight. I don't mean some rain, I mean a run-to-your-car-and-you're-still-soaked downpour. I'll start by saying our 2-bdrm. unit was very nice. A large living/dining room, and nice kitchen. We also had two bathrooms, and the master bedroom was quite large with a nice whirlpool tub. We also had two covered patios -- one screened in -- which was nice with all the rain because we could still sit "outside." I'm glad the room was nice because there is not a lot to do at this vacation club and everything is a very long walk (which would have been impossible in the rain) or short drive. We decided to drive to the "main area' and still got soaked due to renovations/lack of parking near doors. THere is just not a lot of indoor activities. There's a kids' area, which my 8 yr old used for 1/2 hr and got bored. There's a couple pool tables outdoor under cover, and it was very crowded. Luckily, we had a big room to relax in, and we were tired after 3 days at Universal. Otherwise we would have been bored silly. Food choices are also lacking. I was happy to hear upon check-in that there was a restaurant with all the NFL games showing on Sun. But the restaurant is really a glorified food court with no ambience whatsoever. There's Pizza Hut and Boston Chicken, yuck. I did have a nice salad. THe manager was very nice and put on the game I wanted to watch, but not a place I wanted to sit for 3 hrs. Imagine a mall food court, without the selection. As the rain was still not letting up Sun. morning, my daughter and I did work out in the gym, which was nice. I also had a facial at the spa and it was the highlight of my trip. Sue went out of her way to treat me well, and gave me a wonderful treatment. As the rain let up we went over to the "boating" area which is just a small manmade lake with pedal boats. The lone employee here decided I looked like I wanted to hear all about how much he hated to work at the hotel, and decided to corner me and complain about his bosses while I watched my family play pool. Apparently no one told him people are on vacation to get away from that kind of stuff. So -- to sum up -- if you want a wonderful room and aren't looking for a variety of activities or food, stay here. The rooms are great. If you want to spend a lot of time at your resort, I would look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Marriott Property”
Reviews.Author: trvlfan2010
Reviews.Content: The Marriott Grande Vista is in a great location in the quiet area of International Drive. It's very close to Sea World, Prime Outlets and the Convention Center. Bldgs 79-82 are closest to the check in desk and all the activities. We were in Bldg 82 next to the beach area and bridge - perfect. The rooms in these buildings have all been updated. We were there Thanksgiving week - low season. For us its the ideal time to be there as there were no crowds or lines anywhere we went in the Orlando/Kissimee area. The property did have scheduled activities but I would have liked to have seen more kid activities. Maybe in the summer they have more planned. We were in a efficiency unit this time that was very spacious. It had a king bed and a pull out sofa. The kitchenette has a toaster, coffee maker and mini fridge as well as silverware and china for 4. This unit did not have a washer/dryer but they do have laundry facilities that are free. That was a pleasant surprise. Just bring your own detergent. Overall, we would stay here again and recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort!”
Reviews.Author: TFrenette
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in November. Very clean and spacious unit. Perfect for families. The resort has beautiful pool areas and lots of activities for all ages. Very close to all attractions and shopping. Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort and golf course.”
Reviews.Author: Ets127
Reviews.Content: We had a great time staying here. My husband played golf, its only 9 holes gOlf course, but he liked it. He even got to play with some amateur golfers. The only thing that i didnt like was the pillows were too firm and the bed. But other than that we enjoyed the resort.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable beds, great pools, tired unit but good stay.”
Reviews.Author: dmMc
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Marriott Grande Vista the first week in November as a guest of my sister and her husband, who had reserved the unit as a getaway from Interval. I am a Marriott Vacation Club owner, but this was the first time I had stayed at the Vista. Overall a very nice property. We stayed in a 2 bedroom unit 86 on the 4th floor, which is one of the buildings that is a little walk from the pools. This was no problem for us and it was very quiet, which we prefer. Note that all buildings have elevators. The unit did seem a little "used", but was still comfortable. The master had a jacuzzi tub and walk in shower, king bed. The 2nd bedroom had twin beds (note that some 2nd bedrooms only have 1 bed) and was very comfortable with down comforter and pillows. The unit had a full kitchen. We did have an issue with the dishwasher not closing properly, but this was a minor issue. I heard a rumor that they are in the process of updating the units, but not sure. Pools and jacuzzis are great! We had some warm days that made for good swimming, but we also were able to use the pools at night because they were well heated. A pleasure after spending all day on your feet in the parks. There is even a sauna located at the main pool near the reception building. The Vista is located very close to Sea World. It is about a 15 minute drive to the Disney parks. Having stayed at other Marriott Vacation Club properties, I was a little suprised that the outdoor grills were not gas, since these have become a standard feature at the other properties I have visited. This is my only complaint about the property, otherwise we had a pleasant stay!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay near everything!”
Reviews.Author: stormycatNJ
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 7-night stay and it was fantastic! Check it was VERY busy and even though we got there after 2pm, our room wasn't ready. The lines were long for the check-in process. We did check in, but didn't get our room keys. They told us to come back after 4pm to get the actual room keys. Now, if checkout is at 10am, why the 6 hour wait to check in? Anyway, we went to the fast food place right next to the lobby and got some quick food to eat outside. When we were done eating, the line at check in was still incredibly long so rather than wait in line, we called to see if our room was ready - no sense waitng in line only to be told that it's not done! So we did get our room keys and finally were able to get into our room. We had a very nice 1 bedroom with a pull-put sofa for the first 3 nights of our stay. It's great to have a full kitchen, regular size refrigerator, stove with oven and washer/dryer. They did provide us with enough dishwasher detergent for the week. They did not give us enough Tide for laundry! Here's a side note about the washing machine - it's small! It one of those stacked wahser/dryer combos, so it doesn't hold nearly as much as your regular machine at home. Also, the dryer seems to only have 3 settings - hot, no heat and off. I usually use the lowest heat temperature on my dryer at home, so I had to adjust the drying time accordingly. Otherwise, the whole kitchen/laundry area was neat and functional. They seemed to have taken a full inventory of the items in the cabinets so you didn't end up with 1 small spoon and 6 large spoons and there were 6 of everything - plates, cups, glasses, silverware, etc. There was some bakeware and a few Tupperware items so you could put leftovers away in the refrigerator if you wanted to. The dining area and living area had plenty of room for the four of us. My kids slept on the pullout sofa the first 3 nights. It's a pullout sofa - if you're looking for superior comfort, a pullout isn't the place to get it! Quite honestly, when the kids are that tired, they don't complain too much if it's not the most comfortable bedding on the planet! Nice sized flat screen television which had most channels - network, TWC, HGTV, Food Network, Disney, Nickelodeon, etc. My only complaint about the living area was the lack of outlets to plug in laptops and iPads so that you could use them while charging! Also, I did find the lighting to be a little tricky - some things you needed to turn on the wall switch then turn on the lamp switch. The wall switches were all over the place, so it was trial and error to see which switch worked the lighting you wanted. The master bedroom area was nice. Two closets - one with ironing board and iron, the other had the wall safe. Both closets were on the small side, but we stuffed our carryons and other smaller bags in the one and shoes in the other. There was a dresser/built-in that we used for clothing. Not huge, but enough for each adult to put one week's worth of clothing in. One thing I can say is that the mattress was hard - very hard. I like a very soft mattress, so I had alot of trouble sleeping on a mattress that solid. There were three feather pillows, so we eneded up calling down for more (which were delivered very quickly). The bath tub is in the master bedroom instead of the bathroom, which I'm not a big fan of. It's big and takes up alot of room. We didn't make use of the bathtub so I don't know how good it is. There was a sink included also, so it was nice to have two bathroom sinks. The bathroom was nice and functional - sink, toilet and shower. Sink had plenty of counter storage and storage underneath. Shower was ok - not a whole lot of water pressure, but the water was hot enough and stayed hot. There was only a small soap holder in the shower, so all other items needed to be left on the floor. We did have a toilet problem where it wouldn't stop running - for the entire day! From that point on we were very careful when we flushed that it shut off rather than waste all of that water! On day four of our stay, we added the lock-off as the second bedroom for our kids. We were told it was going to have 2 full/queen sized beds, but it only contained a king. Oh well - the kids had to sleep in the same bed! I will say this - before we got the lock-off, we could hear everything going on in that room: parents fighting with kids the first 2 nights, then a couple arguing about sports (at 2:30am) and dropping the f-bomb quite a few times! So if you're staying in a lock-off, be aware that the noise travels under the doors!!! The lock-off/second bedroom had a little kitchenette - mini refrigerator, microwave, coffee maker, etc. The bed was just as hard as the other bed, but it didn't bother my kids! The second bedroom had a nice balcony that wasn't screened it. The master bedroom balcony was screened in, so I guess if you wanted to you could leave the door open and get some fresh air inside. We used 3 of the 4 pools on site. The pool by check-in, the kids pool area and the pools over by buildings 91 and 92. All pools were very clean - no trash around, no trash in the pool, no mess anywhere. Water temperatures were all about the same in the pool - not too cold, not too hot. The hot tubs were either roasting hot or cool! We commented one night that if you threw in some veggies, you could make soup on the hot tub - that's how hot it was! Not a whole lot of pool towels around though. There were supposed to be pool towels in your room, but we didn't have any in ours. I think on the second or third day we ended up with a whole stack of pool towels - I don't know if housekeeping picked up all the wet ones and finally realized that we hit the pool every evening or what! I think I only saw towels by the pool once, so I don't know where you're supposed to get them from! The staff was all very nice. The check-in staff was nice, even though they seemed a little slow! The concierge staff was nice and very helpful. They do offer discounts to area attractions and they do ask if you'd like to sit for a timeshare presentation. We didn't, but heard from other guests at this location who did attend the timeshare presentation and said it wasn't bad. There is a good amount of security onsite - gated entrance, security driving around in golf carts, etc. So when you walked around at night you did feel safe. Housekeeping staff was good, although there were times that they didn't come in to work on the room until well after 3pm. I prefer my room done in the morning, but what can you do? They did put the dirty dishes from the sink into the dishwasher and wipe down the counters in the kitchen area. I don't remember if they ran the dishwasher or not. Now for the negatives... Everything is far once you turn off International Drive. This place is huge so if you're looking for a small, intimate place, this isn't it! Sometimes it seemed like the ride to Disney was quicker than getting from the entrace of the complex to our building. Also, the speed limit inside the complex is 6mph. That's right - 6 mph! I don't think I go 6 mph in my driveway!!! If you get behind someone going 6 mph, be prepared to be awhile! This place really was great and we had a wonderful time here - close to shopping, dining, Disney and Universal. Great place to stay for families!

Reviews.Title: “Business Stay”
Reviews.Author: Caymanita
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Marriott Grande Vista while I was attending a conference at the Orange County Convention Center which is relatively close by. I shared a two bedroom condo with a colleague and there was more than enough space for the both of us. My room had a large Jacuzzi tub which was most welcome after a long day at the conference! The kitchen was fully stocked with everything you would need to cook and be self-sufficient. One thing that did annoy me slightly was the fact that coffee was provided, but with only two little pots of creamer- after one cup we had to drink the rest black. Other than that, the room was great. Unfortunately since this was a business trip there was no time to test the vast array of amenities and activities, it seemed like there was lots to do here. We did however have pizza delivered to our room one night from the onsite Pizza Hut but this was over-priced and we still waited 30-40 mins for the pizza. The resort is very large - too large for my liking. At check-in, the friendly front desk clerk gave us directions to our room and pointed it on the map. The directions she gave were a little off however and we ended up driving around for 10-15 mins trying to find our room (which actually happened to be the building directly adjacent to the registration building which the front desk clerk failed to tell us). With a resort this large, it is hard to give great service to such a vast number of guests and it showed at this resort. Overall, the stay was just average for me - I expect had I had the time to experience the resort as a vacationer I might have been able to score this resort higher.

Reviews.Title: “2nd time just as great as the 1st.”
Reviews.Author: holidaynut!
Reviews.Content: First of all I have to say I am gobsmacked after reading the last couple of reviews. The posters experiences are in total contrast to the experience we had. We returned this year (October) having had a great stay last October and enjoyed our stay just as much as before. Our 1 bedroom villa was immaculate on arrival and housekeeping maintained the good standard throughout our stay (by the way I am extremely fussy when it comes to cleanliness, I am not easily pleased). All staff were helpful and friendly. We were greeted each morning by a cheerful friendly housekeeper. In the elevator we met the maintenance man doing his round who introduced himself and asked if everything was OK. He told us he wanted our stay to be like home from home and even asked if the water temperature was OK for us. At the pool bar 2 members of staff introduced themselves by name saying "it's nice to meet you" , they would have a chat and ask if we had enjoyed our drink. We did not encounter any loud unruly behaviour from other holiday makers. There are people from all walks of life at this resort, you'll see retired couples, the average 2 kid family and families with 3 generations having a grand gathering vacation! It is not at all stuffy which is what we like. I think it has the perfect balance of being a higher end beautiful resort with great accomodations while creating a down to earth feel, a place where you can be at ease and kids can be kids. What I love about this resort is the fact that you get all the living space and mod cons of a villa with all the amenities/facilities of a hotel. Although I NEVER cook on holiday I love the convenience of the full kitchen. I used it to prepare cereal, pastries, fruit etc for breakfast and having the washer/dryer is a God send. No more suitcases full of dirty clothes to contend with when you get home! By the way, I personally find the size of the washer/dryer and the cupboard it's in to be perfectly adequate and there was more than enough storage cupboards for our use. In fact the majority of them remained empty! I would have no hesitaion in recommending this resort to others and thankyou Marriott Grande Vista for another great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation Experience”
Reviews.Author: billoliver
Reviews.Content: We have been coming to Marriotts Grande Vista for years and have never been disappointed.Its location is excellent for all the parks, malls, restaurants, Publix and more.The staff could not be any nicer and helpful to any of our needs. I would highly recommend this as a vacation destination for a family trip to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “This is a cheap motel, not a top quality time share.”
Reviews.Author: Tony C
Reviews.Content: We visit Disney every year. I used to go to the Grande Vista three years ago. Three years ago we had a bad experience with rooms in very poor condition and the quality of people was very poor. By that I mean, they were very loud and screaming and plaiting around through late hours in the night. The rooms were dirty and mold and mildew in the showers. Kitchens and laundry were filthy. Internet was poor in every area of our 2 bedroom. After that visit, we changed the following year to another timeshare property much nicer than this and half the distance to the Disney parks. This year our usual place was booked up, so Interval offered us the Grande Vista again and told us that the accommodations have been upgraded and they would give us a 3 bedroom. I told them about our bad experience and they told me that it is not the case anymore and we would be very happy. We were not! Same quality in the rooms as it was 3 years ago, only worse! The grout of the showers had black mold in them. The walkways in front of the rooms had lint blowing all over the floor from the dryer vents. The bathtubs were filthy and the walls were marked up and damaged. The wireless internet was free but had little to no service anywhere in the room. Late at night people were screaming and playing around in the walkway and pool areas. It was a very poor experience and ruined our trip. I will not be staying at this timeshare property ever again, even if it is free.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Vista needs updating...... Mold & Mildew”
Reviews.Author: ES727
Reviews.Content: We stayed atGrand Vista for three days for the food and wine festiva at Epcot. The first night simply terrible, we were put in building # 90 in room 124, when we walked in we hit with a wave of mold and mildew, it was horrific. I find it unbelieveable that Marriott would even rent the room, it was that bad. We turned the air down low thinking it may have been something we could take care of as the front desk had told us that the resort was sold out. But the smell did not go away, before we went to dinner around 6:00pm I called the front desk and they said they would send someone to the room while we were gone to check the mold. I called in the morning to get moved they finally said they would move us. I spoke with the front office manager Ethan Hauser, who treated me like I was an idiot, as if they did not know there was mold and mildew, the smell was so intense it had to develop over a period of several months, in fact the bell boy who helped us move told us building 90 has had serious mold and mildew problems for a long time and everyone is aware of it. The manager finally gave us a 100.00 credit to our room, after a 15 minute conversation of him giving me the run around, however I do not feel that was appropriate as the entire cost of the room for that first night should have been credited to us.It is unbelievable that they would actually rent a room that is in the condition of that room, not to mention the room was NOT clean, I picked trash on the floor, and there were hairs in the bathroom and the mattress was extremely bad, very very very hard. We were moved to building 80 on the 4th floor and it was very nice and up to the standards that a paying guest has the right to expect. After the first night we did enjoy Grand VIsta, the room was nice and the mattress was very comfortable. I would like to go back but I would be worried about being placed in one of the older buildings. If you stay here make sure you are in a refurbished unit. I am giving my review of Grand Vista very low ranking due to the fact that the first room we were in should never have been rented in the first place.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not exceptional”
Reviews.Author: dohligee
Reviews.Content: We travel to Orlando frequently and have stayed at numerous resorts. The Marriott Grande Vista is very nice, particularly the exterior and common areas. The pool and grounds are beautifully landscaped and meticulously maintained. But it is far from a 5-star or up to the quality we've seen at other resorts. The units are spacious, but poorly designed The layout of the rooms is just inefficient and impractical. Nothing huge, just lots of little things that added together made for a frustrating stay. There is little storage space - very small closet in master bedroom, just a couple of drawers, the bathroom contained no drawer storage - I had to keep everything on the counter. Thankfully we had a 2BR though there were only 2 of us so I was able to use the storage space in the other bedroom. There was no table/closet/area near the entrance to put a handbag,umbrella, package, etc. The tiny washer/dryer was stuffed into a miniscule closet in the kitchen. The resort itself is not very convenient if you plan to spend a lot of time at Disney parks, although it's just down the street from Sea World and also close to Universal and I-4. We did not participate in any resort activities, although it did look like there were quite a few available. The biggest downside to this resort is the virtual non existence of cell service. We use AT&T so don't know if it would be any better with another carrier. We were able to use our laptop, and internet connection was ok.

Reviews.Title: “"Enjoy every second"”
Reviews.Author: Bobalobajob
Reviews.Content: Boy oh boy, this place is wicked. When you are a kid and you imagine what a hotel or a resort might be like, this excels. As soon as you turn into the long sweeping drive, you get goose bumps. You sweep around to the reception building and are greeted with happy, smiling, welcoming faces, like long lost friends. There is a buzz, a kind of floating on air feeling, like something special is going to happen and then it does... follow the golf buggy to your apartment, hear the turn of the key and then WOW !!!!, there it is, your home for the next week or two. Open plan kitchen to living room, large comfortable sofas, with almost cinema size TV, okay you probably won't watch much as there is masses to do. Then the bedroom, spacious, lovely large beds, bathroom with a bath for 9 people. What a pad. Plenty of on site facilities, shops, tennis courts, and the swimming pools, all shapes and sizes to satisfy all needs, there are quiet peaceful, fall asleep round ones, get involved and play games in ones, have a beautiful relaxing early morning swim ones. Perfectly situated for iDrive and accessibility to attractions. Get up early and take a long leisurely stroll around the edge of the golf course, it is beautiful, with the mist rising off the greens and the first rays of sunlight cutting through the trees..see if you can spot the local wildlife.... magic. Go for a lovely breakfast at Faldo's and take a seat on the balcony and bathe in the warmth of the morning sun as you cut into a crispy slice of bacon and a perfectly cooked egg.... take a drink of tea and pinch yourself, surely this is a dream... no you are here, yes you are incredibly lucky and grateful.... enjoy every second.

Reviews.Title: “What a Grande place for a vacation”
Reviews.Author: gsmcc
Reviews.Content: We have been owners at Grande Vista for 5 years. We absolutely love the resort. When you arrive you can just begin to relax. The villas are kept to the highest standard. The activities at the resort are great. I love the executive golf course on the property. Not a long course, but has its challenges. We rotate taking our grandchildren to the resort each year and they cannot wait for their turn again. It is our happy place.

Reviews.Title: “A truly magical place”
Reviews.Author: SuzyWho
Reviews.Content: This was our first experience of a Marriott Vacation property and we were absolutely delighted. The accommodation was everything you would expect from Marriott. Spacious, clean, fresh and quality. The pool area was a great meeting place and we spent most evenings in the hot tub. The view from the appt was first class. We've been told that the golf is great here, but we came for Disney, so didn't golf at all. Perfect spot for getting to all the theme parks and that hot tub was perfect for soaking tired feet. With the washing machine and tumble dryer in the unit, you can do your laundry before you leave and have less to do when you get home. Would recommend this wonderful place to anyone and would stay here again in a heartbeat. My kids tell me they've been spoiled now and only want to stay in Marriott's in the future !

Reviews.Title: “Great Location! Nice rooms! Friendly Reception!”
Reviews.Author: BillyboyBoston
Reviews.Content: We stayed for only one night (2 bedroom suite) on a Marriott employee rate in November. Friendly front office staff checked us in 3 hours early at 1pm and called us via cell phone when our second bedroom was ready right around 4pm. The hotel is right around the corner from Sea World and on the far end of International Drive but 10 minutes away from the series of restaurants. Will certainly stay again next year if the discount is available. Did not use any of the facilities/Amenities due to being in the parks all day.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: WorldTraveler2773
Reviews.Content: We stayed here late october and it was great. Newly renovated two bedroom suite, fully equiped, with comfortable beds and plenty of living space for our party of six. The staff is extremely friendly and maintenance went out of their way to help us fix my son's toy. The grounds are perfectly maintained and very quiet. The fitness center is well equipped, and there are plenty of activities to keep the little ones busy. Sea World is very close and so are many shopping centers. Will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: Travelers_code
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because it was well priced and located close to Universal Studios. For us, the location was great. It was far enough from the traffic and insanity of the main drag, but close enough to the attractions (Universal Studios was only 10-15 minutes away by car). The property is well maintained and neat and the staff is professional. The room we stayed in had: a king bed, sofa bed, large bathroom, dining table to accommodate two, a large balcony, a small closet but plenty of drawers, a flat screen t.v., microwave, mini-fridge, bar ware and stoneware. The room could have easily accommodated 4 adults. While I didn't participate in any of the activities, every day there was something offered for the guests- free yoga, family activities, etc. Previous reviews on this site recommended that we request a newly renovated room, and that's what we got. Overall, this was a deal and we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay.”
Reviews.Author: easy-traveller-mtl
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights in early November and it was great. The grounds are beautiful. If you want quiet ask for a golf course view as the music around the pool is resortish and runs till late. We were hotel guests so we had the luxury of a little maid service such as bed made and towels changed everyday. The maid service isn't the same as a normal hotel but enough to satisfy. Only complaint, the golf is expensive, we played the sister course with a social living purchase otherwise it seemed really pricey for guests, we chose to play elsewhere. My husband's only comment is he loved the size of the bourbon shots at the pool bar, other drinks are very very expensive but the bourbon shot is worth it ! LOL. This is a wonderfully large living space, we enjoyed it, like a condo. Very close to SeaWorld.

Reviews.Title: “One bedroom suite didn't work for this family of four”
Reviews.Author: QuebecFamilyof4
Reviews.Content: Our trip was with two teenagers and the goal was a hotel with a kitchen to prepare meals. This is less like a hotel and more like a series of apartment buildings. Not every building has a swimming pool at it's base. My family enjoyed staying here but I was disappointed that this vacation felt less like a "getaway" because of the hotel's apartment-like look. Service was excellent, the pools were beautiful, and there are many family-friendly activities planned in the evenings. Warning about the hotel beds however: For a family of four, our teenagers were relegated to a very lumpy, very uncomfortable pull-out couch. In the end, they found the floor more appealing. When asked to review the room by management staff during our stay, this was my only comment, which was met with a "yes, we get that a lot". Since most people travel in fours or more to Orlando, they should make their accommodations more.... accommodating!

Reviews.Title: “A solid choice for Orlando--had cell phone issues though”
Reviews.Author: cmhrun_11
Reviews.Content: After much research, and the myriad of choices for Orlando, I decided on the Marriott Grande Vista. We stayed in a 2 bedroom with my spouse and three children, ages 8, 5, and 3. Check-in was was very efficient. The male at the counter was very cordial and pleasant. We stayed in building 97, with a view of one of the four pools at the resort, and the golf course. True to what I was told at check-in, the unit was recently refurbished, and smelled new when we walked in. It was average in size compared to other 2 bedrooms I've stayed in, with a washer and dryer and free w My children stayed in the guest room master bed and seemed very comfortable there, with there own DVD player and LG flat screen TV in the room. As I've experienced with other Marriott timeshares, the mattress seemed rather soft to me. But with the help of lots of pillows, I was able to get comfortable. This resort is very large and spread out, with multiple 3-4 story buildings on the property. We used the small but very pretty and clean pool right behind our room a couple times. It was not very crowded and had a nice hot tub next to it. It had a small area for toddlers with sprinklers that shot out of the ground. We also went to the main pool one day. The kids enjoyed the multiple water cannons, as they got to shoot their parents with water over and over! The main pool had a baby pool, two hot tubs, and a chldren's area with lots of water jets and water cannons for them to play with. The thing it lacked, which would have been the icing on the cake, would have been some water slides for the kids. The resort has a very nice workout room located next to the front desk. I've stayed in multiple timeshares, but this was definitely one of the better workout rooms, with the amount of space and the new equipment, both machines and free weights. There is plenty for the kids to do, with the large play structure for kids 52" and smaller (strictly enforced and socks must be worn), a roomful of video games, an outside ping pong table, fuze ball table, and billiards. Take-out Pizza Hut is also offered on the premises. DVD's can be rented for something close to $6.75 a night, which was too expensive, I thought. My biggest gripe with the Marriott Grande Vista was the cell phone service. I have Verizon cell phone service, and never, ever have issues making calls. Plus, I updated my cell phone when I landed to find the closest cell phone towers here. However, I could not get cell phone service in my room. I had to step outside, and still had a weak connection. It was really annoying. To summarize, I believe this Marriott is a solid choice. It's very clean and the grounds are well taken care of. Everything was in very good condition. I would definitely recommend this place to a friend. However, with the amount of competition for timeshares in Orlando, I will check out some other timeshares as well before returning. The two let downs were the cell phone service and the lack of water slides for the kids.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice resort, hard beds!”
Reviews.Author: krisell333
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott Grande Vista last weekend for just one night in a king guestroom. Overall I really liked the property. There are several pools and they are all heated, which is great. There are two large hot tubs, a kiddie pool and a bar at the main pool. The bar is a nice place to have a few drinks, prices not bad either. The room was just ok. Nice to have the little kitchenette but we've seen better at other vacation ownership type hotels in Orlando. The worse thing was that hard-as-heck bed! I am a soft bed lover so maybe it was just me but even after a long night of hanging out at halloween horror nights, I was unable to sleep on that thing! Didn't really get to check out any of the other amenities so I can't speak to those. Customer service was decent also, no real issues there. It was a nice place and good value but I probably won't consider staying there again unless I go with enough ppl to get a villa. Those are probably better than the guestrooms.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, relaxing, and it has everything!”
Reviews.Author: NomiaRiver
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with up to date, fully equipped rooms. I stayed in a 2 bedroom suite and it had everything - even a washer and dryer. While I only stayed 4 nights, this would be an excellent hotel for weekly/extended stays. It was clean and comfortable. The staff was helpful and friendly, though I had minimal contact with them. I only had one issue that wasn't resolved, and it wasn't even that much of an issue. One of the hairdryers in the bathroom did not work. I left a note for housekeeping and the hairdryer was never replaced. Definitely not a big deal, but worth mentioning. I would stay here again, if the rates were as good as I had this past October!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful”
Reviews.Author: meper3
Reviews.Content: Shared a very large condo with family. It was sparkling clean, convenient to everything. The staff was very helpful. Pools were beautiful. Very relaxing. Loved it.

Reviews.Title: “An experience you must have”
Reviews.Author: JTravelista
Reviews.Content: The smaller size of this resort says "cozy" and made my family feel at home. We have stayed at other Marriott resorts, but this one had a certain charm that made it memorable. The unique daily activities proved a fun distraction from the room and the reasonable spa prices made my trip complete. The convenience of having Sea World within walking distance made our two day passes worth the money. From our room window, we could even see fireworks from Sea World reflecting off the lake. We took the short drive to Disney for the remainder of our stay. The location, ambiance, and overall accessibility of this resort makes it a gem. You should definitely stay the next time you vist Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Special Here”
Reviews.Author: odie1
Reviews.Content: Let me preface by stating that my daughter and I accompanied my husband on a business trip so we didn't actually choose this hotel. I would think this hotel would be great if you are a golfer-period. We also did not have a car and there is NOTHING, you can walk to. There are not even sidewalks on International Drive where this resort is located. The resort is very large and very spread out. There are several pools, but if you have kids and they want to be close to the larger pools, that are more geared towards kids, do not stay at the back of the property. Stay in the back if you want peace and quiet, but be forewarned, that the back buildings (at least #90) are in need of attention. I was disappointed in the food choices here and there is no where to walk to if you don't like it. We had dinner in Nick's the first night, mediocre at best we thought. The food by the pool was from The Cove and was basically pizza and fried foods. We did not try the other on site restaurant. We had a one bedroom villa. The layout is odd, with the tub in the bedroom and the bathroom door in the bedroom as well. It was very loud if someone was in the shower or flushed the toilet. The toiletries were basically non-existent. They did not even supply hair conditioner. It has been a long time since I have been to a hotel with no conditioner or at least conditioning shampoo. The kitchen was well equipped. Maid service was disappointing. They knew there were three of us in the villa, yet each day we only received two towels. Some times, the coffee pot was not cleaned out. We were left a new coffee packet, but never any creams or sugars. The most positive report would be for the bellhops. These guys were great, driving us to the main entrance off International Drive to catch a trolley or back to our room from there. We took the trolley to Sea World, which was easy. But beware the return trip has you crossing an extremely busy, fast-moving road, with no stoplight or crosswalk, quite dangerous in the dark. We also took a taxi to animal Kingdom ($35) and a taxi back from Epcot ($25). All in all, for us, I can see no reason to return here.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely timeshare experience”
Reviews.Author: sallytravels
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the smallest unit, the 'hotel' /efficiency room, which was spacious and very well appointed. The balcony added to the spacious feel, The mini fridge, microwave, coffee maker and toaster plus basic dishes and utensils made breakfast and snacks/drinks easy in the room. The pools were lovely, and offerred variety into quiter ones vs. ones with attractions for kids. The grounds were very well mainanted and there were lots of lovely areas for walking around the 'lake' and property. Some areas were undergoing big renovations, but we were not located near them. If you stay here as a time share owner and/or exchange, then there is only weekly cleaning included, but you cna pay extra for midweek cleaning. If you stay here as a nightly rental, then it is cleaned daily. Location was very near Sea World, so between Disneys and Universal theme parks. You really need a car here...unless you are willing to take a lot of taxis.

Reviews.Title: “Nice accommodations, close to the attractions”
Reviews.Author: porterkids
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in January 2011. My wife and I went away for a week to get away from the snow in New England. We were very pleased with our rooms. Everything was clean, furniture was comfortable and everything was in good working order. We spent a few days at Disney and also went to Universal Studios. Both parks were a short drive from the resort. Can't comment on the activities at the resort as we really didn't spend much time there during the day. Purchased discounted park tickets from the desk in the lobby. Everyone we dealt with was extremely friendly and helpful. We did witness a rude guest who was checking in giving the girl behind the counter a hard time because the resort couldn't accommodate his unwarranted upgrade request. She was very polite and apologetic even though she should have told him to take a hike. Overall a very good experience. We wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice property, friendly staff... dated rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Ozchild14
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Grande Vista prior to leaving on a cruise for two nights. Got a pretty good rate for the 2 bedroom suite, and it was large and spacious with 2 balconies and pretty views of a pool and golf course. The property is HUGE, with several pools, restaurants, and lots of activities. The room had great appliances, including a washer/dryer, and the Jacuzzi tub was an unexpected bonus. Staff were very friendly and helpful, and even gave me a ride to my building at 1:00am after a friend had dropped me off at the lobby. I had checked in late, and my husband was arriving even later with the car. When the receptionist saw that I had no vehicle she quickly offered a security guard to give me a ride! The only downside was that the room and furnishings were in desperate need of some TLC. They were nearly all battered and bruised. It was a bit disappointing considering the overall luxury of the resort.

Reviews.Title: “Love it here!”
Reviews.Author: Tami B
Reviews.Content: We stayed in building 95 for nine days in September. It was remodeled and it was a perfect one bedroom suite for a family of 3. LOOOOVE the jetted tub! The place was fully stocked so I didn't have to worry about much. If you want a view, stay on the 4th floor or higher. We were on the 3rd floor and we had a view of the back of the trees. Our friend was on the 4th floor and he had a great view. They do have a little place where you can buy groceries but it was expensive. I guess that may be the price you pay for convenience. The pools were great for my 20 month old and me. There is a bar close to the pool so if you wanted to pick up the occasional drink it was close by. There are some specials on some nights that made it seem that the drinks weren't too expensive. I loved how they posted a list of events for each day in the elevator. It was helpful for me to know how to plan my day. The room was very clean and the staff was very friendly. My only complaint was the noise from the kids above us. I guess the parents were letting them jump around like crazy and we heard all of it! Oh, the Maze for kids is amazing to let the kids run off some steam and stay out of the hot, hot heat of Florida. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Room Theft”
Reviews.Author: linda y
Reviews.Content: We had a Nintendo DSi and game cards (value $500) stolen from our hotel room most likely by housekeeping. Housekeeping did not come to our condo suite until the 7th day of our 9 day stay. During those 7 days, my son played with his DSi whenever he had free time. He left the game system on a table in the bedroom. On our 7th day at the resort we were out all day and upon returning we saw that housekeeping had come in (beds were made, linen and supplies were replenished) and the DSi was gone. After a thorough search we called the front desk the next morning and someone from Loss Prevention came to take our report. He seemed completely disinterested and unsympathetic. After a day of no response, my husband made several calls to different hotel personnel but no one seemed to be able to address our problem. We had to deal with 3 different people from Loss Prevention before someone called us back. He told us that the housekeeper who came to our room was questioned and she said that she â€œdid not see any DSi in our roomâ€�. He then told us to call their Insurance Company to make a claim. We wanted to know the name of the person whom had been in our room but was told that it was confidential information. We have stayed in many hotels before and usually a card is left with the name of the housekeeper. I donâ€™t know why this establishment chooses to promote secrecy over accountability and transparency. We felt that we were given the â€œrunaroundâ€�, no one took us seriously and there was no policy in place to prevent or deter housekeeping theft. We are very surprised and disappointed that the Marriot-such a huge and reputable (so we thought) hotel chain would operate like this. We will not return to this resort again nor recommend it to anyone due to their shoddy handling of room theft. This could certainly happen again to us and other guests. My 11 year old son felt very dejected and personally violated. He had over 250 pictures and creative art work stored on a SD card in the game system. This really put a black cloud over our vacation. LOCK EVERYTHING!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: katrios
Reviews.Content: The complex is huge, beautiful and very well organized. The units are plenty of space and have everything you need for cooking and cleaning. There are a lot of pools, where kids could spend all the day. We don't use the golf court, but it seems to be very well maintained. This is an excellent place to rest and keep away from the crowd in Disney. All the parks are really close. The only objection is that they don't clean the units during your stay (If you go using a Time Share), but you can ask for clean towells and sheets.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort , great value”
Reviews.Author: bpsmith47
Reviews.Content: This is the second time staying here for me and I'm just blow away with the resort and amenities. Four beautiful pools, three restaurants and tons of activites. Close enough to all the parks and entertainment but secluded enough when you want to get away from it all and relax. This time we are staying in a studio which is perfect for a couple, last time we stayed in a one bedroom, plenty big for four people. amenities included a washer and dryer in the room, full kitchen with granite counters and all apliances. The studio has everything except the stove and washer and dryer. There are laundry facilities on the property for studio renters. This is by far the best way to take a family to Disney for a reasonable price. This is a time share so they only clean one day during the week, the only drawback, but we didn't care.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent family home away from home”
Reviews.Author: John D
Reviews.Content: Three bedroom villa easily accommodated our family group of nine. Close to Disney World with an easy route to any of the parks. Also really close to Sea World. Beautiful resort with staff who aim to please. Villa we were in was three bedroom, three bath, kitchen, living room, dining area. Plenty of room to spread out. Restaurants were plenty, excellent pool areas, fitness center, ice cream shop, marketplace, and walking/jogging paths. Golf on property and across the street was first rate. This place was ideal! We plan to visit again. All we expected and more.

Reviews.Title: “1st. condo stay”
Reviews.Author: sunset777
Reviews.Content: I took my 3 grandchildren to this great condo resort last weekend for 2 nights. I have never stayed in a timeshare resort before and was very impressed. Along with oversized accomadations, this Marriott offered most of the amenities of a hotel. We arrived around 8 on Fri. night and the kids were thrilled the pools were open till 11 so we all went for a swim. The 2 different pools were nice and then we ended the evening at the ice cream shop. The resort gave us a list of activities for the week and if we were staying longer I know they would not have been bored. My husband and I usually stay at The Marriott World Center, Marriott Village or JW when in Orlando. We live just a little over an hr. away so we go quite often and usually stay where they offer the best price and prefer Marriott Resorts. Well the family has grown so I thought since it was just me and the girls, I would give a condo a try. I am very glad we did and would not hesitate taking this route again.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort, great vacation!”
Reviews.Author: Mfisher85
Reviews.Content: Marriott is certainly the way to go. The property is well maintained and there are many pools and activities to keep you busy on location. But if attractions are what you want, they are not far away, all the attractions and parks are just minutes away! The only thing you have to keep in mind is the timing of your visit as it can get very crowded, so be prepared for that during high season. The Marriott staff are all friendly and very helpful. The rooms/condos are nicely appointed and well maintained. As a Marriott resort owner, I know that if I want daily housekeeping I'd need to pay an additional fee, but since it's just the two of us there is no need. Definitely a great vacation location!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay - Very Nice!”
Reviews.Author: JCinAtlanta
Reviews.Content: My extended family and I stayed here back in late May 2011. What a beautiful property! The best part to some of my family members was that there was a Starbucks on site, which made getting up and moving easier in the morning. The pool was very nice. The room was in great condition and was very clean. We will definitely be staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “Good but not Great”
Reviews.Author: Jim J
Reviews.Content: The cleaning staff is the only thing keeping this resort from a 5. The room was great, the property is beautiful and the location was just about perfect for us. Overall it's a very nice Marriott resort in one of the busiest vacation cities in the world. If they would have made any attempt to clean the apartment in the afternoon, instead of first thing in the morning, it would have been perfect. However, since my wife and I were there without kids, we weren't compelled to rush off to Disney or Universal each morning at the crack of dawn, and that just didn't seem to fit into the cleaning crew's schedule. I'd still go back, and I'd still recommend it. Like I said, overall it's a great resort.

Reviews.Title: “Resort has all”
Reviews.Author: SoundFrequencies
Reviews.Content: This is a place to go to when you don't want to worry about anything. The resort has everything and sits in a good location - easy drive to attractions, restaurants, grocery, outlet shopping, even the Basilica. The only problem is, tens of thousands of other vacationers have the same thing in mind, so be prepared for traffic around the area, lines, crowds, you name it. And it depends on the season of course. Since the resort is huge, you can just stay in it and call it the vacation. Seriously, it has pools, well-equipped apartment suites, golf and the works, why would anyone venture out and be hassled by the hordes?

Reviews.Title: “2ND VISIT TO GRANDE VISTA”
Reviews.Author: AmeliaT
Reviews.Content: Stayed Aug 26 - Sep 09 2011. 2nd Visit and has it changed! Firstly we stayed in Bldg 77 Costa Brava, 2 Bed Villa, 7544. 2 Adults and 2,19 year old boys. A month prior to staying phoned the Marriott to confirm that the boys would have separate beds, was told no problem with the first week but may have to change suites for the 2nd week. Having exchanged with Interval this was down to the availability at that time. Nevertheless, was assured that they would try their best to get it sorted out prior to arrival. Unfortunately, when we arrived there was no record of my phone call but that they would do what they could at that time but could promise nothing. Thankfully when we phoned through to reception the night prior to the 2nd week commencing all had been sorted and we could remain in that villa. Reading through the remainder of this review you could ask why we did not insist on changing villas. COCKROACHES!!! The very first morning we had a visit. Phoned through to reception they sent someone up to spray the room when we went out for the day. 2 days later we had another visit. Just got rid of it ourselves on this ocassion. A week later yep, got another visit. Not happy this time so phoned through again and the room was resprayed. Thankfully after that we had no further visits. Packing and then re-packing was just a bit of a hassle when we had a tight schedule of things we wanted to see and do. The villas are extremely spacious and tastefully decorated, however the master bed did not have an awful lot of storage space for hanging clothes. Could have been cleaner too some food stains on furniture, peanuts under the TV cabinet and hair on floor in master bath. Not all the items on the inventory were present in the villa but not sure who checks that in any event. We were missing a cookie tray which would have proved useful on a couple of ocassions. Towels and tea towels were not all replaced when the cleaner came in mid stay. Several changes have occurred since we last stayed. The lighthouse bar is now a sweetery. Never looked busy so don't know why its there. Can now sit down in the Pizza Hut, previously it was just take out. The Copa Loca bar is far better than it was on our first visit and there is a new bar area at the pool near Reception. Did not go to Nick's Grill so cannot comment on that. The boys made use of the Gym and the Basketball court and thoroughly enjoyed themselves. The pool, spa pool and sauna were well used by all of us both first thing in the morning and late into the evening. We did not take part in any of the organised activities so again cannot comment. Location is ideal just off I-Drive. Shame resort does not offer Park Shuttle service. However, if you do not have a car you can still manage to get around on Lynx bus and the trolley. Used the concierge for some tickets they offer the same price as the discounted tickets at Orlando Visitor Centre on I-drive. The grounds are extremely well mainted and the drive up is quite impressive. We have stayed at other locations in Orlando and even though we had the cockroach incidents on both ocassions would still stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott Grande Vista Rocks;)”
Reviews.Author: vacationjoanne
Reviews.Content: we stayed last week and were warmly welcomed by staff upon checkin , golf resort villa was verry comfortable and great place to relax and unwind. beautifull location of property and grounds. The Name says it all: Grande Vista !;) we enjoyed playing tennis @ the courts, perfect resort for family with children because of full day sheduling of activities for kids. recreation facilities such as kayaking, fishing and golfing @ the Faldo golf institute by Marriott,hanging out @the pools and Copa Loca Bar and Grill. We will be back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend together with siblings”
Reviews.Author: PJWILSON
Reviews.Content: We are 50-ish siblings who all live in Florida. We live all over the state and Orlando is a convienient place for us to gather. One has a timeshare, and so we were treated to a 3 bedroom stay at this Marriott! What a beautiful place! All of our needs were taken care of. The 3 bedroom we stayed in had a living/dining area, a master king bedroom, a connecting double bedroom, and a lockout king bedroom. all were connected to the living area. We do not go to Orlando to visit the parks, but rather just want a place where we can get together and visit. Right off International Drive, if we did want to visit the parks, it was close to all the attractions. This was the perfect place. The beds were comfortable, the water pressure good in the showers, and the kitchen could take our intense cooking. We all bring a dish and take turns cooking for everyone. We swam all day in the pool, and found the one close to our unit better than the larger one which was loaded with children. The children's pool was entertaining lots of kids, all very happily enjoying the water pistols and fountains. The daily entertainment is posted in the elevator. The staff was very helpful too! Don't hesitate to choose this resort. Very clean, and accomodating!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful accommodations! Didn't want to leave....”
Reviews.Author: rapril2000
Reviews.Content: We stayed here Sept. 2011 for a weekend away. We arrived late Friday night to check in and the staff at the front counter were great. We were shown where everything was, given a property schedule and asked what area we would like our room near! I, of course, asked for a refurbished room and we were provided with 3621. The room, a one bedroom villa, was amazing! It was located on the 6th floor of that building, which was also the top floor. It was beautiful, clean and spacious. When you you first walk in there is a full kitchen to the right, a 6 person dining area, 3 bar chairs along the counter in the kitchen, and a living room area beyond that with a couch and two large chairs. Off of the entryway on the other side is a bathroom including a glass door shower, and toilet area. Off this bathroom is also a large bedroom area. Inside the bedroom area was a jetted bathtub with large seating in it, a vanity area with a sink, a very comfortable King size bed and a chaise lounge... the room also had a nice size balcony off the bedroom and living area with seating for 4. We had plans to go to Discovery Cove the day after arrival, and we were pleasantly surprised that it was less then a few minute drive to the SeaWorld and Discovery Cove properties! I was able to make a full meal that evening, and unfortunately we had to check out the next morning so we didn't get to see the property or really enjoy it for very long. HOWEVER, I would recommend this resort to everyone and it is possibly the most comfortable Marriott I've stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome family resort”
Reviews.Author: janessajoe
Reviews.Content: This family resort has had some bad reviews but don't listen to them this is a beautiful resort away from the business and road, secluded in a golf course. There is something to do for everyone. Great pools and even gas BBQ in te 80's section. The rooms are eligant and spacious. People talke about bugs I have not seen any and have stayed 3 years in a row. We will be back! The staff cannot do enough for you!

Reviews.Title: “Best Marriott we've been to...”
Reviews.Author: kellehs
Reviews.Content: We exchanged our timeshare week for a week at the Grande Vista....good decision ! We've exchanged for three or four years now - this is the best, most upscale resort we've been to. Quality of the room was first class. Classy, stylish furniture, spacious, well equipped, beautiful view over the golf course. Pool areas were all very nice. Clean, well maintained, plenty of sun loungers. Staff we great, everyone was very nice. Golf course was perfect for our party, which had a couple of beginners. Longer than a chip and put, but no daunting 400 yard+ holes. Stay here, you won't be disappointed....we may run into you, as we'll be back !

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: FoundWandering1111
Reviews.Content: Just spent a week at this great resort. I had business at the Convention Center and it was the perfect location. Loved everything about this hotel. The property is gorgeous, the restaurants were decent and offered variety and the staff was ALWAYS friendly and helpful. Our condo was nicely appointed, clean and in great condition. We all loved it! Only down side- WIFI was out all week. It was like the Bermuda Triangle. Weird stuff happened with our computers and phones - which made it super difficult to do business from the room. Fortunately we were out a lot so we got over it quickly and made the best of it. Even tried talking to AT&T a couple of times to no avail. This should have been addressed quickly but it wasn't. The Hotel staff tried their best to be reassuring and were apologetic but you could tell it was out of their hands. Otherwise, awesome stay and we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxed stay, away from the Orlando insanity!”
Reviews.Author: Kelowna_BCDebalina
Reviews.Content: We exchanged thtough II into a 2 bedroom unit, which was large and comfortable, albiet a bit dated in the appliances and fixturing. The unit over looked the golf course, which was lovely to wake up to. The pools were adequate, although pool service was not offered. The Marketplace had some essentials for purchase and the front desk was very helpful. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very spacious accomodation, great location”
Reviews.Author: alexsinanan
Reviews.Content: We (a family of 2 adults and 2 children) stayed here for one week - as an exchange through Interval - actually using an "accomodation certificate" which was complimentary from Interval International. We occupied a 2 bedroom apartment, which was actually 2 adjoining units with the connecting doors open. The apartment was very spacious, the fittings were all modern and everything worked. The location is fairly central, on International Drive - 5 minutes from Sea World and Aquatica and 15 minutes from Universal. There is a Publix 5 minutes away and the Orlando Premium Outlets shopping is 7 minutes drive away. In the future, if I ever need to exchange into a hotel in Orlando, the Grande Vista will be my first choice. In summary, given that the week at the Grande Vista was a complimentary week, we couldn't have asked for anything more!

Reviews.Title: “First Class”
Reviews.Author: teddy_scot
Reviews.Content: We visited Aug/Sept 2011, a couple with teenage son. The accommodation was very comfortable and spacious.2 bedroom apartment. We stayed in building 90 , which was the furthest from clubhouse but location was quiet and not a problem. Pool at building 91/92 was fine with enough seats and towels for everyone. Staff were friendly and helpful. The added bonus was the attched golf facility. Husband and son took out 3 day memeberships at 72 dollars each which gave them unlimited golf at the nine and eighteen hole courses. An extra $39 dollars per head covered club rental. Golf staff were brilliant. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location, unit, and deals”
Reviews.Author: PumpkinDenver_CO
Reviews.Content: We stayed in unit 6227 which is in the new section that is on the "other side" of the lake from reception. It was a nice sized 3 bedroom unit which worked well for 3 couples and a 4 year old. We were a short 10-15 minute drive from the Disney parks and minutes from SeaWorld. Our unit was very clean and up to date. The only challenge we had was getting the DVD to work. Only my husband could figure it out. We ordered delvery two nights while there and found the pricing a little high, but not by resort standards. Our rental terms included a $30 a day food credit and for the 5 nights we were there, this covered two dinners and several runs to the small grocery store to pick up odds and ends. We ate breakfast in the unit every morning, lunch twice, and dinner all but one night. Parking in this area of the resort was no issue and we usually had the spot in front of the steps up to our unit. The pool area was great. My 4 year old loved playing with the "water guns" and other fun water toys. We have stayed in many Marriott Vacation Clubs and this unit was one of the nicer ones. I would definately stay there again due to the location to parks, the layout of the unit, the activities near by, and the pool.

Reviews.Title: “We'd go back”
Reviews.Author: JPBREEF
Reviews.Content: As Marriott Timeshare owners, we exchanged intoa 3 BR at the Grande Vista. We stayed in building 93 overlooking the golf course. It was clean, stocked appropriately, and comfortable. The staff was friendly and knowledgeable but nobody went that 'extra step' that we've grown accustomed to at other Marriott timeshare properties. We enjoyed the quietness of the pool behind building 92. The main pool and the kids' pool were always too crowded or loud. It was great to have choices. The property is huge so expect a little bit of walking as nothing is 'right downstairs'. The food at the Copa Loca and Cove was okay and convenient but nothing to write home about. The breakfast at Nick's was horrible. We're glad they had a buy one get one free offer. Our daughter isn't old enough yet, but the MAZE activity center is probably the best I've seen. It was clean, modern and there were always activities going on to keep the kids' busy and motivated. We'll likely go back but not in August. It was just too hot and humid.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable, great for kids”
Reviews.Author: bk_in_chgo03
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grande Vista Aug 30-Sep 3, 2011 in two separate rooms (my fault, I booked it wrong). Anyway, the first room was a one bedroom villa in a building directly across from the registration office ... it is so nice to have access to a washer and dryer, particularly when nothing really dries in the humidity! It was also nice to have a stove for making breakfast. Everything was fine except for maintenance's response to our clogged toilet ... we called just before 11 pm and no one arrived until almost midnight. I really liked the second room we stayed in. It was a studio, but still a good size for a family of four ... one bed plus a full size sleeper / pull out couch. Unfortunately, no W/D, dishwasher or stove. Don't remember the name of the building but it was attached to the Copo Loco Lounge (the name might not be right, but it's close). Anyway, there were two building plus the lounge so if felt like a smaller resort and the pool was GREAT for the kids. The pool was broken up into two halves. One half was the kid side (water cannons, sprayers, etc) while the other one was the adults side (no playthings and closer to the lounge). One thing I should point out is that if you're interested in partaking in the resort activities, staying closer to reservations is probably better as you're closer to the "action". Rooms on the "far side" of the resort are by no means remote, you can get to the other side in 5 minutes time by crossing a bridge; it's just not as convenient. If you're planning on spending time at Sea World, Aquatica, the outlet mall, this resort is very convenient. There is also a Publix (grocery store) and Walgreens down the street.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: snoopyv
Reviews.Content: I love Marriott property. Check-in was easy and smooth. The room was beautiful and clean. We were not from the pool and faced the pond. Every morning I could see the sun rising and then in the evening the sun set. Absolutely beautiful. I own at Westgate and it does not compare to the Marriott!

Reviews.Title: “Great resort!!”
Reviews.Author: ny110699
Reviews.Content: Stayed the week of Sept 1st to the 5th. Fast check in. Resort staff very pleasant. Rooms very clean. Mattress very comfy. This is Building 83. The pool was great, lot of activities to keep busy or just sit back and relax. Will definitely book again. We were suppose to stay a full week but Katrina cut our vacation short..bummer.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice but one major problem”
Reviews.Author: Irina111
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grande Vista with our daughter, son-in-law and 3 young kids in a 2 bedroom unit. The rooms were spacious and comfortable with plenty of space for the 7of us. The kitchen was very well-equipped and we particularly liked having a dishwasher and washer/dryer. However, we didn't feel that it lived up to Marriott's reputation as a luxury hotel. There was one major problem! During our 1 week stay we saw 5 enormous cockroaches (palmetto bugs?) in our suite (we killed 3 and 2 got away)! I know that in a tropical climate this is sometimes unavoidable but its definitely not what we'd expect in a Marriott. We were otherwise quite pleased with the resort. The grounds and pool areas were beautifully maintained. The kids pool was perfect for the little ones, the pool towels were plentiful and the staff were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “great women”
Reviews.Author: lucky403
Reviews.Content: this place is good location if you need to party travelling around and searching for fun we came upon this place- what a time we had! women at this hotel are very friendly!! love them all

Reviews.Title: “Amazing option in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: carlosfidelis
Reviews.Content: I have time sharing at Marriott Cypress Harbour in Orlando but i changed my week this year to this special resort! Great idea! Its a resort with the Marriott quality like the others but i think this is more luxurious or newer. Its in the area that I know, close to Sea World , Aquatica and Discovery Cove region. Having car you can reach to many options for buying food -CVS,Walgreens and Publix or you can have in the resort a quick option of market. The ice cream sold at the LIGHT house is marvelous Once i had breakfast at the restaurant (seated and served one) NIKIS GRILL-very good The villas ( i stayed in a two bedroom villa) is great...huge space, clean, well decorated. The one I stayed had views for the lake.... The staff is sympa and the pools are great too.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in every single way”
Reviews.Author: RainbowSal
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure how people can complain, they must have extremely high standards! we stayed here for 2 weeks in June 2011 and The Grande Vista is a beautiful hotel with a long private drive way, large grounds, tennis courts, golf course and numerous pools - all of which were immaculate. Our room was perfect with view of the pool, lake and golf course! Couldn't have been any better! The room was very clean and spacious with everything we needed. Bathroom was spotlessly clean and modern. Kitchen was clean and well equipped. Bed was up to the usual Marriott standard and was sooooo comfy! Could have slept for a week in that bed (especially after all the time we spent at the theme parks). Location brilliant as we had a hire car and it didn't take long at all to get to any theme park. Seaworld is walking distance. Every staff member we spoke to at the hotel was extremely helpful, cannot fault any member of staff. Pools were great! Very clean and spacious. Lots of sun beds with comfy covers on and sun shades available. The barbecue areas at rhe pools were really good and we used them regularly. They were thoroughly cleaned every morning. Plenty of parking spaces too and a yummy on site pizza hut! Overall we found the hotel to be absolutely fantastic in every way, I couldn't find anything to moan about even if I tried. Loved every minute of our stay and we will definately be back!

Reviews.Title: “Can't go wrong at a Marriott!”
Reviews.Author: Patrick S
Reviews.Content: There are always plenty of amenities and activities for the whole family, though we didn't partake in any of the activities. We spent just about all of our time at Universal Studios. The beds are also quite comfortable. This place is right next to Sea World and not far from Universal Studios and Disney World.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible smell”
Reviews.Author: angiekent
Reviews.Content: After staying in Disney we checked into the grande vista using my timeshare. The first apartment in block 90 smelt so requested a change which they then gave me a room in block 93 this also smelt but had a good view. After some consideration my family decided we did not want to stay here and checked back into disney. The rooms are small with a pokey balcony and the place on the outside looked great the rooms are a real let down and for a Marriott establishment should severely be looked at.
