The rooms were dark smelly and pokey as far as we are concerned would not recommend anyone staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Worst service ever!!”
Reviews.Author: christianbehrens
Reviews.Content: We stay in a 3 bed villa for two nights and I will never go back again!!!! Please check the photos and you will see why.... We spoke 2 times with service desk and they didnt do nothing to help us.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Property”
Reviews.Author: SilverGirlz
Reviews.Content: We visited this resort May 27-June 3. We stayed in Bldg 93 in a 2 bedroom condo on the 3rd floor. We had requested an updated room and it was. Nice closed in balcony. Golf course was our view from the balcony. Too hot to sit out except for one night after it rained. Bldg 93 very close to the main pool. Get there early though as the chairs fill up rather fast. Very clean property. It is about 15 min from Disneyworld and Islands of Advenuture. It is just minutes from Seaworld. There is a Walmart about 10 minutes from the resort to buy groceries, wine and beer. We visited Islands of Advenutre mainly to see Harry Potter. Ride lines were long- 80 minutes for the Forbidden Journey, the Dragon challenge only about 20. Forbidden Journey was a cool ride, not sure if really worth the 80 minute wait, but if you go it is something you have to do at least once. Walking through the Castle was amazing. We ate at the restaurant right in Harry Potter world, for $50 for a family of four, we got a nice big salad, ribs, chicken, roasted veggies and roasted corn on the cob served family style. A little pricey but lots of food. Better than a cafeteria style meal elsewhere in the park. So much food we really only ate once the whole time we were at the park, so go hungry! We also visited Cocoa Beach. it is a little more than an hour from Orlando. Nice drive out. You can drive right onto the beach at Cocoa and park right there on the sand. They have a hut that rents our chairs and sells hot dogs, chips etc. We brought some snacks and our own cooler. Had a fabulous time, the only complaint would be the heat and humidity. I would next time go in March or wait until fall in October when the humidity is not as high. Living in colorado where there is practically no humidity was very hard to get used to.

Reviews.Title: “"We'll be back!!"”
Reviews.Author: sparkle519
Reviews.Content: We are timeshare owners here and love this resort. The pools are great for the kids. They have activities at the main pool daily which the kids love. The canon pool, as they call it, has water canons they can shoot water from. It's a lot of fun. This resort is close by to all attractions; Disney World, Sea World, & Universal. It is also not that far from the beach or the Kennedy Space Center. It is a very clean and well maintained resort. Great for families or couples.

Reviews.Title: “Could have been much better...”
Reviews.Author: RobertA869
Reviews.Content: This was an exchange through Interval International. One week prior to arriving, I asked if we could have the same room as we had had in 2009, on the top floor of building 77. The agent could not find our previous stay, but stated that a top floor room in building 77 should be no problem. Upon check-in, we were given building 77, but the second floor. As this was not acceptable, we were able to procure a room on the 5th floor (still not the top floor), after much discussion. Upon arrival at the room, the front door was bent (as if it had been kicked in at some point). The interior of the unit was large and as expected. Bath soap for our one week stay was limited to two small bars per bathroom (one for hand washing and one for bathing). Not realistic for a full 7 day stay. Our telephone also rang 3 to 4 times a day from the sales department wanting to entice us to purchase at the resort. Worst of all, during the last 3 days of our stay, we found a total of 4 cockroaches in our unit. Three were in the kitchen and one was in the utility closet. Very gross! Overall, while the units are large and well furnished, the quality was most certainly not as expected from a 5 star Marriott resort. If returning to Orlando, my family will probably consider other properties before staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Time with young boys”
Reviews.Author: BoyntonMama
Reviews.Content: Spent a week (Monday to Monday) at the resort. The kids LOVED the Kids Zone Maze area. They wanted to go there almost every day. We also did the paddle boats, played pool, fuze ball, pool and ping pong in the lakeside clubhouse. The sunset campfire with entertainment was very nice. There are probably 6 separate pools on property tho I must say the kids really loved the one with the cannons to squirt water and the splash area in the shallows. Even tho the property is quite large it was never tiring walking from our building. The best (although some may disagree) was when we took the elevator to the top of our building at dusk. As we looked across the property from the rail we saw hundreds of bats squeeze out of the roof tiles and fly out into the night. It was so awesome. Hundreds. Wouldn't have wanted to be on the 6th floor but it was cool to visit the 6th and see that. We've stayed at many resorts in ORLANDO but this one really was one of the top choices...the other was also a Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel experience ever”
Reviews.Author: monchotico
Reviews.Content: I arrived to the Grande Vista late at night after a very long trip from overseas. I had stayed in this property many times before and was very pleased with everything until this last trip. Even though my reservation was prepaid, and I was quoted a rate for an upscale unit, I was given a very old unit in disrepair, with a horrible smell. I tried to change the unit and the management told me that this was the only unit available. I paid for a recent ly renovated unit or new unit such as the Grande Vista advertises on this site and got a piece of garbage not worth 1/5 the rate that I was paying. The management was rude and non cooperative. I will never again stay at a Marriott during the rest of my life. They just lost a client that has spent at least 200 nights at Marriott properties.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room and location”
Reviews.Author: Mary H
Reviews.Content: We very much enjoyed our stay at the Grande Vista. It's a Marriot property so you expect the bar to be high. The room was very clean and nice toiletries. The beds were comfortable and the family had a overall good stay. Only complaint is a bit pricey for us. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “great resort”
Reviews.Author: dom3070
Reviews.Content: Our family just returned from yet another great vacation in Orlando. We have been staying at the Grande Vista for a number of years now. Its truly a great resort thats close to everything (shopping,Disney, Sea World, Universal). The resort pool is great, with plenty of chairs and lounges to provide a lazy day by the pool.Also here there is the Market place and a bar. There is another pool area copa loca which has a bar and grill.The check in is kinda of late(4p.m.), but they will let you use the resort prior to check in..We had dinner at Nicks Grille which was very good. There is also a pizza hut at the Market Place.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: NjTen
Reviews.Content: We had a once room efficiency style, pull out queen sofa, king bed and kitchenette. We were given a ground floor suite in building 94, best location ever. Room was updated and clean, concierge was excellent and attentive. Pools are great, free parking, free laundry..close to CVS and Walmart. PERFECT will definitely be back. Forgot to mention Thursdays 7-9pm awesome DJ near the pool with free smores for the fire pit. The kidlets will love it, mine did!

Reviews.Title: “Highly disappointed......”
Reviews.Author: steve s
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at many Marriott's over the years and have come to trust them. We were even considering purchasing a time share. However, after our current stay we have no interest and are very disappointed. My wife has a sensitivity to mold and there was an abundance in each bathroom, only a couple of the burners work on the stove, the beds are extremely hard and very uncomfortable. The on site pizza hut is very rude and not very good. My advice is that it is not worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: DuvaDbr
Reviews.Content: We stayed one week in August along with my brother and sister in law who ar,e owners, and my mom and dad, other brother and sister in law, neices, nephews and friends and their kids. The rooms are very roomy, with lovely kitchens with breakfast bars and big dining areas. The pools are clean, and plentiful, with towels provided and plenty of restrooms. The poolside bar & grill called the Copa Loca is very nice. The staff is friendly and helpful. Scott is the best, and Marquis.....they know how to take care of your every need and are very accomodating. The Resort provides plenty of Entertainment, and activities to keep you busy. It is also a very short distance from the parks, the main strip, Seaworld and Kennedy Space Center. The kids enjoyed the paddleboats and the arcade. They also had an Iron Chef contest which was fun, and Karaoke night. There is a full fitness center, and kiosks in the main lobby where you can print boarding passes for convenience. Edy's icecream is also a nice touch. You could also keep food in the fridge or get breakffast at the marketplace, or Pizza Hut. We were unable to get rooms next to each other, but they did book us all in the same building, and the elevators made it easy to visit each other. There is also a golf course, and a spa too!

Reviews.Title: “Best Family Hotel Stay”
Reviews.Author: famof4cal
Reviews.Content: If the scale was out of 10 this place would get an 11. The staff are unbelievably curteous and helpful. One of the best compliments I could give this place is the cleaning staff. They do a meticulous job and will not come knocking at your door early and bothering you. Leave a note or let them know if/when you need cleaning. The rooms were very much like a nice apartment with a separate room for the kids, master bedroom, living area and small kitchen. A home away from home at a great value. We didn't get a chance to take advantage of all the activities they had but there were plenty...from wine tastings, volleyball games, dance instruction, to pool games. Fun, fun, fun. If you visit Orlando stay here and NOT go to the theme parks everyday...take breaks at the pool, play ping pong , golf or tennis. Super fun place!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent property and great location”
Reviews.Author: Albam237
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights in August. Booked through a timeshare exchange (Interval). Buildings are 5 storeys and we got a ground floor end block which was excellent. One or two things were looking a little tired and the whirlpool bath didn't work on the last nite but overall the property was excellent. 1 minute walk to the nearest pool. Restaurants, shopping and coffee on the site about 5 mins away. 15 mins drive to Universal (International Drive was very busy night and day) and 2 mins to Sea World. Didn't play the golf course (much to my disgust) but it looked in excellent condition. Would loved to have stayed longer but had hotel booked in New York so left couple of days early. Would have no hesitation in going back...... Enjoy.... :-)

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Vacation!”
Reviews.Author: Gemini0569
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a Guest Room which had a King size bed, sofa bed, kitchenette (with fridge, microwave, glassware, dishes & cutlery), breakfast table and balcony. It was perfect for our family of 4. The room was very clean and well maintained with the daily housekeeping. We travelled with our 2 girls (ages 6 & 8) and found lots of activities on the property for kids of all ages. The property is large but walks were nice...not too long. Every thing is well planned and situated. Things to do : rent paddleboats or motorized boats (seats 2 - 4), go to the kid's indoor play area (height restriction....my 8 yr old just made it), older kids can make use of the pool table, ping pong table or arcade; there are also daily activities for young children upto adults which varies and includes crafts, Wii games, ceramic painting, day camp or evening camp (approx 4hrs), various fitness classes and more....we also enjoyed visited the Lighthouse ice-cream shop and spending a day at the spa. The I-Trolley stops right outside the property and travels along International Drive where there are lots of restaurants, parks, attractions and Outlet Shopping!! We had a fabulous holiday, loved the hotel and will definitely go back again!!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing - watch out for the roaches!”
Reviews.Author: katertotyay
Reviews.Content: We had similar trouble to a reviewer who said that their rooms were not ready for a while, even though we told the staff ahead of time we would be arriving in the early afternoon. They said we could not check in until 4 (we got there at 1) and our rooms might not even be ready by then. We went to a Disney park that day and got back, exhausted, at 9 p.m. Our rooms were totally incorrect - we asked for 2 adjacent rooms on the top floor by a pool and they gave us 2 rooms down the hall from one another on the 2nd floor, away from everything. After telling the front desk staff how disappointed we were in the service, they finally found us 2 adjacent rooms on the 3rd floor by a small pool. The rooms themselves were recently renovated and nice at first glance, but my sister's bedroom had something gross on the wall that we couldn't figure out what it was and my bathroom had something all over the toilet seat (presumably cleaner; it wiped off right away). A few days into the stay my sister found a cockroach in their room and we found another in a cupboard (very much alive) on the last day, complete with roach feces all intermixed with the cups in the cupboard. When we called to have this issue addressed, their solution was a guy with a can of roach spray. We told them to spray after we left since we were checking out the next day. I expected a lot from Mariott, considering the website and pictures made the place seem very nice, and my parents and I have stayed here before and had a wonderful experience. This time however I would choose to never go back and I hope future occupants don't have the same disgusting issues we did...

Reviews.Title: “O.K., but have stayed at nicer timeshares”
Reviews.Author: disneyrocksFlorida
Reviews.Content: We used a "bonus" week and stayed in a 3 bedroom. Did not care for the layout of the property, that is always a bummer. Obviously, the unit we stayed in was gonna be redone soon, it was kinda outdated.. The washing machine leaked all over the floor we called front dest they sent over 2 men and they said they fixed it, but they did not we called again, still not fixed, so we decided to just deal with it.....wet floor and all for the week. Did not like the way master bedroom was set up, bathroom was small ( I guess in 3 bedroom units it is?). Play area for kids was nice, but not to friendly staff. Kids made lots of neat crafts, we enjoyed that. No transportation to Disney. We watched some movies we brought on vacation, and accidently left one in the dvd, when we called to see if they could retrieve it and mail it to us they said the dvd was gone, and they could not find it.....sure they could'nt!! Overall, it is an o.k. property, but enjoy Sabal Palms better. We will try Harbour Lake this year. If you have other choices on which timeshare to pick go with another one!

Reviews.Title: “Would certainly return!”
Reviews.Author: travelhappie
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during spring break and did the whole Disney World thing. It was about a 10-15 minute drive to the front gates of Disney. Depending which park you were headed to, it can take up to 30 mins to get to the parking lot. It is VERY close to SeaWorld. Closeby are several restaurants and a couple of grocery stores. Had a 2 bdrm, 2 bath and it was perfect for our family of 5. The property is HUGE. After the turn into the Marriott property it is quite a drive to the main building. There are tennis courts, basketball, as well as the pools. We had asked to be in a remodeled room and close to the main pool. We ended up being in the most recently remodeled room, but a few buildlings away from the pool. The villa has most of the kitchen things you need. We really appreciated the tupperware so we could bring food to the parks. This saved us a lot of money! Yes, there were tons of bugs, but it's Florida. What can you do? They would have several activities going on every day, but we were wiped out from Disney and only did some Easter activities by the main pool. There were just a few things that prevented this hotel from getting more stars. For some reason, one of the pools were partially blocked off when we went at night. Every time we went to the pool they ran out of towels. We had to wait for them to bring more towels. Also, I realize this is a timeshare, but they should put out a cart with supplies in the hallways so people can take what they need. I've stayed at other timeshares and this is common practice. But overall, it is a good value if you are trading your week in and want to do Orlando. We did 2 extra paid nights and not sure if it was worth the price tag for those days.

Reviews.Title: “We had a nice stay.”
Reviews.Author: HIJetsFan
Reviews.Content: In the heat of July, we stayed at a 2 bedroom unit which must've been refurbished, because the televisions were flat lcd which was nice. Some of the decor is a little dated, but comfortable. The unit was clean and we were on the 4th floor so not much bugs maybe one or two, which was not very active and ready to die so management must be doing something to get rid of bugs. The 2 bedrooms was great for 5 adults and 4 kids (4 - 8). Pools are fantastic, and the indoor maze thing was great for kids 48" and under, which is a great rule because there were some big kids (bigger that the 48") without parent supervision started to dominating the slides and little ones felt very intimidated to do anything and management came to tell the kids that the maze was for little kids and that the kids needed their parents to watch them play. The only disappointment was that they closed down their wall climbing activity. Overall I was very satisfied and will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Renovate! Renovate! Renovate!”
Reviews.Author: luv2travel121
Reviews.Content: The grounds are nice but the rooms are old and smelly.One of our rooms was missing the framed artwork from the walls. The furniture was stained, the kitchen and bathrooms were old and mildewy - terrible!!!! When you ask they tell you that the rooms have been renovated - but they look nothing like the pictures on the website. Where are those rooms - that's where I want to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Love, love, loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: tamaradmProspectOhio
Reviews.Content: we had the best stay and THE best room at the grande vista. we stayed july 23rd through the 29th. our one bedroom villa was in building #84, room #4609 - ask for it, you could not get a better room or view. our room was renovated and viewed the lake and the pool area. we thoroughly enjoyed everything about our room. we traveled with our children, ages 7 and 8. they participated in many activities and i went to the mojito making class...excellent and soooo much fun. this resort is very close to seaworld and aquatica. we bought the "length of stay" tickets for seaworld and aquatica which was wonderful. we visited seaworld 3 different times and aquatica twice. this way we did not have to stay at the amusement parks all day. we broke it up and enjoyed visiting this way so much more than feeling like you had to stay somewhere all day. the kids did much better this way too. the rest of our time we spent at the resort enjoying the pools and activities. there are a few restaurants and an ice cream shop, a couple bars, and pizza hut. all of the restaurants had great food. the staff was wonderful too, everyone was so nice and helpful. we did not pay for housekeeping services, in fact, the one morning we had the "do not disturb" sign out and we received a call from the front desk asking when we would like service. there was no extra charge for housekeeping services. i would highly recommend this resort to anyone. we will definitely return and ask for room #4609!

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay”
Reviews.Author: rvstauff
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay here(last stay 2005). We traded our current timeshare and we were not disappointed when we received confimration to the Grande Vista. Location related to Sea World is the best. We did mostly Disney stuff which is only 10 - 15 min away. Pool areas are great. Pool bar drinks are a bit pricey, but it's fun. Food on site is OK. We had a 2 bedroom villa. For 2 adults and 2 kids, it is HUGE. The balcony was HUGE and the view from our room of the golf course was wonderful. Room was ready and very clean when we arrived. Ice maker was not working. I try not to do laundry on vacation, but did need to on this trip. Washer was fine. Dryer did not seem to work very well. We ran clothes throuhg 3 times and they still were damp. We also did not feel like the room was cool enough at night. Sheets felt like they had a plastic lining in them. The thing we liked least was the bed. It was very soft and squeaky. If we trade again, we will not be disappointed if we receive Grande Vista confirmation.

Reviews.Title: “Not Good. Would Not Recommend Staying Here.”
Reviews.Author: gkitz13
Reviews.Content: The room was very spacious but we had lots of problems while we were there. The first night that we were there, we called for blankets for the pull-out bed around seven o'clock but they did not arrive until ten fourty-five in the evening (they were also very loud and noisy upon their time of arrival) when we were all asleep. Our oven started smoking. When we called to see if someone could come and fix it they didn't come until the evening before we left. The fire alarm even went off. Our refrigerator started leaking lots of water and once again was not fixed until the evening before we left. One of the wheels on the drawer in the dishwasher was broken and made that rack not usable. We also killed a cockroach. Overall, The service was good when finally received. Definitely not the best experience. Would not stay here again. The pool was nice in the daylight hours but we could not sleep when people would stay out at night and be noisy.

Reviews.Title: “We were very disappointed with the Marriott Grande Vista”
Reviews.Author: danrover
Reviews.Content: We were expecting a lot from the Marriott Grande Vista , but we were left very disappointed. When we arrived to check in, we were told that our room wasn't ready, we were a little early so it wasn't too much of a problem. We were told if we came back at 4pm it would be ready. After coming back and waiting another 30 minutes the room was finally ready. Then when we got to our room we found that the keys didn't work, so we had to trek all the way back to reception to sort that out. We stayed in one of the 3 bedroom apartments, when we got into our room at first we thought it was quite nice, but after closer insepction the kitchen & Bathroom floors were still dirty (I wiped them with a wet piece of kitchen roll and it was black and full of hair), and the cupboards felt sticky. During our stay we also had problems with broken kitchen appliances, toaster was broken, and the tumble dryer was broken too. These were quickly replaced, which was a positve thing for this hotel. I think the room we must have been allocated was an older room as it was very dated and worn. We were also very disappointed that we had to pay for housekeeping, when at our home resort this is all free. We don't come on holiday to empty our bins and take our recycling & rubbish to the stinky bin store. This is no where near the standards of Marriott we have been use to. The week before we stayed at the Marriott Sabal Palms resort and this was much nicer and more modern than this resort. A much more enjoyable stay there. The only good thing about this resort is the location, it's well located for International Drive, Sea World, DIscovery Cove and Universal Studios. I wouldn't recommend staying here, unless they modernise their rooms and improve their housekeeping.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding anniversary trip, we'll be back....”
Reviews.Author: BFMcLaughlin
Reviews.Content: We've been to several timeshares that my parents own, but this was the first time we tried it on our own. We just absolutely loved it. We had a one-room villa overlooking the Faldo golf institute nine-hole course and our building's pool. It was just outstanding. It took us 15 minutes to say "we'll come back". The pools were a blast, with poolside drink ordering (mmmmm, Mai Tais). Our room was huge with fully stocked kitchen, and the spa-tub inside isn't your regular tiny one -- it's a hottub unto itself. Bathroom opens to bedroom and/or main area, whatever you want. No reason to go downstairs to their hottubs next to the pool -- though those are quite spacious and looked fun too. We loved Nick's restaurant and the cantina place next to the pool which had sandwiches and stuff (can't remember the name). Great food, obviously priced higher than a typical restaurant -- but it was great. We are proud to say our vehicle never left its spot. You can even pick up some quick groceries on site. The place is just fun. Heck, we played bingo while sitting in the pool. The staff is great. Even check-in is fun. There are lots of kids, so keep that in mind (doesn't bother us, we have them too). We got our 1-room Villa for a steal rate of 170 a night. This room is probably worth 250-300 in our opinion. We will come back one day with our kids. The only reason I put a 4 out of 5 for sleep quality is because the bed was a bit stiff for us, but that could be more because of us than the location. Keep that in mind.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed this timeshare.”
Reviews.Author: joananne2010
Reviews.Content: This timeshare is centrally located and you have easy access to International Drive and to both SeaWorld and Aquatica. The rooms are furnished well and the pools and amenities are great for families. The prices for boat rentals is alittle expensive and the wait to use either the ping pong or pool table is lengthy. They have a small restaurant on the premises for pizza, salad, breakfast etc, a market place store and quite a few bars along the pool areas. There are alot of pools for small children as well as older kids and adults, hot tubs too. Everyone was pleasant and helpful and it a great place for the family. The only complaint we had is that the pull out couch was not very comfortable and that the dishware and utensils were only a service for 6. Could not have bowls for cereal two days in a row without washing all.

Reviews.Title: “Shear elegance”
Reviews.Author: PAPO026
Reviews.Content: I just arrived from the Mattiott Grande Vista in Orlando Florida. I looked at Utube to get an idea of the type of place I was headed but, when I got to look at this magnificent hotel suite that I booked, I was so thrilled. Nothing like the utube videos. The shear elegance of this suite knocked me off my feet. Literally, I sat on the sofa just to look at my sorroundings. The suite was newly renovated. It was like a manhattan elegant apartment, Granit counter tops, stainless steel appliances, beautifully decorated, like a HGTV show, a outside patio facing a beautiful pond. huge painting on the walls. Four pools, one was a lap pool.as well as a hot tub. Gated, very clean. Golf course as well as many activites, it reminded me of the cruise I wnt on last year. The service was wonderful, wifi in the bedrooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great Amenities, Friendly, Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: rocker18
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grande Vista for the first time in a few years. Activities for children, tweens and teens every day- most at a nominal cost. Activitity staff are excellent with children- and activities broben down by age- under 4 8 and up etc. Adult classes from yoga to zumba to cocktail making. In terms of the rooms-some have been renovated- the one we stayed in was not- but still well appointed and comfortable. While we did visit the main pool, we spent most of out time at a smaller satallite pool outside of our unit- there are a number of satallite pools- liked the number of umbrellas (if you are seeking time out of the sun). There is a rec. centre, an indoor climbing area for small children and a fitness centre as well as a full spa. A tip- if you like to barbeque, ask to be located in a unit near gas grills- there are a few around unit 76(?) and six around pool where we stayed- unit 92/93. The remainder of the grills are charcoal- too time consuming and messy for my liking. Location of the resort is a stone's throw from Sea World- maybe 15 minutes from Universal and Disney Parks. There is a Publix and CVS up the street and many restaruants within easy travel. Would definitely recommend this resort for families.

Reviews.Title: “Overall beautiful grounds, but room in major need of renovation!”
Reviews.Author: teacher41
Reviews.Content: Always loved staying in this timeshare and I had only positive and glowing reviews. This was the first time that I have truly been disappointed in my room. It was old and outdated and in bad need of repair in many areas. Leaky sink, dirty blankets, poor mattress on sofa bed pullout, cracked cabinets and tiles. I heard that all rooms are being renovated, so I hope that to be true. Also, there are people at the pool who take tons of towels, leave them on chairs and disappear until they are ready to sunbathe. The staff needs to do a better job on having someone personally give out only one towel per guest and monitor the chair situation. On a positive note, the grounds are still beautiful and well kept. The staff is friendly and is there to take care of all of your needs.

Reviews.Title: “Had a good time at the pools”
Reviews.Author: revoFL
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 2 BR suite for 5 nights. Enjoyed the atmosphere and especially the pools. We did not partake in any activity other then sitting by the pools however. We used to live in Orlando so we weren't into going to parks or typical Orlando stuff - so having a nice place and room to stay in and a great pool to relax at all day was key. The location is OK. It gets a little busy if you need to go out to any of the tourist areas, especially if you are heading towards anything on Idrive. However, the campus itself is way off the road and it's like you're in your own world once you're in the gate. Will try to book this place next time we're back down.

Reviews.Title: “We had a good experience”
Reviews.Author: WMB0718
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful vacation at this resort. The main pool was very beautiful. We found our accomodations to include everything that we required without requesting service. We did not do any of the resort activities, but did visit the gift shop which served Starbucks. Everything that we experienced was great. I would return again if in the area

Reviews.Title: “Worst Marriott in our experience.”
Reviews.Author: Rmunro3
Reviews.Content: Dirty woodwork even sticky, old appliances, garbage collection random and everywhere, unsanitary. Staff not responsive to complaints. Great pools but go elsewhere...

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, relaxing resort”
Reviews.Author: DebbieDoll
Reviews.Content: Our first time staying at the Marriott Grand Vista and we enjoyed it very much. Rooms, pools, grounds, restaurants were all so very clean. People who work there were very nice. Plenty of room in the villa. Everything was in working order. Great view over of lake & pools. Nice entertainment one evening.

Reviews.Title: “The Pool was wonderful”
Reviews.Author: smduja
Reviews.Content: My 6 year oldson and I stayed here at the end of May/first of June. We had a studio which was perfect for the two of us. Lovely view of the golf course. This is the first vacation where we spent more time by the pool then out running around. We ended up only staying one day Disney. The pools were not crowded. For the most part staff was friendly. On check out I was listening to the girl next to us explain the whole property to the people checking in. The girl checking us in just handed me a map and the keys. I had to ask how to get to our room. Maybe because we aren't owners? They have the indoor kids area but there is a height restriction and they are very strict about it. My son was barely two inches over and they told him he couldn't play. He was very upset. The beach area was nice and some nights they do campfires and smores. Rooms were for the most part clean. But when I pulled the extra blanket out of the closet there was makeup all over it. And it was in a zipped bag so someone just folded it up and put it back in. The restaurants are pricey, espacially the one near the kids pool. $40 for two lunches. There are lots of things to do but when we were there we just hung out at the pool. Would I stay here again. Probably. It's remote and quiet so it doesn't feel like you are at a resort.

Reviews.Title: “One of my favorite places to stay in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: love2travelky
Reviews.Content: Great Resort! So much to do even if you don't plan to go to the theme parks. Activites include: Golf, Tennis, Aerobics, Paddle Boats, and activites for the children. Each evening there is a message on the phone informing you of the next days actvities. This is my second visit to this hotel. Once, when it first opened about 9 years ago. I was worried that this visit wouldn't be as good, becasue the rooms may be in rough shape. But I was wrong. Our unit was a 3 bedroom and bath. Each bedroom had a flat screen tv. Loved that each room had its on bathroom. We had a great view of the golf course. For the price, I would much rather stay here than get a lot less room on Disney property. We also loved being able to check in around 12. Most places make you wait until 4. We love this place!!!

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the location”
Reviews.Author: bc49st
Reviews.Content: We visited SeaWorld, Aquatica and Discovery Cove during this trip and the location of this hotel was fabulous. We were literally a 4 minute drive from all the attractions. We loved the one bedroom suite (especially the in room washer/dryer which was key) - it was large, clean and comfortable and surprisingly inexpensive. Our kids LOVED the play area which was clean and well staffed. The kids are young, but there were tons of activities for them and I got the impression that it would have been a great place for tweens / teenagers as well. My only complaint was with the front desk staff. They weren't rude, but were fairly unfriendly and almost snotty. The place was very busy and we weren't able to check in until 4 pm and were not able to get a late checkout. The biggest thing to know is that the place is a massive - tons of different building and you should definitely look at a property map when you're getting your room and asked to be switched if you're in one of the outlying buildings. We were originally assigned a room on the main part of the property but really far away from the main pool. We had lunch across the bridge and realized that that area (and pool) was much better for little kids (it seemed like the main area/pool was designed for adults and teen - it had a beach, fire pits, etc) so we asked to be switched. They were able to move us so I think it pays to speak up to get a better location. Overall we were happy and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “The Shine Is Dimming”
Reviews.Author: Murray100Florida
Reviews.Content: This was our third time back for our summer family vacation. Bright Shine We love this Marriott facility because their villas (time-share rentals ranging from 1 to 3 bedrooms with complete kitchen, dining room and laundry) are spacious and moderately priced. Unlike other facilities of this type the buildings do not look like barracks, they are attractively painted, they are clean, and VERY well maintained. Every building or grouping has its own pool that is also attractive and well maintained with an adequate number of chairs, tables, lounges, umbrellas and clean towels at each site. The Grande Vista is huge (hundreds of acres) including a Nick Faldo 9 hole golf course and a well equipped pro-shop with a REALLY GOOD restaurant â€“ Nickâ€™s â€“ where breakfast, lunch and dinner are served.. The centralized check-in/information desk lobby, recently updated Marketplace (PizzaHut, ice cream parlor, billiards, table tennis, notions store, computer facility, spa and childrenâ€™s play area) are easily reached, well appointed and well staffed. The Shine Dims (A) Room Control - What the Grande Vista refers to as â€œRoom Controlâ€� is abysmal. In fact, there is no control at all! There appears to be no coordination as to what rooms are being reserved for whom and no control of the time for room availability. It is all random. We made our reservations for 3 villas 90 days in advance and requested early check-in and that our villas be somewhat near each other as we had two children to deal with and visit with. It is true that they say they will â€œTRY to honor requestsâ€� when, in reality, they make no effort whatsoever to do so. Out of our 3 visits to this Marriott we NEVER arrived where our villa was ready for occupancy and only one time were we even on the same floor as the other people in our group. This time, although we arrived at 12:30pm (checkout time is 10:00am) our room was not available until 3:59pm (check-in time is advertised as 4:00pm). Itâ€™s as though they â€œstuck it to usâ€� for arriving early; and, to make matters worse our 3 villas were located on 3 different floors at different ends of the building we were in. Well, at least we were in the same building. FORGET ARRIVING BEFORE 4:00PM IF YOU WANT A NO HASSLE CHECK-IN (B) Cellphone Service - If Verizon is your cell phone provider you can forget using your phone for texting to coordinate the activities of your group; their service is, at best, pitiful. Messages are either not sent at all, or sent unreliably. In many on-premises locations there is no service at all. All-in-all, given the above, we were angry for the first day. We learned to cope with, and work-around, the problems and had a great time anyway. Itâ€™s just unfortunate that something we so much looked forward to had to be so marred with anxiety and frustration at the very outset.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Geoff1725
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week in room 5505. Absolutely perfect in every way, a 2 room apartment. The grounds are amazing, the pools are amazing, everything at this resort is 1st class. Beer at this resort has many prices depending on where you buy and when I believe. That's the only thing that wasn't awesome. Will be going back. Really close to Aqautica, Seaworld, and everything else on I-Drive.

Reviews.Title: “Better than it's ever been”
Reviews.Author: tenthousandlakes
Reviews.Content: The Grande Vista has been updated, improved and is better than ever. The furniture and beds are all new and top of the line (amazing beds, flat screen tv's) . The property is lovely. The resort is spotless and continues to offer wonderful amenities. Wonderful place for small children and adults alike. The indoor playroom was a really nice touch for the hot Florida summers. I would highly recommend!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Marriott's are still awesome!!”
Reviews.Author: lbrobt
Reviews.Content: This is the third Marriott Times share we have stayed at (Aruba Surf Club and Cypress Harbour being the other 2) and it is on a par with all thier other resorts. There are 4 pool areas, 1 of which is buy the main building, the second one is accross the lake and has 2 areas, 1 zero entry pool which has water cannons and one deeper pool. The other two lakes are located behind the buildings, and are a little more quiet.....the one by my building had a Barbecue area with 6 gas grills, which was nice. We got to eat by the pool and swim afterwards. The resort had a nice gym with plenty of space, outdoor jogging trails were marked on a map, the spa, although not my thing, has specials all week long. The food at the pool bar was very good and the portions were generous. The drinks, always good. The room itself was very nice. Slightly different then Cypress Harbour because of the lock-off lay out, it was clean, had everything we needed in the kitchen, and everything worked. Staff was friendly and knowlledgeable. If you are gonna trade for this place, good for you. If you are gonna get it as a getaway through Interval...you'll be shocked at what you paid and what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Great Trip”
Reviews.Author: Standby_Hitchhiker
Reviews.Content: We have owned a Grande Vista timeshare for 8 years, and this is our 5th trip (we exchanged other years). As always, the 2 bedroom condo was great. Stylish, modern, comfortable. Plenty of towels. The pool is a little noisy, as are the DJ's running the pool games for the kids, but hey, his is a family place. The only downside was the sales presentation that we took (to buy more weeks). VERY high pressure, and lasted 45 minutes longer than the 90 minutes we were told (we did not buy another week). The presentation was not worth the discounts on Disney tickets they gave us. If you go to the presentaion, take the cash. And the Pizza Hut on site is a rip-off. The call a 12" pizza a large one, and have the nerve to charge $15 for it. Get your pizza elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: kamccoy
Reviews.Content: We had a great time here. We enjoyed the pool, hot tub and activites. We hung out at the main pool's bar. We had a great time, and the service was great. A fun time. It is close to sea world and disney. We didn't do either, but lots of places around (shopping, food etc)

Reviews.Title: “Still a great resort”
Reviews.Author: needmoretime
Reviews.Content: We were there from Feb 28 to March 6 (1 week). We arrived at the resort around 2AM due to flight delays and had no issues checking in (2 bedroom condo with lock-off). The front desk was helpful and suggested places if we wanted to get a late night (early morning) snack. We had stayed at the Grand Vista in 2009 and there was no change in the way we were treated with the accomodation and service. This is a great, friendly and safe resort for the family with kids. This time, we played golf at the resort (Faldo Institute) and had a great time, considering it is wintertime back home.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Resort”
Reviews.Author: slhansen219
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Marriott Grande Vista in Orlando. The resort property was well maintained & very nice. Our room, a 2 bedroom villa, was well appointed and very spacious. The pools were very nice. There were several pools & we chose to use a smaller pool due to the fact that there were fewer children & we wanted tranquility. The hotel is conveniently located near theme parks, restaurants and shopping. The resort also has a nice 9 hole golf course which we enjoyed playing. Had a great time & would definitely return to this resort. Resort offers free internet in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Complex”
Reviews.Author: takeatrip63
Reviews.Content: We are members in the Marriott Vacation Club. This is one of the largest, nicest properties we stayed in. The grounds are beautiful! We stayed in a villa a short walking distance from the pool. We only used the pool during our rest between the Disney parks. Otherwise, we would have liked a villa closer to the pool. There are good number of restaurants, ice cream shops, and quick-bite places on the property. We ate lunch at the restaurant overlooking the golf course. The food was great there. We went to Disney on the day before Halloween. So we decided to stay at the hotel on Halloween night. The Marriott had a great Halloween party for the children. They handed out trick-or-treat bags and paraded around the complex as the staff handed out treats. There was music, snacks, games and face painting after. My 5 yr son really enjoyed it. We had a great week at this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great property for young children”
Reviews.Author: SkylarRoseville
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect for families traveling with young children. So much to do not enough time. When going to Orlando most people plan for most activities outside the resort at Disney or Universal make sure to include at least 1 day at the resort to take advantage of all it offers. Beware the food at the resort is horrible but we did not eat at Faldos. Shopping is very convienent with WalMart Super Center and others right around the corner. If you need items for the pool such as noodles or flooties you can hit CVS or Walgreens within a two minute drive from the resort. The resort is also close to several good dining options such as Tommy Bahamas, Pizzera Uno's, Bahama Breeze, Denny's, Panera Bread and many others. Overall we love Marriott because it's always consistant. We know ther resort will be well maintained and service with a smile.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it! Simply superb”
Reviews.Author: vireshjain
Reviews.Content: 15 May 2010 We booked this hotel for our family holiday in Orlando. We have stayed at many hotels over the years, often luxury ones with impeccable details and fantastic designs. Price-wise Marriott is on par with these better-class hotels. Iâ€™m sure we will fondly remember the vacation we had there. We were at the property and our three bedrrom villa had fantastic views of the Golf Course and the lake body from all rooms. The swimming pools, all five of them with hot water jaccuzzi were truly amazing and refreshing. It is the perceptive and friendly service that makes it worthwhile staying in this professionally run hotel. Grande Vista is a place you would definitely come back to and recommend to your friends. Thank you very much for making our stay so pleasant!!!

Reviews.Title: “Life doesn't get much better than at a Marriott !!”
Reviews.Author: babsdisney
Reviews.Content: Well, this is our second time staying here, our original Marriott timeshare is in Arbua. We brought a friend with us and couldn't have been happier with the room, location and attentive staff. A small problem with the ice maker, staff was there in 5 minutes and replaced it. I have read some of these reviews and I question what kind of hotels would make these people happy. I travel alot and rate Marriott #1 and have never been disappointed. The kitchen is wonderful everything needed to cook in which we did a couple of evenings so we could relax by the pool in the day. The hotel is located near all attractions as well as Disney. The staff is top notch and will try to accommodate whenever there are issues that can be settled. For those visitors that will not return thank you for making room and allowing other visitors the wonderful experience here. Thank you Marriott for another wonderful vacation week!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort (if you're in the right room)”
Reviews.Author: swhip
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grande Vista the last week of May while on a family vacation to Disney World. After reading some reviews about old outdated rooms, I had called a few weeks prior and request a renovated room. Upon arrival we were told we were, in fact, in a newer building. However, the building was really far from the main pool/activity area and it was only partially renovated. There was also a weird smell in the room. I called the front desk and asked to be relocated and they did so with no problem. The person at the front desk was fantastic and actually walked with us to new room to see if it would be acceptable. We were in a very convenient location and our room was meticulous. The grounds are beautiful and staff is very friendly. Food and beverages are reasonable and quite good. My kids loved the kids pool area as well as the motor boats and arcade. They didn't use the playscape area. Though I image if you have a day with bad weather, that would make the kids very happy. I would definitely stay here again. We had a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Love, Love, Love Grande Vista”
Reviews.Author: DorrieD
Reviews.Content: This was our 4th stay at Grande vista and I cant fault it. We love coming back to Orlando every 2 years. Grande Vista is set in the most beautiful of grounds. The staff are always so willing to go the extra mile.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice facility”
Reviews.Author: Saxeygirl
Reviews.Content: We traded out time share in Maui and received a very nice two bedroom unit in the exchange. It was new, clean, lovely...everything you expect from Marriott. We were in unit 8544 which was on the "less busy side" on the lake. We were just a short walk from the pool. There are pool areas on both sides of the lake. We liked the side we were on. We spent most of our time there doing Disney theme parks, so didn't spend a lot of time at the resort itself. We did spend some time at the pool on Sunday afternoon, and it was very pleasant. They had fun features for children...Water fountains, and water cannons. Everyone seemed to be having a great time. Parking is free with your unit. There are eating facilities on the premises, also tennis and golf, none of which we used. It's not as close to WDW as the Marriott World facility which includes Sable Palms and several others, but it's within a reasonable distance, and very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott Grand Vista”
Reviews.Author: BuckeyeVoyager513
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at the resort from May 26 through 30th. Just a little bit of background before I start. My family consider Orlando our second home. We have been traveling there since the early 80's. My kids are now adults and now we are traveling with grandchildren. The grounds of the property are very well maintained but I canâ€™t say the same for the villa. Based on the reviews Iâ€™m guessing that those who rated the resort as excellent were given a new unit. My family was assigned to units 6600 & 6601 near the front. The furniture needed to be replaced as it was tears and stains on both the furniture and the carpet. The unit was infested with ants and my son was bitten on his back while lying on the sofa watching TV. I didnâ€™t say anything to my family but the first night I was sitting on a chair in the living room and I felt as though someone was biting me. I next day I put a beach towel over the chair before I sat down. I didnâ€™t want to alarm the family. But the real shocker occurred in the master bedroom when my husband and I witnessed live roaches crawling from the nightstand. Ok I realize from traveling to Florida over the years visitors might see cockroaches because o Florida's warm climate etc... But domestic roaches are just unacceptable. I immediately called the front desk and spoke with Abby. She sent someone up who came with a can of hot shot. Hmmm. The representative told us that an exterminator would come by the next day for more extensive treatment. Of course that never happened. In reference to my son's ant bite, a resort representative delivered sting pads for him to place on his bites. The kitchen floor had scuff marks; the tile in the kitchen was separating from the floor. The ice maker did work and parking is horrible. Also in my opinion the restaurants are overpriced. If I was an owner I would be livid. We had lunch at the Copa Loca Bar & Grill and spent $95 for 3 adults and 3 children (ages 2, 2 & 4) on just sandwiches. The Disney parks prices were better than that. For example we had breakfast with the characters and only spent $100 for all of us which also included a generous tip for Ms. Judy our server. Also there are way too many units for the amount of parking spaces available. On a good note the kids loved the jungle maze as well as the other daily activities they offered.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort”
Reviews.Author: Kattimus
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grande Vista in April 2011 and had a great time! The resort grounds are gorgeous with wonderful pools and even a small beach area. We traveled with our children and really enjoyed all of the planned activities - but their favorite part was the MAZE area, which featured a large indoor playground that was awesome! The rooms are also very nice and clean, but it's clear they've seen a lot of guests. They're just a little "worn". We stayed in a 2BR/2BA and it was easily big enough to accommodate 4 adults and 2 small children. The kitchen and dining area was nice as well - and we got a lot of use out of it. Oh - the staff was very friendly and helpful. We actually purchased our Disney tickets from the concierge, which was really convenient. Overall, we had a really great experience and we'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The resort was nice but the room was just okay”
Reviews.Author: favetita
Reviews.Content: We booked using interval international and for the price we paid, this was a fair value. The resort grounds is beautiful...big....but beautiful. I would have liked to be in a room closer to the kid's pool (across the bridge) but they didn't have any available. Anyhow, we had to walk a few minutes to get the pool. *The pools are nice but could be bigger and we've seen better. *The kid's play zone is really nice and a great feature of the resort. My 4-yr-old daughter loved it. They should, however, pay closer attention to the kids who enter. For some time while mine and another young child were playing, some very large boys came and started playing in the area. They clearly knew they weren't supposed to be there but since no one was manning the side door, these boys knew exactly how to get in and where to hide in the play area to not be seen. *Our room was large enough and looked to be somewhat renovated. However, management needs to take a closer look at everything: - Some wall fixtures were very loose (to the point of hanging by just one screw) - the stove was not leveled so anytime we just bumped it slightly or did any cooking on it, it would wobble - one of the plugs was so loose, it wouldn't hold anything so basically it was useless. This wouldn't be a problem if it wasn't one of the most accessible unused plugs - internet connection was slow and unreliable sometimes - we had a room overlooking part of the golf course. They did lawn work at 6 in the morning. imagine how irritating that can be when you're woken up that early after a long day at the parks while you're on vacation? - they need more cooking utensils, pots and pans, larger bowls, in the kitchen This resort served its purpose for us. I just couldn't give it 5 stars for the quality we experienced there especially since we have experienced better elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Super nice and spacious.”
Reviews.Author: kmcm84
Reviews.Content: We stay at this location for a week. We had a king size room and the lock off room, that was plenty of room. The room was up to date and was very clean. Resort had plenty to do but we stayed busy at all the parks so we never did any of the activities. One thing I will say is bring your own pillow from home. Outside grill area was very nice also.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing bad to say...”
Reviews.Author: LaDolceVita007
Reviews.Content: ... about this hotel. He had a refurbished One-Bedroom-Villa in House 83 and it was really nice, everything was there what we needed. It was clean and quiet and the kitchen perfect. The pools have also been clean, with enough beds and towels and the whole site was in good condition. We loved our stay. The only minus: there was only one elevator for the whole building 83 (6 floors) and it could take a while.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: disney07us
Reviews.Content: Love the Marriott's Grande Vista...have stayed here several times. Our 1 bedroom villa was right next the pool. Villa was clean, bed was comfortable, kitchen had everything you needed to make anything. Loved sitting out in the screened porch. Great view of the golf course. So many activities for everyone all day everyday. Close to Publix, places to eat and Disney. Can't say enough and can't wait to return

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Quiet & Clean”
Reviews.Author: ashleyavd
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here as part of an Interval timeshare exchange, and I was very satisfied with my stay. We stayed in a one bedroom suite with a kitchen - it was clean & comfortable. The rooms were very quiet and I had a lovely balcony overseeing the golf course. I am not one to participate in events or hang around the resort much, but the pools were nice & uncrowded, and the location was fantastic - easily accessible and halfway between Disney & Universal, if you're doing the parks thing. A good place for a family or for a couple - plenty for everyone here, with very friendly front desk and security staff.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here if you are expected a clean, refurbished hotel.”
Reviews.Author: EKPD
Reviews.Content: I checked into the hotel Wednesday night, 5/11/11. The first room we were assigned seemed very old and dirty. The bathroom and kitchen, especially, were very dated. I called the front desk and was re-assigned another room that I was assured had been refurbished. This room was exactly the same. The only thing "refurbished" in either room was the fact that there were flat screen tvs. This does not constitute refurbishing a hotel room. The bathrooms and kitchens were completely old and outdated and gross. I did not want to even put my luggage on the floor. My husband placed our bags on the table. We went to dinner and I just couldn't bear the face of sleeping in that room. It's not as if we got some amazing deal and were paying a cheap rate...for the rate, the rooms were just unacceptable. We ended up checking out just a couple hours later and did not complete our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not a typical Marriott”
Reviews.Author: Fisherbabe91
Reviews.Content: We were excited to spend 2 weeks at the Grande Vista but unfortunately it was not what we have come to expect with a Marriott hotel or timeshare. We called prior to our arrival and were assured of a newer room. However when we arrived we were given a 2009 refurbished room. The furniture was outdated to the 1980 s but the kitchen was nice. the beds were ok. The pool was a hike and very crowded. The grounds are kept up well, much better than the rooms. The overall facilities are nice. The onsite restaurant, Nicks, was awful. We have stayed at better timeshares in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful resort”
Reviews.Author: travelorwannaB
Reviews.Content: I traveled with my husband and four small children in May. We stayed in a two bedroom villa with a water view. It was just as I expected based on previous reviews. A little buggy at the pool but otherwise very nice updated accommodations. Great to have a washer/dryer in the unit as it really cut down on luggage. Location was excellent as we were five-ten minutes from SeaWorld, groceries, outlets, Rx, etc. We will stay there again if/when we go back to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a good place”
Reviews.Author: JackieSteve
Reviews.Content: This hotel was pretty nice. We had a 2 bedroom suite. Everything seemed to be cleaned. The appliances were fine in the kitchen....I didn't really mind they weren't updated. They worked and were clean so that's all that mattered to me. They give supplies to use for the dishwasher, laundy detergent, and dish soap. The kitchen was fully stocked with anything you would need to cook. We were in villa 100 building which had a direct view of the golf course. Flat screen tvs were in the living room and both bedrooms. Jacuzzi tub was nice. Front desk was helpful with anything we needed and everything was answered in about 10 minutes. We did get a chance to use the pools wihch were nice. The negatives I have to say about this place is the water does have a weird smell to it. I didn't drink it or anything, but you can definately smell it when you run the water. Also, everything seemed great until the last night we were there I went out in the dining room to spot what I believe to be a cockroach. I went to kill it and it disappeared and I could not find it. After speaking with my husband about this he also told me he saw one in the master bedroom a different night, but also said that Florida does have problems with cockroaches. Overall, this resort was nice. Not sure if we'd stay here again just because we'd rather stay on Disney property due to the driving, which is was no more than 20 minutes to Disney and Universal and like less than 5 minutes to SeaWorld.

Reviews.Title: “HEAVEN”
Reviews.Author: caroline16
Reviews.Content: Day 2 of our trip. Yes the Lovebugs are everywhere..but they don't bite so just ignor them. Beautiful resort. Great service. The only thing I would say is when you go to purchase a drink...it is like purchasing a "drink of the day" on a cruise ship..they get you for the glass....otherwise...love it!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: LisaMPC
Reviews.Content: I always stay at Marriotts and I usually prefer the Lakeshore Preserve nearby, but it wasn't avail. I am staying in a 2 BR 2 BA. I guess my unit was refurbished because its very nicely decorated. Granite in kitchen and bathrooms, plus a jacuzzi built for 2 in the master. I will say the fridge was not the newest but it was clean and it worked. Separate toilet area with a shower and a door for privacy. Dining area has a table for 6 with additional seating for 3 at the kitchen counter directly behind it. Nice balcony off the master and the 2nd BR has one as well. I took a nice walk around the grounds and they're beautiful. Great paths for walking. Paddle boat rental avail, there is a spa, a gym (which I used) with really nice and new equipment. Pool areas were nice. Lovebugs abound! None of them came on me, just annoying to look at.Oh and the bed is to DIE FOR!! Room I stayed in #7641. Top floor corner unit. Would come again.

Reviews.Title: “Not Like the Marriott's I'm used to”
Reviews.Author: turcich
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the hotel and were given a room that has not been refurbished. This room was dirty and dated. Asked to be moved to a newly rennovated room. The staff was helpful and re-assigned us to a rennovated room. The room was nice, not what I'm used to in a Marriott, but decent. Note to travelers: if you are staying in Orlando, FL in Apr or May be aware of the love bugs. These flies do not bite and are just an annoyance, but we arrived home one evening to the tile landing in our room covered in dead love bugs. I called down to alert the staff, who told me this is common in FL and there is nothing they could do about it. I asked for them to please send a broom so I could sweep them off the floor, fully expecting they would send someone to clean it for us (as we are paying guests in their hotel), however, sure enough a guy brought up a broom and we swept them out. The service was definitely not up to expectations. Would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but not worth the rate we paid. Our room needed work.”
Reviews.Author: 154964Traveler
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed here for 4 nights in April. The hotel grounds were very nice and the pool area was fine, although we only spent 1 afternoon there . The area was great because it was close to Discovery Cove and Sea World. We booked a 2 bedroom unit that was perfect in size and the layout was OK. But we were very disappointed with the kitchen and the bathrooms. The bathrooms needed some serious updating . The grout between the tiles on the floor was dirty. There was mold growing in the master shower on the ceiling, along the shower head and throughout the grout. We called the frontdesk, and they sent a cleaner right away. She did get rid of it in about 10 minutes. After she left I discovered more mold growing outside our shower unit. The cabinetry through the kitchen and bathrooms needed to be repainted. The felt sticky and dirty to touch. We think we paid way too much to stay here. Wouldnt stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Resort”
Reviews.Author: alvin008
Reviews.Content: We are only half way through our two week holiday, but are so happy with the place we had to put something here. Found resort and check in took about 2 minutes ! Even had an American asking about rugby !! ( once he knew we were Welsh). Staff have been great, friendly and efficient. Resort is huge, and is immaculate. Pools are brilliant, though very busy, kids are loving them ( there's 4 ). Location is perfect, if your going to the theme parks, Disney one way, Universal the other, both about 15-20 mins away, and Sea World is literally up the road.We booked our room through Interval and could only get a studio for the dates we needed. I was worried about the size but it's been fine for the four of us( our kids are young though, and would recommend a bigger room if you have teens) it has a fridge, toaster, microwave. ( you can't go to the Golden Corral everyday ! ) if you want to eat in. We.re hoping to come back next year as we have had a fantastic holiday so far, and if we can do it, we will definitely book here again. I've been checking out flights already from the room on the free wifi !

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel! OMG, just awe-inspiring!!!!!!!!!: )”
Reviews.Author: lotzatravel
Reviews.Content: Best resort ever! It is close to EVERYTHING, great activities and awesome staff and villas. We spent a week in and one-bedroom unit and loved it! The Grande Vista is our timeshare homebase through INTERVAL INTERNATIONAL. When you check in make sure to avoid any conferences even if they offer you discounted fast-pass disney tickets. ITS A SCAM!!! The new marriott program may be hard to understand but it is totally worth staying here! LOVED IT!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! : ))))))))

Reviews.Title: “What's not to love?”
Reviews.Author: Joyanne_11
Reviews.Content: The Vista is fabulous! Everything is perfect. We didn't have any water problems...used it to make coffee and it was fine (some places its even horrible for coffee). There are actually four pools! The grounds are absolutely beautiful which coming from the north, I especially appreciate. Its been a long, long winter and the green and flowers mean so much to us! I loved the gated community - felt very safe. Staff was wonderful! Location is terrific. Beds were comfortable (how often do you find that?) with an abudance of pillows (every type you might like) and our location on the resort was quiet which we loved because we are quiet people. The full kitchen is perfect....all you would need. I can't imagine how anyone could ever make a negative comment about this place. Thank you MGV staff!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place”
Reviews.Author: Bpennell
Reviews.Content: Stayed from April 10 to April 17. Close to all attractions. Staff was very pleasant. Very good kiddie pool.Over all very impressed would definitely go back

Reviews.Title: “BEAUTIFUL RESORT”
Reviews.Author: ALLABOUTFAMILY01
Reviews.Content: Check-in was fast. Rooms are spottless with plenty of room. I rented a one and two bedroom villa for eight adults. They have so many people working to keep grounds clean and I was amazed that I never seen a wrapper on the ground. Beautiful lake with several different kind of paddle boat rentals. Pools are amazing for adults and kids. Several outdoor jacuzzi's. Many activities for adults and children. Hawaiin show very good. Pool towels are plentiful at the pool area's. I called front desk for a few minor repairs and they were there in minutes and even called 10 minutes later to make sure we were happy with the service. I ask for more towels and delivered again within 10 minutes. Resort is very big. They offer to come pick you up to take you to pool ect. They staff is well trained and very pleasant. Cody went out of her way to make sure we were happy at all times. Very helpful with all park information. Security is very good. They drive around the resort at all hours of the night. Every staff member says hello and I was asked so many times if I needed anything. I have read some of the reviews and will comment. Yes, I did see one coachroach outside the villa. This is Florida known for many pesty insects. I do agree that the water did have some kind of odor to it but not worth mentioning. The golf course is beautiful. Didn't have time to play so I can't comment on it. The drinks and food are a little pricey but I expected it. They allow you to bring your own drinks throughout the resort as long as they are in a plastic cup. The only negetive comment I have is that they had a band playing across the street at the Golf house with Free shuttle service but when you get there it is one guy playing. Not a band. I would like to see a band play near the pool area one night a week. I wish they would offer shuttle service to the bus stop. My daughter wasn't feeling well and met us at Magic Kingdom later on in the day and it cost 35.00 for a taxi ride and she waited 2 hours for the taxi. I have been to florida many times and always stay at a Marriott Resort. They are in my opinion a 5 star resort.

Reviews.Title: “A dream vacation”
Reviews.Author: Brendad00
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott Grande Vista from Apr 1-7 and all I can say is what a place. Everything you can imagine is going on. We stayed in building 92 which overlooked the golf course and was extemely quiet. While we were in a studio room there was plenty of room for two adults and two teenagers. My favorite part was the hospitality of the stafff and the guests. There are four areas with numereous pools, hot tubs and a sauna at the main pool. In total 6 spas, 1 sauna and 8 pools including the children's and lap pool. Would return in a heart beat. Highly recommend it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and roomy family-friendly resort, 10 minutes to Disney”
Reviews.Author: Jen-Husker
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a condo that was 2 adjoining rooms. We had requested a rennovated room, and they accomodated our request. The room was rennovated, except for the appliances. They were a bit dated, but clean. The room was very clean and a ton of space for everyone. We only had 5 people staying there, but could have easily had room for a whole other family to join us. There are a lot of kid-friendly things to do at the resort, but we didn't get to experience many of them due to being on a short timeframe (only had a week to get our theme parks in). They had a paddle boat lake, fun swimming pools for the kids (area with water sprays and buckets) as well as hot tubs. Also had a cool play/climber area for kids (probably best suited for ages 3-5), a cool arcade, and an ice cream/candy shop. The resort is right across from Sea World, which is nice. We found out (a little too late) that if you purchase Sea World tickets through the resort, you get a second day's park entrance for free. Unfortunately, we ran out of time and didn't make it back to Sea World for day two, but oh well, there was so much to do! We are already chomping at the bit to go back. The employees at the resort were very friendly. SInce the resort is pretty spread out, make sure you request a room near the pool area, so you don't have a far walk to get there. We lucked out and were right outside the pool area, which sometimes also has it's disadvantages (they were doing cowboy karaoke one night!), but it was still fun to hear.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good but...”
Reviews.Author: HollywoodDuo
Reviews.Content: Overall the resort is very nice, lots of pools and stuff to do. Great for kids. Very close to all the big parks. I do have several complaints though. First of all the water was disgusting, even at the restaurants. When drinking and showering it was very unpleasant. Second, the pillows for the bed were very lightly stuff, if that is even a real description (basically there was barely any stuff, if you like that sort of thing then add 1/2 a star). Lastly, we were excited to try out some of the resort activities but none were free (paddle boats, fishing). That was a downer.

Reviews.Title: “Very Relaxing!!!!”
Reviews.Author: soccermomof4
Reviews.Content: This is our first time at this location. We loved the 2 bedroom suite we had. The only downer was that the ajoining 2nd bedroom smelled rather musty/moldy. We had to leave the sliding glassdoor open during the day when we werent there to air it out. other than that the beds were great!!! the mattresses were better than the ones we had at home. The couch bed mattresses were definately showing wear. We found out that the we were in the first bldg that was built at the resort. So...the pull out couch mattresses seemed to be original. need to chang them. The pools were outstanding and very clean. Great place to enjoy yourself and relax.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing property”
Reviews.Author: Niko4411
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at this resort. The rooms, grounds, pools and amenities are amazing. The customer service is also top notch. This property is conveniently close to the all of the Orlando theme parks . Can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “THIS is how you do Orlando for Grown-Ups”
Reviews.Author: UpscaleButRealistic
Reviews.Content: What a great spot! Traveled with four adults looking to get sun and watch some Spring Training Baseball. Now, this IS ORLANDO, so there were TONS of kids at the hotel. But the rooms were quiet, we were never disturbed by any little-kid noise. PROS: Room Set Up - BEAUTIFUL. I would live here. The kitchen was fully stocked. CLEAN. Screened-in porch, great for having your morning coffee. THERE IS A WASHER AND DRYER! Concierge - so helpful! Great recommendations. Location - Great way to get away from the theme park crowd. There is (what we called) "restaurant row" a quick drive away, as well as a Whole Foods. So, you really can have a completely theme park free trip if you want. Pool - Large! Gym - fully stocked CON: There was one "CON" to this hotel... the sheets were super stiff! (But certainly wouldn't keep me from staying here again!) Go get breakfast/brunch at the golf club! Really good! (Not a buffet, only a la carte.) * I also want to note that we were traveling with one person in a wheelchair. We did receive an accessible room, and it worked out great.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BonVoyage555
Reviews.Content: This a great resort. Well located for Disney, Universal Studios, Sea world etc. It is a very large resort with lots of villas. It has a golf course. Be alert that there are LOTS of kids here and as in any place there are lots of people using cell phones around the pool without consideration for others...an issue for us today. We have stayed here every year for several years and will stay again. Close to Mt Dora and Winter Park...both worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and easy!”
Reviews.Author: Hinsdalemama
Reviews.Content: The hotel grounds were gorgeous. The rooms were very good. The only thing we found problematic was the food. Not the beast array of choices for healthy eating. The staff and service were great and accomodating which really made our stay there a pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel complex”
Reviews.Author: AmandaC1060
Reviews.Content: We had two nights at this resort and wished it could have been longer. We had a fantastic suite which was immaculately decorated and impecably clean. The resort and staff were top class. The final flourish on the last night of our touring holiday around Florida - we ate at Nicks bistro and had the best steaks we've ever eaten! We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “felt like a Caribbean resort”
Reviews.Author: absmith
Reviews.Content: We had the most amazing warm, sunny weather (which I am sure has an effect on my perception of this hotel). I really liked the Grande Vista. It felt like a Caribbean resort. I loved lying by the various pools (we saw two; I think there are two more!). I appreciated the unlimited towels located poolside and the pool towels in our room. The grounds are well manicured and clean. There is a big pond/lake in the middle of the property; the sun reflects beautifully on the water at sunset. Our room (a two bedroom suite with a washer/dryer and kitchen) was comfy and quiet (except when the balcony door was open and the young children and golfers were making a racket at 6 AM). I appreciated the free internet in our room. Drawbacks: typical hotel food (read not very good). Nothing organic or healthy, and we ate pool side and at Nick's. We had to wait over an hour for maintenance to deliver a shower bench to our wheelchair accessible room accessible room so I could bathe. And they told us it would be 45 minutes. It is kid friendly, which was fine with us (even though we did not have kids). They were everywhere!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Vacation”
Reviews.Author: travellingbuddyks
Reviews.Content: We went to Orando for one of a two week Florida vacation, staying at Marriott's Grande Vista. We rented the two bedroom vista. Everything was great - the boys took part in a fishing tournament and the girls and I rented a four wheel multi-seated unit (like a bike with four wheels). Had a great time and we're looking forward to the next visit. Close to everything - Disney, Seaworld (very close), grocery shopping, malls. The grounds were beautiful - the pool was well maintained. We didn't often need help but the staff seemed very helpful. The gym was great. We appreciated the little - in house- market to pick little items to eat/drink. An awesome place to call home for an Orlando vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay...”
Reviews.Author: dlee_salem
Reviews.Content: This resort is one of our favorite choices. On our last trip, we had six families with four seperate reservations for 2/2-br and 1/3-br villa and 1 studio. We have always had top-notch service in the past and this last trip again proved that the staff/management of this resort by far superior to that of other resorts I have stayed at. Given that we were booked during school vacation, I was a bit concerned with the resorts ability to meet our requests to have all units in the same building near the pool/pavillion. Suprising, we were all in the same building and one villa on the top floor only 2 floors - above us. Close enough to say this was perfect!!! I have been to this resort 5+ times now and have never been let down with service, quality and friendliness. In instances where there were "challenges", a simple call has always resolved any problems. The staff has always been stupendous and I really can say this is one resort that can make your vacation 10xs better..

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for Family with Older Kids”
Reviews.Author: Jim M
Reviews.Content: Close to all the major attracions But with plenty to do on-site. If you purchase a 3 day or weekly golf membership, you not only get unlimited golf and use of the practice facilities, but you can also play Grande Lakes, Grande Pines and Hawks Landing at half price. The 3 day package was only $175.00

Reviews.Title: “Subpar in just about every way”
Reviews.Author: Jeff1099
