Reviews.Content: I made the mistake of choosing this property to stay at while attending a convention, thinking that the larger square footage of a suite would translate to a more relaxing experience. When I checked into my room the toilet was running continuously, flushing every 60 seconds or so. This was repaired relatively quickly after about an hour. After unpacking I decided to take a shower, which is when I noticed the hair from one or more previous guests in the shower as well as on the bathroom floor. The first morning I attempted to use the hair dryer, which immediately began smoking and was obviously not usable. The housekeeping staff left most of the lights on after cleaning my room. This is despite the property's signs encouraging guests to turn off lights and turn down air conditioners. One night they left a dirty dishtowel on the nightstand, where it remained for the next two days. The "good" restaurant on the property, located in the golf club, served a "special" consisting of overcooked wahoo and cold vegetables. The server did not think to replace utensils after removing them with the salad. Note for Marriott Rewards members: there are no special perks for Marriott Platinum guests. None of the preferences on my profile (high floor room, away from elevator, etc) were honored either.

Reviews.Title: “great service”
Reviews.Author: newfgirl
Reviews.Content: good resort..great service, good variety of restaurants and several pools. nice golf course, having the kitchette and balony were bonuses

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place for us with our two year old daughter......”
Reviews.Author: jenniferky1978
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this resort in Feb 2011. It is simply perfect for what we needed. One bedroom villa so we put a crib in the living room for our daughter and we slept in the bedroom. The washer and dryer turned out to be a life saver and a Publix grocery store was about 1.5 miles away so we got snacks and drinks for the fridge. We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “A fabulous resort and a great vacation”
Reviews.Author: Ronald C
Reviews.Content: We exchanged one of our weeks with International Interval for a week at Marriott's Grande Vista Resort in Orlando. This was one of the nicest resorts we ever stayed at. The amenities were great and the location was only one block from Sea World and within minutes of both Disney and Universal. The service was great and there were grocery stores located close by. The resort golf course was expensive but we agreed to listen to their sales pitch and got some decent rates. There were several courses near by that had good rates. There were numerous heated pools on the complex and they even had their own convenience store. Any problems we ran into were immediately taken care of and the staff was very friendly. We hope to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: lpmsg
Reviews.Content: Nice place to stay, beautiful grounds,great staff especially bar staff and overall a lovely place to stay. will definately go back.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful locaton, Comfortable & Spacious Condos, Resort Amenities”
Reviews.Author: NCtourist
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a week at Grande Vista with another couple and loved the place! Our two bedroom condo was perfect for the four of us. A full kitchen and large dining table enabled us to eat in for breakfast and often for dinner with ease. The location off International Drive is nearly ideal for visiting any of the theme parks (which we didn't) or shopping centers (which we did). Although it was a little cool for the pools on the property we did take advantage of some of the many entertainment opportunities offered at the resort including a lesson in making mohitos and a blind chocolate tasting--both were fun opportunites to interact with other guests if you wished. The bedrooms in our condo were spacious and comfortable with flat screen TV's in each as well as in the common living area. All in all Grande Vista was a perfect getaway location.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property, clueless front desk personnel”
Reviews.Author: Kfamily8
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at this hotel. It was beautiful and we have no complaints whatsoever. However the front desk help was absolutely incompetent. We checked in between 9 or 10 pm after a long day in Walt Disney World with our 6 very tired children. My husband had called just a few hours earlier to let them know we were coming in late. I had called several days before to confirm our reservation. Everything was good to go... Upon arriving, I handed them my confirmation number and drivers license. After looking I was informed that they could not find our reservation and that our unit had been given to someone else because someone had cancelled our reservation. The guy at the front desk disappeared to talk it over with his manager. The manager came back and informed us that their hands were tied and that we would have to find some place else to stay.. I told them that this was unacceptable and that we had already paid for our room in full. They proceeded to get another manager who also told us the same thing. This went on for about an hour..we were exhausted and angry. My husband went to work on it and had them look up our reservation using my name and wa lah, like magic they found our reservation!!! Duh!!! Unbelievable... these people seemed incapable of thinking. We are not sure why they had such a hard time finding our reservation but they put us through a lot of stress after a long exhausting day. They handled the entire thing so unprofessionally. I was very disappointed with them.... but we enjoyed our stay. But, Marriott needs to train their employees better or find smarter people to work for them.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: JetOttawa
Reviews.Content: We spent 1 week at the Marriott Grande Vista, Orlando and cannot say enough good things about it. The rooms were great- all the comforts of home. The grounds were well kept and very picturesque. The pool near the main reception was warm and lovely, and shade was available if you needed to get out of the sun for awhile. No shortage of clean beach towels. The bell man will drive you out to the I-ride trolley bus stop on International Drive so getting around is easy. When you are ready to come back to the hotel, there is a phone at the gate so all you have to do is call reception and the bell man will come and pick you up and drive you to your building. No complaints about this place at all. There is a little souvenir shop/grocery store near reception but it does not carry a lot of food, so it is best to take some with you until you can get to a grocery store.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you could want”
Reviews.Author: pvbbeachgirl
Reviews.Content: This was great. We were two families with young kids. Lots to do at the resort, close to the parks, outstanding furnishings in the unit, nice new kitchen, two screened porches in a 2 bd villa. All good.

Reviews.Title: “Decent, but not up to Marriott standards.”
Reviews.Author: ArkansasRazorbacker
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at a number of Marriott timeshare resorts in the Orlando area and have never had a complaint. However, the Marriott Grande Vista didn't measure up to the standards met by their other resorts. First, let me say that the grounds and common areas were very well maintained. I wish the same could have been said about what apparently was an old building. Given the fact that timeshare owners may a yearly maintenance fee that is supposed to keep the units in great shape, there is no excuse for the complete lack of attention given to our unit in Building 96. The refrigerator was rusted all around the door seal and the crisper drawers fell out the first time we opened the door. The cabinet doors were well worn and the door to the trash under the sink was slightly sprung open. The shower in the mast bath has had probems with water leaks. Rather than fixing the problem they just attempted to cover everything up with huge amounts of sloppily applied caulk. The metal corner bead on the drywall around the shower was rusted and chunks of drywall and paint were coming off. The unit came with a DVD player, which was nice. However, the normal procedure is to hook it up prior to the guest arriving . I ended up pulling out the TV cabinet and TV in order to run the power and video cables. I assume that because we exchanged in there rather than own at that resort we were given the old crappy units. However, it doesn't speak well for Marriott and I say nothing that would entice me to purchase there. Do yourself a favor, if you plan to stay at a Marriott timeshare resort in the Orlando area, select a different location. The overall staff was very friendly. However, once you move into a unit and your days are already scheduled, you don't want to spend your time unit shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Here!!”
Reviews.Author: LaurenMass
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at the Marriots Grande Vista in Orlando. We loved this place!! You are right near Sea World and about half way from Disney World and Universal. We stayed in building 84 room 4505 with 4506 attached as a lockout. We went with our 2 teenage sons for a Disney/Universal vacation. Our unit was recently refurbished. We had approx 1200 square feet with a screen porch and a deck. This unit overlooked the lake which was beautiful. The unit had 2 master suites on either sides of a living room, dining room and kitchen. My husband and I had a large 2 person whirlpool tub which I used everyday after walking the parks for 10 hours. Our boys also had a king size bed and their own bathroom. (no large whirlpool tub). We had 2 pull out queen size sofas which we didn't use but we could have brought 4 more people with us and been comfortable there. One of the sofas was in our sons room and the other in the living room. There is a granite breakfast bar that seats 3 and a dining room table that seats 6. The furnishings are very attractive. I was a little concerned about the bed because it seemed to be a little to firm, but I slept very well on it and they have great feather pillows. If you have a pillow top mattress at home, or need more padding you may want to call and ask if they have rooms with softer mattresses. I did notify them that it felt a little to firm and they said they were all new mattresses and had just been replaced. They sent me 2 additional mattress pads which I did put on the bed. We had 3 LG flat screen TV's. There is a washer and dryer in the unit and we did all our laundry the night before we came home. The only thing they could do to update the unit is to put stainless steal appliances in it. Currently they have white appliances and they are all in good condition but feel a little like the 90's. The pool and hot tub area is beautiful. We used the hot tub as well, and my boys swam in the 84 degree pool and enjoyed themselves. Overall I would give this place a 9 out of 10. Request a newly refurbished room as I did and you won't be disappointed!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Resort”
Reviews.Author: GoliteIowa
Reviews.Content: This is our tenth stay at Grande Vista. We purchased a timeshare when the properties was just beginning to develop. Although time share owning isn't rated high in investments we found the investment to be awesome for us. Our grandchildren enjoy coming here every other Christmas, and we use our points at other Marriott properties on the off years. Now in 2010 the properties are being updated, and the on premise offering for families who don't want to cook has been improved. A new menu to take out or eat in are available. Or we go over to Niki's at the golf course to eat. The location of the resort right off International Drive, a mile from Sea World, and trolley services to other locations, and the shopping malls adds a relaxing several generations family vacation place! Great golf course here, sandv volley ball, three pools, paddle boat, just a lot to do for every age. Love the new spa, and workout equipment!

Reviews.Title: “Could use rennovation”
Reviews.Author: deeann7
Reviews.Content: Stayed for week in Bldg 97 - 3 bedroom (2bedroom + lockout). While unit was large and spacious, the furniture, countertops, appliances are dated and all could use replacing. There are actually rusted aluminum mini blinds on windows (a cut on your finger would mean tetanus shot for sure). The bedding, however, was comfortable and clean - plush white comforters and pillows. TV's were all large flat screens but only one remote worked out of 4. Hotel information notebooks were incomplete, but were replaced by new ones during the week. Grounds were spotless, enjoyed walks around beautiful manicured common areas, pools well maintained and lots of lounge chairs and pool towels. Very convenient location to theme parks.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: PaulsReview
Reviews.Content: A nice place could find no problems with anything. I was close to Disney and on international drive. The pools were too cold to swim in at the begining of November. But there were a few people giving it a try. Good food and service from Dennys which is onlt a few mins drive away.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond Grande!!!”
Reviews.Author: worldseeker2010
Reviews.Content: Do not let the mixed or negative reviews on this hotel throw you off. I just got back from a stay here and I have nothing but phenomenal things to say. Distance: The hotel is right in the middle of the action. It is about a 15 to 20 min drive to WDW and same distance to Universal Orlando. Sea World is literally across the street. A car is needed as there is nothing within the immediate walking distance. Parking is plentiful and safe. Check In/Staff: I arrived at 4pm. I was at the front desk for a grand total of 3 minutes. I was in and out!! No sales hag, nothing. Everyone at the front desk was polite. The staff on the property was top notch. I walked around the property several times and was greeted with smiles all the time!! I was highly impressed with the staff (I thought kindness only existed at Disney) Room: I booked a studio through Interval timeshare. I was worried about the space because studios can be small and crowded. I had also requested a view of the lake. When I opened to the door to my room - I was in shock!!! The room (while a studio) was pleasantly spacious. And the view (look at my photos). I had a view of the lake and the pools. I was on the top floor and it was just perfect!!!! If you want this type of view, put in your request 10 days prior and ask for Madrid top floor. In contrast to Disney selection of 10 channels, Marriott has about 100 channels with HBO!! I loved coming back from a long day at the parks and getting in my bed with full cable tv and free internet!!! Grounds: HUGE resort. However, I know because its Orlando, you may be off to the parks. Take at least one morning and walk around the resort. It is aesthetically one of the best appointed properties I have ever stayed at. I have stayed at Disney resorts countless times but Marriott is spectacular!!! The lake alone is worth the stay!! It is absolutely relaxing and beautiful!!! Pools: What can I say? The best!!! The pools all have great water features and waterfalls. Tons of beach chairs to lay around and be lazy. They open at 7am and close at 11pm. Take at least 2 hours to enjoy the pool - you will not regret it!! Sauna and whirlpools are also available. Activities: Nonstop!!! I did not get to part take in any of them though but they have things going on all day to keep guests entertained. Other comments: There is an ice cream shop on the lake in the lighthouse as well as a full service food court (pizza hut and pretty much standard flare). Both were inexpensive and delicious!! Rock climbing is also available; as well as boat rentals and fishing for a fee. This was my 2nd vacation at Marriott. This time was perfection!! I have no complaints about the property whatsoever, it was sheer relaxation!!! One note of warning, on check out day, housekeeping will start knocking at your door as early as 7am.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful place”
Reviews.Author: gmisskit
Reviews.Content: we canadians loved this place -clean,beautiful grounds -pools room,no complaints -except little store could be bigger-more food -if u dont have a car -and have to rely on going by bus to publix-bell boys are wonderful -this is a plus-they take u to highway and u can call them when u get off trolly/bus and within a few minutes they are there ,would return

Reviews.Title: “Rip blankets and Sheets in Unit 7412 and 7411”
Reviews.Author: Lordthunder
Reviews.Content: The resort is nice but please bring your own sheets and blankets. The old blankets need to be throw away. They smell like pee and new blankets they do not wash when they get theme out of the seal bags. They have smell to the blankets. I recommend to not to stay in building 97. The elevator button sticks on 3rd floor and phone do not work on the 4th floor very well. Also took 5 days to fix the bad pull out sofa mattress had many tears and very worn out. I had my own blanket with me and smell like pee from there blankets. The manager and staff did not fix the room into 5th night at 10:19PM at night that is right. We were there into Nov 13 to Nov 20 2010. I hear other guest complaining about the service. They need to make the pool building 97 has pool towels for guest. It took 40 minutes to get towels there. Not sure what is going on with special request are denied for customers. I asked for days before check in for two nice fleece blankets on the bed and denied theme. I called housekeeping many times for the blankets and did not put two blankets on the bed. They just do not get the service right. I not sure if they cannot read email and special request i check in or something. Also the management failed. I would recommend to stay there if you want stress. Also the internet connection needs to be improved for guest in building 97. I would post pictures but would hurt marriott image. I did like Marriott Manor Club in VA they have soft acrylic blankets with satin bindings i was shocked they did not have soft blankets there when i asked they said "the front desk and housekeeping said they did before i booked the room." They lie and cheat and steal your money. All I want is my money back or another discount vacation for 5 days of hell with a clean bed.

Reviews.Title: “Good quality, as always, from Marriott”
Reviews.Author: sugarpug
Reviews.Content: My family of six adults stayed in two 2-bedroom units at the Grande Vista in November on a trip to Disney World. We are Marriott time share owners and have been staying in Marriott time share properties for 20+ years. This hotel is only a few miles from Disney property and is located near a grocery store, gas stations, a huge upscale outlet mall and lots of great restaurants. It is on the same road as Sea World. The property is well-maintained and the pools are large and very clean. Both pools have bars with a good drink selection and a restaurant for quick, moderately priced meals (chicken quesadillas and buffalo chicken salad were delicious). The rooms are spacious, but a little dated. When I checked into my room, I noticed that the counter in my bathroom had not been cleaned. However, everything else in the unit was clean. We stayed in an older unit so the cabinets and appliances were dated and showed wear, but the counters, furniture and furnishings had been updated. The air conditioning unit in the bedroom was VERY loud and woke me up during the night each time it turned off and turned back on. Otherwise, the room was very quiet... no noise from the front or back (my bedroom faced the golf course... a beautiful view). Our unit was located right across the street from one of the pools and close to the front desk... very convenient. There was ample parking: we had two cars and found parking near our unit upon returning each night. This could be considered trivial, but the TV remotes for all three TVs in our unit were TERRIBLE! The remotes barely worked when held close to the TVs and did not work at all from the bed or couch. Cell phone service is also non-existent on this property so be prepared to drive off-property if you need to make a call or send a text. In addition, I found the sales staff at this property rude and impatient. Upon check-in, we were directed to the "concierge desk" to pick up a "gift." This turned out to be a sneaky sales gimmick: the "concierge" was really the sales desk and in order to pick up our "gift" (a cheap reusable bag), we were subjected to a tenacious sales pitch. Even though we are already Marriott time share owners, the sales staff tried to hard-sell us on attending a sales seminar during our vacation (we did not attend the seminar). This sales gimmick was one of my first impressions of this property and I was not happy afterwards. Outside of our negative experience with the relentless sales people, the staff at the hotel was very nice and helpful. I had to send a number of faxes during my stay and the front desk staff was very accommodating. The restaurant and bar staff were also friendly and attentive as was the room cleaning staff. Aside from a few minor negatives, this is a lovely hotel with great facilities. I would definitely return and I recommend this hotel for families visiting Disney or other Orlando attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay at the Grande Vista”
Reviews.Author: Cram425
Reviews.Content: This was our fourth stay at the Grande Vista. We had a fantastic time at the Grande Vista. The beach party the first night was great. The resort is well maintained. I would never stay anywhere but the Grande Vista when visiting Orlando. Free poker tournment with prizes. Fun pools and pizza hut delivery at night. The location on international drive is close to everything. The golfing around is great. You wont be dissapointed staying a the Grande Vista.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: SummertimefunCanada
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott Grande Vista Resort in October for 3 nights and 4 days, managed to get a newly renovated suite. The suite was very nice, very clean and very well maintained. Wished we had more time to stay there. The staff were friendly and very helpful when asking for direction to attractions. We look forward to staying there in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel with everything you need!”
Reviews.Author: JRPARTY
Reviews.Content: I took my family that includes my wife, son and daughter. We booked a two bedroom unit and we probably would have been fine with a one bedroom because it was huge. It had a full kitchen and it came really handy. We had breakfast in the unit everyday which allowed to save for nicer dinners. It was also centrally located to everything. We did decide to enjoy the resort for a day and wish we would've done it for a couple more days. The Hotel was very clean and was very secure, never did I feel threatened. I could go on and on however I will not, bottom line WOULD DEFINITELY RECOMMEND THIS HOTEL. You get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Yes, they really do have it all...”
Reviews.Author: Ariannadae
Reviews.Content: We were thrilled with our recent stay at the Marriott Grande Vista resort. They truly do have it all and offer it with top quaility service! When we arrived on site, we were first amazed by how large the complex is. All of the villas are located around a large lake, where they offer paddle boats and other aquatic amenities for your enjoyment. The lake is absolutely picturesque and it was a beautiful site to wake up to each morning. We did have a discrepancy with our reservation, but it was resolved quickly with no inconvenience to us. Our guest services representative was very kind and offered us discount cards for the spa and restaurants since we were Marriott owners. We usually stay at Marriott's Sabal Palms when we vacation in Florida, so we were a bit nervous going to a new condo. But our nervousness was immediately washed away as soon as we entered the villa. Gorgeous, clean, spacious - 3 bedrooms and 3 bathrooms, kitchen and spacious living/dining area as well as 2 balconies. My only complaint - the kitchen could have been laid out better (the fridge was hard to open if there were more than 2 people in the kitchen at one time.) But other than that, it felt like home. The resort offers 4 pools, including a kid's pool with fountains and cannons - very fun! It also boasts a spa and kidnasium area - when we go back, and we will, we will be taking advantage of these amenities! We loved the icecream parlor (which looks like a lighthouse) and also the swings they had spread out around the perimeter of the lake. There is even a beach for those who want to play in the sand. They really did think of everything. The Grande Vista is conveniently located on International Drive - close to all the theme parks, restaurants, shopping, outlets, pretty much anything you need, it is within a 2-10 minute drive. I am looking forward to many more years enjoying the Marriott Grande Vista with my family!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: whiskyboo
Reviews.Content: Myself, Husband , daughter and Grandson, spent two weeks in Orlando staying at the Marriott Grand Vista,. We stayed in two Studio apartments, which were very nice, roomy, a large queen bed, which was very comfortable. We had a small kitchen area, with coffee machine, (there was fresh coffee sachets left every day). and a large fridge,freezer, which was good for storing cold beer and water. Also a private balcony, which was netted to stop bugs entering. My daughter had problem with caterpillers entering her apartment, (on a regular basis), she contacted the front desk they did send someone out to try and eradicate this problem, but to no avail. The Pool areas and surrounding areas were always kept very clean and tidy. My daughter and grandson used the Pizza Hut which was located at the resort, which they stated was very good. We all had breakfast one morning at one of cafes at the resort which was also good. The shop on site was well stocked and reasonably priced. This was my Husband and myselves second visit to the Grand Vista and we would definately stay there again. The first time was in a 1 bedroom apartment, which was brillant. Would definately recommend this Resort. Which is central to all the Theme Parks

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Place To Stay...Will Be Back”
Reviews.Author: bgriffis
Reviews.Content: My wife and I decided to drive down from Jacksonville to take our daughter to Sea World. Since we didn't want to spend all day at the park and drive home that night, we used air miles to purchase a 1 bedroom apartment room for 1 night so we would be well rested for the drive home the next day. The resort was amazing in every aspect. There were many activities scheduled for all ages throughout the day. We didn't get a chance to do a lot since we were at Sea World, but made notes of the activities and decided we would probably come back and just spend a few days here and take it all in. They had boat rentals, restaurants, ice cream shop (was great), indoor playground for kids, movie night for the kids, yoga, smores by the fire at the beach area, and the list goes on.... The room was great. It h ad the Marriott king size bed, which is always very pleasant to sleep on. We had our own balcony, 2 flat screen lcd tvs, 2 sinks in the bathroom with a walk-in shower, and a jacuzzi tub next to the bed separated by a low wall. The kitchen was very nice with a refrigerator, sinks, stove, oven, microwave, and dishwasher. There was also a washing machine/dryer to do your laundry inside the room. It was very spacious, and we very much enjoyed our stay here. I would recommend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great property, Lots of activities for the family on site.”
Reviews.Author: NYRobthetraveler
Reviews.Content: This is a beutiful hotel, very well maintained. I reserved a two king bed townhouse, very open space. Came with a full kitchen with Micro, Stove and oven big fridge and diswasher. Master bedroom had a hottub for two and a standup shower. Guest bedroom was seperated by a double door and had a mini fridge small sink and bath. I would give this hotel a five out of five however the only thing thas was wrong was the parking the spots are slightly wider than a minivan and parking is tight. Other than that the property is great.

Reviews.Title: “Not the worst!”
Reviews.Author: FamilyFun4444
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Marriott Grande Vista the week of October 2nd. We rented a 3 bedroom villa for the week. Two weeks before our trip I called with some special requests such as a first floor room and a renovated room and so on. We traveled with our 2 children, ages 3 and 4 and my mother. Our 3 year old son has special needs so we needed some special accommodations. The hotel could not have been any NICER! All of our requests were met with no problems. We were in building 86 on the first floor in an end unit. Our villa was BEAUTIFUL! It was a remodeled unit with all new furnishings. Check in was smooth and easy. We walked right in and got our room keys and went right to our room. All of the staff was extremely friendly! Our room was very nice and spacious. The grounds were gorgeous and the pools were superb. My family loved the ice cream shop and we loved the fitness center. Now to why this property did not get 5 stars- Roaches! We saw our first roach the first morning when we woke up. I called the front desk and they promptly sprayed our room. The next morning we awoke to several dead roaches in the kitchen, bathrooms, and living rooms. We called again and they said they would send someone to spray. This continued throughout the week with live and dead roaches being found on a daily basis. We called everyday and we were never offered a room change just told that they were sorry and that the roaches were bad at that time of year. The last straw was seeing roaches climbing on our food! Luckily, that was the day we checked out anyway. I know it is Florida and roaches are more common there, but come on! We should have at the very least been given a different villa. Our biggest concern with the roaches was with our special needs son who still crawls. We hated seeing him on the floors and we were constantly washing him. The hotel did compensate us for some of our nights as a courtesy. If it was not for the roaches, I would have said this was a GREAT hotel. I don't think that we would try this hotel again, but it is lovely minus the roommates!

Reviews.Title: “we go back EVERY year! - our home away from home!”
Reviews.Author: gudystash
Reviews.Content: Every year we go to the Grande Vista with our family. We love the golf course, love Nicks, the restaurant/club house on the golf course. We have children ages 5 & 6 now and there is a GREAT indoor playset for them as well as daily crafts, games, etc for them to participate in. I find the studio rooms to be a bit small for our family of 4, but the 1 bedroom w/ the kitchen is GREAT! we love it here & are going back in February again! :)

Reviews.Title: “Love the Marriott Grande Vista!”
Reviews.Author: PeterBell61
Reviews.Content: We have been going here with the In-Laws for the past 5 years and we love it... it borders the Nick Faldo Golf Institute, so if you love to golf it's VERY convienent. Rooms are big, very clean, there are alot of pools and things for the kids to do!

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort for All Ages”
Reviews.Author: 4jakes
Reviews.Content: Truly enjoyed our stay at this resort. Our group included two 50 year olds, and four young adults ages 20 to 25. Our unit was very clean and spacious. There are several lovely pools to choose from and they stay open until 11:00 p.m.!!! We were able to enjoy pool side cocktails and a relaxing dinner after a long day at the theme parks. (Very convenient location for theme parks and shopping.) We happend to be staying at the resort during "Oktoberfest" and there were discounts at the bar/restaurant on all things German. The staff held contests and relay races at the pool that were fun for both participants and the audience. Prizes were valued at "well under $3.00". lol (Prizes were actually free lunches at the pool restaurant.) Both children and adults had a great time and one dad won a free lunch for being such a great contestant (his free-style chicken dance was priceless). I would highly recommend this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Resort!”
Reviews.Author: jhs1227
Reviews.Content: I was not sure what I was going to expect when I made my reservation due to some of the reviews and photos on this website. I am a Marriott associate and I LOVE traveling and seeing other hotels/resorts. & I am NOT writing this because I am a Marriott associate and want to glamourize this facility, it does it itself. Driving up to the resort, through the beautiful landscaping, the resort is HUGE. I was quite impressed. Check-in was quick and painless. All the staff we encountered were very nice and friendly, always willing to help. They put us in a building that was newly renovated near the main building where check-in, etc was and it was just beautiful. We reserved a 2-bedroom suite, only for one night unfortunately!!! I could live there!! We did not get to use any of the facilities like the pool as we were there for Halloween Horror Nights. The only downside that really isn't too big of a deal and is 100% understandable being an associate, is a 10AM check-out time & no late check-out. (We got in at 3:00AM from HHN) Which was OKAY, but would have enjoyed atleast another hour! Overall, I'd deffinately recommend this resort to family, friends, etc. I will deffinately be going back for a long weekend! Maybe a week... we'll see. Very tempting.. LOL

Reviews.Title: “"Excellent Location"”
Reviews.Author: wandeayo
Reviews.Content: The service from all staff members was very good. They were very helpful and friendly. The room was very nice and spacious, the bed was comfortable. The living room furniture in our apartment was quite old and dated, which was disappointing. The location was very good. Everything on International drive was within reach, so also the theme parks. Everywhere from our apartment had a nice view. The resort was buzy and lively, yet not noisy or rowdy. Lots of activities for everybody to enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Yorkshiresfinest
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as a timeshare exchange from ours in Portugal, and as usual when doing this, the resort was excellent. We have never had a poor timeshare exchange in 20 years of doing this. This is a big resort though with several separate buildings - if you want a small one don't go for this. We weren't bothered our room wasn't around the main pool, which is big, as we didn't have any children with us and wanted the quiet. Having said that we faced one of the "satellite" pools which played music 12 hours a day (the only thing I could complain about) so we kept the windows closed and didn't hear it then. This pool however was not heated so to swim in comfort we walked down to the main pool which also has a heated lap pool. This was brilliant as never crowded. The unit would have slept 8 but only 2 of us - lock off room not used at all. In our unit it had everything you could possibly need (except EGG CUPS!) perhaps you don't use them in America?? Washer, dryer, full kitchen, 2 big flat screen TVs, a massive (for 2) jacuzzi bath and a Very comfortable king size bed. We always find the beds in America are SO comfortable! Could not fault anything about the staff, and everthing was kept very clean. The bar around the pool has happy hours, so use it then, but it looked like it could do with an update - Marriott take note - this was not up to your standard! We used the pizza hut at the resort and was excellent. It is actually situated next to the pool! which will tell you how big the resort is to have its own! As other reviews have said - on the quiet end of International Drive - about a minute from Sea World and closer to Universal than Disney. And lastly - ORLANDO - STOP CHARGING TO USE INTERNET IN (BUSINESS CENTRES!!!) In these days when us Brits have to count the things we can travel with due to excess baggage charges - we like to leave our computers at home! Didn't get charged once at any hotel (3 different ones) on trip up to Memphis and back!! Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Our second visit was as good as the first!”
Reviews.Author: Miss_Pie
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this resort for the second time last week. This time we had a 2 bedroomed villa and it was lovely. There were 2 bathrooms and washing and drying facilities off the kitchen. The grounds are lovely and very well maintained. The staff at check in were very pleasant and helpful. As mentioned in my previous review the situation is excellent - at the quiet end of International Drive but handy for the theme parks, shops, restaurants, etc. The fact that we have now returned to stay here on two consecutve years speaks for itself. I would not hesitate to stay here again if returning to Florida.

Reviews.Title: “Overall, I loved this place! I will definitely be back!!!”
Reviews.Author: JenniferE33
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here at the beginning of the month for my daughter's first trip to Disney. It was a magical experience. Staying at the Grande Vista was definitely a contributing factor. I was very surprised at how reasonably priced the resort amenities were. I have stayed at many resorts and often end up spending more on food and drink than on what I actually spend on the room itself. This was not the case at this property. They have a convenience shop, a restaurant that serves Pizza Hut and Boston Market-like food, a mini ice cream parlor, and a pool side bar. Like I said, everything was very reasonably priced, I was very content as I am extremely budget conscious. We also ate at Nick's Grill twice for lunch, and that was also reasonably priced. Dinner is more expensive, but the selections are more elaborate. We stayed in a one bedroom villa; very roomy, and a great layout. It had a dining room table, a full kitchen, a washer and dryer and two separate TV's which was great when my husband didn't feel like watching Tinkerbell for the fifth time. There was also a DVD player, which was great, because we brought some movies. When we are on vacation we probably spend more time in the room than the average family. If we have a long day of walking around, we usually spend the next day just hanging out. I really loved that the decor is updated, and the rooms were really clean. My only issue with cleanliness was the shower. I think the water in Orlando smells like sulfur (obviously not the resorts fault as I have stayed at other 4 and 5 star properties in Orlando, and they also had stinky water) and I think that the shower tiles need to be re-grouted more frequently than they are. There is no mildew growing per se, however, it did seem a little dingy. I am not sure why this would be as I was told that the rooms are refurbished every 55 months. This fact would not dissuade me from staying there again because I am super picky about bathrooms. Anyway, for the days we did not do Disney, we were perfectly content to stay at the hotel. They had a great pool and they offered so many activities for the kids. They had a build-a-bear type workshop, a campfire where we roasted marshmallows, candy bar bingo, and so many other activities for smaller children. They also have a huge indoor playground which my daughter absolutely loved. This is a Marriott Vacation Club property, so you can opt to do the preview of Marriott's timeshare program. I would say our preview was informative, but it wasn't. I really left with no more information than I came in with. Once our salesperson (Paul Diaz) determined that we weren't worth his time, we pretty much got the obligatory power point presentation and tour of the model room, but we were never given a range of prices for their program which was the type of info I really wanted. I think between checking his i-Phone (or Droid) and throwing out Marketing 101 terms such as equity proposition and Einstein's Rule of 72, he figured out he couldn't reel us in. To be perfectly honest, once he checked his phone in front of me (which is the rudest thing I think someone who is trying to sell you something can do) I would have never bought anything from him anyway. All in all, I was very pleased with my experience at Marriott Grande Vista and I will be back when we decide it is time to visit Disney again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Resort”
Reviews.Author: kem603
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed this resort. We took two 18 year olds with us and they were highly impressed. The pools were great. Our unit was great. Clean and updated. We are looking forward to going back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Another great week at Grande Vista”
Reviews.Author: pla_orange
Reviews.Content: This is our 5th time staying at Grande Vista while in Orlando. We love it, and love having the space, the kitchen, multiple bathrooms and the washer/dryer in the room when compared to a hotel room (I never have understood people paying so much to stay on Disney property in a 400 square foot room). Our room was in good shape and we had no problems during the week. The pool and grounds were beautiful and well maintained. We arrived on a Monday and were able to check in at 11:00 AM, which was a bonus. Was given a 1st floor room, which I thought I wouldn't like, but it was nice not have to deal with elevators/steps, and the view of the lake right outside the screened porch was just as nice as being higher.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfied Customer”
Reviews.Author: LTHealy
Reviews.Content: My wife & I stayed at Marriott's Grande Vista Resort in Orlando this past June with our two young children. I contacted the resort weeks prior to our check-in date & asked many, many questions. The girl I spoke to could not have been more helpful. She even suggested some room related requests for me to ask for (bldg location, etc...) & noted those requests in their system. Upon check in, the room I was given was exactly as requested. We were so impressed with our stay there that we have already made our reservations for 2011!

Reviews.Title: “WOW”
Reviews.Author: sjanelj
Reviews.Content: This place has it all. The views are breathing taking. The pools are wonderful. There are activities on site and off site very close by. Only 5 min from Disney/ Universal & others. We arrived at 10am and were able to check-into our room with no problem. Our room was wonderful with new upgrades that were done last year. We had a 2bdr unit with 1 king in master and 2 queens in second bdrm. and with a queen sofa bed in living room. And with 2 patios, 1 screen 1 not. The staff was great and the person who checked us in (James) was one of the best customer service persons I have ever met. This place is a must see/stay. Donâ€™t listen to bad reviews go for it and try it for yourself.

Reviews.Title: “We'll Be Back!”
Reviews.Author: martina55
Reviews.Content: Glad I wasn't steered by other reviews. We totally enjoyed our stay at the Marriott Grande Vista. From our 1 bedroom villa, to the service, to the pool area, dinner at Nicks Grill, and the location ( close to supermarket, restaurants, outlets and Sea World) ...it was all Very Good! With that said we will definitely return for another stay at the Marriott Grande Vista. Tip: We chose to travel last week in August returning Labor Day weekend. It's an excellent time to enjoy the resort without the crowds plus it seemed like we had Sea World all to ourselves which made it so much more enjoyable. Tip: The Millenia Mall is about 15 miles away...they have a Cheesecake Factory Restaurant...lovely and delicious! The shopping center closest to the resort has a Publix , Subways, Chinese and Japanese restaurant. Benihana is nearby too. Very convenient. Tip: Don't miss the outlets!

Reviews.Title: “Our whole family loved the Marriott Grande Vista”
Reviews.Author: Maclinda50
Reviews.Content: We just returned from the Marriott on September 12th. I was somewhat worried since I read some negative reviews online. However, I was pleasantly surprised when I arrived. Check-in was great. Some would consider it slow, but the amount of information we received at check-in was worth the wait. We rented two separate condos, each with two bedrooms. They were both very clean and in excellent shape. There are many activities at this resort for all ages. I was particularly impressed with this. You could actually stay here and enjoy yourself without visiting any of the parks. I would definitely come here again the next time I am in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Good size apartment”
Reviews.Author: grotbags
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Grande Vista but like other reviewers had to wait hours for one of our rooms to be ready ,the cleaning was not to a high standard and the pools were also not very well maintained. But we still enjoyed ourselves and the location is very good.

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS Resort, Excellent Location!”
Reviews.Author: SeaSure
Reviews.Content: My family and I (children age 9 & 14) cannot say one negative comment about this resort. WE LOVED IT and will definately return for another stay. This high end resort is gated and very conveniently located. It is about 1/2 mile from Sea World and within 5-10 minutes of Disney and Universal Theme Parks. The units are extremely spacious and laid out nicely. Our unit was 2 bedrooms, 2 baths, the bedrooms were on opposite sides, separated by the kitchen, dining room and living room, very nice for privacy. The decor was sophisiticated and new, palm trees, greens, burgundy, beiges; including granite countertops and 3 flat screen tvs and very clean. If you don't want to leave the resort, they have activities scheduled from 8 am to 9 pm on a daily basis. On Tuesday nights there is a Hawaiian Luau at the Coco Loco bar that was awesome....hula girls and a fire torch twirler. The Grande bar near the main pool has misting fans and you can get a drink in a souvenier coconut carved like a monkey or pirate (Coco Loco bar). Our children climbed the rockwall (free) and learned how to make "mocktails", non-alcoholic drinks. The fitness center is well equipt. In addition to a dozen state of the art treadmills, there are free weights and LifeFitness machines. At night the kids can chill playing ping pong, billiards, foose ball or swim in one of the four pools. They also offer paddle boats and have a fully stocked lake for fishing. There are several restaurants and a Publix grocery store just around the corner. Stay at Marriott Grande Vista Resort and have a relaxing, fully satisfied vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: LueckeFamily
Reviews.Content: Found this place here on tripadvisor, this place made me love this website. Stunning grounds, beautiful villa's that are WELL equipped. Our favorite place to stay in Orlando. Close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “They tried... REALLY hard, but our vacation was a little bit ruined”
Reviews.Author: azunprinzess
Reviews.Content: This is hard because the Marriott really tried to make us happy and yet I am finding myself rating it 3 stars. Why? Well... day 1, we arrive at midnight. I check in, everyone was super nice. We get our room. The room was wonderfully located. We open the door and immediately my bf says "Don't come in, Don't come in!!!!" (I seriously thought he saw a dead body or something!). Come to find out he said that because there was a HUGE cockroach right at the entry way inside the room. I have a tremendous fear of cockroaches and he knew this so he tried to keep it from me. I handled it well though, called the front desk and the Marriott said they would take care of it immediately and they did. A woman came with a can of raid and sprayed around. Now I understand this is Florida where cockroaches are equivalent to rabbits where I live, but that's beside the point. I still don't want to sleep with them. Day 2. We didn't know it but they had ordered a real exterminator! He came in with the hard core stuff and started spraying. I was talking to him and telling him how FL was weird because we had our AC on 63 all night (and I am someone who is ALWAYS cold) and that it still felt the same as when we walked in. He told us that the other rooms were much cooler and that we should call the front desk because it is not typical. So I call. They say they'll send someone immediately. Someone came eventually but it kept us from going out and starting our day of our 6 day vacation so we got a really late start. He said something was wrong with the AC and he fixed it. Day 3 We found another cockroach in the kitchen. I seriously had to wash everything before using it. Day 4 I'm taking a shower and my eyes are shut and all of the sudden I hear a weird noise while lathering my hair. I open my eyes and the shower had a hole in the tube and was squirting water at the roof. Within seconds the stream became huge so I hurried up and rinsed my hair out and got out and called the desk (trust me I am NOT high maintenance and I was embarrassed to call again!) They said they would send someone immediately, and they did. Problem was the 2 people with me hadn't taken a shower yet. The bathroom was SOAKED. The maintenance guy came, said the hose was old and changed it, meanwhile he tracked his shoes through the puddle and the floor became filthy (not his fault I know). So then we all wait for them to clean it so they can shower and nobody comes. After 2 hours and another late start of our 6 hour trip my bf decides to sop up the water with the towels that we had and take a shower. He took one and so did my son. The maid didn't come until much later. When the maid did come they failed to provide us with the things that we lost in the shower explosion, like new toilet paper because it was completely soaked and we didn't have anymore, also we didn't get enough towels. I could have called again. Day 5 another cockroach, flipped over dead. Other than that I really don't know what to say. We were rushing on this vacation to begin with, because there's so much to see in Orlando, and yet 2 out of the 6 days were started extremely late because of how long it took them to fix stuff and when you're dealing with Disney World park hopping tickets this was not cool. Also, the place could have been cleaner. The floors weren't very clean. I want to like this place, because they tried hard, but I can't. I LOVED our room. The location was amazing! Everyone that worked there was nice. Once I was carrying a bag of trash and a worker rushed to me and took it (that's worth 3 stars instead of 2) but too much went wrong and I was fine with the fact that stuff happens until the shower incident.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: disneydreamsnh
Reviews.Content: My family of 5 stayed at this resort for a week at the end of July. The resort is beautiful, and well cared for. We had a three bedroom suite, on the 1st floor of the Madrid building. The location was great, a little noisy at night because it is so close to the pool and bar, but not too bad. We loved this resort, they had activities going on all the time, for all ages and interests. The Hawaiian Luau show was great. Our only complaint would be that we arrived at 330, and didn't get our room until 745pm! This was difficult for our three children who had been in the car all day and wanted to have space to relax etc. The room was very spacious, and comfortable. Our only issue was the AC did not work in the third bedroom. We kept the door open and it was ok.

Reviews.Title: “Much BETTER!!!!”
Reviews.Author: 1mrskfcook
Reviews.Content: You may or may not have read a 'not so awesome' review from me on this hotel. We have since visited here as a compl stay to make up for some problems we had the last time. Anyhow, this time the trip was awesome! This time around the people were extremely nice and helpful! The room was really great (we got the 1BR/1BA room) The pool area is really nice. Have nothing bad to say about this visit! Ohh, and they added a spa since the last time I went, that was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Close but.....”
Reviews.Author: FloridaStephanie
Reviews.Content: Despite all the red flags from our first stay, we decided to give it another shot. We love all-inclusives and this resort offers the no need to leave characteristics. Unfortunately, they just don't quite get it. The best way to describe this resort is it is like a mirage. You can see what you want, but just can't seem to get there. A few examples of the small but more than anoying issues. On every floor there seems to be a centralized located cleaning locker. Every morning (early) the maid gets started by opening the door and letting it slam shut. Not just once or twice, but at least once every minute. When you come to a resort like this it is to relax and SLEEP LATER than you would while at home going to work everyday. During our last stay, the cleaning crew began steam cleaining the carpets at 05:30 (yes 5:30 in the morning). We happened to be checking out that day and stood behind others who also complained. We also complained about the early morning activities. Neither of us received so much any consolation. Item 2: You constantly need to call to the front desk to have people bring things that should be in the room. (i.e. no (yea ZERO) towels. You can have a TV in you room but don't expect batteries for the remote. There is a full kitchen, but no hot pad. (Seems superficial until you realize that you have something in the oven with no way to retrieve it.) Item 3: Very quick to close the pools due to wx, but not so quick to re-open. I write this understanding that this is an issue of safety, however, they appear to be VERY conservative on the issue while not so conservative about the room rates. Speaking from the point of view of someone that is required to shut projects down due to wx, They are extremely conservative. If you come, you better hope that there is no rain in the area (highly unlikely for Orlando). The pool will be shut down from 2:30 until 6:30 everyday during rainy season. Although, the pool should be shut down for safety reasons some of this time, not the whole time that a black cloud is in the area. It appears that is too inconvenient to re-open the pool as wx permits. Long story short, the general attitude from hotel staff. Too bad, you are here, you have paid and there is nothing you can do about it. Just for reference point, I spend approximately 50 nights a year at Marriotts. I am also not a nitpicky traveler, I just wish to be treated as a customer.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a quick long weekend getaway.”
Reviews.Author: LadyGolfer99
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 days at Grande Vista and was not overly impressed at first. Check-in was smooth enough but the reception person directed us to the "Concierge" for a free gift, which was a cheesy Marriott Grande Vista t-short (like I would ever wear that). The concierge was just there to push timeshares. Then when our schedule didn't permit us to attend the FREE BUFFET BREAKFAST a/k/a "sales pitch", the guy called us a half dozen times until we finally had to tell him we were NOT interested and just wanted to relax. The carpet and upholstery smelled a little stale but I always travel with Fabreze spray if I am not staying at a Ritz-Carlton or similar hotel so it was fine after I doused them. Bed and linens were on par with any 4 and even some 5-star resorts I have stayed. It has a 24-hour staffed controlled access gate, and lots of fun things to do, all of which are a short walk around the resort. We stocked the fully-equipped kitchen with a few food items after a quick trip the Publix supermarket a mile away and we were good to go. Free Wi-fi was spotty and virtually useless so I gave up after trying several times on the first day. We didn't go there to surf the internet anyway - we went to relax. The 9-hole Nick Faldo golf course was a TREAT! A quick 9 holes before dinner was just what the doctor ordered and after 2pm, it's dirt cheap! Better bring your sun block, though, because the Florida sun is brutal in the afternoon. Food at Nick's Grill was overpriced and has a reservation requirement. Plenty of other little shops for snacks, sandwiches, burgers and even an ice cream shop. Booked it online the same day and our package rate included a daily resort credit, which amounted to free breakfast and snacks each day and then we prepared and ate our own food and took the leftovers home with us. All in all, a great place to hang out and not have to get in your car once you are settled in.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: moe0289
Reviews.Content: Poor reviews I read on trip advisor were correct so a good deal isn't always the best choice!! First as numerous reviews stated check in was a NIGHTMARE. My wife booked a later flight just so we wouldn't be dissapointed getting to hotel early and our room wasn't ready. Well I guess at Marriott Grande Vista 4:30pm on a saturday is still to early. Waited 20 minutes on a check in line to hear at 4:50pm my villa still wasn't ready. However I did hear from receptionist don't worry will be ready soon and we will call your cell phone, Ha Ha yeah right! A trip to Publix supermarket and returned at 6:00pm waited on another line to check in and receptionist stated I felt bad watching you wait on line again, LOL are you kidding me?? I said you couldn't have given me preference or call my cell phone as stated?? An apology from her and off to the one bedroom villa. Villa was clean and had no problems, all appliances worked. Maid service was terrible. Because we were guests we were entitled to service however they came everyday after 4:00pm exactly when we were back from theme parks taking a break. So my wife declined everyday and we swapped towels and anything else we needed with maid then she was on her way. Resort is huge and pools were small and crowded. However didn't mind the crowd as much as the walk from our villa to get to a pool. We just drove and parked near the pool it was easier then walking. I will not be back to this marriott price was right but thats about all that was right!

Reviews.Title: “Don't try to make reservations here...they do not get them correct.”
Reviews.Author: CtRacefan
Reviews.Content: You may want to think twice about making a reservation here because they: a) don't know what they are doing, b) screw it up royally and c) don't know how to fix it. We made a reservation for Feb. 2011 when we were there in Feb.2010. Now thinking that I should check on the reservation I was shocked that it was not there. When calling to find out about the mistake, we were shuffled to Interval International and given the royal runaround...we can have a different place to stay for $139.00!!! Now after paying $500.00 a month for a three bedroom time share yearly, would you be stupid enough to say "sure I will pay the extra money to stay where we didn't want to!! If I had to do it all again, I would NEVER deal with Marriott again.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have asked for much more”
Reviews.Author: loves2read71
Reviews.Content: The property is located about 15-20 minutes from Disney, 10 minutes from Universal and right next door to Sea World. I checked Trip Advisor before booking and found mixed reviews. I decided to go for it and left quite happy. We used an exchange for the week of July 9th. Check in was easy and staff were friendly. They do not offer upgrades for exchange and I had booked a studio. The room was very nice. The bed quite comfortable. The bathroom was a bit dated. The room was clean with a great balcony view of the pool. Each 3 or 4 units share a pool. Our pool was a decent size and there is also a main pool that is larger. Overall the property was beautiful and well maintained. This is a gated resort so it helped to feel a bit more secure. The food on property was pricey but average. Nick's Grille restaurant was very good. There are planned activities throughout the day. The one sticking point that they request is that check out is by 10:00am. We were aware of this and planned accordingly. My boys were very happy with our stay; I was too.

Reviews.Title: “TOTALLY MAGIC”
Reviews.Author: biggiebolton
Reviews.Content: very clean place excellent service beautifull back drop... very plush something to boast about... made the whole experience magic

Reviews.Title: “An overall pleasant experience”
Reviews.Author: CharlBlue
Reviews.Content: Review in brief... Room was clean including the air quality. The bedding was very comfortable. The pools were plentiful and clean. The staff was very friendly and service oriented. Closest to Sea World. Our personal preferences: The furniture had much ware on it. It looked to be about 20 years old. The room's amenities were also out of date and could use an update. Another example would be the television. It did not offer a DVD player. (The TV was from the days before RCA jacks were included) These are just some of the simple accommodations being offered today that I believe are simple improvements that this otherwise wonderful facility can make to earn it a greater rating. There was no complimentary breakfast offered. As for value.. dollar for dollar, it was a little more costly than other resorts yet not up to current resort room standards to command the price.

Reviews.Title: “Unpleasant Experience”
Reviews.Author: sandrajfb
Reviews.Content: From check in to check out, it wasn't fun. The rate I paid was different (much higher) than the internet rate I planned on paying; staff was not the least bit accomodating while this was being worked out (I had documentation). We drove and brought food, that soon spoiled as the fridge was not working; though they replaced it rather quickly, the Florida humidity is not match for perishables. When I travel and choose a good name like Marriott, I do so in part because I believe their service and reputation can make good on any minor problems that often pop up; this was not the case here and for more than $250 per night, I expected better service. When I asked for other guests to quiet down at 2:00 a.m., that request was also ignored. We ended up leaving 3 days short of our planned departure and I would not recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Grande Vista; Good week for mom and dad but just so-so for teens”
Reviews.Author: IowaDisneyMom
Reviews.Content: We just arrived home from a week at the Grande Vista, July 1-8. Arrived earlier than 4 p.m. and our 3 bedroom villa wasn't ready. We headed to Downtown Disney and hung out there. I had my choice of 3 different buildings (none of them were located near either of the two "main" pools but I chose Building 90 due to it being a first/ground floor unit. I had read how the elevators were so slow if they were working at all. I have a bad leg. We had a 2 bedroom unit with a connecting studio. I liked that we were connected between the "walls" not like when you are only connected by breezeway. Rooms were clean and spacious. Building 90 was refurbished in 2007 and it still looks new. Plenty of room for 3 teens and mom and dad. Lanai area was screened in, that was a plus. Our view was a "pond/lake" and a fairway. Very quiet. That was one nice thing about not being in a building by a main pool. There was a quiet pool in the next building but we never used it. We didn't use the "cannon pool" either. All our pool time was at the main pool due to the kids playing volleyball, ping pong, etc between swimming. We never had trouble finding chairs as some people had said. True, the pool was always busy but never ridiculously crazy. Parking was fine. Lots of spaces to park by buildings. That was never an issue. Wanted to try a spa service but prices were really high (for me). Fitness center was nice and plenty of equipment. You MUST be out by 10, in fact, housekeeping came at 9:30 and asked when we were going. She acted put out. That ticked me off, we were going to be out at 10. They don't need to bother people when we know it is 10! Another thing that aggravated me was the problem with cell service inside the units. It was impossible to make a phone call from inside the villa. If I went out on the lanai and stood by the screen I could do it. Perhaps it is a Verizon thing but I saw several others doing the same thing. We had an issue with our stove not working. Called maintenance and they quickly came to fix it. The value for us was great because we were gifted a week from my parents timeshare and we only paid the exchange fee. If I were paying cash I would NOT stay here. Why? There were VERY FEW organized activities for teenagers. My teens were very disappointed in this. In fact, we saw very few teenagers here. Lots of little ones. If it weren't for the volleyball net, they would have been bored as there is only one ping pong table and one pool table. We stayed at Vacation Village Parkway last year and there was so much more for the kids to do there. Overall though, the price was right this time and we had what I always want more of--FAMILY TIME!! Feel free to email me specific questions!

Reviews.Title: “NIce rooms, great for larger groups!”
Reviews.Author: Libs1414
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a very comfortable 3-bedroom villa. Each bedroom had its own full bath. The beds were very comfortable and the rooms were quiet. I would definitely recommend this hotel to people traveling with a larger group. We loved the large balconies off the living room and bedrooms. We also enjoyed the kitchen in dining areas of the villa so we did not have to go out for every meal. This hotel would not be as convenient for business travel however. Much more of a vacation type of place. I would definitely recoomend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: ccs124
Reviews.Content: We stayed here a week in a 2 bedroom suite and were extremely pleased with the room and service. The room was well equipped with full size kitchen, one bedroom with two queen beds, and master bedroom with king bed and a tub to die for. The tub was big enough for two and was jetted. The master had an enclosed patio with a ceiling fan which was nice to sit in the evening and relax without worrying about bugs. The spa was nice, not the best, but everyone was extremely nice and helpful. All the staff at the resort was friendly and always made sure our requests were granted. There was a nice breakfast/lunch spot called Grande cafe that had reasonable quick meals which includes pizza hut. We enjoyed our stay and would come back again.

Reviews.Title: “2nd time - good”
Reviews.Author: jengaloveshawaii
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd stay at MGV - with little kids. Our room had a slight musty smell and was an x-smoking room, I purchased an air freshener from Publix on the first night which helped, but still the must was strong. Clean rooms as usual, and staff was okay - watch the bartenders - they were pouring cheap vodka when we ordered (and paid for) top-shelf. The first time, I let it slide, the 2nd time, I had to say something. He said it was a mistake. Grounds and pool areas were clean, food was average, but we didn't visit Nicks this time. Nicks was great the last time. Fire alarm went off accidentally one day, and the housekeeper rapping on our door at 10 a.m. on the dot on our day of departure was slightly annoying.

Reviews.Title: “Expected more - Not my favorite Marriott resort”
Reviews.Author: RiffRaff63
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 7 day stay at Grande Vista. We are Marriott owners of a Gold Week in St. Thomas, and traded our week for Grande Vista so we could take the kids to Disney. We have stayed previously at Marriott vacation resorts in St. Thomas, Breckenridge, and Aruba. We had done a tour of Grande Vista in 2007 before we purchased, and it was advertised as one of the nicer properties. Here are some of the things we liked/disliked: The grounds were very nicely done and the amenities (pools, tennis courts, etc.) were nice. I liked the central courtyard area with the store, gym, and activity center(s). Although the kids prefer pools with slides, they enjoyed the water cannons and fountains at the pool we used. The resort is within a couple of minutes from shopping dining and grocery stores, and within 15-20 minutes from Disney parks. There are 2 main pools and 2 smaller pools at the proprty. The 2 main pools have poolside bars/dining, which is nice. We had a couple of minor problems with the room upon check-in (a missing sprayer at the kitchen sink, and there were roaches on the back patio). The maintenance staff were there within an hour and fixed the sprayer and sprayed the patio. On the downside, we were hoping to get a room close to the one of the main pools, but the only thing they had available was one of the older buildings on the fringes of the resort. We had a view of part of the golf course, but it was a LONG walk to get to the main area. Even though we arrived early and told them we were Marriott owners, the front desk said all the good buildings were reserved for Grande Vista owners. The design of our building could have been better, as well. Thare was one elevator for the whole building, and not only was it very slow, but there were many times we had to wait for cleaning crews to get on and off with their carts. They could have added a service elevator for the guests' convenience. Also, we stopped by the poolside bar to grab a drink before picking up a pizza, and the female bartender was pretty rude. She was doing a 'wheel of fortune' game with a couple of other folks, and they must have been tipping well, because she treated my wife and I like major annoyances. Another female bartender we had at the kid's pool area couldn't have been nicer, though. There was a thunderstorm that closed the pool, so we camped out under her awning and had a couple of drinks and she was extremely nice. Overall, I would recommend the resort, but not enthusuastically.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: savanna13
Reviews.Content: Went on vacation the first time with my 4 yr old grandaughter. She loved it, We had a two bedroom condo overlooking the baby pool and the big pool. I was a little worried about some of the comments but it turned out to be a wonderful place for my family. The trash was picked up very fast and the people that worked there were very friendly. My daughter had a friend that is working in Orlando for the summer and came to visit and he could not just come in, She had to come and meet him. So it is very secured for families. We just loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort and a truly grande vista”
Reviews.Author: holseeker_8
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 weeks in May 2010 in a 2 bed 2 bath unit using an II exchange. We paid for an additional night (incl $30 food and beverage credit) at the start of our stay to work around our flights from the UK. Resort check in attentive and courteous - we had travelled for 24 hours thanks to the effects of the Icelandic volcano. Despite check in staff's efforts we had to move rooms on the first morning from block 83 to 78. The move was dealt with quickly and someone came to help us move our cases. In light of the negative comments on this site we were fearful that our second room would not be as lovely/well appointed and furnished as the first. We should not have been concerned the only difference was that we had a beautiful lake view from our new room in block 78! Excellent sized and appointed accommodation with good quality furnishings and equipment. The only niggle is the lack of reasonably priced cleaning/housekeeping services. When asked the central Housekeeping staff were unaware whether we would have a full clean at the end of the 1st week's stay before our 2nd week started, and were similarly vague about the cost citing approximately $80. We ordered a full clean on day 6 - which was not as comprehensive as the name suggested e.g. sink counters not cleared and cleaned, towels were removed and not replaced with clean ones etc. We then got a further "full clean" on day 7. This standard of resort deserves a reasonably priced bed and towel change service midweek for those guests who choose to stay in excess of a few days. There was a washing machine and dryer in the apartment and I used them so that I came home with cases full of clean clothes. However, I do not expect to have to wash my bedding on holiday. The grounds are beautiful and constantly manicured. The range of organised activities for all ages is excellent. Our 3 year old was a little too young for some of these yet, but he thoroughly enjoyed running around in the indoor a/c play area. The pools were very attractive and we had no issues with people reserving (and then not using) sun loungers during our stay. The pools were open until 11.00 pm and so if you have little children you may want to be based in blocks away from the immediate vicinity of the pools. We used the pool a couple of evenings to refresh our aching limbs after long days in the parks! There is a small convenience shop on site which had a reasonable selection of goods at a slight premium - but you're paying for the convenience of not having to get in the car and go and find Publix etc. There is also a Pizza Hut which will deliver to your door but we didn't have time to try it. We ate breakfast in Nicks Grill once - food was good (except the very uninspiring fruit cup) but it was a little pricey, and the staff there were miserable and disinterested. I used the on site spa 1 day but the staff member was not especially friendly or communicative, and snuffled her way through my treatment. I think there are probably better pamper options off site. The location is brilliant - away from the hype of I-Drive proper but incredibly close to Seaworld & Aquatica, and the joys of Disney are only 10-15 mins away. We would definitely recommend this resort particularly to those travelling with children, and are hoping to return in the not too distant future.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not the best”
Reviews.Author: AlpharettaGuy53
Reviews.Content: My wife and I are owners at Sheraton Vistana Orlando and wanted to try the Marriott on an Interval Getaway. Boy it was cheap...cost wise. We paid under $300 for 7 nights for a studio which is all we needed for the week (I was fairly busy at meetings from morning till 9 pm) Marriott's Grande Vista is exciting when you enter the property. The drive in from International Dr tells you that your stay will be quiet...the best point of the resort. You are off the beaten path so you know you will have a chance for a good night sleep...till you find out that the pool areas are loud and stay open till 11 PM. The guest services are very good including the guards who raise the gate for you. They greet you well and keep it up all week long. The registration is slightly faster than that of Sheraton and very helpful. The guards at the entrance really make you feel at home. We only had one meal at Nicks Grille. It was very good but kind of pricey for the portion size. The girl at the pool we used surprised me by making a mixed drink for a girl who was probably under age. She never carded her. The girl who ordered brought one of two drinks over to her father and she took the other one. Florida has a drinking age of 21. That is a pretty serious legal violation. Someday they will get caught and it will cost them. There were a few things about the property that were kind of issues or just off. First, there is NO wireless reception in the guest services area. I got a gut feeling they do that on purpose. Second, wireless service on the property was somewhat limited. My Verizon Droid did not work well here. Third, the bathroom vanity had water damage on the base of it. Needs replacing. The sinks and counters seem old. Fourth, for some reason the closet was rather small. Fifth, there is only one elevator for the building we were in, #92. This place has 6 floors of people! The elevator also has no air conditioning in it and is steamy from all the people coming in from the pool. Sixth, they have way too few pools for all the people here. Sheraton has tons of them and they are larger, or seems that way. Seventh, there is no washer/dryer in the unit. There is a set down in the pool area which was not too bad to use. Finally, the unit bathroom had no air conditioning vent. We had to keep that door open all the time to keep it cool. One excellent thing about Vista is that there is good parking. Lots of cars but good parking. Be careful when turning left onto International Dr. Very hard to get out. It would be best to turn right and use the u-turn lane just down the road. Overall, a good stay but Sheraton, which is newly renovated, beats it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation - will be back again”
Reviews.Author: Meri675
Reviews.Content: Had a great week at the Grand Vista. We stayed in a 3 bedroom in Bldg 80 and it was very nice. The resort is a little dated but exceeded all my expectations. I truly recommend this resort for family's as there is a lot to do without leaving the property. I have been a Marriott Vacation Club owner for 8 yrs and this was one of the best stays I have had. I will be booking here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Grande Vista was great!”
Reviews.Author: lizzie68
Reviews.Content: Our family of 5 stayed at Grande Vista the last week of May. It was wonderful. We were on the 2nd floor of building 91. We liked that building because it had it's own pool and 6 gas grills that we used 4 times. The view from the balconies of that building were also nice....golf course/water view. We were on the end of our floor (#19/20)which we enjoyed because we did not overlook the pool..it stays open until 11 each night and found the end unit a little more quiet. Our children ages 9, 12, 14 enjoyed all of the pools...we spent most time at the Copa Loca Pool. They have plenty of chairs and towels you can use there. Had Pizza Hut one night from the marketplace after a day at a park. There is a small arcade and a maze room that is for younger children. Many activities were planned each day of the week for all ages. The Marketplace also gave out complimentary bags of ice. My husband and 14 year old played golf at Grand Pines across the street...we are marriott reward members.It cost my husband $34 after 3 and no charge for our son. There are 2 Publix within a mile or two and outlets are a few minutes away. We went to Magic Kingdom, Seaworld (which is literally 2 minutes away) and both Disney Water parks. The location of the Grande Vista was great. We enjoyed our stay and would definitely return. We had a 2 bedroom villa. It had everything we needed. Don't know if it was newly renovated or not, but we were pleased with it. Plenty of room, 2 full baths and 3 flatscreen tvs.. I would recommend this resort to others.

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel Is the Best that I have stayed-10 of 10”
Reviews.Author: savannalex
