Reviews.Content: We stayed at the grande vista from May 27 to June 4, let me just say that shame on the people that write bad reviews about this hotel, I was a little scared about going to this hotel after reading some of the reviews, but we stayed on building 97 room 7413 and 7414, it was awsome, the check in was quick and the workers were very friendly, my kids and nephews did not want to leave they had a great time always something to do. and they were from ages 4, 6, 12, 14. so you know that there is something for all ages. Great Job Grande Vista definately coming back again we loved it, keep it up. THE BENEVIDES!

Reviews.Title: “You will not be disappointed”
Reviews.Author: AZyoung
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 days with my sister and her family. The staff was extremely friendly. Check in was a breeze. There were 5 of us in a 2 bedroom villa. Building 77 room 7142 ground floor room. Two screened patios which were ok for sitting at night, but too hot during the day. The resort is really great! The property is extremely clean and well maintained. The resort is near lots of major attractions and close to the freeway. Marriot had lots of activities for kids each day. Free parking. We didnâ€™t use maid service it was extra, but not necessary since they gave you plenty of towels and there was a washer and dryer in the room. There was also a grocery store just down the street as well as a market place on premise. There were also several great pools on the property. The property is spread out but all in walking distance. Great Wireless internet. Cell phone service was terrible. Enjoy

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: angelfire771cat
Reviews.Content: We go here every May and it is always a delightful vacation, beautiful, tropical, great drinks, and great beds to sleep in. Lots of room and activities. The Child's indoor playground is great as well as child activities. The pools are beautiful and refreshing.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite place to stay in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: NJhavetotravel
Reviews.Content: LOVE this hotel. We stayed in the 2 bedroom villa with 2 adults and 3 young kids. We had more than enough space and 2 bathrooms made it much easier to get ready in the morning. With kids, having the kitchen and a full size refrigerator help our budget, as we prefer to have breakfast and sometimes lunch in our villa. I have stayed here many times and recommend it to others who like it very much. 2 miles from Seaworld, and about 10 miles from Disney. I like that it's off the highway and quiet. We look forward to our trips here.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Ole Time at Grande Vista”
Reviews.Author: scfa
Reviews.Content: I have to caution everyone about the negative reviews, ignore them. I have stayed in hotels all over the world for years as a business traveler and Grande Vista exceeded my expectations. I like many of you were concerned about the reviews but it was all for nothing. Check-in: friendly and efficient, I waited on line for less than a minute. Room: We rented a 2 bdr 2 bath villa, which was in great condition. new flat panel tvs in every room, bedding was the best I have ever slept in away from home. yes there is no room service or maid service (unless you pay extra) but this is a vacation home not a hotel room. after having all this space my family won't be able to stay in a hotel room for more than a couple nights, we are spoiled. Grounds: Huge, lush, beautiful, located away from all the highway noise. Everything is well maintained and every day workers were busy doing cleaning and maintenance. Pools are wonderful, bars are a bit pricey but you can bring your own drinks to the pool. Activities: We were blown away by the amount of activities for all ages, kids and adults. They actually offer more things to do than on our last cruise. Activity staff is really nice and we were surprised that many of the activities are free. Location: we really liked that its off the beaten path, no highway noise. Very close to the outlets, super market, sea world and only 15 mins from the airport. Disney its about 15-20 min drive depending on which park. Summary: I honestly can't believe people can complain about this place. I am soo glad we picked Vista for our family vacation and we will definitely return again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: honnie1234569010
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for about five days, and all five days were perfect! when we first arrived we were a little early, but the room was ready to go, and the staff was very kind. i was a little upset that the maid service was not complimentary, but other than that everything was fine. The last time i was there was before the renovations, and i was excited to hear about the new poolside bar, a sweetery, ( with AWESOME ice cream!), and a new part of the market place! All the food was delicious, and the grounds were goregous, as usual. we spent a lot of time at disney, though I was upset to find out disney now seem a bit less cool to the teens, thats the only thing that upset me on this vacation! everything was perfection! alas, five days went way too fast! i miss it already.

Reviews.Title: “Ignore other reviews! Great getaway!”
Reviews.Author: fluffyhog
Reviews.Content: The family stayed at Kalahari this April for Spring Break. The hotel is right next to SeaWorld and minutes from near-by Orlando attractions. Ignore the other reviews, the grounds are peaceful and beautiful as are the rooms. I would advise you to call two weeks ahead to ask for a renovated room. We did and our room was amazing! Three flat screen TV's, brand new kitchen appliences, and beautiful decor. There are 3 big on-pools that all looked nice. If you are looking for a timeshare when visiting Disney and surrounding parks, look no more and stay here. -- There are also paddleboats, ping pong tables, restaurants, and a huge golf course that all looked nice but we didn't have time to go to.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: PhillyBrownie
Reviews.Content: This was our first time taking the kids to Disney and we wanted it to be perfect. Being a Marriott TS owner in NJ we exchanged for Grand Vista. Our flight landed in Orlando 45 minutes ahead a schedule so we got to the the resort earlier than expected. As we pulled into the driveway the grounds of Grand Vista were impressive. The tree and flower lined drive was manicured and tidy. The place is huge but we did see the tennis courts, golf course and lake on our way to check in. We got to the front desk and the staff were courteous and friendly. After reading reviews I asked for a newer building close to the pools so I wouldn't have to walk far with my kids. The woman at the front desk said no problem but I was told the room that they had for us was newer and close (Bldg 94) which it was. They automatically upgraded us from a 2 bdrm to a three bdrm that slept 12! Now the only draw back at check in was we were told our room would not be ready till 4:00 and it was only around 1:00. They said we could make full use of the resort so we went to the pool and had lunch. After some lunch and swimming we were told the room was ready ( hour early).Upon entering the room we noticed it was very clean (smelled of bleach) and very spacious. Granite countertops, flat screen tvs and jacuzzi tub were very nice amenities. Our screened in porch was right on the golf course and with the exception of some landscaping was pretting quiet. I didn't know that housekeeping wasn't complimentary so finding out prices for tidy service ($44.00 a day) and full room cleaning (117.00 a day) was kinda surprising but having a washer and dryer helped. The pools were clean and had plenty of water activities for kids which was great. After going to the parks we would go down to the pool (Open till 11:00pm) for drinks and let the kids swim for a couple of hours, They had some cool theme nights at both main pools like reggae, cinco demaio, and calypso complete with live music and shows. Food was good but a little pricey, great to have pizza hut (on Site) deliver right to your lounge chair! Overall the place was great and we would have spent more time there if we weren't visting the theme parks everyday. This resort exceeded our expectations for our first trip to Disney with the kids. I would recommend this place to anyone looking to stay at a top quality resort in Orlando. Thanks Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Fair”
Reviews.Author: 3DD
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night prior to a cruise. While property (grounds, pool) are great, room was nothing like it looked like on Marriott website. I'm not sure how they assign rooms or if some are better than others, but ours was like a poor Fairfield in type room. Room was small, a/c didn't work, walls thin.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: jimmer102
Reviews.Content: Great resort with lots of amenities and activities for children. We were so busy at Disney that we had little time to utilize the resort. Everything was exceptional, from the pools to the cafes. Loved the ice cream parlor and paddle boats on the lake. Units were beautiful and beds were the usual comfortable Marriott beds. Staff went out of their way to assist you. It was convenient to Disneyworld and just around the corner from Sea World. Our only negative was that most of the grills were charcoal rather than gas and were remotely located from some of the buildings. Would have been nice to have a shuttle to Disneyworld. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: drew2263
Reviews.Content: I expect better from Marriott. I thought it was expensive for what you got. Common areas of our building were dirty and requests to house keeping for extra towels were ignored. Room was fine, but did not seem as spacious as other Marriott properties. Lot's of activities for younger children. Golf staff at Faldo Institute was very average and the condition of the course was poor. It is a nice executive layout for kids.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic resort”
Reviews.Author: bramleySussex
Reviews.Content: Fantastic resort ! Great hotel which was immaculate and well managed. The 2 bed, 2 bathroom unit was very clean, well presented and safe for young children. People have complained that they had to drive to the pools! We were quite a long way from the resort centre and still only took five minutes to walk ( good exercise!) Food was average, but no worse than most on offer in the surrounding area. The pools were great and child friendly.Despite what you may read we found the staff very helpful . This hotel is very close to sea world and disney parks. If you have children please be aware of the golf carts. They drive much too fast and do not seem to adhere to speed limits!! Watch out for resident gators around the lake areas, keep the kids close. Otherwise ENJOY !

Reviews.Title: “Great family vacation”
Reviews.Author: doobie86
Reviews.Content: My family enjoyed the resort. It had everything you needed. Pools were great , service was fantastic and the beds were comfortable. We will be back

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Mariott Grande Vista”
Reviews.Author: JodeeNewYork
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Mariott Grande Vista from 3/28/10 - 4/4/10. The hotel was very nice - the condo was beautiful and clean. Monica at the front desk was so helpful and spent extra time to be sure we would be happy with our location. Management should take note of this employee! We were in building 85 and it was near the pool and a short walk over the bridge to the main building. My only complaint would be the chair situation at the pool. People put towels on them and save them when they aren't even using them which doesn't leave enough chairs for the people that are there. Hotel location was excellent - very close to theme parks, shopping, restaurants, etc.

Reviews.Title: “1st time.....definetely not the last!”
Reviews.Author: doubleAA730
Reviews.Content: We travel to our time share in Aruba every year. This year we wanted to do our first family trip to disney for 1 week. We were too quite leary after reading other reviews. So we were more than pleased with everything when we arrived. The grande vista has sort of an island vibe. Temps in the 80s, mix of sun and clouds with a nice breeze. The lake with fountain and walk ways surrounding..perfect for a stroll or jog day and night. Grounds were very well kept! The staff was more than accomodating and got us right in to our room a few hours before check in. We found the entire staff to be most pleasant and helpful. We felt extremely safe and secure. They are very family friendly and have so many great activities for kids. An ice cream and pizza parlor on site was a major plus! We stayed in building 96. Had a nice view of golf course and just a short walk to smaller pool. Room was very clean. Had some spider webs just outside our door but maintence came to remove them right after we called. Staff also brought up extra towels right away when we requested them. Bed was very confortable!. Can't beat the location! All disney parks are within 20min....Great restarants close by too. Nicks Grill (right on site) was very good. Reasonably priced, kid friendly and very nice staff. I wouldn't bother with the breakfast buffet next time. It was set up in a very small room and very disorganized, line was long for waffels and omelets. If you continue down I-drive past seaworld and the conv center they are quite a few really nice places to eat. had dinner at Maggianos, Capital Grill and Ocean Aire...all were very good. The spa could use a face lift. Florencent lighting...eek! unconfortable couches..poor layout. They served ice water but no tea or snacks...it was very clean and massage and facial were good. Gym was great too. Treadmills over look the beautiful lake and fountain. Golf course was perfect. Overall, it was a great family trip, I would recommend to it to families.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to Marriott Standards”
Reviews.Author: biztraveler22
Reviews.Content: As a Gold Elite member, I stay in a lot of Marriotts every year and this one ranks among the lowest on my list. I realize that several reviews are positive but I can not agree for the following reasons: I came to Orlando for a Marriott timeshare presentation and was offered to stay at this resort. The location is not all that convenient to anything, except SeaWorld. The check-in person I had was quick, almost robotic in her quest to get me checked-in and out of the lobby. The hotel wasn't even busy! The room we had was dark with outdated and damaged furniture. It consisted of a too soft king bed, a small kitchette, a sofa bed, a small table with 2 ugly chairs and a very small screened porch. When I asked to be moved or upgraded, I was told that in order to do that it would cost more money. Our view was supposed to be the golf course but we looked out to a small patch of grass and trees. The pool area is nice but they run out of chairs fast. Parking can be a problem also. The grounds are nice but there was a stain on our walkway to our room, a large stain on the cement that was never cleaned up. The staff is not very friendly and overall we decided to eat and play elsewhere. Basically, this resort has seen better days.The timeshare presentation was at another location and was very professional with no pressure whatsoever to buy a thing. Unfortunaltely, we were so turned off by the Grande Vista that we did not buy. For our last night in Orlando, we stayed at the Marriott World Center -- absolutely goregous and a flawless stay!

Reviews.Title: “wow great resort”
Reviews.Author: laverne_10
Reviews.Content: The grand vista was a large however well orginized property. You have no reason to leave the resort. There is a Public Grocery within a mile and the outlets were just as close. We visited several resturants Joe crab house was good. The hotel gave directions to one that is actually closer to the airport but there is another one next to down town Disney about 10 minutes in distance. My children went fishing as well as boating on the property and love it! They also caught a fish! They really enjoyed and requested that we stay there next spring break. Also the staff was friendly and overly helpful. Keep it up Mariott! Pools at every unit site.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: princessdebbie
Reviews.Content: We stayed here while taking our 13 month old to Walt Disney World. This is by far one of the nicest places to stay in Orlando. The rooms are spacious. We reserved a 1 bedroom suite. Each unit had a full kitchen, laundry, jacuzzi tub and shower. We ate at Nick's Grill. Service was a little slow but enjoyable. There is a ton to do at this property. Activities for the kids and bars for the adults. I would highly recommend the Marriott Grande Vista and will be visiting again. The only downside is the 10am check out. I am use to 11am and 10am does seem very early. The grounds are absolutely beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice suites with a few problems”
Reviews.Author: Gary144
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one week in a two bedroom lockoff. Suites were spacious, especially with both sides of the lockoff. Check in was very accommodating - I called about 12 hours before we arrived because we would be checking in late - 2 a.m. and I wanted to get a 1st floor suite because our daughter often runs around or jumps - they were very accommodating - it later turned out they were sold out, too. Suites were well furnished with all necessary kitchen equipment, coffeemaker, etc. Barbecue tools can be ordered from housekeeping. Maid service is by extra charge only. Our suite did have a faint musty smell, which caused us to leave the windows open most of the time - this was not a problem in early April, but I could see how it could be a problem at other times of the year. The room safe (key locked, not code) was broken. The biggest "problem" if you can call it that, was the water temperature. In both the shower and the sink, the water temperature could fluctuate between scalding and cool without changing the setting - apparently similar to plumbing in some houses where the temperature changes when someone else uses a faucet or toilet - except here, that person could be in a completely different suite! Oddly, I found this to be a problem even in the hotel spa when I showered after a massage. At least they're consistent, I guess. Also, our suite (Building 100) looked out on the golf course, which was very nice, except that the landscapers mow every morning or two at about 7:00 a.m. The larger suites have a washer-dryer, but it is small - we could only launder about 4 shirts/pants at a time. Parking when they are sold out or almost full is a problem if you return at night. On our first night, there was no parking near our building. There was a staffer on a golf cart who helpfully suggested I park at the restaurant parking behind our building and guided me there and drove me back - it took all of three minutes and I could have walked, but I was fortunate not to be disabled or unable to walk a distance. At less crowded times, this is probably not a problem. The pools appear convenient to all buildings and were clean and large. Deepest area was 5 feet or so, so most older children can stand throughout. There appear to be barbecues near each building, but gas only in two locations. The property is huge - I got lost once going to the exit. There is an indoor climbing/play area for children under 52 inches, and they actually enforced the size limit, insisting on excluding our autistic daughter who is tall for her age. But the monitors appear to be there only part time. There are numerous activities each day that would appeal to all different interests, if everyone wasn't in Orlando for the theme parks. There is a large man-made lake in the middle of the property with paddle boats, kayaks, etc. The one annoyance related to the activities is that one or more times a day, every day, there is a voicemail to all phones about all the activities of the next day. A schedule is provided when you check in, so this is unnecessary, and the voicemail does not indicate how to erase old messages. Within a few days, your voicemail box is full from these unnecessary and redundant messages, making it inconvenient if you have messages from others. Note cellphone reception, at least throughout our building (100) was consistently terrible. Fine on the grounds, but bad in the building. WiFi is free, but slow. The location is convenient to the freeway and airport (15 minutes) and Disneyworld (20-25 minutes without traffic). Seaworld is less than 5 minutes away, and the convention center is only a few minutes more. There are Publix and CVS Pharmacy about 1 1/2 miles away, and a Whole Foods and Winn Dixie about 7-8 miles away. The spa was mediocre as resorts go - clean, but with the minimum typical conveniences - there were towels, lockers, robes, a steam room, but I couldn't tell if the "body wash" in the shower was even soap - it seemed like water, and there were no extras in the men's locker room such as hairdryers, combs, shaving gel, etc. that one might expect. I had a 50 minute massage which was very good, but not outstanding by any means. 18% gratuity was included automatically. There is an onsite small market that stocks most necessities, some basic food & drink including alcohol and barbecue stuff such as charcoal, and laundry detergent, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort, perfect for our family”
Reviews.Author: jbud
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 2 bedroom villa from March 20th - 24th and were extremely pleased with our experience. The hotel room itself was in perfect condition, included two separate bedrooms and a full kitchen. The master suite had a king sized bed, jacuzzi tub, bathroom, shower, enclosed patio and flat panel TV. The 2nd bedroom also had it's own bathroom, flat panel TV, and 2 double beds. The kitchen contained all items necessary for a short or extended visit - fridge, microwave, dishwasher, stove, dishes, pantry, etc. The countertops were all granite and it appears the rooms were very updated. i believe the resort also has 4 separate pools, however we only visited 2 of them and they were nice with very warm water. Overall, i would definitely recommend the Grande Vista as an excellent family resort to stay when visiting Orlando. The hotel is located on International Drive and probably about a mile from Sea World.

Reviews.Title: “The only Marriott where you fly blind. You won't have a clue what you get”
Reviews.Author: ffvsartoris
Reviews.Content: Worse still. You will have to ask for everything with the laziest housekeeping staff in a very fine chain. You get a teeny map with no detail. No real facilities description, and since you are a stuck a mile from a strip highway dripping with all the same boring franchises you have on every other strip highway in the US, you might give them a lot of business if you only knew what restaurants they had and when they were open. Are there ice machines? Are they ever going to replace linen? Is everything expected to get in that one tiny waste basket? How bout the towels. Why aren't there signs to the various features spa, pools, restaurant etc? Like to get yelled at when you walk on the fringe of a two lane paved golf cart road for "being on the golf course." Want to improve your Hatian patois? You will ADORE the Grande Vista if you just love calling the hotel service lines every five minutes and helping them understand how their hotel functions. Let's face it. If you bring EVERYTHING you need like a canoe expedition up the Amazon it has electricity and running water (but don't drink any of it, yech!) and great showers and a great bed... and you can take advantage of the tennis and golf, it sure beats the ghastly Las Vegas hotel competition on International Drive.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: bean129
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in timeshares all of over the world and this by far was the worst one. We had a 2 bedroom villa in building 91 which was noisy and filthy. Twice we had to call security because of noise in the pool late at night after pool hours. There were stains on the furniture, handles missing off shower doors, both sinks in the master bedroom would not drain and when asked for additional blankets, housekeeping brought up blood stained blankets. The appliances were dirty and the refrigerator was never cleaned from the previous guest. We never received new towels the 4 days we stayed there and found the staff at the front desk extremely rude. Very disappointed in the state of hotel...would never recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “not up to the reputation”
Reviews.Author: ErickW
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my two kids in a studio in building 99 which is not renovated. Don't stay there. It is simply terrible. Old, extremely noisy (even if people in the next rooms were rather quiet). In the studio you will only get a small refrigerator and a microwawe. Even they put only stuff for two people (so two plates, two cups, etc). Terrible. I do hope the renovated bedrooms are much better. The swimming pools are very small, even the main one. Stay away.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for Families - Timeshare Not a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PennStateFan
Reviews.Content: My family (2 adults, 2 kids aged 7 and 4 and a visit from grandmother) stayed here for a week as part of the Interval timeshare swap. We own a Marriott property in Arizona and swapped here for a 2BR stay over our spring break and Easter Weekend. Please note that this is a time share property primarily although they do offer rooms like traditional hotels too. The biggest difference for people not used to timeshares are their are a number of 6 story buildings spread out over the property, not a single building. And if you do the timeshare swap, you don't get housekeeping service during your stay. We stayed a week but used it primarily as a place to stay to take the kids to Disney each day, so we didn't use all of the amenities. Location: It's right off International Drive, a main drag in the Theme Park areas. Plenty of restaurants and shopping in the area including the Premium Outlet mall about 3 miles from the facility. You will need a rental car to stay here. It's a good central loction between Disney World, Sea World and Universal Studios. Room: We stayed in a 2BR condo in building 91 overlooking the smaller pool. Great layout, BRs on different sides of the condo, so you can keep the noise down between different rooms. The master bedroom had a king bed, small sitting area, big bathroom with jacuzzi tub and separate shower only. The other bad had the combo shower/tub like most hotels. The 2nd BR had two queen beds. Full kitchen with full sized appliances, stacked washer/dryer (work great, but are the smaller sized one). Nice dining area with 6 chairs and nice living room with pull out sofa and two chairs. Great 42 inch LCD TV (may be a little bigger) in the living room and other LCDs in the BDs. Balcony had small table with 4 chairs. Ours overlooked the pool and a golf course. I'm not sure when it was renovated, but liked the room and layout. The walls are a bit thin, especially by any connecting door. We could hear our neighbors at time (another family) Amenities: I know there are at least 2 pool areas (may be more). We didn't use the main pool since we were so close to the other one. Great little store, ice cream shop, pizza hut on property. I think I saw a workout room, but after days at Disney, didn't need the treadmill. There is also a Maze room for kids, but we didn't use it. There is a daily list of activities for adults and kids (mainly kids). Some are free, some have nominal cost. Free wireless internet. Service; We weren't demanding at all and since this is a time share, we really only dealt with employees at Check in and stopping by the store. They were all nice and helpful. We did get a call for the timeshare presentation but told them we weren't interested and they left us alone. I think this is a great property for families when you need a little extra space. I'm not sure we can do a single hotel room again with our kids and sharing bed.

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation at Marriott's Grande Vista”
Reviews.Author: happytraveler574
Reviews.Content: My husband and myself came here with another couple. I was in building 81 facing the pool. I was so happy to open the room to a newly renovated space. Everything was perfect from the granite countertops, to the very clean bathroom. The front desk staff was great, they supplied all the towels and sheets that I asked for. There was live entertainment, the grounds were spotless. We enjoyed the pools and hot tub. I would definitely go back to this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Resort!”
Reviews.Author: pdshoe
Reviews.Content: Upon our arrival at the resort, check in was very smooth. We were in a 2 bedroom. There were 8 of us staying the week. We found that there was plenty of room for all of us. The grounds at the resort are beautiful! We spent time at one of the smaller pools and found that it was very quiet and relaxing. They have an area where you can play ping pong and pool or fish from the pier. Workout area looked very nice. Treadmills actually have TV's attached to each one of them. Staff was always friendly and helpful! I would definitely recommend this resort to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific family resort”
Reviews.Author: jennyams
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely 4 night/5 day stay at Marriott's Grande Vista. We were in a 2 bedroom unit (1 bedroom lockoff plus the studio) which together as a very large space for my family of 4. We probably would only need the 1 bedroom if we returned. Although the front desk told me they could not accomodate my request for a new or renovated space, our building (89) seemed to have been renovated -- kitchen had granite countertops, new looking appliances, etc. The decorations were very nice. Unlike the experience of some other reviewers, our unit was cleaned (new towels, made beds, even new coffee) every day. We took full advantage of the amenities for families -- my kids (6 and 9) had a great time at "Kid's Night Out" (extra $$), which gave my husband and me a chance to go out on our own. They took part in pool games one afternoon, built battery operated cars another and used the climbing wall on the beach. The 9 hole golf course was quite nice, and did not charge greens fees for juniors after 3:00 when accompanied by a paying adult. The pools were heated, which was great since the weather was a little on the chilly side. We ate at least once at all three restaurants. Nick's grill is nice but pricey for dinner. The other two aren't really restaurants - one is cafeteria/fast food style, and the other is outside and part of the pool bar. We wished there was one indoor pub style restaurant, but other than that we thought the accommodations were exactly what we were looking for. Location is very close to Sea World. We had purchased (through AAA) 14 day return tickets, and the close location allowed us to return a couple times (although we paid for parking each time). We were about 10 minutes from Universal. We didn't do Disney this time, but I think it too is only 10 minutes away. There is a desk right at the resort to buy Disney and Universal tickets. There are a bunch of restaurants about 1 mile past Sea World near the Convention Center. We wished we had found these before our last night.

Reviews.Title: “An owner who is utterly disgusted”
Reviews.Author: Mariettatraveler55
Reviews.Content: I am an owner at Marriott Grande Vista, but I will be the first to admit it has really been let go. Our three bedroom villa had the following problems. Master bath, the sink was broken -- would not let water out Kitchen, the refrigerator leaked water like Niagara Falls. Everything in the "frig" was water logged. Bedroom #1-- brandnew LG flatscreen turned off an on at will. Guest lock off -- shower sprayed water all over, but not out of the nozzle. If they give you unit 220 in building 90 say NO THANK YOU> I will be looking to sell my timeshare asap Previous guests left toys on the floor and the maid left them also. Anasty flip flop was found sticking out from under the bed in bedroom #1, we put it in the outside hallway -- there it sat for 6 days. Someone left a cup from McDonalds in the outside hallway -- I actually saw the housekeeper walk past it twice and not pick it up.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Resort”
Reviews.Author: jg1991
Reviews.Content: This is a stunning resort that is near it all yet away from it all. SItuated off International drive it is just one mile from Sea World but a short drive from the "hustle" of I-Drive. Beautiful grounds, spacious and clean rooms. From the drive in till the day we left, there was always something to do onm property. They offer daily activities for all ages (most of the free).

Reviews.Title: “Good, but could be better if you get a renovated unit.”
Reviews.Author: grandetraveler
Reviews.Content: Several of these units have been renovated, but my unit was not. (Bldg 90, 3rd floor) The front desk called it "refreshed", which I can tell meant new paint job only. The kitchen was old and very worn. It lacks essentials that most other timeshares have - kitchen towels, mitts, place mates and the like. The rugs were torn and crayon written over them made me wonder what parents would allow their kids to act this way, but that's another issue. The rugs in the LR smelled mildew and the odor permeated thru the unit. The bath room mini-blind was broken and cracked, so it was left in the up position like noone could tell? We had to hang a towel since the window faced another unit. Housekeeping was very attentive when it came to delivering towels and foam pillows, calling back as follow-up, but not good on doing anything about the shade or the leaking refrig in the kitchen. (Another towel on the floor absorbed the water for the week) What a mess! Parking is inadequate, with people using the curb and the turn-around for overnite. I am an owner at Grande Vista but had not been there for 3 years. I sent a letter to Marriott stating that I was sorry I did not trade my timeshare off for something newer. The location of the facility is great for themeparks, shopping at the prime outlets. Having stayed at lots of Marriotts over the years, I was disappointed by the condition of this one. A new facility is being built at Grande Lakes in Orlando next to the JW hotel, and that will be my request next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great accomodations/Good value”
Reviews.Author: powder068
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a Disney vacations with my fiance. We booked using a getaway through a timshare. We only ended up paying $400.00 for the entire week in a 1 bedroom villa. We got a high floor on the pool bar side. Very close to the bar and entertainment. I found this to be the most economical stay for us and would be for any family. Yes you will need a rental car but you are no more than 15 minutes from Disney and Universal. NOT a big timeshare person and hate thre presentations...but they offer very cheap trips if you give them 2 hours and they are not typical timeshare presentations.....NOT PUSHY at all. Tell them you set your timer. All in all great large rooms, nice jacuzzi tub, large balconies and great location close enough but far enough to enjoy the evenings.

Reviews.Title: “Typical Marriott quality and service - a total pleasure”
Reviews.Author: Gordo65
Reviews.Content: Just what we've come to expect. One bedroom with king bed, very roomy with good kitchen, marble counters, tasteful decoration, laundry, large dining room table, comfortable sleeper sofa and two easy chairs, whirlpool, separate second sink with toilet and shower. Fabulous facilities with many pools, two golf courses, just a great place. Terrific location just south of Orlando, very close to Sea World and short trip to Disney parks. International Avenue where its located is lined with high end resorts and many top flight restaurants and stores. Can't go wrong here, IMHO.

Reviews.Title: “Grand stay at the Grande Vista!”
Reviews.Author: sktss_123
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to this property. I have been to the other Marriott resorts that are part of a time share. I was very pleased with the location, grounds, room and pretty much everything in general. The service was very slow. I requested pillows 3 times in 2 hours and finally got them after 2 hours of waiting. I then received the same pillows that I already had and were allergic to. It wasn't trip dampening. The rooms/ kitchens could use some updating, but nothing major. The beds were quite comfy and the rooms were quiet. Bonuses in my book. (Warning to the ladies who use round brushes: Bring your own hair dryer. It was a catastrophe and I had to buy one at the local CVS :) I would definitely stay here again...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent property; disappointed with dated building”
Reviews.Author: mego1216
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Grande Vista while visiting the Orlando area theme parks. Location was great and resort ammenties were excellent. Beautiful pool, exercise facility and lake area, which had a beach! We were, however, disappointed with the dated building (#100). There was only one elevator for the entire building (which was slow and rickity) and the bathroom and kitchen were dated compared to other vacation club properties we've stayed in. We wished we would have had a unit like the web site advertised. Would love to stay there again but would request a different building.

Reviews.Title: “Disney Trip”
Reviews.Author: DeborahJ4
Reviews.Content: Nice resort . Great location lovely views. Close to Seaworld not far from Disney. We were there for 5 days went to the Disney Parks only 2 days. Went shopping and to other game rooms every nite. Only used a half tank of gas.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT GET STUDIO HERE!!!”
Reviews.Author: Cruisedave
Reviews.Content: I am writing tIhis from the Studio accomodations here at the Marriott Grand Vista. At the conclusion of this review, I will be packing my stuff and leaving after one night of a three night stay. I have stayed here before in the one bedroom and it was fine. However, the studio is just an extention of that room so basically it's like sharing the room with strangers with just a connecting door between the rooms. You can hear EVERYTHING from the other side and that is with people talking at a normal level. If they open a bag of chips, you can hear it. If they boil the water for tea, you can hear it. If they sneeze, you can hear it. I think you got the idea. Also we had issues with our coffee maker not working. It took over and hour and four phone calls to get the new one. I hope this was a useful review and I am now checking out of this noise machine....thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Love this resort”
Reviews.Author: BARBARA C
Reviews.Content: 40 days of sheer relaxation.....everyone is so helpful we stayed in bldg 81 . top floor which overLooks the main pool area...this would have been great but the weather was horrendous this year..BUT the Pools are so warm..and the hot tubs always 104 ...that makes even the coldest day bearablel...Marriott beds/linen were wonderful, acxtivities plentifuL..variety of exercise classes./ gym facilities super... Very enjoyable stay..Always the very best at the Marriott

Reviews.Title: “Great resort - relaxing”
Reviews.Author: clgfan
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here while touring colleges. What a great find. We spent a very enjoyable day at the pool and on the lake, and everything was relatively close by. Lunch by the pool was good, but a little bit pricey. The rental boats were great fun. Rooms had pretty much everything you could want, except for conditioner. The rate was really good for such a nice resort property. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Property - Cramped Rooms”
Reviews.Author: LuigiCT
Reviews.Content: Timeshare property, so not always sure what to expect. Grounds and staff were very good, particularly if you like golf and tennis. Pools were excellent, and nice sized exercise area with current equipment. Small ice cream shop and snack bars (very pricey). Very close to SeaWorld, and not too far from Disney. Main dissapointed was our king size room with pullout. These are "lockouts" or a tiny part of bigger suites being rented out as single units. Rooms are equipped no better than a Super 8 motel. tiny fridge, sink, and a few random pieces of glassware. Observed the room was never really cleaned by housekeeping each day, just made beds (no clean sheets) and ran water over any dishes in the sink, no vacuuming. Disgusting. Pullout bed was crummy piece of foam with noisy springs and no fitted sheets. On the plus side, they offer free wireless in the room, which was a nice suprise. Others seem to rate the bigger units very spacious and clean, so perhaps they just don't bother keeping the smaller, less profitable, rooms up to usual standard. Tried to upgrade a few times, but front desk staff could not accommodate. Suppose might try this property again if staying at the larger units, but there are many, many better choices in the immediate area, especially if you're not golfing.

Reviews.Title: “Huge, Gorgeous Property”
Reviews.Author: truantWestminster_MD
Reviews.Content: Hats off to Marriott. The Grande Vista is a quiet, beautiful, LARGE property with something for everyone. Although close to Disney, and particularly SeaWorld, we felt worlds away from the hustle and bustle. Our 2 bedroom unit was lovely, clean and very comfortable. Ya just cannot beat that Marriott bedding. A couple of the days were a tad chilly as January can be in Orlando, but with the heated pools and spas, who would notice? With so many acres of manicured property we never felt crowded, although truly this is one big property. Even a nature trail and we were just off of International Drive...very kewl! Staff was friendly, available but never pushy. Food options just ok, with the Pizza Hut and CocoLoco handy and tasty, but not great. Nick's Grill is overpriced and ordinary; needs to be either re-done or closed. Seems to appeal only to senior citizen golfers. Still, all and all, as owners we plan to return and enjoy this beautiful property again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific - Relax or Adventure”
Reviews.Author: galewind76
Reviews.Content: My husband and I only live a few hours away, and did not want to do theme parks but have a relaxing vacation without the hassle of airports. I was a little weary of the resort based on the mixed reviews, however upon arrival it all dissapeared. WOW! is all I can say upon entry into our room. Note it is confusing and I am surprised no one else mentioned the difficulty of finding our building. There are building numbers which do not correspond to your building. The room numbers do not as well. Keep your eye out for the small sign in the front of each building to find the right place. This place is HUGE! We lucked out and stayed in the building facing the lake near the copa loca bar. Our room was a newly rennovated one which I requested and was terrific! The swinging benches under the pergola were a definite plus. The room had 2 flat screens, although only the living room had a dvd and not a blue ray one to note. There was a surprising 2 seater jacuzzi tub that was enjoyed by hubby and I. Granite counter tops in kitchen and double sink vanity. We had a screened in patio that was nice for evening drinks or morning coffee. There is plenty to do onsite from free pool table and rock climbing, a faux beach, paddle boats, fishing, an arcade. We did not eat at the onsite restaurants except for the food court Market place and we DON'T reccomend the chicken although the pizza hut pizza was good and can have it delivered to your room. They have a little sundrie shop much overpriced but convienient. There is golf although we are more of the mini golf variety. Pirates cove is a short drive and highly reccommend doing the full course. Bahama Breeze nearby is a good dining choice. We also ate at OCharleys which was a steel with a restaurant.com coupon. The food was very good compared to my expecatations. We do not have children but if we did would definitely take them. There are many many onsite activities for children even encouraged them to participate in the bar karoke which was surprising. This location was pretty well centrally located for the activities we did and that was appreciated. Staff was nice whenever encountered. Start your ice maker as soon as you chekc in and also ask at the marketplace for a complimentary bag of ice. The only cruddy thing was the shower stall had a little mold around the outside but not a big deal. We didn't use maid service as I only needed it once and they actually didn't come anyways so I cannot comment on that. The spa has specials if you book ahead of time but we didn't try it. We had a very relaxing trip seeing sights off the tourist trap such as Rivership romance cruise (recommend if over 60 but food was good), winter park and tiffany museum nice, and we made a jaunt on the way out to Cassadaga (Spiritual community) which was accurate. Overall, I would go back to the Marriott Grande Vista for a quiet and relaxing visit.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful trip, going back for 2 weeks this year”
Reviews.Author: lisapratt1
Reviews.Content: Our visit to the Grand Vista was amazing. The 2bdrm, 2 bath accommodation was immaculate, fully equipped, relaxing, spacious, and beautiful! We were in the main reception building, and our room overlooked the main pool. Our teens and pre teens loved the pools, the Itrolly to downtown, and "Winning!" the Iron Chef Challenge at the activity center. We did not ride the paddle boats, but plan on doing that this year when we return. The climbing wall is free, and available on the beach daily. The pools are beautiful, and the location felt safe enough for us to go out to dinner one evening leaving the kids at the teen activities at the resort and ordering pizza up to our room for dinner from the marketplace on site. Free ice in the market place stores.....always a plus. Long morning walks before the heat set in were awesome, and even an alligator sighting one evening the kids will never forget. They made friends, we relaxed, all of us decided the Grand Vista is our Florida home away from home. At least 4 POOLS! 3 or 4 hot tubs...... well worth the trip for anyone who wants to blend family time with grown up luxury.

Reviews.Title: “So Friendly”
Reviews.Author: gert0517
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for Christmas. The staff was so extremely helpful and the resort was BEAUTIFUL. Tia the Bartender was fabulous! The only complaint I would have is that the pull out sofa in the room needs desperately to be replaced. Would go back again and again!

Reviews.Title: “So-So”
Reviews.Author: Momonthego08
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend works for Marriott so we got an employee discount. I would like to note that we stayed here one other time and had no problems however this time was disappointing. We live in Jacksonville and decided to take a last minute trip to Disney. We were only staying one night. First of all check in took about 15 min. My boyfriend said everyone wsa checking in at once..ok, no problem. The front desk gave us a pool view with a balcony (which the kids LOVED). The room itself seemed small. It was a king sized room with a pullout. Very cramped for a family of four. The bathroom was small also. Room had a fridge, coffee maker, hair dryer, micro (I think). While putting the kids to bed we noticed a big reddish brown stain on one of the sofa cushions. My boyfriend said it looked like they didn't bother cleaning it, just flipped the cushion over. GROSS! There was no fitted sheet for the pullout (only flat sheets) so the sheets wouldn't stay on the bed...PAIN! As we were on the bed watching tv a bug of some sort was seen crawling on the wall. This was not a BIG deal to me because I live in FL and bugs are everywhere however it does leave you with an "icky" feeling. No noise from hallway or room next to us (we even had an adjoining door too). We decided to order some food to be delivered. It was around 7pm. We found a menu in the room for a place called Milano's (pizza, calzones, sandwiches, etc). We decide to order from there. We call, order and they tell us it will be 45 min). Ok, no problem (it's Fri night and they are probably busy). An hour and a half later we finally get our food. This is not the hotel's fault but I just want future guests to be aware to NOT order from this place. The delivery guy calls our cell phone to ask directions to the hotel (speaking in very broken english)...are you kidding me? Like we know where the hell we are?!?!? Food was ok (not great) and luke warm. We were so hungry we just ate it. Check out is at 10am which I find to be a bit early. Overall hotel property is beautiful. Lots of things for families to enjoy like golf, swimming, paddle boats, work out facility, etc. I think this trip was just a fluke thing because our last visit was perfect! Front Desk was really nice when I asked for extra towels. We will be back but will make sure to ask for a larger room and get recommendations for food delivery.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott needs to answer phones and clean their bathrooms.”
Reviews.Author: GeorgiaCalgal
Reviews.Content: We were surprised at the lack of service from the front desk and the deli - no one would answer pnones. People were friendly but just wouldn't answer the phone - it would ring at least 20 times at the front desk - I hung up and tried again. Bathrooms were not clean, floors were sticky, and dishwasher didn't clean dishes well. Managment needs to shake up staff.

Reviews.Title: “Nice looking hotel but terrible service with a few Cockroaches in the mix”
Reviews.Author: Mel057
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mariott grande Vista from Dec 25th to Jan 2nd. We arrived late and the front desk only had a few available rooms. I had read on previoius postings to ask for a newer building, so I insisted and was given a room in building 90. We were on the main floor. We put our bags in the room and went for dinner. When we returned we found two cockroaches waiting for us in the bathroom. Needless to say, as a mom with two small kids who are sleeping in cots that are close to the ground, I was not pleased. The hotel staff was not helpful, they were reluctant to come to the room and added that it was "normal" to see a cockroach or two once in awhile in Florida. When we finally convinced them to come to our room they explained that the only thing they could do was move us to a new room. I asked if they could guarantee that this would not happen in another room and they said they couldn't. Even the people who helped us move told us that this happens once in awhile. Well, I have stayed at many hotels in Orlando and I can assure you I have NEVER seen one in my room. We were credited our first night stay, but I don't think I will ever get over that. Gross!

Reviews.Title: “If you like to sleep at a hotel RUN from this one!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Tumaini
Reviews.Content: There is zero and I mean ZERO sound proofing in this resort so unless you want to feel as if you're sharing a room with strangers do not stay here! I moved rooms after my second night here because the noise level was unreal. You can literally hear every word people say in the room next to you...and their screaming babies, poorly behaved children, arguing parents, etc. Terrible, terrible place and the front desk is useless in helping you out. I asked to change rooms and they did but put me next door to what sounds like a herd of elephants. On top of that I tried a couple of the restaurants here and the food is terrible. The grounds look nice but don't let that lure you in...that's why I stayed here. If I had known I would basically be living with a family I would've stayed somewhere else. Again RUN, RUN, RUN away from this horror!!!!

Reviews.Title: “We had a fantastic family experience at Grande Vista”
Reviews.Author: RebeccaKiraHannah
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Grande Vista in a 2 bedroom villa with our two kids and another family of four. The villa was very comfortable even with 8 of us in it. The fact that it had a washer and dryer in the villa was wonderful, especialyl since it rained several of the days that we were there and the kids regularly needed fresh clothing. The villa had everything we could ever want and we spent many mornings with a fresh cup of coffee and a good book, relaxing on the private screened in balconies. While we were there a hurricane was blowing it's way through and the hotel did an excellent job of keeping us all informed about the situation. Despite the weather we were able to enjoy our stay. The pools were clean and kept at a very reasonable temperature. The kids loved the family luau on the beach, especially the making of the smores at the fire pit. We are not owners here and we were not approached nor hassled to become owners, we paid what we felt was a very reasonable price for a very nice accomodation. We had a wonderful time and would return without hesitation in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort, below average rooms but we hear some are nice”
Reviews.Author: VARoadTrip
Reviews.Content: We stayed after Christmas 2009, thru New Years. Our room was small, old looking, and not the cleanest - very unlike what we expect from Marriott. We got a "deluxe guest room" that supposedly sleeps 4, but there is no room to move around (or sit) with the queen sofa bed opened up, and there is no room for suitcases/clothes for 4 people. This was a time-share sales special that we travelled on, and every time they called to confirm, they noted a room for two - and each time I corrected them that there would be four of us (to no avail, as our accomodations would only be suitable for two). Some people we know stayed the same week, but got the full suite for their family of four and enjoyed their room. The staff was generally friendly, but not overly helpful. Worse part was the New Year's eve "celebration". There are lots of activities at this resort, and daily phone messages to inform you as to what is going on. They advertised to "come spend New Year's Eve at one of the poolside bar/grills", so we made plans to do that. Well, New Years eve apparently ends early for Marriott employs, as they closed the poolside bar at 10:20PM, even though we were told earlier in the day that they would stay open if there were guests present and it didn't rain (there were still 20 or so people there and no rain when it closed). To make matters worse, we stayed there enjoying our last call drinks hoping to ring in the New Year without Marriotts beverages, when security arrived at 11:00PM and told us we had 3 minutes to leave! Bad enough that they were evicting us before midnight (on the one night of the year you'd expect to be out), but to give us the bum's rush of 3 minutes notice was just unbelievable. Again, we expect great customer service from Marriott, but we didn't get it here on this stay. The timeshare sales pitch was generally good, but they never told us the purchase price, and instead only discussed monthly payments (based upon rediculous terms) - this was a big red flag for us, which turned us off from something that may have otherwise been an interesting prospect. The idea that we got a deal to stay here to entice us to buy, but then got crummy accomodations is somewhat ironic as well - I expected to be put up in a room that I would love to return to - definitely not the case for us. The pool areas where VERY nice, however. There are several pools with different set ups for adults and children, all heated, which was necessary at this time of year.

Reviews.Title: “Christmas was ruined with a flood, poor customer service, and dirty room!”
Reviews.Author: blavie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I checked in on Dec. 25th to a 1 bd Villa in Bldg 83 on the 3rd floor and upon inspection the bathroom and kitchen didn't appear as clean as we would have like, so I proceeded to disinfect the entire two rooms. Within an hour and a half arriving and sanitizing the whirlpool, bathroom, and kitchen a pipe in the hallway burst which sent water gushing into the hallway and shortly thereafter into our room with full force! We were credited $50 for the inconvenience and moved to Building 90 but once we arrived we were disgusted by the lack of upkeep on the building, the dirty rug, and the remote location of the the room. So we packed up again, and this time went to the main bldg and spoke to a manager who apologized and credited us with an additional $50 but honestly I was not satisfied because at that point we were not able to attend a show at City walk (Blueman) in which the tickets costed us $140 and we had not had dinner and as a pregnant woman you can imagine how uncomfortable I felt. In addition, I had a bag of wet clothes and they had no way to dry clean them so I was stuck to deal with the mess. At this point, it's Christmas day around 9pm and we're pissed! We've been moved twice, left with a bag of wet clothes, wasted money on unused tickets and the attitude of the front desk was not that accommodating. So finally, we were moved to building 82-room 2525 and the space was in better condition but also not clean to our standards. For instance, the bathroom shower door had water stains-it appeared someone had taken a shower and it was not cleaned thoroughly after. The other area of contention was that I previewed the property on a timeshare spiel last year and was shown a room with stainless steel appliances, flat screens, and granite countertops. We were put into a room with plastic appliances, big older model TVs, and an older room with less appeal. In addition, we had to go to a 90 minute presentation even though I paid $680 for the 5d4n stay. What a rip off!! On Day 3, I asked a house keeping employee for a new bed spread and she informed me that she would not give it to me because I was not scheduled for a full service and that I needed to call room service. I've never met such rude, unpleasant staff like the housekeeping staff at this place. On day 4 we over heard one staff yelling from the 4th floor down to another on the ground floor-how unprofessional. By day 4 my husband and I decided to leave a day early. We had enough and wanted to go home. Why stay another night in a dirty, uncomfortable room when we could drive home 9 hours to the comfort of our place? I think all things considered, the hotel should have given me adequate compensation to have my clothing laundered and to cover the cost of our Blue man tickets. Even a fruit basket would have been appreciated as a gesture. Also fyi the main restaurant, Nick's Cafe is horrible. The food is over processed and they can't even make a Cappuccino correctly! We ate there the first night and the lobster bisque tasted worse than something you'd get from a can. I didn't even touch the crab cake because my stomach was shot after the soup. The next day we had breakfast, and even the pancakes were rubbery and more bad cappuccino. Anyhow, the pros of the hotel include the close proximity to International and a washer/dryer in the room (which comes in handy when your room is flooded and you need to rewash all your clothes). If you're considering buying a timeshare at the Grande Viste- beware I can inform you that it would be a bad decision. Try a place that values its guest and knows how to treat their customers.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Resort - Beware the Pizza Express Flyer!”
Reviews.Author: baeverly
Reviews.Content: Marriott Grande Vista is awesome. Our two bedroom villa is clean and spacious. We are Marriott Timeshare owners in Aruba and this property is similiar to other Marriott Vacation Club Villas we have experienced. Our villa appears to be have been renovated within the past year or so. We received a flyer under our door last, our second night here. It was for a company called Pizza Express. Beware, this place is a scam. They did deliver a pizza but it was cold. We also ordered wings and got 15 when we ordered 20, and they were also cold. It appears this place gets pizza and wings elsewhere and trys to scam unsuspecting tourists. Check the reviews online!

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch”
Reviews.Author: MissMouse1928
Reviews.Content: PROS: The villa I stayed in was so clean, I would have felt comfortable to eat off the floor! The villa was humongous! Although only one king bedroom and a sleep sofa, the dining table was big enough for 6. The screened lanai was delightful. The staff was friendly and extremely helpful. Excellent location for all the area theme parks, just a short drive to Disney, fabulous outlet malls and lots more. Sparkling clean, huge, full kitchen with everything you could possibly need on hand. Free WiFi, free parking, excellent off season rates. CONS: I was in the building closest to the hotel entrance which I was told was the newest building. I was disturbed by the noise made by cars driving over the wooden bridge that brings you to the hotel security gate. I considered asking to change rooms but I adjusted to the noise after one night. The noise is fairly constant from very early morning to very late in the evening so if you are noise sensitive request a room that is not near the front entrance. SPECIAL NOTE: Monica in reservations went far and beyond what I would expect for courtesy and service as a hotel guest. She deserves many kudos and she should be a hotel manager or better some day. THANKS MONICA!

Reviews.Title: “In need of a kidney still...”
Reviews.Author: tonig23
Reviews.Content: we got there it was really nice. We open up the certains and allot of dust fell on my head and face i could not belive it . After a few minutes later an incredable itch came all over my body, face, neck, back, my butt ,legs, toes every were in my privite area. I called the front desk they send someone over, And he ask me too move that samenight, it was not so easy becasue it was about 11.00 clock at night and my husband is in a wheelchair and is only able too see with one eye only. And we have a 3 year old child and we shoped for the week. It was just too much for my husband, and he has dialysis in the morring and hast to wake up at 5.00am in the moring. He told me to take a shower, but I still itched. The next day I got some zyrtec allergy antihistamin 10 mg. I sleept the hole week and we were unable to go get on the kidney transplant list and it was not a very good time so we had people calling us all time trying to sell us another time share or trying to buy us tickets to the parks.And they got mad when we told them no so we asked for the week back and they told us no. Very disapponting i can not belive it, I'm never again in my live going back. I even asked just for a few extra days just to get on the kidney list. And they still said no....

Reviews.Title: “Will not stay anywhere else! This is the resort for us! Perfect for families with young kids!”
Reviews.Author: tigressbabe
Reviews.Content: It was great! We stayed here from December 12 to December 18th. It was fabulous! We stayed in building 92 which was literally next to the Golfside Pool. It was great to be able to come off the elevator and there was a pool and whirlpool spa right there. There were also many grills that we could use. It is definitely a very family friendly resort. The pool area over by Copa Loca featured a mini splash park of sorts that is great for kids. There are also water cannons and waterfalls cascading into the pool. Also the bar area had a decent selection of food and a great selection of drinks. Then there were several pools over by the main building. A pool designated as a lap pool, a huge family pool that the depth was a constant 3 1/2 feet, a toddler pool with a fountain in the middle and another pool that the depth went to about 5 feet. There were also I think 3 whirlpools surrounding the pools. What was convenient especially our first night was the ability to have room service. After all the travelling we were able to order chicken fingers with french fries, a whole rotisserie chicken, mac and cheese, mashed potatoes with gravy, creamed spinich, an apple juice and a 2 liter of Sierra Mist including delivery and taxes for $35. Hubby of course was excited that the golf course was right there and he received discounts because we were staying on the property. They also have activities!!!! There is something for everyone. They activities just for teens! They have a storytime for toddlers with cookies and milk! They have arts and crafts for the kids. There were a ton of activities. They even had mojito making for the adults. Oh there was also a Caribbean night where we were serenaded by steel drums and there was a polynesian night! Every night the activities desk would leave a message informing you of the activities for the next day. You could also rent movies for about $7.50 for 24 hours. They also had a pretty decent game room with arcade games. There there was the maze. My 4 year old son was absolutely in love with the maze. After an hour he was exhausted however still determined to explore. Also you could rent paddle boats and take them out on the lake. In the lake there were several turtles and really huge fish. We stayed in a two bedroom lock-off which had a screened in porch, LG flat screened tvs in the living room and in each bedroom, 2 person jacuzzi, standing shower and tub. The room was immaculate and smelled of bleach when we arrived. There are so many good things to say about this resort! The grounds were well-maintained. We were convenient to everything. There was a lot to eat on the resort itself. There was a Denny's down the street, Super Walmart and the outlets were 7 minutes away. Sea World literally down the street. This is the perfect resort when visiting Orlando with kids. There is a lot for teenagers too. They even have a Disney Quest for the teens. You should experience this resort, its great.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: Doriee
Reviews.Content: This was a very large suite. Two bedroom lock off. It was great, however I still like the Cypress Harbour down the street. Grande Vista is newer and bigger, but I found the service at Cypress much better and the ameneties where something I would actually use. A great resort for the money. Would I go back? Probably not ... I will stick to Mariott Cypress Harbour instead.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Marriott Grande Vista!!!”
Reviews.Author: Val8
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Marriott Grande Vista for 3 nights when in Orlando on business. My board meeting was at the Caribe Royale, but a co-worker and I decided to stay at the Marriott instead. The rate was lower, and the property was far superior! Everyone was jealous when we talked about the size of our villas and the amenities. The property has so many features that I did not get to experience: a full slate of activities daily, restaurants, spa, fitness center, etc. I hope to go back soon on a real vacation to experience the property to the fullest! A+ for the Marriott Grande Vista, a fabulous choice in the Orlando area!!!

Reviews.Title: “Superb but quiet location in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: Miss_Pie
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stay here very much. The postion of this complex is wonderful. It is close to all the attractions but its position is at the quiet end of International Drive so the traffic is not heavy. The grounds and surroundings are lovely although the apartment itself could do with being updated. We stayed in the one bedroom apartment and although the bed in the main bedroom was very comfortable the mattress on the bed settee could have been better. The service at the Marriott was excellent - there was a problem with our cistern and maintenance arrived only 15 minutes after I had contacted the desk - I was very impressed! If going to Orlando again I would probably consider staying here again, based mainly on its excellent location and excellent facilities within the grounds.

Reviews.Title: “Lives up to expectations”
Reviews.Author: K8K8
Reviews.Content: This resort was fantastic. The pictures posted paint a pretty accurate picture for you, though I will admit it was a little smaller than I expected, but still worth it. I loved this resort and all of the amenities offered. I will certainly stay there again on future trips to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Still a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: wrisberg
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here twice before in 2003 and 2005, and the resort is still as i had remembered. Clean well maintained grounds, pool areas and rooms. A few things didn't work in my parents room - the patio door would not lock and it took two days to fix, the smoke alarm kept beeping and it took 2 days to change the battery but overall it wasn't a major issue.I used the gym a few times and it was very well equipped, the bar had happy hour though we only used it once. At the main pool they played the same cd over and over again which was a bit toooooooooo much. My kids loved the rock climbing which was free and the visit from Bret who came from GATORLAND and brought aligators. lizards, scorpions and some lovely creatures for us to look at. We ahd a great time and would go back again in a minute

Reviews.Title: “The grounds were awesome!!!!”
Reviews.Author: paratrooper1397
Reviews.Content: We arrived to a nice welcoming and quick check in. Once we arrived at our assigned villa we were very surprised on the strong foul odor of mold. They room was very clean and spacious, but the smell definitely over rid the satisfaction of the nice clean room. I had 5 other families that we traveled with staying in the same building. So I went and checked 3 other units to see if they were having the same problem. They all had the same smell but not as bad as it was in our unit. Iâ€™ve stayed at several up scale villas in the Orlando area with no issues of the smell of mold, and was advised by the front desk to crank the AC to eliminate the smell. We left for the afternoon and into evening to attend a show and returned to even a more foul smell. I called the front desk to see if we could move to a different villa. They advised they would get back to us, THE NEXT DAY! They offered us a room in a different building. We went and looked to see if it too had a stench odor. Upon arrival it was obvious it had just been painted and smelled of fresh paint. I went back to the front counter and was directed to the manager of the villas assignment and demanded a room with minus the smell of paint or mold. WOW!! Within just 5 minutes we were given a villa minus the paint smell or mold. My suggestion is when you arrive and you smell the strong odor of mold go up to the front and talk to the manager. It was just a bad start to our vacation having to change rooms, and dealing with a foul odor, but other than that the place is great for families.

Reviews.Title: “Huge resort”
Reviews.Author: Elmer&Lizette
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for just one night, so we didn't get to try all the facilities but it's a huge resort with a lot to do. The pool near our building was closed due to maintenance. We wondered why they didn't give us another room since it wasn't busy at all. Upon arrival we found a pile of garbagebags from other rooms next to our door. The room was dark and the carpet was wet at places due to a leak near the balconydoor. Bathroom was clean. Bed was ok.

Reviews.Title: “A Worthy Timeshare Exchange; definitely would visit again!”
Reviews.Author: Empress5150
Reviews.Content: My husband and I own a timeshare in Cabo San Lucas. We recently exchanged our one bedroom for a two bedroom two bath at this resort. We asked another couple to join us (the primary purpose of our trip to Orlando was to hang out at the International Food and Wine Festival at Epcot/visit the other parks at WDW). The unit (villa) was very, very nice. We were placed in Building 86, which is a bit far away from the main action of the resort (pools, restaurants, lobby) BUT it was extremely quiet, which we prefer. We were on the third floor in an end unit and, in general, did not hear much noise from any other guests. The villa was equiped with a more than decent kitchen and a huge (glass) dining room table (I shudder to think about what young children might do to this table, as well as the coffee table, which was also glass!) Glass cleaner was provided! A safe was in the closet of the master bedroom, which was large enough for two laptops and several other items (complimentary in villa wi-fi was very much appreciated). Check in was fast and easy. It was no problem to add our visitors to our reservation so that they could get through the guard gate. We ended up inviting one other person to come stay one night; ditto that process. All cars are required to have a parking pass displayed while parked/when coming into the resort; I was pleased that the parking/passes were free (some resorts charge for parking). The check in staff/guards were nice. We found the house keeping staff to be a bit "surly" but we didn't have to interact with them at all (room cleaning was an extra charge; I did think they should have cleaned the room once mid-week, included). What I mean by surly is; they did not hold the elevator for my husband; looking blandly at him as he raced to get to it (he had luggage or else he would have taken the stairs). One other time I saw a maid going into an nearby room, I smiled at her; she just looked away. We ate at one of the small outdoor pool restaurants (Copa Loca) once; service was fine and food was good if a bit expensive ($9 for frozen cocktails, about the same for a sandwich/wrap). The other time we were at this pool (one of four; the closest to our villa), we had hoped to get pool side service but there didn't appear to be anyone. No matter, really; the bar tender was nice. We ate in several nights, utilizing the huge nearby Publix (on Vineland in a shopping center) to obtain provisions. The kitchen was stocked enough such that we had a pot roast, salad, biscuits, and a pie (although I did have to bring my own springform pan!) The grounds of the resort were lovely; we were near a golf tee (not sure which). Sort of park-ish. Since we were at WDW most of the time, we didn't explore as much as we might have. My husband called to get directions to an ABC (liquor) store; they provided them but first tried to direct him to a much more expensive Sony store (don't do that; their prices are a rip off!) We received a daily (recorded) message from "Staff" with the next day's weather forecast and activities going on at the resort (again, a lot to do for people that would care to). We did get one call from someone attempting to talk us into a timeshare presentation in turn for $75, but, we're wise to this and just told them "No thank you" and never heard anything else. We've found that, if you own or are exchanging, they know that you know what the score is and so give up pretty easily. Each of the bedrooms had its own private balcony; very nice. Word to the wise; NO SMOKING is allowed in the rooms, on the balconies, or in the pool area. I had called to ask where smoking WAS allowed (one of our friends is a smoker); the answer? The parking lot! We did see many people in the parking lot/area smoking. She opted for a small table near the parking lot where a friendly racoon kept her company most evenings. There was a spa on site but we didn't use it. Our bathroom had a HUGE jetted tubs, which we did use a few times. First time in my life that I've been in a jetted tub with the jets underneath me. Sort of an odd experience but it was relaxing. My only complaints are minor; the surly house keeping staff, the additional charge for room cleaning, one screen on one of the windows was not on correctly and the pillows were awful (either too soft or rock hard). All in all, nothing to really complain about but I cite them for others information. We get to Orlando every three or four years; we'd definitely try this resort again. In general, I would surmise that the folks who had issues with this resort are in the minority.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Place, Great service”
Reviews.Author: travelerwsix
Reviews.Content: We went from October 11th to the 17th. We had a two bedroom Villa. It had a great living area and full kitchen. We really did not cook in that much except for frozen pizza and hot dogs, but if we wanted to, there was everything there we needed to prepare full meals for a family of six. The beds were very comfortable and the room was very clean. We got maid service daily, which is unusual when you rent a villa. The location was very close to seaworld and not too far from Disney. The pools were big and spacious and the kids really enjoyed swimming in them. We got a great rate since it was being promoted as their 25th anniversary rate. Only 172.00 a night for a two bed, two bath full kitchen condo. I have paid almost twice as much for facilities not quite as nice. Overall, a wonderful, memorable family vacation. would defintely stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “More Like an Apartment than a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Augie101898
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed 7 nights at this resort. It was our anniversary week. We do not have children and I called before hand to let them know the reason for the trip and that we would like to not be located near the children pool and that I would like early check in about 1pm. They told me to call. Yet each time I did call I was told I had to show up to get an answer. I did show up about 2-3Pm and was able to check in. My room was spacious about 800sq feet and full kitchen. The kitchen smelled bad. Perhaps who stayed there before me cooked something that did not want to go away. I called and they came back and before the next morning the smell was gone. We did get about 3 calls to be sold time share. We declined and every day there is a voice mail givng the weather and activities for the next day. My wife and I passed on all the activities as we were busy hitting the parks. Overall it is a nice place. They stated they were renovating and my villa had yet to be done and did look a bit dated but it worked well for the purpose of our trip. And I paid about $95 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Seaworld. Our room needed renovation.”
Reviews.Author: saleksza
Reviews.Content: Stayed at MGV the week of October 11, 2009. The resort is right around the corner from SeaWorld, but far back from the road. The resort campus is huge. You might very well need to drive from your room to the main pools. Check-in was relatively smooth. We had multiple rooms and that was a little confusing for some reason. We were in building 87. This is pretty far back and in NEED of RENOVATION. Speaking of renovation, a lot of buildings are being worked on. You see a lot of construction, but it was not invasive. The room looks like it was really nice when it was first built. However, it is showing its age. The furniture is all study and well built, but stained, scratched, chipped, etc. The kitchen stove and cook-top had about 2 temperatures â€“ on and off. The refrigerator had rust on the door. The list can go on. We had to have maintenance come and fix the garbage disposer, a ceiling fan, and the sink stopper. That plus the multiple housekeeping requests (Garbage bags are rationed like sugar during the war) were all quickly responded to and they have a nice touch of following-up to ensure the item was addressed and if anything else was needed.
