However, I would just rather have everything be there and to not need to be fixed. We planned to cook a lot in the room and we did, but it was a challenge with the quantity and quality of the cookware. The remote pools did not have any towel service or staff around. This made them quiet, but a little low service. They were really warm though. The main pool was a little too cool even in 95 degree weather. We spent a couple days at the main pool. This had towel service, bars, etc. Very nice area, but it could have used better pool skimming and pool side clean-up (Glasses, etc). There was also a lot of fire ants. You needed to shake out any bag you had on the ground. The poolside frozen drinks are about $9, but are large portions and taste great! The main village area is nice. The convenience store, child play area, pizza hut, etc are all right there and very nice. Some reviews mention a shuttle available to SeaWorld. That was not the case while we were there. The only shuttle was the public bus. We took a pass and drove over. On a side note, the Shamu show continues to be amazing. I do not think you can see that show too many times. The evening resort entertainment was weak, but this isnâ€™t a cruise ship ï�Š. In the morning, the ladies ran and used the fitness center. The only complaint was that the fitness center was way to warm. We do not golf, but the 9-hole course on property seemed very nice. We took the requisite timeshare presentation; it was informative and smoothly conducted. The new property by the Ritz Carlton looks very nice. While we did not purchase, our sales rep was Fred and I would not hesitate to purchase from him if the time was right for you. I do not think we will staying at MGV again or recommending it to others.

Reviews.Title: “We're repeat customers!”
Reviews.Author: redtraveler6
Reviews.Content: The best review I can offer is the fact that we're frequent customers! This visit we had a two bedroom unit with some other family members. There were four of us and it was more than enough room. One bedroom had a sunken tub, bathroom, bed, balcony. The second bedroom has a mini frig, microwave, bed, bathroom, couch, and balcony. The second bedroom converts to a studio unit as well. The living area had a couch, chair, tv, full dining room table, full kitchen, and washer and dryer. Additionally, there was a balcony off the family room. The Grande Vista is about 15 min from Disney and close to major roads. The grounds are beautiful. The pool is great, and the property is very nice for a morning stroll. They have activities everyday for just about every age as well. We love this hotel and look forward to our next visit!

Reviews.Title: “Great resort in excellent location; perfect for families”
Reviews.Author: LuvMyEagles
Reviews.Content: It was our second trip to the Grande Vista. We stayed in a very large 3 bedroom villa, perfect for a family with 3 boys (ages 12, 9, and 7). Having a kitchen in the villa is great for cutting expenses. Just buying some milk and cereal saves money and hassle. The on-site marketplace great for picking up a quick meal after a long day at theme parks. Pools, the grounds all well maintained and lovely. I have to say that while we were there the fire alarm in our building went off in the wee hours of the night due to some maintenance issue. Although rather annoying (and initially scary), I was extremely surprised and impressed by the response from Grande Vista management. The following day we received a apology letter, including a monetary credit for the incident. Kudos to Marriott for still being a class act in a culture of greed. A small and appropriate gesture, but one that will make me choose Marriott for my travel needs. And definitely the Grande Vista when returning to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Huge resort, great location”
Reviews.Author: AmyKMinnesota
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Grande Vista Oct 4-11 in building 77, in a 2 bedroom unit. This is my 6th stay at Grande Vista and all have been great. I called 10 days prior to request buildings 77 or 78 (since those are the newest), top floor, end unit. I received everything but end unit which was great. The units are nice sized, we had 3 adults and 2 children and it was perfect. Our unit had been renovated (at least with flat panel tv's), I was told these were only in buildings 93, 94 and 95 so far. The pools are nice, we were there a lot, it was so hot while we were there. Zero entry on one pool which is great for kids. Lots of activities going on, we didn't partake in any of them. New indoor kids area is ok, it was nice to get rid of some of the kids energy and still be cool inside. Check in and Check out was very smooth and free wifi worked great, will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to relax & lots to do for all ages.”
Reviews.Author: SMFS
Reviews.Content: Came to Orlando to take my 3 year old to Magic Kingdom. Marriott's Vacation Villas are the only way to go when traveling with kids! It's an actual condo but you have all the amenities of a resort! The resort was so pretty we had pictures taken there to use for our Christmas cards! Several restaurants, a Sweetery, & a bar by the pool. Would go back in a heart beat.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for relaxation and young children”
Reviews.Author: woochk
Reviews.Content: This is our second stay at the Marriott Grande Vista and it did not disappoint. I love the peace and quiet overlooking the golf course. If you ask for a particular room they do a terrific job getting it for you. There are lots of activities for younger kids including the play zone and wading pools. We spent two days at Disney and five days just hanging out at the hotel. It was fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Had a GREAT time!”
Reviews.Author: blueazd
Reviews.Content: The service we experienced was top notch. All of the staff we encountered was very friendly and helpful. The room was well appointed with very nice furnishings and included a mini kitchenette, which we really enjoyed having. Location, Location, Location! The property is right in the center of all the action near SeaWorld, Universal, Islands of Adventure and City Walk. But yet set in a private area where you could easily disconnect from all the hustle and bustle of the nearby action. We would definitely recommend this property and look forward to staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “Met expectations...if you have realistic expectations”
Reviews.Author: famtravmom
Reviews.Content: This timeshare-based property is showing its age. The decor of our two adjoining one bedroom rooms was looking worn and the coffee maker did not work. We were in a quiet location but far from pools. The back of our unit looked out towards Sea World and each night we saw the fireworks show from our balcony. The pool was very pretty but needs better supervision. The last night we were there there were lightning storms that were visible and close by, but yet there were people in the water at the pools. The most annoying thing about staying at this property is the daily sales call from one of the sales divisions at Mariott (restaurant, photography, buy a BIGGER timeshare from us).

Reviews.Title: “Grande Vista with toddlers”
Reviews.Author: kal72
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week at the Marriott Grande Vista (last week of Sept 2009). This was our second trip to the GV and we absolutely loved it. Our travel party consisted of my wife and me, our twin 2 year old boys and grandma and we were very comfortable in a 2 bedroom villa. We originally requested to be close to the Copa Loca pool in a renovated room, but they couldn't accomodate that request (due to a couple of building closures for renovatons). Our building (#94) was a 15 second walk across a parking lot to the main pool area, with a golf course view and just fine for us. There were some large improvement projects underway (painting, etc) but all facilities were open for business. Our 2 year olds loved the very-cool indoor play-yard..suitable for toddlers (especially during the early morning toddler time 8-9 AM). Older kids 4-10 would get more out of the playyard than 2 year olds, but it was still a nice safe, indoor activity. We spent a week there including 3 full days at the resort and hopped back and forth from Copa Local and Main pool, and spent some time on the sandy beach. The only thing that would have improved it, is if they had a shaded area or umbrellas on the beach - from 11 AM until sunset that beach is soaked in the sun, and hot for the toddlers.We got our beach time in before noon and it was fine. We also visited one of the "satellite" pools where we found the water to be warmer although there were no bar services...it was a nice place to spend the afternoon. The staff was great, especially the Copa Loca bartender lady. We used Starbucks almost dvery day, and ordered pizza from the Cove. We were also impressed by the reasonable prices of things at the Marketplace...they weren't as cheap as the grocery store but snacks were cheaper there than I expected. We knew we'd be spending a lot of time at the resort because our kids can't go all day everyday to the parks. We spent a few days at Seaworld and AK, and a road trip to Clearwater beach, but really loved the "downtime" at the GV. I know there are a lot of other resort options in the International Drive area, some newer than GV, but I am not sure why I'd even try one other than the Grande Vista for our next Orlando vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I was expecting, nothing special.”
Reviews.Author: SolidStateS15
Reviews.Content: I was here on a business trip with 2 other work colleagues. We booked our stay online and had never seen this place before so we were only going by what we saw on the website. They make it look like an awesome place, but it's really not that special. For the price you pay here I was expecting much more. Who would ever own a timeshare here is beyond me when there are way better places in the area. This is just a regular marriott hotel on a larger scale, meaning speard out over many buildings and large property. The scenery is very nice though, and the on site lake and golf course are nice. There are a few different pools, but they are always packed with kids and families. The on site restaurants are way overpriced for what you get and so not worth it. Being on I-Drive all you have to do it travel a few mi up the road and there is every kind of restaurant you could want. Avoid the on site eateries unless it's an emergency, or otherwise order delivery from a local place in town. The room itself is just average to me, as far as a marroitt goes, or other similar grouped hotel. Personally I would have rather stayed at a Hilton or Hampton Inn even. I don't need all the extras they have here, just a nice room. The room is a good size with plenty of space, but they bed was a cheaper mattress which was too hard and not very comfortable. There were like 8 freaking pillows on the bed which is just overkill when you only need 1 normally, however their feather pillows are not supportive at all. Luckily I found a couple traditional pillows in the closet and I found the best to be a combination to be a feather on the bottom with the regular one on top. There is only a small round table in the room though and it was just big enough for my laptop. I would have rather had a larger table or desk in the room. There was a small kitchenette which was nice because most marriotts anymore you have to specially request a mini-fridge. Already having the micro and fridge was nice. The bathroom was just ok, nothing nice or fancy. I was also disappointed with the small selection of toiletries. Only 3 items were given, 1 shampoo, 1 facial soap bar, and 1 body bar. No lotion, no conditioner, etc. I would have expected a better selection of items. Even the Hampton provides better toiletries. One nice thing though was they included a full spare set of towels, seperate pool towels, extra toilet paper, tissues, paper towels, kitchen supplies inc plates & silverware, and even a sponge & soap for dishes. Of course you wouldn't know unless you look in every drawer and cabinet, but they are there. I didn't have to call room service at all the whole 2 weeks I was there because they had enough on hand. I am not one who uses the maid service every day at a hotel. Usually only once a week or so, just for new towels and other items, but there was enough here to not need service. This place is very family oriented, and has many activities for everyone. There's everything from yoga and fitness classes, to kids crafts and sporting events. There is a new scedule every day with activities. The annoying part about it, is they call you every day to tell you wether you care or not. I have gotten more calls here than anywhere else I've ever stayed, and they were all from the staff!! Plus if you refuse daily cleaning service like I did, they call you again to tell you that you refused service? I think I realized that when I put the sign on the door. I'm fully aware that I won't get any new towels, so I don't feel like I should have to be daily remided over the phone. Their voice mail service is also the most complicated thing I have had to use in a while. I am a very techical oriented guy and am up on all the latest electronics and computer type things, and their system was very confusing even for me. They should have just used the standard voice mail service that the cell phone companies use. Oh yeah and you also have to watch out for all the staff member flying around on their golf carts. They are always zipping all over and don't watch where they are going or pay attention to traffic. They will pull right out in front of you without looking and you have to hit the brakes. There are also speed bumps all around the place which are annoying if you get put in one of the farther buildinds. It will take you 10min just to get back there because there are many stop signs and speed bumps to get though. I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone, unless you really like golf, and or have small children that need entertaining. I don't see why anyone would be hanging around the hotel all day though and using any of those activities when sea world, disney, and universal are right down the road. You are better off staying in a Disney themed or regular style hotel. Preferably one which includes free Disney bus shuttles. I don't know why the marriott for all the money you pay doesn't have free bus shuttles, when the cheap cockroach inn down the street for $34 a night does have a shuttle!!! Ridiculous, is all I can say about this over rated place.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort for 1st "Disney" vacation”
Reviews.Author: pamperedbecky
Reviews.Content: My parents are Marriott timeshare owners and they used their points to treat us (me, DH, 7 yo son and 4 yo daughter) to a week stay in a 2 BR unit. They stayed in a 1 BR unit in a different building. The resort was beautiful. We were there the first week in March and the weather was unseasonably chilly so we didn't use the pools much. The resort is quite spread out, but it was a nice walk to their little store and coffee shop. We had a ground floor unit with a nice view of the pond. The unit was plenty big for our family of 4. Free wifi was nice. It's very easy to get to any of the Disney parks. You do need to pay for parking because we weren't on-property Disney guests, but no big deal since I knew this going into it. We spent 4 days in the parks. It was a perfect amount of time. My DH played golf on one of the off days and enjoyed the course across from Grande Vista (I believe that's where it was). My daughter had an accident in the bed one night, so early the next morning we requested a total bed linen change on her bed. Got back from the parks later that evening and it still wasn't done. Poor thing was so tired and ready for bed, but we had to wait for them and come change the linens. About 20 minutes later it was done. Staff was friendly upon arrival and we got free t-shirts. We didn't really participate in any of the resort activities, but we've always loved them at other Marriott resorts. At lunch at the poolside restaurant the last day and that was good. Huge sandwiches if I remember correctly. We never took advantage of the bar due to kids needing to get to bed at the end of busy days. I'd stay here again if we're looking to stay off property for Disney or if we're looking to do other Orlando attractions. But soon we'll be staying on property at Disney to see how that is, which I'm really looking forward to!

Reviews.Title: “Clean Grounds, Comfortable & Spacious Rooms, Great Pools!”
Reviews.Author: HappyVacationer78
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our trip to Disney and our stay at the Marriott Grande Vista. My family consists of myself, my husband and our 2 1/2 year old son. We also vacationed with our friends who have a 2 1/2 year old boy as well. We arrived at the Grande Vista mid-day and were welcomed by the beautiful grounds and friendly check in attendant. We received our keys and headed off to our 2 bedroom villa. We stayed in 3109 & 3110. They were adjoining rooms. The rooms were spacious and clean. It was equipped with a full kitchen including all pots, pans, dishes, silverware etc... It had a dishwasher, full size refrigerator, oven, microwave and also a washer and dryer! Everything was clean and in place. The bedrooms were nice as well. One room had a king bed and a Jacuzzi tub along with a full size bathroom. The other room had a queen bed with a queen pull out sofa in it and again its own full size bathroom. The adjoining room was the kitchen/ dining room/ living room. The dining room had a full size table and seating for 6. There was also a breakfast bar with swivel chairs. The living room had a pull out sofa and a couple of comfy chairs and of course a flat screen TV. Off to the right of the living room was a screened in porch with a table and chairs. The property was great. For children they have a playroom called the Maze that was fantastic... there is a huge jungle gym like structure for the kids to play in for hours. There was also arts and crafts and different activities offered throughout the day for the children. An example was they had a build a bear workshop and also offered kids cooking lessons! The staff there was super friendly and lots of fun. There were also various pool areas throughout the property. I think there were 4 but we visited only 2. One had a toddler pool, and lap pool along with a huge family pool to hang out in. The other had a really fun "kid" type pool with squirting guns etc... and also another family type large pool. Both areas had food available. One was like a bar and grill.. the other had a pizza hut and sandwich shop along with a bar... both fantastic! The ride to Disney from the property is about 15 min and the ride to the airport is about 15 min... It's located right in between and very convenient!! It is also located next to a Publix market and other food places if you want to fill up your fridge or if you want to eat out! I also wanted to mention that I visited the spa for a pedicure which was great! Not only did I have a nice 45 min relaxing pedicure but the price was super cheap compared to any surrounding resorts! This property has a full services spa that you will want to try out if you have some time :) I would definitely suggest this hotel to families traveling to Disney! You will get MORE room than staying on Disney property for a cheaper price!! I have stayed on Disney property before but would definitely go back to this place again in the future!!

Reviews.Title: “Marriott Grande Vista”
Reviews.Author: Geoff1725
Reviews.Content: We were invited by family to join them at this beautiful resort. However, things did start off a little rocky. An early arrival was requested by my father and it was 3:30 before the suite was ready. Not an early arrival I'd say. Once the room was ready we got together and drove to the unit. Got to the 5th floor and the card keys would not work. We called the front desk and they sent someone to get us in and bring new keys. Took around 20 minutes, no biggy but it was blazing hot outside. Once inside it was noticed how worn things were in this unit. Definitely not up to Marriott standards. The ceiling fan in the master bedroom was swaying around lopsided making a banging noise, they sent someone to fix that. The room all together is very nice just showing some wear and tear of the years they have been in use I assume. The grounds and pool areas are just beautiful. You can see fireworks from Universal from some of the units at night.

Reviews.Title: “they stole 2,500 cash and all of our passports!!!!”
Reviews.Author: cutefati
Reviews.Content: somebody broke into our villa and stole cash that was hidden in the drawer,,, cause i didnt see the freaking safety deposit box they stole my iphone my husband handbag and the 7 passports of the 7 of us .... loss prevention didnt help at anything we got the police report but they didt care... the manager did help us by not charging the food we ate for the rest of the days and the phone calls we made ...and for extra charges... that was good,,,, but the insurance company marriot has is a ripoff they didnt help at anything at all... so be carefull cause people steal stuff here.,... tehy broke in through the porch door. and they did this to another room too cause they left and ipod case that wasnt ours but it belonged to the other guests.... and the maids steal stuff too we are sure of it..

Reviews.Title: “So much fun!! Loved Grande Vista”
Reviews.Author: Besitos22
Reviews.Content: I really canâ€™t complain about anything at all. This property is HUGE!.. with a nice golf course and beautiful grounds. Our suites (we had two) were very tastefully decorated with beautiful views of the pool and lake. The hot tub in our room was very spacious and comfortable. The staff was more than friendly, they even offered to take us around the property in a golf cart! The children's indoor playground is pretty new and the area is very well maintained. I think it's amazing how many activities this resort has to offer. We played volleyball, did BBQ, bonfire, paddle boats, golf, billiards, etc.. They also have a fully equipped gym with free weights, a spa, business cntr, ice cream store, restaurant, etc.. So much fun... so much to do! It has 3 pools (at least) one of them has water canyons for both kids and adults to play. There's also a bar/rest. by the pool with great music, great service and good food. This resort is located about 5 minutes max. from Sea World and Aquatica but this is a property that must be enjoyed :) So take a day or two off from your busy theme park schedule and enjoy what it has to offer. We will be going back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Great Time at Grande Vista”
Reviews.Author: cot427
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Marriott's Grande Vista Aug 14-21. Check in: We arrived at the resort at 3:30, right before the scheduled checkin of 4:00. There was no line, no wait. We walked right up to the counter and the staff member was more than happy to assist us. She checked us in quickly and gave us a quick tour of the huge property through a little map, then sent us on our way to the building we were staying in. Building: We stayed in building 85, Cristobal, in the west village, which consisted of about 5-6 buildings. Our building had a lake view, and it was the next building over from the 2nd largest pool area and a bar called Copa Loca. The building has 6 floors, each with about 7 villas on each, 2 stairs on each side, and an elevator in the middle. Our room was on the 2nd floor, right near the stairs on the right side. We thought we might have trouble with noise, but this was not the case. In fact, the whole stay any time of the day at the resort, it was quiet, with the exception of the pool areas obviously. Room: We stayed in a 2 bedroom villa. The master bedroom had a king size bed, lounge, nice flatscreen tv, and a balcony off of it with a sliding glass door, and a huge bathroom. There were 2 sinks and a huge whirlpool tub near the bed and further into the bathroom with a door was a toilit and a huge shower. The 2nd bedroom was on the other side with 2 queen sized beds, a flatscreen tv, and a balcony off of it. It also had a bathroom which not only connected to that bedroom, but it connected to the kitchen and living area, therefore 2 doors in this bathroom. The bathroom was the usual,but it was a nice size. The kitchen, dining area, and living area seperated the two bedrooms. The area was a nice size also. The kitchen had everything you need for a weeks stay and more. Nice fridge, microwave, toaster, coffeepot, sink, dishwasher, dishes and silverware and much more. It was decent sized for a kitchen on vacation. It also had 3 barstools and a counter to eat a quick snack. The dining area had a huge table with 6 chairs. And the living area had a huge flatscreen tv, dvd player, and 2 couches, 1 with pullout coach, we never used it. The villa also had a washer/dryer combo next do the double door bathroom and a closet right across from it. All in all, this was one of the nicest rooms we have stayed in. Property: The grande vista was a huge property right off of international drive near sea world. You needed swipe your card just to get into the building areas, which was a nice saftey precaution. The property has a huge lake with a bridge that connects the west village with the main side. You could rent paddle boats for the lake also, and fishing poles. The property had basketball and tennis courts, a restaurant near the golf course called nicks grill, a bar in a pool area called Copa Loca, and it had a market place in the main building with pizza hut pizza and other items. There was also a store in the main building with starbucks coffee, donuts, and food items like a tiny grocery store. There was a small bar in the main pool area and finally a lighthouse that has an ice cream parlor at the bottom. The property also has a fitness area, and full spa with tons of spa services. 4 pool areas are in the resort, including 2 large sized areas and 2 smaller areas. The Copa Loca pool area had a little area for children to play in. I would definitely 100% recommend this resort to a friend!

Reviews.Title: “A Grande Experience”
Reviews.Author: nedrews
Reviews.Content: Traveled to Florida with 2 thirteen year old boys and 2 -16 year old girls. Had a great time. The hotel had 4 pools (2 we never even got to) but we did get to the two main pools equipped for adults and toddlers as well. Snack bar near both pools and Ice cream available at a cute ice cream parlor near one pool. Work out room was great..computers available at a small fee in the recreation room..paddle boat and squirt boat rental on the lake..pool table, ping pong, oustside near pool under cabana, indoor climbing playground for the little ones and rock climbing for all ouside on their own beach near the lake...arcade video game room...onsight spa...golf...basketball (1/2 court).. tennis...walking trails with beautiful landscape...sauna attached to one of the main pools...hotel room for us was a 2 bedroom...fit all of us just fine..2 queen beds in one room and king in master..two verandas..we were on the 1st floor in building 77...cross over bridge on lake to get to one of the pools....so nice...outdoor swings aroung lake to just sit and relax...even got in early on Sat AM as we took redeye in night before and pleasant manager helped us do so....although not everyone is happy as first girl at chek in was rude but not everyone is happy so you need to forget about that..did not get discouraged as next girl at check in was pleasant...definitely accommodating...nitely and day activities sponsored by the hotel...fun for everyone if you make it fun.....This was a great place..even saw an armadillo on one of my walks...LOL... There is a quick eatery for pizza and sandwiches which was great and a restaurant that we never went to which was a bit fancier....there is a small store for qick items you might need such as some food like cereal, milk, bread, soup, pasta etc as well as small gifts and suntan lotion...This was a great hotel.....A definite must stay again....also internet in the room was easy to access

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Resort For Our Entire Family!!”
Reviews.Author: b5travels
Reviews.Content: I'll start by saying we are pretty well traveled and very picky! We have stayed in many hotels and resorts in Orlando and around the world and were VERY impressed with the Marriott Grande Vista. The entrance is gated and beautiful! Check in was a breeze! We checked in at 9 am and our requested room was ready! We stayed in building 81 (overlooking the main pool) in a 2 bedroom, 2 bath. My husband and I and our 3 boys ages 6, 9, and 12. The rooms were very nicely updated and HUGE! the family room was a great size and there was a large dining table fitting 6 comfortably as well as a breakfast bar seating 3. We had a balcony off bdrm 2 as well as a balcony off the master/living room. Bedroom 2 had a sofa sleeper and so did the living room. Plenty of room in the kitchen that had everything we needed. Also a washer and dryer in the unit. They provided pool towels in the rooms and would bring fresh towels within minutes of calling and asking. No housekeeping until the end unless you want to pay an additional fee. The pools and hot tubs were amazing and kept the kids happy! There are paddle boats and kayaks to rent for a small charge as well as fishing poles and bait. We did catch some fish! There was a pool table, ping pong and foosball outside the ice cream shop. A great spa and fitness center. A rec center with something going on always-usually for a fee. A small arcade with a few games, and a rock climbing wall. A sand area for playing volleyball or playing in the sand. There is a store (the market place) for small grocery items and a mini starbucks. The kids liked the pizza hut express of course! There is another restaurant (nick's) that is more upscale I guess, but we never made it there. There is also a photographer that will do a photo shoot for your family outside and each room gets a complimentary 5x7. The grounds are filled with palm trees and very clean. We are planning on staying there again for our next Orlando vacation for sure!!

Reviews.Title: “VERY large Resort with LOTS of Amenities”
Reviews.Author: nyja44
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week long stay at MGV. I traveled with my sister a couple of our friends. I have stayed at other Marriott properties in Florida and this one was similar to the others. We are timeshare owners and traded to get MGV. We called 10 days in advance to request a specific unit in Building 78 in the West Village and upon check-in our request was honored. We actually had an early flight and although check-in is not until 4 pm, by 1 pm our room was ready! Check in and out- no problems very smooth Customer Service- great! Front Desk called to make sure all was well and that we were well taken care of. Rooms- smaller than other 2bdrm 2 bath units at other Marriotts but comfortable. Clean, well appointed, and 2 balconies which was very nice! Housekeeping- my only problem with the resort. Although they were friendly- they never came to give us fresh towels during the week. Since its timeshare and not a hotel- I am used to getting fresh towels just one time for the week but that never happened. We called housekeeping and within 30 mins we had fresh towels! Staff- Everyone was VERY friendly and helpful! Amenities- the resort is HUGE! 4 different villages- each village has 6 buildings, each building is 6 stories high. 6 pools, more than 4 hot tubs, a sauna, nice gym/workout center, rock wall, tennis, basketball, volleyball on small sand beach, large lake with paddle boats, etc. There seemed to be a lot for young children to do. Overall- nice resort for vacationing families, close to all parks and shops and restaurants. If you want peace and quiet at this resort request to stay in the west village (which is located across the lake from the main village and all the ammenities) as this affords a more quiet atmosphere (away from young children-especially at night) but is just a short walk across the gorgous bridge to the stores, activities, and restaurants. Not recommended for honeymooners or older couples looking for peace and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “eventful getaway”
Reviews.Author: firefighterteacher
Reviews.Content: Beautiful place, you do not feel like you are in Orlando so close to the theme parks. We have come to visit friends here but this is our first stay ourselves. We traveled with extended family. Half of our party checked on a Thursday and we arrived Friday night. After a restess night sleep we woke up to find bed bugs in our bed and evidence of their dinner, Me! We reported the problem immediately and they had us move to another unit. If this happens to you save one of the bugs like I did in a bag to show them. We moved our things our of that area immediately to prevent them getting on our things. Luckily I had just read about this and did not dismiss it. They are on the rise even in upscale hotels and resorts. This was no small move with 3 children and 4 adults and a refrigerator fully stocked. The resort was apologetic and helped us in the move and gave us compensation for our inconvenience. The continue to check on us throughout our stay. The new room worked out fine and we were able to enjoy the rest of our stay. The kids really enjoyed the pool, planned activities, and indoor playground. We only ate at the pool bar once and found the food to be fair. We loved the upscale rooms and their decor. We did have some key issues as many have mentioned and we learned that they are sensitive to cell phones and can cause your key to be disabled. They did say they are upgrading the lock system soon to help with this problem. Despite some issues we will return to this resort and as a traveler more knowledable about what to look for before settling in.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Pirate_Mom316
Reviews.Content: Stayed here while taking the family to Disney World for the week. We're owners at another location and traded into Grande Vista. Evidently there are different codes for 2 bdrm villas versus lock-off units. We wanted a 2 bdrm but got a lock-off. Wasn't really a problem, just had to prop the lock-off door open during the day. Location Great location. 10 minutes to Disney, just up the street to Sea World. Tons of other timeshare/condo resorts around the area. A Wal-Greens and Publix are just down the street along with a McDonald's. Wal-Mart isn't too far...although we went on Saturday night to get groceries and Wal-Mart was a madhouse. Could barely walk for all of the people. It was worse than shopping at Christmas. Most must have been new arrivals in town doing the same thing we were. I'm sure Friday and Saturday are big check-in days. Upscale outlet mall is just down the street on Vineland. Very close to lots of restaurants on both sides of I-4. The resort sits back off of International Drive, you can't see it from the road. That makes it very quiet from a traffic and business standpoint. It's not in the congested part of International Drive either, so we never had a problem getting out of the resort. The trolley does go by if you want to take it up and down that main stretch. Size This is a huge resort. We've been to several other Marriotts, but this was the biggest. May be at least 10-15 buildings, 4 pools. We were in building 84 next to the Copa Loca pool, which is the kids' pool. It was pretty crowded even in the morning at the pool. At night I guess teenagers and others come out because we could hear noise and talking from the pool in our villa. But Marriott was good about closing the pool and all of the noise stopped right at 11pm every night. We never made it across the large lake to visit the other side of the resort since it is so large, and we were so busy going to the parks. Villa Our villa was on the first floor of Bldg 84. The bldgs around the kids' pool have been remodeled somewhat, but not completely overhauled like some of the other bldgs. Staff said since those bldgs are so popular they can't shut them down to do the work. So you could see the age on the villa but it also had some nice upgrades too with granite counters, down bedding, etc. Floor tile is older, shower and jacuzzi tub are older, some of the light fixtures had loose parts, dining room chairs showed wear on the wooden part, etc. But everything worked and what didn't work was fixed within 24 hours. The villa didn't have all of the kitchen utensils and pans that the other Marriotts have had, but we had enough for what we needed. You can always call and request something that's missing. Guests This resort had a broad range of guests staying there. Many were foreign tourists. I'm sure it's because of the theme parks that you have such a variety of demographics. Many more teenagers than we've seen at other resorts and some of the guests were a little rougher than what we've seen at Marriott's beach resorts. But no one caused a problem. The crowding at the pool was the least favorite part. By 10am, there were already several families there. The teenagers came out closer to noon. One afternoon some guys were floating in tubes in the pool drinking beers. Would have preferred that they keep the drinks out of the pool. Again, we were only at the pool a couple of days since we spent most time at the parks. We did notice that the resort did not require anyone to have on a wristband noting that they were a guest like we've had to do at other Marriott beach resorts. Amenities Nice golf course surrounds the resort, beautiful lake sits in the middle with paddle boats you can take out on the lake (it was too hot for us to do it). Cute lighthouse with a dessert/sweet shop under it. Nice workout room. Good kids' program with lots of activities (as if you needed more being in Orlando). Small beach by the lake with a volleyball net and a rock climbing wall. Nice store/small restaurant with Starbucks by the registration building. Bar/grill next to the kids' pool called Copa Loca. Four pools. The kids' pool has four fort/tower type structures that have water cannons the kids can spray into the pool. You never know when you're going to get hit with water, but my 6 year old son loved it. They didn't work all of the time, but we did see Marriott staff coming out to try and fix them so they were all working as much as possible. There's a sidewalk around the lake and the map shows the distance and paths you can walk if you're wanting some outdoor exercise. They also have nice sets of swings overlooking the lake. The grounds are secured so everyone has to pass through the guard before entering the property or have a room key to access the gates. It's not a brand new resort like Marriott's place in Myrtle Beach, but it's still a nice place that we enjoyed. It worked great for us. We could easily go to the Disney parks in the day and quickly come back for a few hours in the afternoon to swim or eat before going back again at night. Disney makes parking as easy as possible, and you only have to pay for parking once each day so you can go and come as you please. We stayed at Marriott's Cypress Harbour last year and it was pretty comparable to Grande Vista in the villa itself. It seemed to be a lot quieter.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: FloridaJambo
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in a villa (which is actually an apartment) for a close location to Disney but about half the price. Overall the place was clean, large and comfortable. Our room was a bit close to the pool pumps/machinery and sometimes had a slight damp smell due to this - nothing bad enough to complain about, but try to avoid that position. We actually checked out then decided to stay one more night and had a better location (near the "average for the price" Nicks Grill). Overall, a nice stay and would recommend but no idea about the facilities on site as we didnt use any of them!

Reviews.Title: “LOT's of fun expecially with kids!”
Reviews.Author: 65Chevy
Reviews.Content: WOW! Nice resort , well kept, very neat & clean with very friendly staff. Lots of activities for kids, pools are great expecially Copa Loca pool area with 0 entry & waterworks. Pool bar & restaraunt are also great, good food, drinks & great staff. Excellant location if visiting area parks like Disney, Sea World, Ect. Rooms are VERY nice, roomy, very clean. Totally enjoyed our stay, no complaints. Unfortunately left 13 DVD's in room & realized too far away to go back. Called resort, no problem, they mailed them to us right away. Excellant customer service!!

Reviews.Title: “WE LOVED THE PLACE, WE WILL GO BACK NEXT YEAR!!!”
Reviews.Author: TEELOUISIANA
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at this resort, it was wonderful. The resort is a very pretty resort. The room we had was a nice size. We stayed in a 1 bedroom villa in bldg 83. We have already booked our room for next years vacation at this resort. We liked everything about the resort. We can not wait to go back. You will not be disappointed, if you choose this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great, Fantastic, Comfortable & Dependable”
Reviews.Author: ZachlorH
Reviews.Content: We arrived on 710/09 @ 12:30pm. Yes, it was early for checkin but the registration staff were terrific. Every request but 1 that I had requested prior to arrival was met. WOW! We requested to be ground floor w/ pool and lake view. Got it. Requested to be at main pool - did not get. But, we were at what they called the "kid's pool". Another WOW. Not your ordinary kid's pool. There were 2 jacuzzi's - One was quite hot, the other was toned down a notch. Two swimming pools, one with 4 little water falls. Both went up to 4ft 9 in. Plenty of lounge chairs. The Copa Loca bar and grill was mmmmm. The wait staff were right on top of things. Drinks were a little pricey (Mixed were $8.00, but hey, we were in Orlando. Gotta expect it. My room keys were constantly disabled, possiblilty that they kept coming in contact with my cell - hmm not sure. Anyway, each time I called to replace or if we had a problem maintenance or housekeeping wise, they were there within 3 to 4 minutes. FANTASTIC! When you have kids and are on vacation, the less stress the better and Marriott Grande Vista in Orlando really performed and met all expectations. The beds were so wonderful. Due to my size, I have a hard time sleeping in most beds. True to Marriott's standards, they produce the best beds. The in room jacuzzi tub is big enough for 2 people and the jets work like fire. The kitchen had all the emenities of home. If you run out of ice, no going to the store, just go up to the 2nd floor and get free ice. Can't get that anywhere else. Flat panel tvs that kept the kids entertained. Another one of those thank goodness moments. The only 2 drawback that I actually have were the pull out couch. You could tell someone had sat on it for awhile and all the pillows kept sinking down, Not a comfortable couch but hey, they more than exceeded my expectations on eveything else and the rooms were lockouts. We were in Bldg. 84 overlooking the pool. Rooms 4109, 4110, 4111 & 4112. Stepped outside our door and we were overlooking the lake. Rooms 4109 was the main living area and master bedroom and rm 4110 was the lockout connected to it. Room 4112 was the main living and master with 4111 the lockout to it. Traveling with 2 younger kids (8 & 9) and then 2 teenagers started to pose problems with the the teenagers going out "their doors and the younger ones following. Had to take keys and make main entrance only door to be used. Every employee there gave terrific service. Brandon w/ reservations and Zac at Copa Loca- kudos to you both. Oh, the grounds were stupendous. Absolutely beautiful. Location... Internation Dr., right down from Sea World. Everything within your fingertips. GREAT!

Reviews.Title: “Best resort we've ever been to!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jujubean2
Reviews.Content: Wow! What a beautiful resort, the landscape, the pools, the lake, the villas...Awsome! We stayed in a 2 bedroom that was beautifully decorated, very spacious and CLEAN! I mean not even a bug or spiderweb in in the screened in patio, and that's pretty amazing especially in Florida! It's the little things, like having a well stocked room and free ice...that make it that much better. We enjoyed the pools, the music, and the activities.The kids really liked the Kareoke, the game room and the ice cream...lots of ice cream!!!! My only complaint is that we had to leave. I can promise you that the next time we visit Orlando, I will not waste one minute looking an any other resort. It's definately a 5 star in my book!!!

Reviews.Title: “Customer service - nonexistent”
Reviews.Author: TheLuluB
Reviews.Content: This was our third time staying at this property. We return because we enjoy the amenities as well as the convenient location, but this will definitely be our last stay. Upon check-in, we went to our room and our keys did not work. We called the front desk, and they assured us that they would send someone over with new keys right away. Twenty-five minutes and another phone call, a loss prevention representative finally showed up...but with no new keys. He tried to use our key to open the door. Did he think that we didn't know how? Obviously, the keys did not work, and he had to use his master to let us in. I asked him how we were supposed to get new keys (after all, isn't that why I called??) and he said we had to go back up to the front desk. Then he said this was the third time this happened that day. Our trip was uneventful for a few days, as we enjoyed the area. And then we started noticing suspicious bug bites upon waking up every morning. So, after four days of dodging the phone calls from the salespeople trying to sell you a timeshare, we finally answered. She inquired how we were enjoying the property. I told her about the problems at check-in, as well as the fact that I suspected our room may have bed bugs. She said she would call me right back, and left a message that she had informed the front desk and room control about our problems, and that we would like a new room. Almost twelve hours have passed and we have heard nothing more, so we are checking out a day early, never to return again. There are too many other resorts in Orlando to suffer sub-standard service.

Reviews.Title: “I would go back again, again and again ....”
Reviews.Author: Vlaf4
Reviews.Content: We just got back last night from a week long stay at the Marriot Grande Vista. We were booked through Interval International for a 1 room efficiency/studio. At first, I didn't think this unit would be large enough for my husband, my son (2 1/2 years old), my daughter (6 1/2 years old) and myself. I was wrong, the unit room 4403 (building 84) was brand new (flat screen tv, king size bed, queen pull out sofa, granit countertops) with a patio overlooking the lake. The beds were comfortable and room was really, really clean. When I called the Marriot to confirm our reservations, I asked if it was possible to be placed close the kiddie pool and our request was granted. Yes, it is true that they don't provide daily housekeeping services like at other Marriot timeshares, but it was so easy to get fresh towels everyday and all the extras you need. There was a housekeeping room on our floor and all you had to do is go and drop off your used towels and pick up new ones. They always asked if I need anything else, like soap, coffee ....... There was also a trash room on the floor to dispose of our daily garbage. For the kids the pool (not the main pool, we played at the other pool across the bridgel) was clean and fun (you can get clean pool towels by the bathroom, they keep a ton of them there), if you didn't want to go to the pool they had a hugh indoor jungle gym for them to play in, my kids totally loved the jungel gym!! Plus a game room and outdoor rock climbing, ping pong and whole bunch of other stuff. If you have teenagers, it is also a good pick, but you might need a bigger unit. I felt it was in a great location to all the theme parks (down the block from sea world, 7 miles from disney and 7 miles from Univerasal Studios) but the next time we visit we will be only visiting one theme park, it is really too much to do all of them in one trip. Plus you don't have the time to enjoy everything the resort has to offer. So yes, I would recommend my mom to go with her friends!! LOLOLO!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: sports59
Reviews.Content: Great 9 days at Grand Vista. The kids didn't want to leave the pool to go to Disney or Seaworld on a couple of the days. We had a great time just "relaxing' with them by the pool. Grand Vista is so close to everything you want to do in Orlando that it was effortless getting to where we wanted to go. Not far from Cocoa Beach, so we went there to surf too and try to catch the Space Shuttle Endeavor take off, but the launch was scrubbed. next year. Resort staff was great! Pleasure Island is a blast and you dont have to pay anymore to get on there!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful - Wonderful - Wonderful!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Quilter2
Reviews.Content: Returned June 27th from a 7 night stay at the Marriott Grande Vista. We went for our daughter's 50th birthday. Our son-in-law and 2 grandsons, 17 and 19 traveled with my husband and myself. We stayed in a 2 bedroom, 2 bath in building 83. It was not one of the renovated units, but it was very comfortable and clean and very spacious. The boys enjoyed the pools every night. The entire staff was very friendly and "Johnny - on- the -spot whenever we needed anything (including the front desk!) If we had anything to complain about it was the weather - high 90's with a heat index in the 100's. Grandma and Grandpa had to stay back one day just to rest. Hard to keep up with the rest. We shopped for groceries the first night for breakfast foods, juice, water and snacks.

Reviews.Title: “USED TO BE GREAT BUT NOT ANYMORE”
Reviews.Author: napagirl2
Reviews.Content: I have previously stayed at this hotel twice before and have always been happy. It used to be a classy Marriott timeshare right on a golf course. Unfortunately this past stay of mine was a disaster and I will not return to this hotel ever again. It has totally gone downhill. The place is huge and was pretty crowded. It was very chaotic. The food at the surrounding restaurants is not very good. Even the upscale restaurant Nick's by the golf course tends to overcook everything and ruin the food. Our first room smelled very musty. We called the front desk and they sent someone up from housekeeping. A man came in and proceeded to gas us by spraying a large quantity of room freshener throughout the room. We thought he was just going to spray the air conditioning vents. He never suggested we leave the room. We ran to the pool when we started coughing and figured the room would smell better when we came back. The pool was totally chaotic and not relaxing at all. And this was the quiet pool. When we came back to the room it still stunk. They gave us another room in one of the newly renovated buildings. This room was nicer and did not smell. The next morning I was woken up at 9am by someone from the hotel who wanted me to preview Marriott's newest timeshare in Orlando. I was not a happy camper to say the least. Checkout is at 10am and on the morning that we were leaving, the maid rudely starting pounding on our door at 8:40 am. Is she the wake up call or just in charge of making sure everyone leaves on time? We thought it was totally inappropriate and have never experienced this at another hotel. We would never return here.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice resort - Marriott is working very hard for your business”
Reviews.Author: zen_journeyman
Reviews.Content: This was my first return to a Marriott resort after a very disappointing stay at another Marriott resort. I decided to give Marriott another try and was glad I did. This property is immaculate and beautiful. However, as my in my last stay at a different Marriott resort I found the front desk, check-in staff to be rude, arrogant, capricious, and condescending. Marriott *REALLY* needs to fix this at their resorts. Front desk staff are *the* guests' first impression. Fortunately, the front desk check-in staff were the only rude employees I consistently encountered during my 1 week stay. All of the buildings, grounds, and pools are kept immaculate. The resort store, dining establishment, service staff, and concierge desk, and peacefulness of the resort more than made up for the condescending front desk staff, ensuring all questions, inquiries, and requests were fulfilled promptly, in a friendly and courteous manner. Normally shying away from golf resorts, I found the Marriott Grand Vista to be well-kept and not uptight at all. Very family friendly, with several large pools and tons of activities, a well-equipped exercise room kept things interesting. As an Orlando-area native, I was pleasantly surprised at the non-tourist-y nature of the resort and found this 'stay-cation' to be a perfectly-time week away. Extremely well-placed for easy access to Universal/IOA/City Walk & Disney, I was able to take advantage of both my Universal & Disney passes with a minimum of stress on the road. I can definitely recommend this as a nice change of pace - one that I wasn't disappointed in. I will be open to exploring a few other of Marriott's resorts.

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE when making an Interval International exchange, they have very small efficiencies”
Reviews.Author: NursesheriIndiana
Reviews.Content: We made an exchange through INTERVAL INTERNATIONAL and didn't realize that we exchaged for a very small efficiency, not a villa/condo. It has one vent for ac for the unit, no vents in the bathroom, making it hot and stuffy at times. Our bathroom has some paint peeling around the top edge of the tile, which we also reported, but didn't repair, however, it's probably hard to do that with us in the room. Interval really wouldn't make any changes for us, but Mariott did change out the bar-size refrigerator when we reported it wasn't working properly. We made a complaint to the front desk, but they made the comment, that Interval was responsible for allowing this exchange to be made. I feel we've been cheated, and didn't realize that you could make an exchange for such a tiny room. It also has a 13 year old tv, with not even a possibility of connecting a dvd player, which we considered buying. We were told that had we gotten a villa, they are all equipped with dvd players. We intended to have a quiet week of hanging out, watching movies, eating out some(no cooking facility) and that was all messed up due to the small room. The resort itself is very nice, and had we been able to get a villa, would probably been very happy. All the staff we've met have been very nice. They claim the whole resort is sold out until the end of July.

Reviews.Title: “Check out before it was the moment”
Reviews.Author: JMVL
Reviews.Content: If you only want to visit Orlando to go to the parks NEVER stay in this hotel. Besides they rush you to check out before 10am and the keepers open your door and call fearsely to your phone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Property”
Reviews.Author: gallows
Reviews.Content: We recently spent a week here at the end of May with our 19 and 21 yr old-the villa was perfect for us-plenty of space. We had requested a newly renovated room close to the pool area. We were in Bldg 95 which was a great location. The unit was completely renovated with granite countertops- 3 flat screen TV's-2 king beds and 2 queen pull outsand a spacious living room/dining area. Having 2 full baths and 3 sink areas made getting ready so much easier than having a basic hotel room. We stopped on the way and picked up groceries for breakfast and snacks at the nearby Publix. The 2 pool areas were both very nice and well maintained- one was more geared toward younger children. We spent alot of time at the Disney parks so we were not at the resort that much but there was alot to do there if you wanted to just relax and stay there. Our only complaint was the check in-our room was not ready when we arrived at 2:00 and when we returned at 4:00 there was a huge line and some rooms were still not available. We were able to check in by 4:30, but by then 1/2 the day was gone and check out is at 10:00 which is early. If we had thought ahead of time you can request late checkout but by the time we did this they couldn't let anyone else check out late. I was concerned after reading several negative reviews but we had a great experience and I would definitely recommend staying here!!

Reviews.Title: “Another Wonderful Vacation with Marriott”
Reviews.Author: Love-my-Lhasa
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from our one week vacation in Orlando, Fl at the Marriott Grand Vista Resort. We vacationed there with his brother and wife in a two bedroom, lock-off king bed suite in Bldg 93 on the 5th floor facing the golf course. We are owners at Horizons, Orlando (currently renamed Harbour Pt), but traded in to stay at the Grande Vista this year. Horizons is really best for families with children. We have previously stayed at Marriott Cypress Harbour, but could not get in this year. I thought that I would be disappointed with the Grand Vista since it is a much larger resort and didn't seem to have the homey atmosphere and lake views of the former. However, I was quite pleasantly surprised and enjoyed my stay at the Grande Vista even more than at Cypress. We requested and received a renovated room and it was just beautiful, quiet, comfortable, with a beautiful view of the golf course and a water view as well! There is granite everywhere in the kitchen and baths and of course the whirlpool tub in the master was great. There are three flat screen TVs in the unit. One in each bedroom and a 40 ft screen in the living room. There is a large screen-in dining area off of the master bedroom and living room areas and a private porch also off of the second bedroom. The second bedroom had it's own sitting area, dining table, bath and bar/fridge area and could be locked off from the main dining area for more privacy. I would recommend this arrangement for couples. As always, all of the cooking utensils, plenty of bath and pool towels, as well as an in-suite stacked washer and dryer are provided. The free in-room WIFI worked well for my purposes. We usually just vacation for relaxation and quality time together and don't visit the parks. We do always go to Olde Towne in Kissammee (about a 15 minute drive with traffic), which I do recommend for either couples or families with children. I believe that it only opens on weekends. There are lots of shops, rides, games, live music, an astounding bungee-jumping ride thats even fun to watch. They also feature a huge antique car show, as well. It's a cross between a carnival and a state fair and there is no charge for admission or parking. We also drove to Tampa to visit family and they also have a fairly large casino, The Hard Rock Cafe Casino, there as well. Otherwise, we just shop, eat-out at the area restaurants, play golf (at the Resort) or miniature golf in the area, or just cook in our rooms and view Netflix DVD's, which we bring along. Also, the Grande Vista has recently opened a spa on site. I highly recommend the Grand Vista Spa Pedicure, the best that I've ever had (I typically get mine done in Richmond every one-two months). I believe that my therapist's name was Bernadette, with whom I also received a very gentle and relaxing waxing service. The resort also has a nicely appointed fitness area with the typical cardiovascular machinge (elliptical, treadmill, bikes...all with flat screen TV's), weight machines and free barbell weights. They also have an aerobic exercise room, a child play and child care area, all sorts of games (ping pong, billiards, tennis, boating, fishing), three separate pool areas throughout the resort with spas, gas and charcoal grills spread throughout, beautifally landscaped and perfect for walks. The facility has a 24-jpir manned security gate into the living area, a nice formal restaurant on site, and other smaller eating areas, including a free cotton candy station, and a candy shop. The Market Place is expensive. We recommend that you either go to the Publix grocery store which is a couple of miles away or the Wal-Mart which is probably about 5 miles away. We always bring a car and recommend one since there is so much to do in the area. We also recommend the Bonefish restaurant for fresh reasonably priced seafood- the coconut shrimp were superb! We found everthing at the resort to be clean and in excellent repair and the services from check-in to check-out were great. Although we are Marriot owners, we also do the timeshare presentation. They are opening a new facility that now offers waterfront townhomes over by the Ritz-Carlton (which is also owned by Marriott). Owners there also get to use some of the Ritz facilities. We find their timeshare presentations to be very low-key and informative compared to others. They pick you up from the door of yourvilla and return you there and were very good about keeping to the 90 minute presentation, unless you wanted to see more. We opted not to and took the $75 Marriott card (per couple) good at any Marriott facility. We used it to pay towardsr our overnight stay at the Marriott Courtyard in Florence, SC on our way back to Richmond. Negatives? Our flatscreen blinked out during about day 5. However, they sent up a repairman within about 30 minutes to troubleshoot and ended up bringing in another new TV. However, I really couldn't really register this as a complaint, since one never knows when the flatscreens will die. I had a similar problem with my own one at home after two years....and the important thing is that the Grande Vista staff addressed the issue quickly and with many apologies....so I couldn't complain. All and all a great stay and I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Family Location!”
Reviews.Author: SnowBunny999
Reviews.Content: Not being familiar with the Orlando area, I was very nervous about selecting a hotel. I could not have been more pleased with the Marriott Grande Vista. It was a great family location since there were daily activities for my 4 year old. I loved the privacy of the resort and the staff made us feel right at home. I have told everyone about my experience with the maintence engineer. To fully enjoy the pool, we bought a new pool toy on our trip. We did not notice that the pool toy needed a screwdriver to put in the batteries. We called the front desk and they sent the maintanence engineer to help out. He arrived within 5 minutes to help us. He quickly found out that we had purchased the wrong battery size. He went to the shop and brought us back 2 batteries in the right size. Other hotels might have just told us "tought luck" but not at the Marriott. I will never stay anywhere else in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “ANOTHER GRANDE VACATION AT THE VISTA!!!”
Reviews.Author: Diamondgirl
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this resort and Cypress Harbour once before. I love the Cypress Harbour as well but nothing compares to the Grande Vista. The grounds are beautiful. The entrance into the resort is GRANDE. Before arriving to this resort, I called the front desk a week before to request a certain building(s). I asked for building 77 or 78 because when we stayed here back in 2006, I remember they were just building those two buildings and they were located in a perfect spot for me. And of course they were "newer". I am not a Marriott owner (at least not yet), so my request wasn't guaranteed. But of course, we received just what I asked for, which was either of those buildings in a corner unit on an "upper" level (nothing under 2). The view was beautiful. We arrived just when the weather was getting almost perfect again, between the dates of 05-29 thru 06-05. The first four days we had NO RAIN at all. Sunshine, warm and breezy!!! The last few days there was a bit of rain in the afternood for no more than an hour at most, then it went right back to being beautiful out again. The service was great. We stayed in a 3bedroom villa and whenever I enter for the first time, I have to do "my inspection". The only problems we had was in the second bedroom the cable wasn't working and the lightbulb on one of the lamps in the master bedroom was out. I called the front desk and within 10 minutes a maintenance man had the problems fixed. This man was so friendly. He gave us tips on where "the best" of everything was located. About an hour or so later, the front desk called to make sure our problems had been fixed. Great service. The only complaint that we had was on the last evening there, our neighbors just above us were really having a good time at around 1-2 a.m. in the morning. How annoying when you have to catch a 9am flight. We tried very hard to let it go, but after it seemed it was getting louder, I called the front desk and I guess it was taken care of, because the next thing I remember was the alarm clock going off. I immediately went into a major depression because I DID NOT WANT TO LEAVE!!! I have read several negative reviews about this resort, but I do believe that where your villa is located and the newness or at least it being recently upgraded is a major key in having a better stay. From what I understand, all of the villas are undergoing upgrades and renovations, so I think this resort is only getting better. Keep in mind, this is a HUGE resort with a whole lot of buildings, so do your research before coming and ask for a recently renovated building. They have the flat screens and other little bells and whistles some of the olders ones don't just yet. We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Resort Activities Complimentary.. Great Property”
Reviews.Author: Sexydreaaa
Reviews.Content: We stayed @ Marriott Grande Vista (Resort) 6/22-29, used this timeshare through Interval. We stayed n a studio, Villa. The studio was big n enough space 4 us, the mini kitchen was stocked w basic supplies 4 the wk, n could ask 4 more if needed. Superwalmart was just down street so could stock up on quicks eats. Recived pool n shower towels daily. The bed was so comfortable, that must b the Marriott part, LOL. Our studio, Villa was on the 2nd fl of building 79, which overlooked the pool, hottub n golf course. Beautiful Property n nice facilities. they have a nice bar n grill area called the "Copa Loca" where they have music lights n a ping pong table set up where people hang out. Ok tennis courts(clay) which i used daily. Fun activities, thats why i call it an resort. Most activities were complimentary(free). the best night was Tuesday, which they have the Polynesian Revue Show-Hawaiian Entertainment..Hula girls n an Torte man. Very nice property.. would recommend n stay again, also close 2 eveything.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay! Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: CruisingCamper
Reviews.Content: Room: We stayed at the Marriott Grande Vista on International Drive from May 21 to May 28th. We exchanged our timeshare through Interval World for a stay at this resort in a three bedroom. We had three families consisting of 9 people, so each family had their own bedroom. The 3 bedroom was HUGE!! We had plenty of room, and the place was clean and had all the regular items found in a timeshare. The master bedroom consisted of a king bed, two sinks, whirlpool tub, seperate shower, big screen TV, DVD, and a chaise lounge. Very large room and bathroom. An adult and a small child shared this room. The second bedroom consisted of two queen beds, big screen TV, DVD, one sink and tub/shower combo. This room was a little small for four folks, but bigger than your average hotel room. The kitchen and living area consisted of a table for six, large couch, and two chairs. It had a big screen TV with DVD also. The kitchen had a full size refrigerator and dishwasher, and had dishes/glasses for eight. We were supplied tissue paper, paper towels, dish liquid, dishwashing powder, and trash bags. It also had a coffee pot and toaster. Plenty of cabinet space for your groceries. We just had to move a few dishes around. There were also wine glasses, but no cork screw. The washer/dryer was the stackable kind, so very small loads only!! We kept it going the entire time!! This area also had a very nice screened porch with a table and chairs. The third bedroom was a studio unit with a separate entrance door, but was attached to the second bedroom by a set of connecting doors and a foyer area. This bedroom had a king bed, sofa sleeper and a table and chairs for two, two ottomans, and a balcony with table and chairs. It also had a small refrigerator about half the size of a regular sized one. It was not your typical mini- frig, it was larger than that. It had a coffee pot and toaster. The bathroom was one sink and a tub/shower combo. The bedrooms had plenty of drawer space for clothes and closet space was good too! The closets did not have many hangers.Each closet had a small safe for your valuables. You are provided towels, but they only change them out once during the week, so we had to wash them to have enough for a week. Building: Our unit was located on the third floor of building #80, the Main Building where you check-in. It was a great location. There was a huge pool area, kiddie pool and splash area, plenty of lounges and umbrellas. This area also had a Market Place to get a few groceries, wine, beer, souvenirs and snacks. They also had Krispie Creme donuts and Starbucks coffee. There is also a Pizza Hut and a small Deli type eatery in the buliding and a full service bar. The fitness center, playground and boat rentals were also in the building. Location: It took us about 20 minutes to get to Disney and about 5 minutes to get to SeaWorld. Outstanding location!!! Negatives: Pizza Hut Delivery was terrible! We finally had to go down and get it and they didn't have it ready! We got FREE Pizza for that one! Hot Water: At night, we rarely had much hot water, it was only lukewarm. Overall, it was a great experience and a great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Another Vacation Club”
Reviews.Author: cbufis
Reviews.Content: I took my wife to surprise her and the concierge and front desk messed it up. They put me in the wrong room etc. Additionally, the AC did not work in the "wrong room" I was supposed to have a car reserved from the concierge but it was not. Good thing I had a backup plan with Avis. This club had several nice golf resorts nearby and sported the usual "Mariott Vacation Club" poor cleanliness and room odor complete with hairs and dust. The dishwasher did not work in our kitchen. The television was a 25" CRT old school tv. Astonishing that there was no flat screen at a resort. Mariott needs to focus on service and cleanliness in their vacation clubs. I love their hotels but the clubs need a serious overhaul.

Reviews.Title: “Upscale resort with great entertainment”
Reviews.Author: PhoenixsunPhoenix
Reviews.Content: Wonderful staff, very attentive to the needs of their guests. Any complaints are dealt with immediately. Went to the Copa Loca bar and grill which is located right by one of their pools. Beautiful view of the lake and lighthouse. They had Karaoke there on Friday night with a husband and wife team. Never seen that before. They put on a killer show. Started with an idol singing contest and then had regular karaoke until after 9. The dj even sang a special anniversary song for my husband and I. Lots of props, and great song selection. Both the husband and wife team sing. Lots of interactivity with the singers. They played the funniest birthday song I have ever heard for one of the guests. The karaoke monitor was cool, it had videos playing in the background behind the lyrics. While we were there, we met a Canadian couple that has stayed at the Grande Vista for 8 weeks and they said they have gone to the karaoke show every week that they were there. The dj even gave out raffle prizes to the singers. The dj said that the pictures that the wife takes, sometimes end up on their website. I checked it out, but I didn't find mine. I guess they just put some of them on their website. Check it out at www.stage3stars.com they have the web address on their song slips that you sign up with. Truly the best show we've ever seen. Get there early if you want a seat.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Time Share Place”
Reviews.Author: hinkgen
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful property. We stayed here as part of a promo to try to get us to buy a timeshare (we didn't). The accomodations are great with beautiful grounds and facilities. Be ready for a fairly high pressure routine from the timeshare department (pleasant enough sales guy, just didn't want to take no for an answer). We did the whole Disney bit and rented a vehicle to travel back and forth to park (about a 15 min. drive). We had previously stayed at Disney properties and preferred that over this for the overall Disney experience.

Reviews.Title: “I love this place....”
Reviews.Author: hellsbells42
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 4 years ago but we were a bit 'out on a limb' last time, well a bit far from the main pools & receptions, market place etc. This year we were in Block 79 'Madrid' right next to the Copa loca bar & grill and West Village Pool, so after reading the reviews I couldnt have been more happy with my given location. There was slight noise during the day when they had karaoke etc but we were out most days and as long as there was no noise at night we were happy !! After a 9 1/4 hr flight I couldnt be mithered where I was situated location wise so I just asked for a quiet room not to far from one of the main pools and our villa location was perfect. We reserved a 3 bed villa and got a 2 bedroom lock off next to a 1 bedroom suite which was perfectly ok, it smelled a little of paint the first night but was too tired to care. The beds are just the best, I'm a light sleeper and usually have restlessness getting used to beds but not here they are soooooo comfy. The suite was clean and nicely furnished and maid service was fine. The pool areas were fairly busy but large enough for everyone and we had no problems getting sun beds. Only had dealings with the Reception staff on check in/out and also the Copa bar staff both were friendly. My only 'But' is that this place is a bit TOO Huge, luckily the West Village is nearest to the exit otherwise i think it would have driven me mad if we were situated at the furthest side (Block 90) like we were on our previous visit.

Reviews.Title: “Nice family vacation”
Reviews.Author: cne24
Reviews.Content: I exchanged into the Grande Vista with Interval - all went well. Got to the property four hours early and was allowed to check in far earlier than the 4pm advertised time, which was fantastic as I'm with 11 month old twins. I asked for a renovated room (2 BR - with lockoff) and was sent to Building 96. Not sure I got a renovated room, as the bathroom looked somewhat dated and different from some of the pics I saw here, but since I got in 4 hours early I wasn't going to raise the issue. Service at the front desk was excellent and the 2 pack-n-plays and 2 high chairs I requested were provided at once and free of charge - very nice and kudos to the staff for being prompt. Room is fine (I'm writing this on "rest" day while here), though the kitchen appliances are old and worn (microwave dated 1998). Seems a bit out of place since the living room area is obviously re-done. But the appliances are functional so not a big deal. As I said earlier, both bathrooms are in need of some updating. Plumbing a bit iffy, hot water was on demand - no waiting. Hot tub works great. Can't hear a sound in our "main" bedroom, though foot traffic in the corridor is heard pretty easily in the lock-off room. Doesn't wake up the twins, though. Patio is screened and we have had breakfast out on it every morning, which again is nice. Wireless internet free but very spotty. I have to check in to work every day, unfortunately, and the internet is hit or miss at best. If you need reliable access, forget about it. I had issues for one whole day and the staff basically blew me off - Wayport fixed the issue by calling the desk on my behalf. But it is free, so - again - not that big a deal. Wished the service in regard to the net was better (from the staff). Grounds very nice. I like how the property is about a mile off I-Drive via a nicely landscaped road, which makes it seem more secluded. Have a pool next to our building (the clerk called it the "country" since not many people are there - and he was right) and we have visited the other main pools. The main pool near reception was great for young kids - the "outer" main pool with the water cannons was better for older kids. Haven't had to fight for a pool chair which was better than I expected. Pool had a bar area which was a bit overpriced, but good. Food at the fast food place (clerk compared it to Boston Market - I guess I can see it) was fine if you want something quick and aren't concerned about price. The location can't be beat, really. Only minutes to Disney and Sea World. Haven't made it to Universal. But great proximity to lots of things to do and have had no problems getting around. Publix for groceries and the Premium Outlet Mall is about 5 minutes away at most. You won't have to travel far to do things or get something to eat at a nice place. The thing with the Grande Vista is this - if you plan on staying at the resort with your family and having lots of stuff to do here and rarely leave the site - look elsewhere. Sure, the pools are nice but they aren't big at all, and that's really about it. There is a wall climbing thing, paddle boats, a golf course, and some grills - but there aren't any other activities. All this is perfectly fine with me, though. To compare - I have traveled with a family member to Orange Lake (apparently called Holiday Inn Orange Lake Resort now) and that place has a ton of pools, a tubing river, mini golf, several restaurants, arcade, and more. They never leave the property. However, that place is wall-to-wall people, which makes the Grande Vista nice - it hasn't seemed overcrowded. As we like to get around and see things and enjoy the resort, but not live at it, the Grande Vista made a nice destination. Can't give the place 5 stars since they are some nagging issues, as outlined above (and the tiled kitchen floor was terribly dirty - no excuse for that, really). To compare, the Marriott Surf Watch in Hilton Head blows the place away in terms of room quality - if that's your thing. However, if you like a nice place to stay and will get around, has some nice amenities on site, a great location and service, and can tolerate some minor issues (what place is perfect, anyway?) then the Grande Vista is worthwhile. I'd come back.

Reviews.Title: “Our property was STOLEN and Marriott Gradn Vista treated US like the CRIMINALS! AVOID THIS PLACE AT ALL COSTS!”
Reviews.Author: Marriott_LIES
Reviews.Content: This was our FIRST family vacation EVER. We had waited months and months to enjoy our time in Orlando. We were there celebrating our daughter's 4th birthday which turned into a nightmare.
