Here is what happened from start to finish: I received a call from Marriott to take a 5 day 4 night promo visit at a low rate. When they first called, they only offered west coast stays, so I declined because it would not be possible for us to easily get there. After a few MONTHS of calls from them, they finally told us that we could stay in Orlando for the rate of around $200 for the entire time (not bad I thought) as long as we attended the sales presentation. I agreed and bought the time. When I eventually went to reserve the room at MGV, they told me that I purchased time in Hawaii and could not stay in Orlando (I NEVER AGREED TO THIS), so the sales thief must have gotten some commission on booking us in Hawaii. Nonetheless, I argued it and after spending over an HOUR on the phone, being transferred many times, I finally got them to agree to 'letting' us stay in Orlando. I should have known we were being scammed at this point, but silly me..... When I booked the room, they told me that I could no longer get the studio (THAT was what I agreed to when I bought - again.... lied to), and that I had to pay MORE for the 1 bedroom. So far, really not a good experience. We stupidly agreed because we figured we could save the difference in money by having the kitchen and cooking food there rather than eating out. I called ahead to request no down in the room because of severe allergies (both my husband and I can't breathe with down bedding) and also requested to stay closer to the central pool area since we were so far away the last time we were there and our little one has a tough time walking that far. We were told no problem on both, but when we arrived, we not only had down in the room (and were not offered any alternates), but also were in the SAME building that was so far away as the last time we stayed. We were told it was because it was a refurbished/updated room with the latest amenities and that it was in tip top shape. If you call missing dinnerware, a broken garbage disposal, huge holes in the screens, hornet nests, non-working lights, missing towels, and ant infestation refurbished/updated, then I guess that was what we got. We spent hours waiting for maintenance to come and fix all of the issues. Unreal. Come to find out, the sales person at the presentation told us that refurbished rooms have plasma tv's and ARE in tip top shape. She also told us that Marriott sometimes tells guests that the rooms are updated to make them feel more excited about their stay... NOT impressed. Did I mention that the concierge was VERY RUDE? That was the least of our problems. So, are you ready for the icing on the cake? We left for the Magic Kingdom at 10 am on 4/23. Before we left, my husband put his Dolce and Gabbana eyeglasses into his Ray Ban sunglasses case, which he then set in the drawer under his shorts in the nightstand next to the bed. He wore his prescription Ray Ban sunglasses to the park that day because he didn't want to risk losing his eyeglasses. I don't drive, and we drove all the way from New York to Florida for this trip (HE did the driving, bless his heart). We returned from celebrating our daughter's 4th birthday at the Magic Kingdom at about 11 at night, put our sleeping birthday girl to bed, and my husband went to put his sunglasses away and put his eyeglasses on. GONE! The housekeeper who came in to 'clean' our room took them. I am certain of it. They didn't clean, they barely made the bed and didn't replace towels, but they ruffled through our property and STOLE FROM US. I saw him put them in the drawer that morning, we discussed whether or not to bring them, and made the choice to leave them tucked away! UGH! Nonetheless, we literally turned the room upside down as well as our car to look for them. NOTHING. We called Loss Prevention and were dealing with them until 2:30 am. We were told someone would contact us - lie - we had to call and call and call. Of course, we were supposed to check out that next day and were hanging in limbo because we were told to wait for a call (which never came). I could go into further detail about what happened next, and what is STILL happening, but why bother. You get the point. They have been terribly rude to us, never even offered an apology, AND have told us that they refuse to submit the claim to their insurance! We even have family that owns with Marriott, and told them that - they could care less. They RUINED our first vacation ever. Is THIS what VACATION is like? If so, I don't want to vacation! I can certainly tell you that I will NEVER stay with Marriott again. By the way, did you know that they have some kind of agreement where they can't accuse their housekeepers of theft, even though they know that it happens every day? BEWARE! By the way, upon returning home, we also realized that we are missing other small items that would typically go unnoticed. They did this in a sneaky way - the last night there when they knew we would have to check out and travel home, and took something that many people commonly misplace.

Reviews.Title: “Good...If You Like Time Shares”
Reviews.Author: tinainvirginia
Reviews.Content: This was our first time staying at a time share resort. After our stay here, we realized, it's not our thing. We like having our roomed cleaned everyday (the room is never cleaned here). The rooms are spacious and comfortable, but this is for people who like cooking in their room and hanging out in the room. There isn't a bar to get drinks (except for a snack bar that closes at 10pm) and the only room service is pizza for pickup. The pools were crowded and to be honest, we were bored. We wish we had stayed on-site for one of the parks to be closer to activity and places to see and do. The high speed internet is free, which is great; however, it was not very reliable.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the view”
Reviews.Author: jajipoolu
Reviews.Content: Mariott Grande Vista is an excellent property sprawling with a large golf course and excellent ameneties. It is worth staying in this property with a two bed room villa and suitalble for all ages. conveniently located and with good deals you can get the room at an affordable rates

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely perfect place to stay”
Reviews.Author: LisaFL
Reviews.Content: My husband and I came to the resort to "get away from it all" and we sure did, the grounds are outstanding, absolutely beautiful landscaping gorgeous golf course, the resort offers all types of activities during the day from pool activities to Kareoke at their restaurant/bar, and a complimentary photograph by the resorts photographer. The rooms have jacuzzi's near the master bed and a separate bathroom and shower, perfect for two. It's a beautiful place and one you won't be disappointed in.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: TravelNurse1
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a stay at the Grande Vista and we had a great time. We were using my dad's timeshare and since we stayed a whole week for pennies, that made it great too. We thought the resort was pretty and had nice amenities. We did other stuff during the day so it was really just a place to sleep but we did enjoy the pools and I liked not having to pay for the W/D usage. We were in a studio suite which was a little small for two adults and two tweens but the money we saved using the timeshare made up for that. It may not be the grandest of hotels but it beats a Comfort Suites. Maybe if I l owned the timeshare myself I'd be a little more picky but all I need was a clean place to sleep, close to things I wanted to do, and a nice pool to relax by and I got all of that and a little more.

Reviews.Title: “1/2 Star Resort”
Reviews.Author: trav-4-fun-1
Reviews.Content: When you arrive at Marriott Grande Vista as you drive up to the main building it looks nice BUT looks are deceivingâ€¦. The first thing you notice when you walk up the stairs to your room is how dirty the corridors are. In the room there were dirty hand prints on the walls and doors. Stains on the sofa cushions, tried flipping them over and the other side was worse. The noise was unbelievable, you could hear everything that was going on around you, and I mean everything! When the people in the next room set the table you could hear the silverware and dishes being placed on the table, you could hear them washing the dishes, their conversations, their plans for the day, and at nightâ€¦ Well I was just glad the guy didnâ€™t have much stamina (sorry Joe, I heard his wife call his name through what I can only assume were cardboard walls) you could hear the people in the room above walking around their room and using the bathroom. The door to our room did not close properly, you had to slam it as hard as you could to get it closed all the way and lean on it to get the lock to click. Had to call and ask for fresh towels and washcloths, they would forget the washcloths every time. Way too many people for the little amenities that were offered. I heard this place was recently remodeled but I didnâ€™t see that. The only positives, the bed was comfortable and we had a nice view of the golf course. In a word Dump. Consider upgrading to a Motel 8.

Reviews.Title: “A comparison with Marriott Cypress Harbour”
Reviews.Author: chadp1
Reviews.Content: First off, the place was great. My family and I have stayed at 4 of the MVC properties in Florida. This was our second trip to Grande Vista. The Pluses Very clean and kid friendly. The Pools were very nice, and there always seemed to be plenty of chairs. Pond was GREAT for fishing and Tennis Courts were clay. The room had granite counter tops, and you can request the second bedroom to have 2 queen size beds. Pools were always busy. I got the sense that Grande Vista was the destination for people rather than the theme parks. But maybe that was just the economy. The negatives. Nothing major. Make sure you request a building close to one of the two pools. There were units that are at least a 10-15 minute walk from the pools. For how many units they have, they really need to put in a third major pool area. Maid service is 'lite' at best. Beds get made, and dishes washed, and thats it. They didn't even replace towels every day, and I didn't see them carrying vaccums. The advertise basketball and rock climbing. The rock climbing wall was open for 1 hour the entire week we were there. There is a half court basketball, but it's way off by itself. Lots of kids wanting to play. Seems like a pretty cheap addition would be duplicating the two full sport courts they have at Cypress Harbour. Compare between Cypress Harbour and Grande Vista Grande Vista rooms are nicer, but quite a bit smaller. The queen size beds in second bedroom is big advantage for Grande Vista. Overall I'd prefer the Grande Vista rooms. Pools- While both are nice, my kids greatly prefer Cypress Harbour. They seemed larger and better layed out. Grounds- Cypress Harbour hands down. They have the sportscourts, more spacious pools, minigolf, and overall just seemed nicer. You can't go wrong with either, but my kids really liked Cypress better Both are nice properties, and much less hectic than staying at Disney. If you have 5 or more in your family, MVC is definitely the way to go.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Marriott Grande Vista!”
Reviews.Author: emmyf1
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a week vacation at the Grande Vista and couldn't have asked for a better place to stay. The resort was well maintained, clean and very kid friendly. Our room was near the back of the resort and it was a little walk to the kiddie pools but there was a regular pool and spa close by. There were also clean and available gas grills by the pool. The resort staff were friendly and willing to help with anything. Once we got to our room they brought us a pack n play and highchair that were pretty clean. Our room was quiet and huge for a 1 bedroom with a screened in porch overlooking the 9th hole and the local alligator. The bed was so comfortable! The only negative thing that I have to say about the resort is that my husband killed a cockroach that was hanging on the window blinds.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, kids loved it:)”
Reviews.Author: BabyBlondie
Reviews.Content: Second time staying here, room was very nice, loved the whirpool tub. We stayed in a 1 bedroom villa in building 93 which was a close walk to the main pool and shop, food court, poolbar. Our room was beautifully furnished, very clean with a TV and DVD player in the living room and bedroom. Kitchen was great and had all the basics, washer and dryer which was very handy. The bed was nice and comfy. This place is huge so if you are in a building away from the main pool and lobby, it can be a little hike, especially if you are going to hang out at the hotel and do stuff instead of doing theme parks. Very nice place, daily activities for kids was a plus!

Reviews.Title: “Great Accomodations in Great Area”
Reviews.Author: KyleTravel
Reviews.Content: The Grande Vista is just off the busy and fun filled International Drive in Orlando. The newly renovated accomodations are great. We had a 1 bedroom studio with balcony. It was in Building 91 on the fourth floor. It was clean and the A/C worked great. Bathroom was adequate. There are 4 pools we did not use due to time, although they looked nice. They also have various paddle boats for rent to use on the lake. Did not eat anywhere on the resort although everything looked nice. Check in was smooth as well as check out. It did not seem to be over run with kids either. No issues.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Families”
Reviews.Author: jlmason4
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took our 3 small children here in the summer of 2007. It was absolutely beautiful! The place was so clean and the staff was there to help out with any information that I needed . They were very accomidating with the room choice as well. There was so much for the kids to do here.. pool, indor play area and activities planned almost every evening. I would highly recommend this resort to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Would go back AGAIN and AGAIN!!”
Reviews.Author: used2bekt
Reviews.Content: Just returned from the Marriott Grande Vista and was thoroughly impressed! Staff was friendly and helpful. Our room was ready about 30 minutes before check-in and we requested a newly renovated, view room which we received. We were on the 4th floor of Building 95 which overlooked the golf course. We had a 2 bedroom with lock off. We had two king sized beds and two pullout sofas. The pullouts weren't too comfortable, but the beds were very nice. Beautiful, spacious, updated room with large dining room table and screened in patio that overlooked the golfcourse as well. This was great because the weather was perfect and we were able to sleep with the sliding glass doors open for the night breezes. No morning construction noise, just the sprinklers one morning. The grounds are meticulously maintained! I can't say more about their beauty. There were at least four pools, two main ones, and two smaller ones. The resort is very large, but there seemed to be a pool within walking distance of each building. Daily activities (for both kids and adults) were offered the whole time we were there. The restaurants, ice cream shoppe, and small market made it almost not necessary to have to eat or shop off site. But there was a grocery store and many restaurants nearby if you did venture out. We went grocery shopping at the beginning of our stay for breakfast items, since we ate at the parks most days, but if you did plan to make a large meal, there was more than enough pots, pans, etc. to get it done. Plus a fullsized coffee maker, toaster, etc. Location was perfect and easy to find. Almost adjacent to the entrance to Sea World and Aquatica. Disney World was a little further, about 15 minutes. Wet and Wild and Universal Studios were about 15 minutes as well. I can't say enough about this resort. We would go back again and again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Spacious and Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: swan0299
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Grande Vista. There were a few problems, but they would not stop us from visiting again. Pros - Many beautiful pools, something for everyone A beach! A great surprise. There's a fence along the water of the beach, so we could let our daughter play in the sand w/out worrying she'd go into the water. Nice entertainment HUGE rooms and comfy beds. Great views from our room. Cons- -Front desk needed more staff, there was constantly a line -Our buildings (89 and 92) were too far from main pool, a long walk for very young (3) or older crowd (70+)...not too bad for the healthy, though. -First building (89) did not have night lock. I slept with one eye opened, worried our 3 year old would walk out at night! Without the night lock, the door was very easy to open. Staff kindly moved us for the rest of our stay. -Thin doors. With everything else being "top end", why the flimsy doors? You could hear everything through them. -We did not notice construction, but there was a lot of noise due to landscaping (refreshing mulch, pruning, etc). Can't really complain about this, it needs to be done....right? We've also stayed at Horizons in Orlando. For young families, we'd probably first opt for Horizons (although, Grande Vista is nice). For folks wanting something a little less kid-oriented, this would fit the bill. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Spacious resort with lots of amenities...”
Reviews.Author: EnchantedVacations
Reviews.Content: First off... This is a timeshare resort with condos. We normally stay at Disney Vacation Club but we ran out of DVC points and 2 we wanted to see what else Orlando had to offer and by staying onsite at Disney we don't venture offsite often. Also, coming from California we stayed our 1st night at All Star: Movies because our flight did not arrive until 11 pm. Spent the morning exploring All Stars: Movies which my kids loved. Great place for kids. Then, we drove over to Marriott Grande Vista around 1 pm to check-in. To our surprise our room was ready. That was AWESOME but we realized afterwards that resort is HUGE. We were assigned unit 6625 in building 86 overlooking the golf course. We got a 2 bedroom non-lock off unit so, the guest bedroom had 2 queens in it. The unit was very spacious. It came with tons of dining seating. The kitchen even had a walk-in pantry. This one of the largest Marriott units we have ever stayed in. I loved the space. Everything was clean. There was internet available. The washer and dryer combo was VERY small. It took me 2 loads to do one days worth of clothes. We used the washer/dryer alot as it was colder than we expected and we didn't have enough warm clothes. The hair dryer in the master bedroom did not work. Actually, the entire outlet did not work. There was no screened in porch on the guest bedroom side. Awesome unit! Activities onsite included several pools. We had to walk to our pool but not too far. There had these little pedal boats in shapes of ducks, swans, dragons, etc that you could rent. It was like $10/2 seater per half hour or $15/4 seater per half hour. They had a rock climbing wall that was free. It was not up a couple of days because of wind. There was also other boating things you could rent. They had a motorized mini-jet things you could rent. Looked like a lot of fun. There was a sand volleyball area. There were several pools. The main check-in area had the Marketplace & the Maze and the gym. The Maze was closed for remodeling. I saw one bar area restaurant. I believe there were more but the place is so huge I think, I needed to drive to it. They had a BBQs onsite but they were charcoal only. I never saw anyone ever using them. Personally, I would not buy charcoal while on vacation. I think, gas would be better. The Marketplace was HUGE and had a huge assortment of stuff that you could easily skip the grocery store but the prices are high. Our trip consisted mainly of visiting Disney parks, Space Kennedy Center & a gulf side beach. We did not make it to the beach as the weather wasn't the best so, for our next trip we will. We did not like our location from the front gate. You had a maze of parking lots to drive through. We even took the short cut and it still was annoying. The location is great for Seaworld and Discovery Cove. As for Magic Kingdom the location wasn't the best but any offsite location would not be. To get to MK you had to drive about 20 minutes, then, pay for parking, then, you drove into your parking spot, Then, you waited for the tram to take you to the transportation center. Once there you either took the ferry or monorail to the gate entrance. This whole process could take you anywhere for 60 minutes to 90 minutes to do. We liked staying onsite at Disney as the buses take you right to the gate. We also liked that if staying onsite you can split up as a group. I needed to do some Christmas shopping but that was impossible to do with the kids around. I had no way of requesting packages to be sent back to my room nor could I go ahead and go back to the room to hide the packages. I didn't realize how much that would bother me. We really didn't eat in the area. I found the area had a lot of chain restaurants that we have at home. So, we really didn't want to do that. We ate mostly at Disney. I wish I had made reservations at some of the fancier restuarants in the Orlando area. I don't think, I researched this enough but our main goal was Walt Disney World so, it didn't really make sense to leave the parks to eat. I'd say this a great location for visiting Orlando but probably not if your focus is DisneyWorld. This would be a great area for toddlers, teenagers, adults only. It was very quiet. We never heard our neighbors nor did we see them. It had more of condo feel than a resort feel. There was always parking when we returned late at night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: TravelWII
Reviews.Content: Very nice! Would stay again. Everyone was very nice! Anything you needed was taken care of.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Toolate8
Reviews.Content: Just got back today. Resort is currently under some construction but is still highly functional for the the most part. Arrived and we asked for a newly renovated room and were given one. Staff was always nice and efficient with everything. Stay in a room close to the main building or across the lake if you want easy access to the main pools. Pools are great for the kids with various levels and areas. I am familar with this property, Horizons and Cypress Harbor. My family by far enjoyed this the most.

Reviews.Title: “Huge resort...wonderful pools, central location to attractions”
Reviews.Author: glebo
Reviews.Content: This is one of the largest Marriott resorts I have stayed at. We own in Williamsburg and traded a week for this one. We were not disappointed. Our room overlooked the golf course, which is maintained wonderfully. I was disappointed that we were not closer to a pool..there were 4-5 pools and we were the furthest away from them all...seems I can never secure a room near a pool...even though I travel with young children. Who do you have to know???? Nick's restaurant was very nice. The bar near the pools were great. Children's activities were enjoyed by my granddaughter. We even had an armadillo visit our parking lot which was a lot of fun to watch!! The place is maintained very well. Everyone was very friendly and accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice resort”
Reviews.Author: MissingSanDiego
Reviews.Content: I was nervous after reading some of the reviews posted here and other places so I called ahead to tell them we would be arriving late and to request a refurbished unit. We arrived close to midnight (the resort is about 15 minutes from the airport) and the front desk attendant (Rod)could not have been nicer! He worked very hard to put us in a nice new room (bldg 95 which others have warned about had just been completely re-done). After a snafu with room keys not working we got settled in. The suite was gorgeous--looked just like the pictures on the internet! The resort is huge but our building was close to the main building and the main pool. We were there during the coldest spell Florida has had in 16 years and the suite was very warm and toasty. We have stayed in other Marriott vacation club resorts and this one was on par with the others. We loved having a full kitchen to make breakfast, a washer/dryer, a screened porch, and 3 big screen tv's! We did not get the maid service, and we did do the timeshare presentation because they offered us one hundered Disney dollars! My only complaint would be the sound--we could hear everything our neighbors said and did and the family above us let their child run the entire villa from 6 a.m. til they left for the day--it sounded like a herd of elephants on our heads. One family that checked in half-way through our trip blared the television all night forcing me to sleep on the couch. Overall nice place and great trip!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: Joeclean
Reviews.Content: The place was beautiful the grounds the pools the room were all great.There was some renovations going on but it was not a bother. The front desk and gate people were very professional. The location is very good. I stayed in a newly remodeled room and they did a great job. The only downside was something that I read in a review from this forum and have to confirm and that was the cleaning service. On the day of check out they start knocking at 9 ish to see when you will be out then 15-20 minutes later they come back and see if you are gone yet. The second time we were just gathering up our bags so I told her to go ahead but I was not impressed with the hounding. Since we were leaving anyway I did not say anything to the staff at the desk. I would still love to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort.. Room is Another Story...”
Reviews.Author: worldseeker2010
Reviews.Content: I loved the resort. However, a few complaints. On check in day. I was told my room would be ready at the check in time - when I arrived to my room - housekeeping was still in the room cleaning the oven. She stressed that a housekeeper had cleaned the room earlier in the day but that she did not clean the oven well enough and left the room dirty - so she was cleaning after the original housekeeper. She then told me that I could come back in a hour and she could finish cleaning or she suggested we call the front desk. I called the front desk to complain and they were rather oblivious about the situation (this was at 630pm at night) and after a long day I was furious that the front desk was not more helpful. In the meantime, the housekeeper disappeared - never to be seen again. I called the front desk again and they said, they would get on it ASAP. The 2nd day, I went to front desk to remind them about my oven needing to be cleaned (it was filthy) - they said they would personally go to the room after a housekeeper went there to make sure it was up to "Marriott Standards". However, when I got back to the room that night, the oven was not touched. It was ridiculous. My other complaint is that the whirlpool tub in the room did not work really well - after several calls to the front desk, they sent a maintenance person who got it working but several minutes after he left, it stopped working again. A minor beware- there are ants in the room. I found a whole bunch of them by the balcony area before we left and did not realize they were there. The grounds are beautifully maintained. The main pool area is stunning as is the lake and other pools. Construction shut down a lot of the amenity areas but those were not missed. Oh yea, one more complaint: Every morning between 6am and 10am (automated calls came in from Marriott Vacation Club about going on a tour. Im not talking one call, im talking several calls all morning long and to top it off, all day long with additional calls from the MAZE about their activities for the day. It got very irritating. The MAZE activities were great and the nightly entertainment at the bar was nice. On check out day, beware that housekeeping will begin knocking on your door between 6am and 7am. My 1st knock was at 630am and continous knocks lated until 8am when I opened the door and the housekeeping lady told me that it was check out day and I had to be out soon. VERY RUDE. From up to the second we left the room for good, she kept pacing back and forth in front of the room waiting for us to leave. I loved the resort but I had a very disappointing personal stay at the resort.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: cuda153
Reviews.Content: I stayed via vacation club/time share offer. the 2 hour spiel was low pressure and painless. It is well -located near theme parks and the grounds are very nice. The Faldo golf clinic and grille were a nice surprise. Rooms were spacious, if slightly dated in decor. With the rate charged with the time share presentation, it is an enormous bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Appreciate Marriott consistency”
Reviews.Author: MItravels
Reviews.Content: We have never been disappointed in any of the Marriott properties at which we've stayed, and this was no exception. We requested a newer building near (but not adjoining) a pool, and were pleased to have a 1st floor unit just down the hall from a beautiful pool area. Our unit was 2 bedroom, 2 bathroom, and since it was a lock-off unit, the rooms were huge. The decor is very nice and the room was spotless. The hotel grounds are very well maintained, and during our stay they were completing construction on a new fitness facility and another bar area. There are so many activities for the kids to do right at the resort, we ended up only doing the Disney thing for three days and hanging out the rest, for a truly restful vacation. We have stayed at many timeshare "resorts" over the years, and these Marriotts are by far the best and most consistent in quality.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but could care less about frequent travelers”
Reviews.Author: nativenewyorker9
Reviews.Content: I chose this property based upon my preference for Marriott properties and the larger rooms. Being a Marriott frequent traveler I have become accustomed to upgrades. When checking in a requested an upgrade (as the hotel was not busy) and the front manager said that is only at Marriott hotels. Onn multiple previous stays I had been upgraded so I was a bit set off by that response. Other interaction with the front desk staff was met with the type of response that led me to believe I was bothering them. This is something I am unaccustomed to at a Marriott property. The hotel itself is motel style and has larger than average rooms meant for extended stays. It is averagely appointed but probably not as much as a Courtyard, which I think are better than this. It is probably more on the lines of a Fairfield Inn. The amenities are difficult to use unless you are driving back and forth to the front area. This property is spread out and large. There is a 9 hole course and Nick Faldo Institute on the premises. Both were nice and well run. I had breakfast and dinner at the golf course in Nick's Grill. Both were rather average and overpriced. The servers however were both friendly and attentive. I would agree with other reviewers that this is certainly not for the business traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort”
Reviews.Author: KazBristol
Reviews.Content: This resort is big with beautiful grounds, several pool areas, lake, tennis courts, golf, restaurants and bars. We had a studio apartment on the ground floor overlooking the pool and Copa Loca bar area which wasn't a problem as the bars close at 10pm, so no noise after that. The apartment was well presented and maintained, fabulous comfortable bed! Staff all over the resort are friendly and only to happy to help, if you need anything they will oblige wherever possible. Even though the resort is huge it doesn't feel too big as there are so many little areas to relax or walk by the lake and all were clean and well kept. Its a great base from which to explore Orlando, I would definately go back!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Resort!”
Reviews.Author: hazel1954
Reviews.Content: Having just spent 5 weeks in the States 3 of those we managed to exchange into all Marriot Resorts. There was my Husband and myself and we stayed in a studio unit which was ample size for the 2 of us. This Resort in particular was lovely! Staff friendly, Pools and settings very nice! Location was excellent...for us that didnt want to drive in all the hustle and bustle of I Drive..we just rang the bell desk and they would send somebody to pick us up and drop us at the main gate where there was the I Trolley Bus Stop. We puchased a weekly pass ( I think it was $8 each ) and away we went ...we could get on or off I Drive which would take us to most places along the main location. Well worth a visit!

Reviews.Title: “Marriott Grande Vista Orlando, FL”
Reviews.Author: edtoby007
Reviews.Content: I made the mistake of thinking this property was suitable for business travelers. I got a very small studio room, reminded me of those tiny rooms you often find in NY City. Not even a desk for my laptop. You have to walk 10 minutes to the main building for coffee, papers, etc. There was a Tiki Bar right next to my building, 10 bucks for a large draft beer (craft beer, not Bud). Yes, 10 bucks. I did notice a Nick Faldo Golf School on the property, nice for the golfers... Front Desk personnel, I hate to say it, were a tad snooty, not like your typical Marriott folks. So, nice place, very clean, but the studio rooms are uncomfortably small and more suited to the non-business traveler.

Reviews.Title: “it is ok.”
Reviews.Author: IgorA
Reviews.Content: The rooms were average. They looked more like motel rooms than the rooms at the 4 or 5 star resort. Neutral colored walls and old furniture did not make the room too esthetically pleasing. It was a bit tacky and would suit a motel at the shore. The property itself is not bad at all. Lots of greenery and overall it is very clean and well maintained. We did not use the pool or the golf course but both looked pretty decent. If you are looking for a resort close to Disney, this is not a bad place to stay and little kitchens are definetely a plus if you don't want to venture outside for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “A very good stay”
Reviews.Author: GTHER
Reviews.Content: First, I am one of these readers who always looks for the bad comments, and then assumes the worst. That said, I thoroughly reviewed peoples comments going back the last 10 months. Even though there were a lot of negative comments, we still decided to try the Marriott Grand Vista. I have to say that the negative comments are way overdone. This is not the JW Marriott - if you want a 5 Star Hotel, then book a different hotel. If you want a nice, pretty clean condo-like room, then this is great value. The property is huge, nice to walk around and has some nice scenic views. The staff was amazing. My wife commented that she never had so many people say hello. We booked a 1 Bedroom villa in the 90 Building. Our friends booked a 3 BR villa in the 91 building. Both were clean and in good shape. Are there things that could have been better - of course. The bathrooms have older tiles, toilets, showers and sinks â€“ but they looked good. Weâ€™d have preferred a better cable-tv option with On-Demand movies, but were more than satfisfied with the TV selection. We ate at the pool-side bar. Food was good (not great â€“ but honestly how bad can you screw up a chicken sandwich) and the prices were very fair (we purchased the $30 food coupon for $10 - worth the investment). Drinks were good and fairly priced. We do Disney three times a year and normally stay at Disney resorts (Contemporary or Grand Floridian), that said, we found the commute from the Marriott fine - took us 15-20 minutes from hotel to parking lot- not bad at all. We will stay at the Marriott again!

Reviews.Title: “Huge Property”
Reviews.Author: ratking23
Reviews.Content: Beautiful property. Huge. The room was okay though. It looked like it hadn't been renovated in a while. Old TV and room had a slight muggy smell but got accustomed I guess after a few minutes in it. Stayed in building 94.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Art_expert
Reviews.Content: Beautiful property and unit overlooking the lake. Nice and efficient staff handled minor check-in problem professionally and quickly. Great location for Discovery Cove (which we loved) or Sea World. Only complaint that I would have was for two recommended delivery food places. One Italian had a flyer under the door. Very ordinary food. The other was a Chinese place recommended by the concierge and the food was no better than out of a can. But other than that, the staff and the property were top notch.

Reviews.Title: “Big Dissappointment”
Reviews.Author: xangotraveler
Reviews.Content: Directions to the unit took me to an exit that was for people with SUNPASS and NO HUMAN there or NO CASH ACCEPTED. So I had to decide to back up to get on the turnpike, or exit without paying since I did not have a SUNPASS. I got into the unit. It is for 4 people. Only 2 bath towels, and 2 hand towels. No wash cloths. No towels for the kitchenette. No tv listing of channels and was told they do not put that in the room any more. They do not have information in the room with instructions or guidelines. I was not given this at check in. There are 2 plates, 2 glasses, 2 spoons, etc. Not for 4 but only two people. The website for Marriott said oversize soaking tubs, and the tub is extremely small. I called housekeeping to bring washclothes and towels for 4. They did not bring wash cloths. I had to go to the front desk to get a printout to know which station is which number on the tv. I had to ask what to do with trash, etc. They handed me a list of goings on today which I was not informed was available at check in. The people are friendly on staff but do not seem to really care. I mean I had to call many times to get the wash cloths.

Reviews.Title: “In Poor Condition”
Reviews.Author: ObamaFan
Reviews.Content: The property did not meet my expectations. I was considering buying a timeshare but the villas are in bad shape. On the outside the property is beautiful but inside the unit is another story. Before going, I did read the reviews but I went anyway. Unfortunately most of the bad comments were true. Not only was the villa in bad shape but it had a bad smell too. The tile in our villa was cracked, the appliances did not work, the sheets had stains and the villa overall was a bit dirty. The kitchen and bathroom areas needed a thorough cleaning and I wound up making a trip to Walmart for plug ins, Lysol, and house slippers for the kids due to the condition of the dirty floors. I am a very loyal Marriott customer but I was disappointed with my accommodations this time. Maybe this will get better after ALL of the renovations are done.

Reviews.Title: “a rocket start”
Reviews.Author: tiger62z
Reviews.Content: We stayed at a one-bedroom villa for a week exchange through Interval during the Thanksgiving week. After reading other reviews, I called the resort to request a newly renovated room 6 months before our arrival. Upon checked in, we were told that the room we would be staying was remodeled in 2007. Since we arrived around 11:30 pm, we were tired and tried to settle down as soon as possible. However, we couldnâ€™t open our room after trying both room keys for 10 minutes. So we called the frond desk to report the problem. After 10 minutes, a maintenance person came to help. He couldnâ€™t get door opened either and he told us that the lock battery might have been out and he had to go back to his office to get some tools. It was cold that evening, the temperature was around mid-40s. After waiting in the cold for almost one hour, the door was finally got opened. Then, they spent another hour to try to replace the battery. It was unsuccessful. At 1:30am, we had to tell them to come back continuing their work during the day time. Two days later, when I opened the cabinet under the kitchen sink to get an empty garage bag, I found there was quite amount of water, obviously the sink was leaking. Anyhow, we had a pleasant stay. The room was clean, had a nice balcony. However, I really think it probably only got minimal renovation in the previous year. Because in addition to those two issues mentioned earlier, the bath room countertop and kitchen cabinets appeared quite old.

Reviews.Title: “If you like theme parks this might be a good place.”
Reviews.Author: frequent-traveler3
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in October 2008 to visit with vacationing family. The family members brought their kids for the theme parks. The Grande Vista looks like a nice place, but our room was really musty and showed signs of heavy use from a busy season, I guess. If you like golf they have it covered, I don't play golf but my westie loved running around the well kept landscape. The restaurants are nothing to speak of and you're better off going out to the local thai restaurant nearby. My impression is this not a very good Marriott if you want to getaway, I've had much better experiences at other Marriotts. However, to be fair, I don't have kids and this place is better for the Griswalds or if you want to bombarded with time-share info. If you want to enjoy a big pool and be close to the theme parks, this might be a good fit for families. I don't plan on returning.

Reviews.Title: “Not What Expected....”
Reviews.Author: dnlpac
Reviews.Content: My family and I were very pleased with the resort itself, but the room was something else. First let me say we were asked not once, but twice how our room was and nothing was done. Our one bedroom unit had a fork, yes an fork that you eat with holding up our shower rod so that showers could be taken. Our bathroom sink was clogged, luck it was a dual sink. There was some type of mold on the ceiling. All these issues were brought up to management and at the timeshare presentation, yet nothing done. I asked the rep, how do you expect me or anyone purchase a vacation timeshare here when all our requests have fallen on deaf ears. All we got was sorry, now if you are interested that will be 25 grand. I said no thank you and left the sales office. The only thing that the saleman was interested was that we have him a score of 10 when asked about his presentation. This was a joke, would we buy or stay at a Marriott next time, I don't think so. I think we will try the Hilton down the about a mile or so away.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay at the Grande Vista!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Den04
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a wonderful stay at the Grande Vista. There was a total of 7 people in my group we had a 3 bed/3 bath villa. It had 1 king bed in the master with 2 queen beds in the two other bedrooms. I requested early check in at noon and also a new villa in the west village lake section. Had no problem getting both. Everything was new and clean. Would stay here again in a heart beat.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: HotelReviewerHalifax
Reviews.Content: This place was a great place to stay in Orlando. Myself my wife my 3 year old, my mother and my mother-in-law stayed in a 2 bedroom villa, with a standard room attached. Plenty of room and great amenities. The place was clean and well maintained and staff were freindly and helpful. It is big and I did have to request something close to a pool. Stayed in building 100 on the third floor and had a pool right accross the parking lot although we mostly walked to the main pool ( about a 3-4 min walk). It's much larger with a kids pool and gets sun all day long. Our units overlooked the golf coarse which was nice in the morning to sit out and eat breakfast on the balcony overlooking the coarse. I'd recommend something on a lower floor because of the stairs, although each building has an elevator, but if your room is at one end it makes for a bit of walking. Rooms are super quite, did not hear a noise the entire week we were there. Got a deal on line so price was good, but there are other places all around there with similar villas that are a lot cheaper than the regular advertised prices of the Grande Vista. Shop around, but if you can get a good rate here it's a great place to stay. I read some reviews on here that were not so good, but I wouldn't pay too much attention to them. The place is clean and well maintained and currently being renovated. The only real downside I agree with is the place is very large and spread out and if your too far from one of the main pools, (there are 2 accross the lake from each other attached by the bridge you see in the pictures ) that would be inconvient. Didn't do the timeshare sales seminar because i"ve been on them before and it doesn't seem like that great a deal to me. I stayed at the place for a week for about $1500 for a 2 bedroom villa, and a standard room. I could do that for the next 15 years and still not have recovered the cost of the timeshare, not including the yearly "maintence" fee. Publix is right down the street on the corner of Vineland and International Drive South, which is great and Sea World is a 3 minute drive down the street. International South is great beacause there is very little traffic and you can get anywhere fairly quickly. Disney is about 10 minitues away so you close to everything. Hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: “Plenty of room for a Family of 5”
Reviews.Author: sullivankzs
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of a time share, but still thought the property was worth reviewing. Why stay in a regular hotel room when you can spread everyone out? This had all the amenities of a house. You could stay here and make it your destination vacation. They have activities for kids & adults (teen campfire, happy hours, pool side party to watch Space Shuttle launch, on-site photographer, etc.) There are walking/jogging paths throughout the property, spa and tennis courts, too. The MGV is almost across the street from Sea World. We drove to the Disney parks. It is only 15 minutes to the main gate. In November there was no traffic to worry about. We had adjoining rooms: Room #1, the kids used the queen bed (high quality linens, lots of pillows to choose from), and pull-out couch. They had a full bath and mini-kitchen with toaster, coffee maker, microwave, and mini-fridge. This room included a screened patio w/table & 4 chairs. Room #2, Parents had a separate bedroom (queen bed w/high quality linens and lots of pillows) also with a screened patio, table & 4 chairs. This unit includes a pull-out couch in the living area. This unit had a full-size kitchen with stove, dishwasher, stacked washer & dryer, coffee maker, microwave, toaster, tea kettle, blender, utensils, etc. We saved time & money having breakfast here. One night we used the grills near the pool for our own cook-out. There is a large Publix grocery store only 2 traffic lights away. We stocked up for the week. We used a pool and hot tub near our building (#91). Because we were staying as a timeshare we did not have daily cleaning services, but I didn't mind. I don't need someone walking around my unit every day. We kept it clean. We used the w & d to wash towels. There were pool towels in the pool area to use and leave. There are full-size w & d's in the pool area if you need to do larger loads of laundry. The furnishing were very nice. Some cabinets in the kitchen and bathroom had a few nicks, but that's a very minor issue, if I had to find something wrong. Otherwise we LOVED staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Five Star Resort???”
Reviews.Author: cmkovacs
Reviews.Content: I couldn't believe this was a 5 star resort! If we had paid more than $100 a night I would have been upset! A little run down, luckily we got a renovated room right by one of the pools. The pools are not as great and beautiful as the photos you see. I am not trying to slam the place but my expectations were a little higher since this is a Marriott. Without a doubt the staff are VERY friendly and there are some really good amenities like the sauna and steam room and extra activities for kids. The room: we were on the first floor which was a handicapped room and got a standing shower only with no bathtub (would have preferred a whirlpool bathtub). Screened in porch with table and chairs which was very nice. There was a very distinct mildew smell in the room and funky smell from the drain in the bathroom floor but it disipated after awhile. I can see why previous reviews immediately asked for another room. The couch was stained but the king size bed was great. If you walk up to the lake it is very unattractive and unappealing. I've seen lots of lakes in Florida and this one was really gross. The size of this place is enormous and if you are in a building not close to a pool it can be a hike. We did do the timeshare presentation which was fine but the incentive was well worth it! I might stay here again if I can get another deal for under $100 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Just okay”
Reviews.Author: mamaanna
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a four night stay in one of their one bedroom villas. We had high expectations after reading some of the reviews and unfortunately we were a little disappointed. The rooms were very spacious, but they did smell pretty bad and the decor was very dated even though we were in one of the newer units. I think what made the hotel just okay was the size which was enormous. We hardly saw any other guests and we couldn't walk anywhere. Too big for our liking.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: kuklainunionville
Reviews.Content: This place reminded me of the resorts in Mexico as far as appearance goes. We only slept there and explored the grounds from time to time. We stayed in a 1 bedroom and for our two 8 year old boys and us it was plenty of room. Bonus washer and dryer in the room was nice. We were first put in the smelly muggy room but later requested the "refurbished" room with no hastle. Building 92 and it was quiet as well. Staff very friendly and there to please. No hastle for the timeshare routine. Again October was less crowed and best time to go. Very close to the parks and shopping! We were there October 25th. Beds were comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: Richy_Anthony
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a 7 day stay in MarriottÂ´s Grande Vista and had a great time, the hotel is very big and because of the season it was not crowded. We stayed in a one bedroom villa, when we arrived in front desk we requested a renovated unit and the girl in the fornt desk didnt had a problem with that, in fact she was very helpful and friendly (not all of them are), the first thing you notice at the register building is the popcorn smell, they give free popcorn that my wife enjoyed : ) The rooms are clean and comfortable, I was a little worried because of some reviews that aware of bug problems, we didnt have any problems of that kind. We were assigned to building 90 which is at the back of the property theres a pool near by and is clean and heated, the main pools are also very nice. Grande Vista is almost a walk distance form Sea World and 15 minutes to DisneyWorld and Universal, theres a big store a mile away but stay away of the little one that is at the side in International Drive everything is $5 there including toothpaste or one litter milk, also do not make any long distance calls directly from the hotel we made one minute call and were charged $23 for it, instead buy a prepaid phone card, theres internet access in the register office but it is expensive. This is definitely a great time to come to Orlando we never waited more than 30 minutes to get in any ride including the Simpsons ride at Universal. The grand value package of $30 credit for beverages and food is very convenient we took advantage of it, we would definitely come back to Grande Vista, the reason I didnt rate 5star is because after all is a timeshare and you do not have the service you could get at a luxury five star hotel, but if your traveling with family or do not have any problem with the villa concept you will have a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Had a Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: TraderHamburg
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week exchage through Interval, Oct 16-23. After reading other reviews, I phoned the resort 2 days before our arrival to request a renovated room. I was unsure we would get one, as many reviews related requests were not honored. Without mentioning my request at check-in, the girl in reception was very pleasant, and made a point to tell us we were assigned a renovated villa. Of course, time of year must impact room availability, and our stay was mid-Oct. (Great time to visit - less crowded and we had gorgeous weather (81-87), and no rain.) We had a 2 bedroom end unit in Bldg. 89, which is in the back of the resort. The room had been updated with granite countertops and new furnishings. All very nice and spacious. Beds very comfortable with down comforters. Kitchen well equiped with utensils, supplies, etc. - better than most timeshares. Our balconies overlooked the golf course and ponds and was extremely quiet. Pool areas are beautiful and plentiful for a resort this large. A little bit of a walk to the main pools, but that was OK, as we were away from the high activity areas. Smaller pool near our unit was very nice as well. Pools were very clean and heated. Resort undergoing renovation, but not an inconvenience at all. Staff very friendly. No pressure from time-share sales - only one phone call early in the week, and nothing more after we declined a tour. Played the Faldo golf course twice after 2PM for a reduced rate, and the course was in excellent condition. Very convenient to WDW or other attractions, grocery stores and pharmacy. One minor negative: Had to pay for internet access in the lobby area (although internet access available in all units), which seemed a little "nickel and dime" to us. Would definitely stay here again! Resort will only get better as renovations are completed.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: VoyagerPlus
Reviews.Content: Had a fantastic time in Orlando, staying at Marriotts Grande Vista for two weeks. The room was excellent, couldn't fault it. Staff very friendly. Stayed there as a Timeshare exchange. Just a few little niggles ........ because we were a timeshare exchange, it meant that if we wanted housekeeping, we had to pay for it which we thought was a bit off. The last thing we wanted to do on holiday was to clean and make beds. It probably makes us sound like snobs but we were on holiday and in a big hotel, which as far as we are concerned housekeeping should be standard practice. Our hotel block was not near the main pool but right next to one of the smaller pools which didn't bother us at all, but what we couldn't understand was the fact that in being July and being very hot, the poolside bar was not open which meant a bit of a trek to the hotel shop to buy something cool to drink and some food. There was a drinks machine by the pool but unless you had the correct money it was rather pointless. Also the toilets by the pool weren't cleaned regularly enough. For 4 days running the bins weren't emptied and paper over the floor etc and only after 4 complaints was something done about it. Apart from those few things no other problems. On the whole there was nothing that would stop us staying there again For one of the best value for money all-you-can-eat buffet restaurants, you can't beat Sweet Tomatoes. 4 of us ate for Â£24.00. Their range of food was phenomenal - salads, pizzas, jacket potatoes, soups, pastas, many choices for desserts and their chocolate brownies were to die for!!!!! Breakfast buffet to fill you up before the parks - Ponderosa. Â£3.00 each all-you-can-eat. Some reports havent been very good about this place but we didn't have any problems - no its not 5 star but it's clean, friendly and fills up teenagers with hollow legs for a few hours!!!! Other fab places we ate were Magiannos, Outback Steakhouse, Bahama Breeze and Cafe Tu Tu Tango. Those were our favourites but there are many others to try but hope this gives someone a few ideas. As for the weather - we had a few days out of 14 with afternoon thunderstorms but that's normal according to everyone. It was certainly nothing to worry about. Enjoy - its fab and we love Orlando !!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Impressed!”
Reviews.Author: nicmer
Reviews.Content: I loved it! It is a Huge Resot. Many pool areas, it has a marketplace to stalk up on things you may need! The Grounds were kept nice. The staff was helpful and efficient. The rooms were very nice and clean. I would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “fabulous resort”
Reviews.Author: bladefan
Reviews.Content: What a pleasant shock when we arrived on 0ct 2nd 2008 after reading a lot of the reviews before we went.The place is simply stunning.Our 2 bed 2 bath villa/apartment was fantastic.Absolutely massive and furnished to a very high standard.We cannot praise enough the size of the place.Ample big enough for 2 adults and 2 children.Everything you could possibly wish for in the kitchen area.The pools were fab and most were heated.The only down side would possibly be the size of the resort but then again they had transport to take you to the entrance to the I-trolley bus or to the reception etc. depending where your villa was situated.Ours was block 86 room 6524.Away from any noise and overlooking the lake only 5 mins walk from the Copa Loca bar and pool area which served fairly decent fast food.All in all a definite 5 star resort that we would reccomend to anybody at all.A special mention to the resort staff everyone of them was polite and helpful a credit to Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, recommend it!!”
Reviews.Author: GymNut
Reviews.Content: The resort is HUGE and the grounds are well maintained. Initially, we were assigned in bldg 92 but asked for a building overlooking the lake and by the pool area. Without hesitation, front desk upgraded us to bldg 90 with a breath taking view of the golf course and the lake. Our 2-bedrrom unit was clean, spacious, and well decorated. There are 4-5 pools, with the two main large pools that are parallel to the lake. The pools over a splash area, baby pools, kids area, lap pool, and waterfalls. My only complaint was the maintenance crew start working as early at 7:00 am and they are quick to take guest parking spaces. Overall, MGV is large, beautiful, well maintained, and under a lot of re-furbishing. Food is good at Copa Loca but overpriced. Most staff members were nice and polite.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort dont worry about the bad reviews”
Reviews.Author: CHEF260
Reviews.Content: This is a lovelly resort, on initial check in to our 1 bedroom villa we were not very happy as the room smelt damp,was very dark and over looked electricity pylons. We contacted at your service straight away and were re-located. This was a much better room & veiw. Ok so for the bad reveiws you may have read. 1, The old rooms that have not been re-furbed are old and dated and yes they do smell damp but they are clean. 2, You would not really know that a renovation project was happening unless you see the vans and work men. 3,At the moment the starbucks and pizza hut is closed as this is being re-built and dont think it will be to long, you can still get the pizza hit take-out from 4pm and there is a shop just to the left of the lobby were you can get everything including bulk brew starbucks. Both pool areas are fantastic both offering different things. The staff are very friendly and helpfull. Nicks grill is very good may be a little over priced. This really a lovelly hotel and when completely re-furbed will be the nicest Marriott vacation club in the area, and yes I have stayed at a number in the orlando theme park region, so I can comment. We plan on staying again next year. I have just came back and my stay dates were 31st august-18September 2008.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience compared to the not so great reviews.”
Reviews.Author: tsunshine
Reviews.Content: After reading many reviews I was concerned about the renovations and the older section of the resort. I ended up in building 79 which was wonderful. The front desk staff was friendly so even though our room was not ready we felt OK because of their attitude. The room was beautiful with lots of space. The view of the pool was pretty and the property well maintained. I have stayed at many Marriott properties over the summer months and this is by far an excellent experience. The property does need renovation in the older section. They are doing a good job at keeping it operational during construction. Our family group ranged from children, teens, and grandma so they offered somthing for everyone to enjoy. Love the landscaping. I am impressed way to go Marriott with a great staff and beautiful property.

Reviews.Title: “Does not meet Marriott quality standards!!! Remodeling and cleanliness needed.”
Reviews.Author: Estibalitz
Reviews.Content: We exchanged one week through interval and expected a nicer villa, like the ones we have in our resort. The carpet and the chairs were stained. The bathroom smelled bad. We found cockroaches in the villa 4 out of 7 days!!! I called housekeeping, and they told me....Oh itÂ´s Florida, there everywhere!! The appliances were rusty and the whole villa needed an urgent remodeling. I am sad that I exchanged a very good week and I received a very old villa. The resort is beautiful and conveniently located, but they are so late in their remodeling process that it is not worth to go there, unless you are sure to get a villa in good conditions. I am a very satisfied Marriott vacation club owner, but if I would have gone here before buying, I would never have bought any weeks. Next time I go to Orlando, I will ask for another resort.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: ClePaffle
Reviews.Content: Don't stay here. I can't beleive this is a Marriot. It's completely run down. The rooms have not been renovated and they smell moldy and musty. Everything is outdated. I didn't want to sit on any of the furniture because it was damp. SO GROSS! I'm also shocked at the great reviews. Are we at the same hotel? We could have done much better. I'm so dissapointed. The only good thing about the hotel is that the staff is really nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: kb1321
Reviews.Content: The location was as everyone had said...perfect. We visited SeaWorld, Discovery Cove, and Aquatica and were just a few minutes from those parks. We had a 3 bedroom villa and a 1 bedroom villa in bldg 95. The rooms did have a musty smell and could be a bit cleaner, but overall our experience was very good and we would definitely return. I think the air is so humid in Orlando, it's probably hard to avoid the musty smell??? I would suggets removing the carpet for starters and just use area rugs that can be easily replaced. It was my first stay in Orlando, so I have nothing else to really compare it to. Extremely pleased with the size of the villas and the location. Away from the chaos further down on International Drive.

Reviews.Title: “Does not meet Marriott Standards”
Reviews.Author: alstrooper
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott as part of a timeshare sales preview and were informed the Grande Vista is sold out for timeshare purchase. I let the sales person know I would never consider purshasing at this site anyway! Overall, the property looks impressive, the pools are beautiful, and the staff is courteous. However, the property is 11 years old and shows much wear and tear in the rooms. Cleanliness and maintenance were the main issues from my experience. Some of the rooms have been 'renovated' with the Marriott bedding package, nice art work, granite countertops etc. But what is the point of these renovations if the rooms have bug problems, musty/mold problems, and cleaniness issues? In our first room (1 bedroom unit), my husband was bitten by a nasty bug with scorpian like pinchers while sleeping in the sofa bed (which by the way was the most uncomfortable sofa bed he every slept in). My daughter was right next to him when it happened and she was very upset trying to sleep at night for the rest of the vacation. Someone from Marriott declared the bug harmless but said they would fumugate the room. We said do what you need to do, but we are getting out of there. We had to push a little bit but finally obtained another unit (2 bedroom unit). This unit was suppose to be in one of their newest buildings but it was extremely moldy, especially the master bedroom. We have mold allergies and were not feeling so great after the 2 days we spent there. We were too exhausted from our park days to contemplate requesting another room. One other note: both rooms had a grimy feel to them. I had to clean black finger print marks and other dirt marks off of doors and walls in both rooms. In both rooms, there were stains on the carpet and all of the dining chairs. Most annoying was the sales presentation. There was no pressure and our sales person was very nice but after our experience it just did not sit right to hear this nonstop stream on the wonders and consistency of the Marriott brand. They wanted us to committ to a $25,000 timeshare for their latest resort. I am sure these resorts are beautiful when they first open but 10 years later, people have worn them down and Marriott just cannot hold to proper maintenance and cleaning standards in my opinion. We had also stayed at a Disney timeshare resort during this same vacation, and I have to say Disney does a much better job maintaining their properties.

Reviews.Title: “Grande Vista not completely grand”
Reviews.Author: delledge
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are Marriott Vacation Club owners and we exchanged our week for the Grande Vista property this past August. Interval International agents suggested that if we wanted to make a special request for room location, etc, to contact the property directly within 48 hours of our arrival. I did just that. Upon arrival, I was assisted by front desk staff who seemed quite indifferent to accommodating my request and as it turned out, not only did he NOT meet my special phoned in request, but did not accommodate our reservation confirmation for 2 double beds in the 2nd bedroom. Thankfully, he didn't meet the 2 dbl bed request because the room we were assigned was sub par. It strongly smelled of mildew and one bathroom was filled with an odor I hate to describe. The furniture had seen better days. The door was located at the end of the corridor near a trash can and the overflowing trash on the ground attracted a pair of raccoons who were gathering a feast only raccoons would love! Once the raccoons scurried away with their treasure, we headed back to the front desk and received a different room assignment so to have the necessary 2 dbl beds in our 2 bedroom suite. The new assignment was a distinct improvement all the way around. Our new room was wonderful. Here are some notes regarding our 8 night stay: Room quality: Very good. Beds and pillows were great. Kitchen appliances and utensils good. TVs great, but remote controls were a problem. Maintenence required twice. Bathrooms a bit small but fine. Balconies: All ground floor balconies are screened and various balconies on floors 2-6 are screened. Neither of our balconies were screened and we preferred that. Our balconies had a table, four chairs, ceiling fan and light. Marriott staff: We really liked all the grounds keepers, housekeeping, and maintenence staff. The folks at the Marketplace were always personable. Pools: Really nice. Nature Trail: There is a wonderful nature trail on the grounds of this property. I highly recommend exploring it--with closed toed shoes. It is definitely a NATURE trail! Ease to travel anywhere off property: It is best to have a car. Marriott does not have a courtesy van/shuttle to/from theme parks, etc. Apparently it's a 35 dollar cab ride to a Disney park. Preview tour stuff: What a pain! We received 3 calls and one request in person to sign up for a preview tour. I was so disappointed in their assertiveness--they must be desperate! Front desk staff: This is why the rating I assigned is only a 3, along with the disappointing appearance and odor of the 1st room we were assigned. The front desk staff is not friendly, barely courteous, and they made more mistakes with our reservation information than I have detailed here. And I know it wasn't just me. While waiting in lines, I noticed other guests receiving mediocre treatment by staff who seemed quite disinterested in the work they were doing. Very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort”
Reviews.Author: LadyB-NJ
Reviews.Content: We are timeshare owners here. We have been visting this resort for the last six years and still love it. We have never had a problem here. The grounds are meticulously landscaped. The villas have every amenity you could ask for. Disney is 5 minutes in one direction and Universal is 5 minutes in the other direction. Seaworld is across the street. There are so many great restaurants along International Drive and close by. This timeshare was the best purchase we ever made. Guaranteed vacation every year to a luxurious and FUN place to be!

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tiggersam00
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Marriott Grande Vista, and couldn't have been happier with it! Our room was beautiful (I have noticed some people have made comments about the "out of date" colors in the room, but pastels and corals are very traditional in Florida), and I found the room to be very new and modern. When you can have a full kitchen on vacation it sure does make a difference on your walett! We bought food and wine at the Publix right down the road and after a day at a park, found it quiet nice to be able to whip up a quick meal and be comfortable and relaxed rather then rushing out to dinner. The pools were wonderful and even in December the weather was great. There is a big mix of people staying at the resort (which is common when you head to the parks), and there were activities for all. I liked Grande Vista so much that I am taking my whole family back again this December - all 9 of us- to stay in a 3 bedroom 3 bath suite. Can't wait!

Reviews.Title: “Grand Vacation”
Reviews.Author: ace4you
Reviews.Content: We visited Grande Vista by swapping our Marriott Timeshare in Las Vegas for a 11 day stay (7/5 - 7/17). After reading previous reviews we called in advance to request a remodeled room away from the pool but within walking distance. It is possible we received better treatment as Marriott owners but our stay was truly enjoyable. I made sure to find out the managers name/email and sent several messages prior to our arrival. We (2 adults, kids 8 and 11) chose this resort to be close to the disney theme parks yet far enough away to enjoy some peace and quiet. The commute to the disney parks was 15-20 minutes max at 8:30 a.m. The accomodations (2 bed, 2 bath) were very spacious, clean and modern. We stayed in building 78, room 8443 and had an excellent lake view, with a short walk to the pool. We did receive maid service the first 3 days and than, we had to call and request towels but this was acceptable. We would have prefered that the initial maid service would have been spread out. The BBQ facilities were sufficient and clean. The staff was very helpful for any requests we had. The pool ran out of towels on a few days which was frustrating but we used towels from our villa. Very good drinks at the Copo Loco but they were a little pricey. We did not dine here as we had a 2 bedroom with kitchen, Super Wal-mart, and Costco we within a 10 minute drive, Publix groceries 5 minutes away. The pools were busy as expected in the middle of summer but not over crowded. There were lots of friendly 'loss prevention' staff visible throughout the property which made my wife and children feel safe and comfortable. They can improve their outdoor basketball courts by fencing in the area to avoid balls rolling into the brush. This is an excellent resort for kids and close to all the theme parks. We would stay here again. Thumbs up to Marriott on this property, we were treated very well as Marriott owners would expect.

Reviews.Title: “don't judge a book by it's cover”
Reviews.Author: arthanial
Reviews.Content: when I arrived at the hotel I thought it was very nice looking. the pool scene was great and the landscape is fabulous. When we got to the room it looked nice as well. We were impressed at first. We had a nice two room suite with a patio. It really started well. Then we tried to turn on the television and noticed that half of the suite didn't have electricity. So we called MX and they reset the circuit breaker. whatever.....but later when we plugged in our computers/cell phones the electricity went out again. When we called the maintanence guy again he informed us that we shouldn't plug in our things in one of the bedrooms. So apparantly they were aware of the electrical problem, but were yet booking the room out. I'm not an expert on electricity, but I do know that electrical surges are dangerous. and ignoring a short circuit is dangerous. If the circuit breaker doesn't work properly the problem could start a fire. I was really disappointed to find out that the marriott grande vista knew about this problem, but was still booking the room anyway. it is a hazard and an inconvenience. hopefully this is an isolated occurrance, but please be on the lookout if you are staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but not what I expected.”
Reviews.Author: travelpro78
Reviews.Content: I am a very serious traveler, so when I book a place I expect a few things, a clean room, not just a neat room, there is a difference. Overall the resort is nice there are things to do throughout the day and into the evening. The pools are a good size and there is ample seating. The only restaurant I can mention is the Pizza Hut. I only ordered once, the food was as expected. I can not really talk much about resort itself because we spent most of our time at WDW. The rooms need to be updated, they look like something out of 1983. The beds though were very comfortable, even the pull out sofa. The kitchen was well stacked and the employees are very friendly and helpful. My husband notice a roach at 1am. I did not see any but he did see one night during our seven day stay. *The resort is very close to Sea World, Discovery Cove, and Aquatica. The I-trolley will take you there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience at Marriott GV”
Reviews.Author: Upstatefamily
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week in late July early August and had a wonderful experience. We were lucky enough to get a 3 bedroom-3 bathroom suite through our timeshare exchange and we had lots of room. The suite was well furnished and we were pool side in the clubside part of the resort. I loved the location. Our pool area was quiet with plenty of room and we could walk to the main pools for activities when we wanted. We enjoyed playing golf on the Nick Faldo course and also took part in one of the clinics. Our son who is 11 was able to play for free which was a great bonus. We also enjoyed using the practice range. The fitness center was small but I think that was due to the renovations that are taking place in that area - and we were able to access the elicitical equipment when we wanted... Staff was very accommodating and responded right away to an issue we had with one of the televisions. We definitely utilized the kitchen and cooked several meals for ourselves. Location was very convenient to Sea World/Aquatica and Universal. Also easy access to Disney. We highly recommend...

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Grand”
Reviews.Author: fairadvisor
Reviews.Content: My family own a timeshare with another property, not with Marriotts, but was able to trade with one of the Marriotts properties. We considered ourselves lucky for even being able to get a condo at the Grande Marriotts in the middle of August in Florida. The entrance to the property is grand. According to my spouse, Grande Vista is a beautiful resort! When we checked in, the lady in the front desk gave us a puzzled look and said that we are already checked out. We just arrived! We had to wait for quite sometime before the problem was resolved. The moment we entered the room, there was already a pungent smell. The smell was a cross between a wet carpet and molds. The bathroom was not that clean either. The rest of the unit is clean so we decided to let go of the odor. We hoped that the smell will eventually go away. Unfortunately, the odor remained in the room. We had to call room service for an air freshener. They kindly responded to us. After 2 attempts of aerating the room, we gave up. We were worried that the molds will make our kids sick. We requested for a room change. We were informed that there were a lot of newer units and because a lot of these units were empty, we can definitely request for one. We asked for a newer unit but unfortunately, we were assigned to an old unit again. The front desk personnel who helped us during the room change was rude. The odor in the room we moved into was not as bad but had bugs this time. We got tired of complaining so we ignored the bugs. A Marriotts Timeshare salesperson contacted us for a presentation, free breakfast, and free spending money in Disney. We initially agreed to attend but we changed our minds because we did not want to purchase a timeshare that does not seem to take care of its property and its clients. This Marriotts did not live up to our expectations. The old units, the odor, and the bugs would have been ignored but customer service ( the front desk in particular ) is definitely a turn-off.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but not quite as good as expected”
Reviews.Author: MikeHibb666
Reviews.Content: My wife and I (both 39) and kids (14 and 12) stayed for a week with the main aim being close to Universal parks, which it is (it's also very close to Sea World and Aquatica - try this water park if you haven't already - mega). I had booked this hotel largely based on its Best for Families award and so I was probably expecting it to be more than it offered. It's nice enough - nothing of any significance to be of particular concern - but it didn't blow us away. It's a large resort but the only decent (ie non park quality) food was in Nick's Grill, which was very nice with good staff. We therefore spent most of our week going off-site for decent restaurants. We booked a 2 bedroom villa which comprised a standard double room with en-suite connected to a larger double room with larger bathroom, larger kitchen area, lounge, two balconies and a jacuzzi bath. Big plus points were the spacious accomodation, which for us was more than adequate, the in-room facilities (including full washing machine and dryer, large fridge, small fridge, 3 tv's and dvd players etc etc) and the jacuzzi, which after a long day walking around the parks was fantastic. All of this adds up to good value. The downside to the 'villa' was that it was on the sixth floor and, as we found out to our annoyance, close to the large air conditioning units on the roof.
