I did speak to a very helpful member of the maintenance staff but, unsurprisingly, nothing could be done. It's possible that the management would have moved us if we had insisted but, having unpacked for the second time on our trip, we didn't fancy packing again. There are a number of pools spread out throughout the site, although we only used one of them, which was quiet and nice. There are also BBQ areas all around the resort which are available for use (gas and charcoal). We did make use of this one night when visited by friends and this was a good facility for a night off from more formal dining. Overall, the resort is above average but because of the lack of good restaurants on site and the noise from the air conditioning we can only give it 4/5. Admittedly, not all of the rooms will suffer from this but those on the top floors will.

Reviews.Title: “It was okay-The picuture on line was better”
Reviews.Author: vacationwithfamily7
Reviews.Content: I was very excited when I saw the picture online with all the pools; the images looked so inviting...BUT when you get there it's a different story. The resort needs to be updated. They have about 6 buildings called "The West" that are newly built and they are usually booked by Grande Vista Timeshare Holders- SO forget about requesting the rooms because they make no promises to place you in any room; however, the staff will take requests which means nothing when you arrive.. The shower smelled really bad.. You can tell the rooms are not thoroughly cleaned-just enough to look nice. The newer buildings and renovated buildings are far from the main attractions: The Maze, Front Desk, and etc... The elevator areas are very dirty and hot!!! My kids did enjoy the day camp for $30.00 a day from 11-3 ( rip off)...The beds are very comfortable.. It was okay; I will go back only if I can get in the new building.

Reviews.Title: “Not very enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: foodie109
Reviews.Content: The room was efficient and the bed clean and comfy. The room did smell a little musty though. Our room did not have a blow dryer and the hotel ran out of them. They even called in the morning to wake us up to tell us they could not locate one! If your room is near one of the pools - be warned it will be loud in your room! Then after an exhausting day in Orlando (in July!) we could not go to sleep as someone was having a huge party with LOUD music and yelling and screaming. We are not old, but we ended up calling the front desk to complain and then we had to call security directly. It took about an hour to shut it down! Would not go back..

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: valdan19881988
Reviews.Content: My kids and I went with my parents for a 5 night stay at Grand Vista. We loved the condo - plenty of space and very clean. The staff was very helpful. Housekeeping called every day to see if we needed their service and brought towels twice a day. This resort is very large so it's not fun to walk so far to everything in the heat. There were always staff members on golf carts that can shuttle you where you want to go. My neices played in the indoor playground. It is in need of updating as well as the game room. The view from our room was beautiful. We enjoyed sitting on the balcony at night listening to the surroundings. This resort is very quiet. It was full every night but we did not hear anyone around us.

Reviews.Title: “Owners since 2002...may be time for improvements”
Reviews.Author: NWOHGAL
Reviews.Content: We have been owners at the Grande Vista since 2002 and have always loved our stays. During our last visit, July 18-26 2008, I must say that some improvements need to be made. The golf course is a mess and the club house staff was very rude. My husband had requsted a rain check after having just played only 3 holes of golf before a storm came through and was treated very badly for just asking. He was given the credit to finish the game, but it was just the idea of it all. No staff to police unruly children at the pool. I don't understand why people let their children play in/on areas clearly marked "Do not climb on waterfalls". In the past someone would at least walk through just to check on things. Increases in ALL or at least many of the resort activities. $15 for a 30 min. bike ride or paddle boat...Wow! We were pleased to see that Marriott was doing an impressive renovation to the food court and kids play area. We were told that it did not come from our yearly maintenance fees which is nice if it's true. DO NOT go to the sales presentations if you don't plan on buying another timeshare! We went just to see the new property opening in 2010 and our salesman was really pushy. I felt bad for a couple at the next table that were not currently owners trying to tell the guy No thanks. Marriott is very very pushy to sell their villas! I hope when I return to see the golf course in much better condition, pool staff, and an overall better experience.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Every Minute an overall great time.”
Reviews.Author: brianli5
Reviews.Content: We are a family 7 and had a wonderful time on this property. We stayed in the Madrid building which was very accessible at all. This is property is close to all Disney World Attractions. Very kid friendly. There is even an indoor play area for small kids. Food was good. Service was good. We will definately go back to The Grande Vista.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience for Family and Friends”
Reviews.Author: kentonsxng
Reviews.Content: This is the 2nd year we've spent a week at Marriott Grande Vista and I couldn't be happier after 7 great days in a 3-bedroom Villa. We stayed in Building 77 (Costa Brava) where the rooms were clean, the view breath-taking, and living area spacious. The 3-bedroom units are rated for 12, so the 8 of us were really comfortable. If something is broken, not working properly, or isn't up to your standards, the maintenance team is right there to address it. Simply call the front desk, tell them the problem, and within 2 hours its fixed. The beds and linens are super comfortable. Daily Maid service does a good job making the beds and cleaning things up. Often times when you go to a hotel or resort, where the on-site restaurant is too pricy or the food isn't up to standards.... Thats NOT the case here. Nick's Grill is reasonably priced, excellent service, and the food is mouth-watering. You have to try the "British-Open Burger." They also have daily specials. The pools are spacious and plentiful. We went to 4 hot-tubs and 3 big pools while we were there. The only down-side is the depth max is 5 feet. I would prefer a deeper adult pool, but for insurance/liability and catering to younger kids, the decision to keep it fairly shallow makes sense. My Group consisted of Male 30, Couple 24 & 19, Couple 29 & 26, Male 18, Male 19, and Male 20. I highly recommend this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Resort”
Reviews.Author: Cheryl230
Reviews.Content: We are Marriott Rewards members and were invited to stay at the Grande Vista for 5 days and 4 nights for a great deal so long as we heard the 90 minute talk. It was definitely worth it. All staff were very accommodating and friendly. Be Sure to be picky about your room at the desk. We were not and we were first given an extremely musty 1 bedroom suite that made me feel nauseaous. It took me no more than 5 minutes to call the front desk and it took them no more that 10 minutes to have us in our new wonderful1 bedroom suite overlooking the golf course and a stream that we really did see an alligator. The suite was all that we wanted and more. Full kitchen with washer and dryer and dishwasher, breakfast bar, dining area and living room with a Tv. Separate king-size bed bedroom with a TV and a jacuzzi and a screened in porch overlooking the golf course. The bathroom was giant size with just a shower but terrific water pressure. The grounds were well-groomed with 5 pools, one for anyone's pleasure, including children or not. One had a poolside bar. It was very convenient to DW. Maybe 20 minute ride.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Grande vista”
Reviews.Author: Hackensack_NJNas
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our stay at the Marriott Grande Vista. We had a superb time. Of course we were on a timeshare preview promotion but I must admit after our 5 day 4 night stay, we were tempted. We declined and of course were offered another stay next year for 8 days/7 nights for a total of $595 at any other timeshare resort by Marriott so we'll take them up on this. The property is beautiful. I do believe they needed to expand the fitness facility and when we went on the sale presentation, the agent showed us new construction where they are expanding the facility. We were in buiding 98 1 bed room king suite with washer/dryer and full kitchen with a patio. There was plenty of room. There are 6 pools total on the property. The one behind bldg 98 was nice but the unit they wanted to sell us that pool was fantastic. Secluded location...in some ways too spreadout I would jump in the car to go to the main bulding for coffee. but after a few days your in the swing of things. On one occasion there was 1 or 2 morons...chugging cases of beer to the pool and acting DUMB...This was my time to take the kids upstairs. Someone else must have complained because they were not there long. I would say the only thing I hated was the maid service. For some reason they would take the soiled towels but never replace enough. Location to Seaworld, the interstate and the airport is great!!! Make sure to stop by the 7-Eleven and give Joe the local pizza guy from NYC your business. Joe is a great guy who helped my family a lot during our stay with fantastic tips. Lastly, the timeshare preview stay is worth the trip and although the tour is 90 minutes very enjoyable but this is a great way to do Disney on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Grande Vista.”
Reviews.Author: Mulla
Reviews.Content: Check in was a breeze, asked for a newly renovated room with a golf view which we got. The rooms were big with a relatively soulless bathroom. The room had a microwave, a coffee maker and a fridge. The bed was king sized and was comfortable, there was also a sofa bed in the room. The concierge people was helpful and informative. This hotel is so huge, getting from one part to another is a good 6-8 mins walk, there is a courtesy shuttle to take you around but not worth the wait. There are a couple of onsite restaurants with a marketplace near the reception which was convenient. The hotel is near Sea World and approx 20 min drive to Universal and 30 min to Disney parks.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite Marriott Timeshare”
Reviews.Author: travellenfool
Reviews.Content: I stayed June 19-26 in a two bedroom in building 82. When you request a room make sure it is near one of the main pools if not it's quite a walk. The resort had free rock climbing and daily activities. Some were a small fee. We paid 30.00 per child for a kids night out. My children loved the people and the lunch that was given to them. You wont go wrong with this resort. They let us check in at 11am. I don't have one complaint about the Grand Vista.

Reviews.Title: “The Best - Read This”
Reviews.Author: Jazz77
Reviews.Content: We booked this property with Interval Timeshares. We booked a two-bedroom villa. We called the property several weeks prior to our arrival requesting a newly renovated unit, on a high floor, with a good view. Our requesting paid off as we recieved a spetacular unit #5606. A unit on the top floor, with a superb view of Grande Vista's lake. The unit was very modern, clean, and newly renovated with granite counter tops, nice tvs and great beds. There were two balconies, one screened in and the other was not. The master bedroom had a shower, double sinks, and huge jetted tub. The other bedroom had two queen beds, and a nice sized bath. Parking was free, and nice. The golf course looked nice and the resort features tons of things to do, from the kids center to renting paddle boats. There are four pools, and the one closest to the main building we liked best. The absolute best thing was the LOCATION. You have all of the attractions and dining of International Drive, but you seem like you are miles from it. What I mean is the hotel is right off of the I-Drive, but it is tucked away into the trees about a 1/2 mile from the main road. It was terrific! Seconds to the SeaWorld parks, Disney is right around the corner, and Universal is not far. When we checked in, they offered us a meeting with a Timeshare saleman, for a 90 minute presentation, tour of property, and breakfast. Plus you get a $100 gift card to either Disney or Marriott. The timeshare presentation lasted three hours, and we decided it was not for us at that present day, maybe in the future. BUT IF YOU ARE INTO TRAVEL, WE RECOMMEND YOU GO TO THE PRESENTATION!! Ask for the salesman named GERMAN FUENTES! HE WAS TERRIFIC AND NICE, NOT TO MENTION HE PASSION. Great guy. DID NOT WANNA LEAVE!!! Ask me if you have questions!

Reviews.Title: “Great get-away!”
Reviews.Author: MrsA0630
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott Grande Vista through the Interval International timeshare. We were originally booked to stay at a resort on the gulf coast, which was a DUMP, so we were lucky to get into the Marriott. Although our trip was to check out the beaches on the gulf coast, we had a great time at the Marriott. The pools are very nice and we never had a problem finding a chair. The pool drinks at Copa Loca are great too. A little pricey, but worth it. Try the strawberry daqueri/pina coloda mixed one. The rooms were very nice. We had an efficiency and had plenty of room for my husband and I. It had a king sized bed as well as a pull out couch, a nice kitchen area, and a screened in patio. Our villa overlooked the golf course. We did go to the timeshare presentation and altough we did not purchase, it was good information plus we received a $100 Marriott gift card which we used to purchase waterpark tickets and pool drinks. The staff was very accommodating. We ordered fresh towels 2 of the days we were there and they arrived promptly. The consierge was also very helpful when we had questions. We felt at ease with the gated security 24 hours a day and the loss prevention staff that roamed the grounds often. My only complaint is that the walls are thin and we had neighbors that woke up earlier than us so it made it a little hard to sleep in. This would be a great resort for families since it is near all the Disney parks and the resort has many daily activities for the little ones.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice resort...”
Reviews.Author: Troy S
Reviews.Content: We went as a timeshare preview throught the Marriot Rewards club, which I purchased a year and a half ago. I didn't really want to go, but was glad I did. We had a one bedroom suite/condo in Bldg 100, overlooking the Faldo Golf Institute. Room was fabulous, clean, well-appointed, spacious for us and our teenage son (slept on sofa pull-out). The full kitchen was great as was the washer/dryer in our suite. Large whirlpool tub in master bedroom. Spacious bathroom. We cooked or ate off campus. Did have cocktails at the Lighthouse bar, and the were good, Theresa the bartender was great. The pool was very nice. The time share pitch went a little longer than promised (almost 2 hours) but was very low pressure. I would stay there again but don't plan on returning to Orlando ever again (third time there, too much traffic...etc) Since we're not timeshare owner's, daily housekeeping was included (fresh towels...etc). Coffee and filters, as well as dishwasher detergent, dishsoap & sponge, papertowels, and a small box of laundry detergent were included! Wireless internet worked well. Cable TV offers many channels, plus the room had a DVD player.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Resort”
Reviews.Author: EssaruVa
Reviews.Content: This resort is gorgeous!! My now hubby and I stayed here for our honeymoon for a week. He called and told the resort that it was our honeymoon and they never once bothered us about timeshare information. Check in was a breeze, we got there around 12 pm not expecting to get a room right away but it never hurts to check. The lady working the front desk got us a one bedroom villa in building 100. The villa was great!! Clean, well appointed furniture, and everything we needed was provided in the kitchen. Our balcony overlooked part of the driving range. The bed was very comfortable which was all I cared about. On our last day we did some laundry and housekeeping brought us extra detergent when we called for more. We didn't visit any of the pool areas but did visit the Marketplace. Not exactly what I expected but if we had needed anything it was provided. I liked the location of the resort which is nicely situated between Disney and Universal and right down the street from Sea World. I can't say enough great things about this place. We would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great exchange in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: sfanelli0208
Reviews.Content: My husband and I exchanged through IntvervalWorld.com. The grounds were beautiful and so were the rooms. The rooms were recently updated. The location is close to Sea World and other great Orlando attractions.

Reviews.Title: “What a dump! Dirty rooms, WAY overpriced!”
Reviews.Author: Altitude9600
Reviews.Content: I can't believe what this place attempts to charge for its rooms. We got a deal through Interval for a "Studio suite". This was in fact a very small hotel room with no windows. The sliding glass door was blocked if you pulled out the sleeper sofa. The restaurant (Nicks) REFUSED to make me a grilled cheese sandwich because I am an adult, so I had to go to Denny's down the street! The bathroom was filthy, with dirty handprints all over the door. Two tiny cardboard like towels. There was never, for the entire week, anyone at the pool with pool towels. The laundry facilities = two machines shared by a couple hundred rooms. GOOD LUCK with that. Up, down, up, down the stairs to check and it was busy every time. What a waste of a vacation. This place was actually did sort of ruin our trip. I will stay at Mystic Dunes again next time, it is well worth the short drive to Sea World.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: toastmaster1
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a great location near Sea World. 15 mins to Universal and Disney's gates. Plenty of free parking and no silly service fees or nickel-and-diming like other places. The rooms are beautiful and well-equipped. The balcony was an unexpected bonus. I arrived in the morning and my room was ready. The only negative was spotty room service. All the towels in the bathroom were collected but some weren't replaced. One day the room wasn't cleaned at all. Besides that, highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Best Resort - Completely Speechless at how wonderful this place is!”
Reviews.Author: vester44
Reviews.Content: There is a REASON this is listed as one of the top 10 family resorts at tripadvisor.com. We got to the property, which was so gorgeous, its difficult to describe. The lake with the duck and swam boats and fountain is gorgeous. The front desk was wonderful. We did have to wait until the obligatory 4pm check in, but they let us have a corner in the back play room to put my daughter down for a nap.... - there were activiteies like fingerpainting, a bonfire, and play room, unbelievable. The duck and swan boats do charge extra - 10 dollars per half hour, but well worth the fun! The property has a pizza hut (which delivers woo hoo!) and Edy's ice cream. They have a store which is fully stocked and even has a grill for sandwiches etc. The pools in the center of the property are unbelievable. All are heated. The baby pool, too! They are fantastic, including a little spash center with fountains splashing up that the kiddos love. So relaxing and I havent even gotten to the room yet! When we walked in the room....I just....stopped. Holy cow. I've stayed in a lot of nice places, and regular rooms too for work. I have never seen anything like this - pictures did not do it justice. The kitchen was massive and fully stocked with dishes, etc. including wine glasses (which we utilized thank you very much!) Plus, there is a washer dryer, which is fantastic and got a lot of use! The frig and dishwasher were great to have too. The dining room table seats (wait for it....) 6 people. Unbelievable (can I stop staying that? no....!) The front room was really nice - TV was great. The bedroom has a chase lounge and the bed was super super soft. The jacuzzi tub seats two and was huge. There was a place to put makeup on, etc. there as well. The bathroom was alos huge with a wonderful shower, and two sinks. Seriously - huge. The best part? The deck. It was beautiful to look out onto the pool which was by our hotel (different than the pools at the main part) and the lake. We stayed in building 92. I have never wanted so much to go back to a place. It is 15 min from Disney - great, easy super easy drive if you go 536 instead of I-4 which I highly recommend. Its about 2 seconds from Seaworld and Aquatica :) Its about 10 min from Universal and that stuff :) Totally wonderful - would go back again in a heartbeat. Dont even hesitate to even think about staying here. The staff and the location and the room and the amenities are wonderful. Best stay of my life, and I have been a lot of places. :)

Reviews.Title: “absolutely fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: razin3kids
Reviews.Content: My family of 6 (3 kids, 3 adults) just returned from the Grande Vista. It was great. We had a two bed two bath with plenty of space. Because of our flight we arrived very early but was able to use the pool and eat pool side at the copa loca grill. Our room was ready at 3pm which was 1 hour earlier than promised. The room was very nice with all the dishes etc... However I was in building 83 which is an older unit. The cabinets had some wear and tear (very minor) but the room was still very nice with a comfy bed and down comforters. One negative was that there is no free maid service. It cost us $44 for a full cleaning in both rooms. This was only for one day. Since we were gone most of the day, keeping the room clean ourselves was not an issue. We did have them come in the middle of the week to change linens clean bathrooms etc... The property is beautiful. Its sits off international drive a bit, so it is kinda nice to feel like your going to your own private property. Because this is a resort and not a hotel, there is no free continental breakfast, and the breakfast at Nick's grill is not to die for. However, if you don't have a car this is perfect. The resort offers so many free activities and even some competiton activities (tennis, table hockey) for a small fee. This is definitely a great place for families with a lengthy stay. The resort is very kid friendly with pools for just about everyone. However the marketplace is pretty pricey (5.79 for a box of cheerios!) If you have a car, walgreens, publix and walmart are not very far. We did have a slight problem with our dirty towels being picked up, but with a resort this big and this nice, it was a very minor issue. I booked through interval international and got a 2 bedroom for $550 for a whole week! This was definitely well worth the money. I also did a tour at the Horizions(to get some free tix) and the prices to buy one of these is pretty pricey, but it was not a hard sell presentation. All in all I rate my stay a 4 out of 5. The service was good, the rooms were very clean, and it was close to all the parks (disney, universal, and sea world.)

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: Antamy
Reviews.Content: This was really a wonderful place for our family vacation. We booked the 3 bedroom condo and it was ideal. The location is fairly close to the Orlando attractions. Pool facilities are great and the grounds are beautifully maintained.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: overnighttraveller
Reviews.Content: I recently returned from a quick three day stay at the Marriott Grande Vista. Based on previous stays at the resort, I requested a new or newly renovated unit and was told that I received a renovated one bedroom. The unit was spacious with a King bed in the bedroom and two entrances (one from bedroom and one from kitchen) which could be used if you had someone sleeping on the pull out sofa. Linens, furniture and carpet all appeared new, however it didn't seem that the kitchen or bath were part of the remodel. The kitchen had low end older appliances, kitchen and bath had older low end cabinetry and bathroom had lower end counters which did not make it feel luxurious. These were the only negatives about the unit and kept it from being 5 stars in my opinion. As always, the grounds were pretty and well-maintained as were the two pools I visited. I actually didn't visit the parks on this trip and spent a very pleasant two days just lounging at the pool. I prefer the main pools which are more scenic and have access to food/beverage, but there are also several smaller, quiet pools scattered through the property. I do recommend that you request a location near one of the main pools if this is important to you, as well as a new or newly renovated unit. I found that some units were a long walk to pools/main hub and had previously stayed in an older unit which was showing its wear.

Reviews.Title: “Smaller rooms are OK too”
Reviews.Author: nicolasj
Reviews.Content: I found a prepaid decent deal on the Marriott website for one of the smaller studio rooms. It was a good choice : - the property is great, a real resort, with nice views from the room - staff was correct (but at reception not really friendly) - towels, bedding, room amenities, everything was comfortable and in working order - excellent location Some mild negative points : - only one elevator for each building ... there can be some wait - elevators not really air-conditioned - concierge staff is sometimes available (with 3 at the same time), but at other moments there was just 1 person who could not deal with all the waiting customers at the same time

Reviews.Title: “What a fantastic, luxurious get-away!”
Reviews.Author: zagole
Reviews.Content: We traded our timeshare to stay here and we were very happy! We chose Grande Vista because of Trip Advisor's consistantly great reviews, and weren't dissappointed in any way. Our family of 5 had more than enough room in the 2 BR (we could have invited more to join us!). I really appreciated the room's red and gold decor, since it was elegant and not the typical Florida timeshare pastel. Since we have kids, we chose to be by the main pools. If we come again w/o kids, I'd still want to stay in bldg 82 again. It was one bldg away from main pool, so it was quiet. All the rooms around the lake are set up to overlook it, I believe. We arrived near noon, and were able to check in by 2pm and get our previously made special request to be near main bldg. This was important to us, since we often went back and forth from room to pool with the kids for food. I'd recommend stocking up the kitchen with meals, as the restaurants are, of course, expensive. The Pizza Hut had decent prices, though. The room had everything we needed. I'd recommend bringing a little, collapsable cooler to hold ice to keep drinks/snacks for pool days. I used the room's ice bucket for pops and Freezies. We would come here again. There are many nice timeshares in Orlando, but from experience, I'd say this is one of the best.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Vacation at Mariott Grande Vista!!”
Reviews.Author: beachloverontario
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our stay at the MGV (May 5-12) with our 4 and 9 year old daughters. What an amazing vacation. We were all sad to go home! Check in - Our room was not ready when we arrived at about 1:30pm. They kept our bags for us while we went to have lunch at the Copa Loca Grill on site. I always pack our bathing suits, shorts and sunscreen in our carry-on bag so we can change as soon as we get there and hit the pool. This is exactly what we did this time. As promised our room was ready by 4:00pm (the set check-in time). The staff at the check in counter were very friendly and informative, and we did not need to wait in line, as it was not very busy at the time. We were assigned a 2-bedroom unit as requested. A bellman drove us in one of the Marriott vans with our luggage to our room because it was a bit too far to walk with all our luggage. As it turned out it was not far at all to the lobby if you don't have several suitcases to carry. The bellman was also very friendly and helpful. Room - We were in building 83, which was not one of the newer rooms, but was still VERY nice and well appointed. As I mentioned, we did get a 2 bedroom, which was actually a 1 bedroom with a lock-off (adjoining) door to a second 1 bedroom. The first 1 bedroom suite had a full kitchen, bathroom with a large Jacuzzi tub and sink in one area and a second bathroom area with a shower, toilet and second sink. Very clean. There was also a screened in balcony, TV, and king size bed. There was a second TV in the living room, a large dining room table (seats 6) and a breakfast bar (seats another 3). The kitchen had granite counter tops and there was a stacked washer/dryer in the pantry of the kitchen (which we used a lot). There was also a pull out couch. The second bedroom had another king size bed, a pull out couch, balcony, bathroom, mini fridge, microwave, toaster etc. It was MUCH more than we needed, but was great to have. There was another TV in this second bedroom too. Our kids loved having their "own" space! We did not have a single problem with anything in our room. We called the front desk to request a jug so we could make our own lemonade and a brand new Rubbermaid jug was delivered shortly after we called. We even had a non-stick frying pan, which is something that we used daily. From our experience this is something that is often not provided. Facilities - There was so much to do at the resort. We spend most mornings at the beach area where the sand was beautiful. There was a volleyball net, which we used with our beach ball and one morning we went fishing off the beach, but didn't even get a bite. We went on the paddleboats, climbed the rock wall which was free. Anybody 45-250 lbs could try it. Our 9 year old loved it and went almost every day. It is located on the beach. There were bikes that you could rent but we didn't get a chance this time. We spent everyday at one of the pools. There are about 5 different ones. The 2 we tried were heated. One of the pools has a great splash pad with water cannons that the kids loved. The water was not as warm in that pool, but the other pools were a very nice temperature. There were hot tubs in each pool area, which were nice too. There was an incredible kids climbing area (similar to the ones at MacDonaldâ€™s), which was great for the kids if they wanted to get out of the heat. This was free too. There were several childrenâ€™s, adults and teens organized activities daily. Some were free and some were not. There is a schedule at the front desk that tells you what is on all week. We went to the campfire where we made smores. They provided everything for free (stick, marshmallows, chocolate and graham crackers). They lit a nice bonfire and had some music. It was very nice and fun for all. Restaurant - The Copa Loca Grill served sandwiches, burgers, fries, cocktails etc. Food was good but rather pricey. It was convenient when you were swimming and got hungry, but we usually packed lunches in our cooler to take to the pool. We shopped at Publix and bought lots of groceries so that we could make most of our meals. This saved a ton of $$$$. Nicks Grills was excellent and I highly recommend it for dinner. The food was great and so was the service. We had dinner there twice. The prime rib is fabulous and you get a large portion! Good value too, but not cheap. Golf - My husband went every morning to the Faldo Golf institute to either play a round or 2 (9 hole course), or use the driving range/putting/chipping facilities. It is beautifully manicured and the grounds are amazing. Because we didn't have a vehicle some mornings instead of walking he would call the bellman at the front desk and they would pick him up at our room and drive him to Faldo's. He also got a ride back some days if he didn't fell like walking. He never had to wait more than 5 minutes for a ride. He also played a round of golf at Grand Pines, which is across the street from MGV. We did not have a car there so he got a ride from the bellman from our room to the golf course. He said Grand Pines was amazing too. There was so much to do right at the resort that we didn't go to any Disney parks or SeaWorld (which is 5 minutes away). Also, it was so hot (over 90 degrees) while we were there that we proffered to be by the pool this time and our kids did not once ask to go! Transportation - Many travellers mentioned that a car is needed. If you stay at MGV, we don't think you need a car. We took the I-ride Trolley to Publix for groceries, which was about a 5-minute ride. It stops right outside of the entrance (across the street) to MGV. You will need to get a bellman to give you a ride to the bus stop because the entrance from the rode to the buildings/lobby is too far to walk. When you return there is a phone right at the gate, which is a direct line to the front desk. We used this phone to call for a ride back to our room. The bellman never kept us waiting longer than 5 minutes. Our first trip to Publix we took a taxi ($10 each way) because we knew we were going to buy a lot of stuff - too much to take on the bus. The next time we took the I-ride Trolley. Almost across the street from Publix are the Premium Outlets, which was fantastic. We took the I-ride there a couple of times too. Lots of great shops! Next to Publix is a Walgreens too. Service - We experienced excellent service from all staff at MGV. Everybody was very accommodating, helpful and friendly. Overall I would rate MGV 5 out of 5 and recommend it to anybody wishing to take a vacation in Orlando. I donâ€™t think I missed anything, but if you have any questions do not hesitate to ask. I have posted a few photos of some of the things that I did not see photos of when reading other reviews. Enjoy. We are already planning our next trip to MGV. Can't wait!

Reviews.Title: “A Real Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: debi_yancy
Reviews.Content: We came down for a confrence that my husband had to attend and had decided to extend our stay and take a vacation at the Marriott Grand Vista. Oh What A Mistake!!! We had to wait 4 hours for our room which was not at all what was advertised, it was small, dark and right under the kiddie pool which is open until 11:00 p.m. We changed rooms, telling them before we moved, that the room was somewhat better but the maids had not picked up the used tissue under the sofa, they said they would have it taken care of immediately. (Never got picked up) At least the pool was quieter but the screen door was falling off, the carpet was dirty, the front door had gaps that any and every bug came through. The maids were rude and extremely lazy. They never left pool towels and wouldn't leave extra towels for the room so we were always short on towels. The garbage and dirty linen stayed out in the walkways over night. It's a real shame because the property is beautiful the service and rooms are horrible!!!!! We were disturbed by the Marriott's people that wanted to sell us a timeshare. They should take that time and money to fix up the resort first.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful property”
Reviews.Author: ngsix
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the MGV in April of this year. We had planned a getaway without our kids to relax a little and to also check out things for a possible family trip next year. We had been told about the resort by friends of ours who had visited last year. We rented a guest suite which was nice but we upgraded to a one bedroom later in the week. The property is beautiful and the staff are very friendly and helpful. We attended the time-share presentation which took longer than the 90 minutes that they promised but there was no pressure to buy. If you are visiting this resort it is probably a good idea to have a car as it is off the main road a bit (although that is nice because you are away from traffic etc) but it is a bit of a drive to go to the grocery stores and Disney parks etc. It is just a lot more convenient than buses etc. But the resort is situated well in that it is close to Sea World, Disney and Universal. The rooms were very clean as were the pools. The pool behind our building (91) was very convenient and not crowded at all. The main pool and the pool near the bar (Coco something or other) were larger and had more things for kids like water cannons etc but were obviously busier and louder. It is nice to have a choice though. Expect to have walk a bit around the resort as it is a rather large property. I would recommend the Marriott Grande Vista for a family vacation or a more quiet getaway. The option is there for both.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay at MGV”
Reviews.Author: goherd90
Reviews.Content: Well we decided to take our first trip to Disney with our two little one's (ages 2 and 4) so I traded in my timeshare for a gorgeous 3 BR unit in buidling 91. The unit was in great shape. It had a nice pool (never crowded) and several grills to use. I do not understand how others are complaining? No its not 5 star but I'd give it a solid 3.5 - 4. Yes one time the sink in the BR clogged but they immediately came to fix. They had plenty of activities for the kids. We took them on the DUCK paddle boats, road 4 seater bikes around the complex and also an inside play area. The gym for adults was adequate and they even gave massages. Since we were there the entire week we hit all the theme parks and the furthest drive may have been 15 minutes. There are plenty of restaurants within 10 miles on international drive for everyone's liking. I highly recommend this to everyone and would not hesitate to return.

Reviews.Title: “Time Share Weekend”
Reviews.Author: a410traveler
Reviews.Content: As a Marriott Rewards customer I was offered a long weekend deal at this facility. While I'm not really a fan of time shares I dediced to give it a chance. I did not buy but I did have a really good time. The on-site food and drinks were reasonably priced and pretty good as well. the buildings and grounds were meticulously kept and very attractive. My room was nice but the air conditioner was a bit loud. The lanai face a large pond and was my favorite area to relax and read in. The sales staff described it as a five star facility but I only saw three stars myself. Perfect for families or just relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “We were impressed!”
Reviews.Author: DragonflyTrips
Reviews.Content: We traded our timeshare in Maine for a week at the MGV resort in Orlando. We loved it! We had just come from a week on the gulf coast with family and wanted another week to unwind and just do our own thing. It was just my husband and I, so we were a little concerned about going to Orlando with all the people and kids. We got a room on the top floor (6th) in building 91 which was right by a quiet pool and away from the hustle and bustle of the main pools and buildings. We had a wonderful view off of our balcony - of the hot tub, the pool, the grilling areas (they had 6 gas grills that the guests could use), the pond with turtles and gators in it, and the golf course. We spent several days right at the pool enjoying the sun. We had an efficiency room which was like a hotel room with a microwave, fridge and some dishes in the kitchenette. It was perfect for us! They offer up to 3 bedroom suites, which I understand are really nice. I would definitely recommend this resort!

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased, will return!”
Reviews.Author: Southcoaster
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grande Vista for two nights on our Florida vacation last week while visiting Universal. We chose a 2 bedroom, 2 bathroom villa as my best friend was staying with my family (myself, husband and 12 year old son), and we'd all have some degree of privacy if desired. We were not disappointed with our villa or our stay in the least! We were in the Clubside section in Building 95 and did not find the accommodations dated or run-down in the slightest-in fact until I read some reviews on this site just now I had no clue I was in the older part of the resort! We had ample privacy as our screened porch and balcony looked out onto palm trees and the golf course-we all agreed we'd rather be here than at a poolside villa! The setup worked out great for us and we loved having the washer/dryer and kitchen/dining area. The resort is only a 10 minute drive to Universal so it's pretty convenient! The only complaint was that the TV in the living room was dying-the tube must have been going as people looked like the kid in Willy Wonka that ate the blueberry gum! It was minor since there were two other TVs in the villa to use but I did alert the front desk. We also ate at the Edy's Ice Cream/Pizza Hut on the resort property-a little pricey but we expected that. Finances permitting, we plan on returning to FL next year to visit Sea World and stay at the Grande Vista again! Hopefully we can try out the quad bikes at the resort next time!

Reviews.Title: “Just ok...again”
Reviews.Author: rtwinboyz
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at MGV...Our first trip was horrible because of the old, dirty room and problems with service. We were called again for a timeshare "deal" and decided to give it another try. I totally understand saving the better rooms for owners, but when trying to sell timeshares to people, don't you think they would get a lot more sales if they made sure the rooms were clean, updated, and service was good?Check-in was fine...we requested a room close to a pool since we were with our 6 yo twins and 6mo baby. We stayed in a 1 bedroom villa...it was ok...updated, but still not great. Appliances were old...bathroom was old....whirlpool was dirty (old hairs in it, GROSS!!)...no wow factor whatsoever. We did get the kitchen this time, which worked out great with the kids. We had a problem with the toilet the first day there...had to take my sons out before 7am to find a bathroom because our toilet wouldn't flush. A guy came and snaked it, only to have it clog up again the next morning. Waited for maintenance...called at 7am and was told they would "be right there". Called again to be told that they didn't start work until 8 and then had a meeting. A worker didn't show up until after 9 and again had to snake the toilet. He was then supposed to call housekeeping to come clean the bathroom immediately, but they didn't show until almost 3pm. We told them to forget it because the baby had just fallen asleep and my husband had already cleaned the bathroom. The front desk then calls to see why we "refused" housekeeping. Maybe if it didn't take them 5 hours to get there, we would have been fine! Went to the sales presentation...it is more like 2 hours...our guy was nice enough...we told him that service at MGV makes his job selling timeshares a lot harder. I have stayed in nicer and better run Marriott's near Sesame Place and Hershey in PA. When his talk was over, another guy comes over to "close" the presentation. Offered us another stay since we weren't buying at that time (and never will!!) I would stay again, but know what to ask for. You have to stay on top of things. The grounds at MGV are beautiful. There is lots to do and lots of activities planned for all ages. My guys were happy to just be in the pool. It is set back off a queit section of International Drive, which is a nice feature. We got lots at Publix and that saves $! There were fastfoods close by...saw Wendy's and some others. Not really more than a five minute drive. We asked for a pack and play and high chair the first day. Got them in a few hours. Got a call the next afternoon to make sure we got the PnP and chair....shouldn't they follow that up a little sooner?? How about they check our broken toilet??? MGV was ok for the price we paid. I would definitely NOT be happy if I was paying $300 a night for this room and "service".

Reviews.Title: “Cool place for Family with kids of all ages”
Reviews.Author: 4StarFamilyFun
Reviews.Content: Summer Family fun in Orlano. The Grande Vista is perfect y located for families looking to have fun at Orlando amusement attractions..(closer to Sea World than Disney).GET A CAR...you will need one....the food on site is limited eventhough it is open late......no fast food close by either The Property (It is a time share ) that is going through renovations...try and get a renovated villa if you can pay the extra $$$ its worth it if you value 4-5 star accomodations. If not the base villas aren't bad at all...the place is HUGE we got lost trying to find our villa ....Several pools and activites to chose from..I recommend getting started early and making the most of what the property offers...on site tennis, basketball. Pools and poolside dining on both sides of the property w/ adult and kiddie pools (try and visit both) pools open late....teens will like that (mine did). Bars open late as well...you may like that (I did) Golf Pro Shop was really nice...and large well manicured course for those who play...The Coutry Club is where the nicer resturant is located...worth a go see for quiet mom & dad dinner if you can get away (kids are welcome of course) There is a rather large arcade (open late) and Gym , with an ice cream shoppe (not free) and mini mart for snacks...etc..TAKE WALKIE TALKIES to keep up with the kiddos Rooms are large and offer plenty of space to spread out and get away from each other, washer/dryer for swim gear (and sweaty clothes), kitchen for cooking, left overs, bottled water and sodas (do go by local Publix and pick up some $$ saving items drinks on site and at amusement parks will break you) We did have an issue with the cleaning staff not cleaning the room for 2 days and walked into huge bugs pigging out in the trash...NOT GOOD!!...There was yelling & screaming..major buzz kill We had to sit in on a Time Share presentation which was harmless (although there was a high pressure sales mgr who came into close & got irked when we didnt want to sign up...get over it man) I would actually purchase property (given the current housing mkt - buy cheap) there as a vacation place but not as a time share/rental Easy access to Disney/Sea World..(we went to Disney )drive was less than 10 mins...but you can get lost getting in and out of the Disney property jeez!! I wouldn't go back unless I planned on a week long stay...you want to make the most of it...it if you just want a place to sleep while your are not at the amusement parks you may want to consider closer cheaper options

Reviews.Title: “Grande Vista was Great + WONDERFUL local Restaurant”
Reviews.Author: ReneeC08
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week at Marriott's Grande Vista Resort. I had read all the reviews and was a bit nervous. However I am happy to report that we had a very nice, clean room with no bugs or ants even though we were in building 95, which is one of the 'old' buildings. My kids (ages 5 and 6) loved the pool, the splash pad and the paddle boats that were available for rent. They also have an indoor play structure for younger kids (under age 9 or so) that was a lot of fun. The staff was friendly in person, but trying to call the operator or front desk usually took 30+ rings to get an answer. GREAT RESTAURANT FIND: We went to downtown Celebration and dined at The Market Street Cafe. It was GREAT. Celebration is just outside the parks and worth the drive if you want a really good non-chain restaurant. Entrees were in the $12-18 range, the food style was "American Diner" and they had a good kids menu. Dress code is casual (my kids still had on their mouse ears).

Reviews.Title: “Mixed emotions on MGV”
Reviews.Author: Jugdish
Reviews.Content: I have mixed emotions about staying at the Marriott Grande Vista. First I will share the positives about the property. The property is quite large with many options to keep busy during the day including several pools, boat rentals, kids play area, video arcade, and beach with volleyball net. Rooms in the newer section are nicely appointed with updated furnishings and down comforters on the beds. There is a washer/dryer in each unit, and a hot tub (without jets, only bubbles) in the master bedroom. The 2 bedroom villas are nice for traveling families. The downsides of the property really overshadowed the positives: The resort, as I stated earlier, is quite large........meaning HUGE. There are 24 separate buildings in which you could be housed. You can request a specific location 2 weeks prior to arrival, but there is no guarantee once you check in that it will be granted. If you are unlucky and are placed in an older building (as we were when we first arrived), you will be disappointed. The room had updated furnishings, but had very dated floors, showers and appliances. The A/C did not work properly, and the room was quite musty. The service at check in was less than stellar as I requested building 82 or 83 2 weeks prior, but was told at check in that was impossible because they were sold out, and was given a room in building 97 (the oldest part of the property). I was not happy, but was assured by the clerk that it was his favorite building because of the great view and updated decor. As you read above, I checked out the room and went straight back to check in. Miraculously, after 15 minutes of B.S., a room was available in building 86 (the newer part of the property). The thing that bothers me is that I stopped at the front desk twice during our stay to ask questions, and overheard, both times, 2 different clerks tell unsuspecting guests that building 97 is their favorite. (no joke) It's pathetic that MGV trains the staff to sell guests on the crappiest part of the property, to leave newer parts open to those with more points (more on that later). On the second night of our trip, we were awoken at 3:30 a.m. by drunk college kids in the villa above ours shouting on the porch and ,what sounded like furniture being moved around. I contacted security, and it took 30 minutes for the noise to subside, which was long enough to wake up the kids. For the size of the complex, the pools areas are not that large. We only visited the pool a couple of times, as it was very cool the week we stayed, but we always had an issue getting a single chair to put towels on. Also, the pools seemed very crowded with kids playing on top of each other. MGV is part of the Marriott Vacation Club which is a "points" timeshare. Being a timeshare, I only can compare it to one other timeshare that I have stayed at regularly ,which is the Royal Sands in Cancun, MX. Apples to apples, the Royal Sands blows the MGV away in all categories. First, if I were to buy a timeshare, I would never buy into a "points" property. At the Royal Sands, my in-laws own a specific villa for a specific date. WIth points, you need to request your date well in advance, then you have to fight with whom ever is at the front desk when you check in to get the best room possible at that moment in time. When we go to Cancun, we know exactly what were are getting: how far the villa is from all of the amenities, and the quality of the furnishings and decor. At the MGV, it's a crap shoot. Second, we rented this week from an owner for only $950. (which is why I have mixed emotions). According to the sales rep, you can get into this property from anywhere between $15,000, and $40,000! If I were an owner at this property, I would have buyers remorse, as I don't think it is worth owning. But, the accomodations were sufficient for the price we paid for the week. Overall, I would not stay at this resort in the future, as there are many options in Orlando with similar accommodation. I think Marriott became greedy with the size of this property, as they saw dollar signs with more villa sales. But this is a excellent example of quantity over quality.

Reviews.Title: “needs updating”
Reviews.Author: 1lovecakes
Reviews.Content: We just came back from this resort and we were disappointed because we felt mislead by the term kitchenette(they only have wetbars in the studio rooms). Since we booked with a getaway deal for 5 days 4 nights thru a friend, we asked on several occasions what was in the room. We could not get a straight answer until the week before. We were told to look on line but could not find what was in the studio room. Many times prior to our trip we requested a larger room but were told no availablity. The day we arrived and complained about having only a wetbar instead a real kitchen, all of a sudden an upgrade was possible for way more money. We opted to keep the room we had since there was no telling what we were getting. The bed was very nice, but for us that was the best part. Since we did not have a kitchen we ate out a lot. The last night we decided to use our Marriott travel card at the Copa loca lounge. We approached the bar to be served and sat down. No one offered a menu so we eventually had to ask for one. We then had to ask to order. After taking our order, we had to ask for our drinks again. Then shorlty after we got our drinks our appetizers were served. As we sat, we noticed several people served effeciently. As we continued to wait for the rest of our order, the bartender finally remembered to check on our order which was not completed. We think he ended up making the order himself,(after disappearingin the kitchen for about 10 minutes) because when we took it back to the room it was wrong and the kitchen was closed. After waiting an hour for service and food (as we sat at the bar in front of the bartender), he advised me that our travel cards do not work at that restaurant. A supervisor finally came by after my protest and charged the card properly. Our toddler spilled something on the down comforter and when house keeping came to replace it, it was full of wet feathers. She tried to refuse it back stating the it was dry. She finally took it back and dried properly before giving it back. There was no ice available in our building, my husband had to catch a ride with a staff member to get a complementary bag before the store closed. no dvd player in our room My husband needed directions to the Copa Loca lounge to catch up with us and a staff member told him he was going the wrong way and sped off on the cart without giving directions. we were really disappointed. we would have expected more from this name brand!

Reviews.Title: “Good Place, but not my favorite Marriott Vacation Club Location”
Reviews.Author: Chapsbaby
Reviews.Content: After declining Marriott's offer to hear their Marriott Vacation Club Sales Presentation in exchange for a good price on one of their villa rentals at least 5 previous times, we finally broke down and accepted one since this deal almost seemed too good to be true. We chose to stay their 5 day/4 night deal at the Marriott Grande Vista in Orlando and we recently returned from this trip. We had a 1 bedroom/1 bath villa for $ 329.00 total (all 4 nights) - but the stipulation was that we were to attend a 90 minute sales presentation. Overall, we thought the $ 329.00 deal was pretty good for 4 nights as at the time we stayed there, a 1 bedroom/1 bath villa was running $ 289.00 per night. The villa had a lot of room and was decorated nicely - but compared to other Marriott Vacation clubs that we had rented at before, MVCs in Virginia, Hawaii, and Hilton Head, this villa looked shabby. The walls were dinged up, kitchen and bath cabinets were badly scratched, the bathroom vanity appeared to have water damage as the veneer was raising up, the living room entertainment center was damaged, and all of the villa doors were dirty with finger prints - could have used a Mr. Clean sponge and the stove was rusting. However, for the price we paid, can't complain. On the good side, housekeeping was very good and responsive, grounds were very nice as were the common areas such as the lobby and the pool. This was the first time in 8 family trips to the Orlando area that we didn't stay within the Disney property and I have to say that we found this Marriott complex to be quite convenient to get to a variety of Orlando attractions, including Disney, which we drove to at least 3 times during our trip. Our children are now pre-teens and perhaps this is why it wasn't too bad to drive back and forth to Disney now. I could see where it could be inconvenient to do so if they were smaller. This Marriott is very, very close to the various Sea World parks - within a few minutes drive - which is very nice. Another nice thing about this complex is the various activities they offer - called the MAZE program where every day there are different activities for children, teens and adults - a lot of variety. As for the sales presentation - ours wasn't too bad - lasted about 120 minutes as opposed to the 90 minutes, but we had an 8:15 a.m. presentation, so we still had a full day at Sea World after our presentation. Our presentation wasn't high pressured either. So overall, a nice trip at a good price. If looking for a stay at an Orlando condo complex, would recommend this one.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort for families”
Reviews.Author: mefcgf21
Reviews.Content: We just returned from the Grande Vista & really enjoyed it. After reading other reviews, we requested a new room & at first we given an older room on the 3rd floor, but bc we have small children I requested a 1st floor unit. We ended up in a very nice 2 BD unit near the Copa Loca restaurant & overlooking the golf course. The rooms were spacious & well stocked with everything you would need for a family. The tables were glass (strange considering they cater to families with young kids). We did however ask for a crib & were given a pack & play which is somewhat of a trouble bc my 2 year old likes to climb out. The check in process was slightly out of control bc the so many people were checking in at once but the staff was really accomodating. Parking was very convenient & the housekeeping was very responsive to our requests. We had also heard that they Marriott time share sales called the rooms constantly, so we were prepared to take the phone off the hook but we never got one phone call. The resort was beautiful & very convenient to all the parks. The pools were crowded but manageable. The Copa Loca restaurant was great but the menu is limited & the service is very slow. The playspace for the kids was terrific. We were fortunate to have great weather & we still used it. They also have an activity center for the kids as well as some events when the parents can leave the children but the min. age is 5. They have swan/duck paddle boats that you can rent, which sounded like a good idea until you are in the water which is really swampy. As a note about the parks----I would recommend going to Animal Kingdom & SeaWorld in the beginning of the week & Magic Kingdom at the end to avoid the crowds. The busiest days at Magic Kingdom are M/T & Animal Kingdom busiest days areThurs & Fri. Even knowing this ahead of time, we ended up at Animal Kingdom on Thurs & it was a nightmare. It was way too crowded & the fast pass for the safari were sold out by 11 am. It is not a great park for toddlers even with a stroller. I would not return to Animal Kingdom. Overall we really enjoyed the Grande Vista & will definately return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “better than a normal hotel”
Reviews.Author: DavidBahamas
Reviews.Content: Since becoming a father I have been dreading the obligatory Disney World visit but am pleased to report that the Grand Vista eased the pain somewhat by providing a quiet oasis away from the madness of the Parks. We took a one bedroom unit and our 2 small children shared the sofabed. The room was large and the kitchen (and washer dryer) was put to good use. The pools were OK and not too crowded even though we stayed during Easter. The complex is huge but very quiet. We did have a couple of minor issues with housekeeping but I assume they were very busy during Easter and they did respond well to our requests. As is so often the case in America the staff and service was great. I would certainly visit again. We spent three days at Disney and one at SeaWorld and thought that they were both very expensive and of course packed. Our children loved every minute. The only advice I can give is plan your day, prioritise the rides that you would like to do and go early. We had some success at Magic Kingdom before midday, after which the lines were brutal. The organisation of the car park is very well done. Finally my wife loved the Premium Outlets Mall at the South end of International Drive which (especially for Euro based travelers) offered great deals on designer gear.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely resort, slow service”
Reviews.Author: ne_ohiofanily
Reviews.Content: Overall we had a great experience at the Grande Vista. We traveled to Florida to visit SeaWorld with our 2 small children ages 4 and 7 over spring break. Our 2 bedroom villa was wonderful and in a great location. Our villa was tidy and well kept. The grounds were also well maintained. The hotel is a 5 minute drive to SeaWorld. We had planned to use the Itrolley to get there but the resort is so huge it was a 15 minute walk from our room to the bus stop. No big deal for older kids and adults but for tired small children that is a long way to walk after a day at an amusement park. We used taxis, fares were about $8. The pools were fabulous. Most of the pools ranged from 3ft to 5 ft, however there were 2 zero entry areas that my 4 year old could easily walk around and play in water waist deep. The pools do not have lifeguards or any staff at all. However, since most of the patrons were families (with parents) it was not a problem. The food options, while a little pricey were good for families. We did not have a chance to try Nick's grill. The indoor play structure was a real hit with the kids. There were plenty of other activities provided by the resort, had we had the time. Our one gripe was the slow service, whether we were calling a restaurant, the front desk, or the concierge, they did not always answer the phone. We would have to let it ring 10-20 times to get someone to answer. They only had two bellman to serve the entire (large) resort. Each time we needed a bellman we had to wait at least 30 minutes or more. Would we stay there again. Perhaps...for the price we paid I would have expected much better service.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Wonderful!!!!”
Reviews.Author: briashla
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in March. After reading a few of the reviews I was very apprehensive. Not to worry!! The room was fantastic!!! The room was spotless. There were plenty of towels in the two room villa we had. (Building 81) I looked hard and I could not find any bugs in the room. The washer and dryer was a plus. The cleaning service came in early and the room was complete by the time we returned from breakfast. The pool areas were sparkling! The staff was friendly and responsive to any need. Our family is returning this summer and we plan on staying at the Grande Vista. We were not in one of the newer units but we were right near everything and the room was still geat! Contact me if you have any questions!

Reviews.Title: “Orlando at its very Best!”
Reviews.Author: burtieb
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 10 days at the resort - it was excellent. There is nothing bad to say about it! Everything is designed for you to have a wonderful time. I had a one room suite - with kitchen, maid service everyday. There is a tennis court, basketball court,jogging track and indoor fitness centre. You could wear yourself out if you wanted to, pools and grounds are immaculate! With so many suites you would think it would be packed but it never seemed that way! The market place has an excellent piza takeout - they where great! A shop selling groceries and other goodies. The Flado restaurant did an excellent breakfast, lunch and dinner! I dont play golf but the course looked interesting! 4 pools so lots of choice - children friendly or quiet for adults. Laid well back from International drive but on the I train route, there is a shuttle service (golf buggies) to run you from the gate back into the resort if you dont feel like walking. I did get asked to go to a timeshare talk, but the guy I met was very nice and when I said I wasnt interested he didnt push and we shook hands and I left after 45 mins! It was v. tempted tho! The staff where friendly and responded quickly to any queries, there is a desk for booking tickets to attractions - disney etc. I aksed for directions to Faldo restaurant and the guy walked me to it - as 'he didnt want me to get lost!' If I ever go back to Orlando this is where I intend to stay! It is central to all the attractions but relaxing and quiet if you want to chill out and watch the geckos and turtles play!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Property”
Reviews.Author: fireball50
Reviews.Content: Pros: The property is gorgeous. Checking in and out was a breeze. The rooms were large, clean and comfortable. Beds were extremely comfortable; did not want to get up after a long day at Disney. Nice view overlooking the lake. The pools were excellent. You are just five minutes away from Seaworld, and a little farther (15 min drive) from the other parks. Cons: Just a little spots, one of the corners in the room wasn't clean at all. When it rains, the water comes thru the bottom of the door from the outside and we would open the door to find a big puddle inside. Had to use a towel to block incoming rainwater. The Marketplace is too expensive but nothing but a drive to Walgreens to pick up the necessary items. Internet was down for two days during the week we spent there. I would most likely come back to this property.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Villa for a Lengthy Stay”
Reviews.Author: WDWDolphinFan
Reviews.Content: I joined my parents here for a couple of nights before heading over to a hotel at Disney. They have booked a 2 or 3 bedroom villa at the Grande Vista for the last two or three years, with various relatives joining them for their stay. They love the Grande Vista, and find it much nicer than several other villas they have tried in Orlando. The villa is perfect for them - the group is generally in their 70s and 80s, and they enjoy the ability to prepare breakfast or even lunch in the villa, taking full-day or half-day excursions, and having space to socialize in the evening. The villa itself is very nice, with the master bedroom opening onto a screened porch, and the second bedroom opening onto an open-air porch, and a spacious living room/kitchen/dining area. The villa overlooked a lake, which had a nice lighted fountain at night. The beds were comfortable, and the bathrooms reasonably large. My mother loved being able to leave the breakfast dishes in the sink for the maid to clean up. The resort is huge and attractive, with a children's pool that looked fun for kids, but the pool area was rather noisy (even in the morning on a cloudy day), and the pool loungers were crammed in very closely together. Because the resort is a gated community that is set back quite a way from the main roadways, they feel safer here than they did at other villas they've tried. The villa works very well for their type of trip, where they stay for several weeks with the main goal of simply being in warm and sunny Florida. It does not work as well for a shorter trip focused on DisneyWorld. We went to Epcot one day, and while we were tired out by mid-afternoon, it was simply impractical to return to the hotel for a break before dinner. I usually stay at the Swan or Dolphin on Disney property, where I can easily take a break in the afternoon, and head back to dinner and the parks refreshed and ready for a great night. We had to just stay in the park all day, and wound up heading for dinner at the California Grill utterly exhausted, and too tired to stick around for the fireworks. You do miss out on the Disney experience here - while they returned to the villa after dinner the following night, to sit on the porch and watch the fountain or sit inside and watch TV, I returned to the Dolphin and was able to take a lovely walk around the lake, watch some of the street entertainers at the Boardwalk, watch the Illuminations fireworks from my balcony, listen to the piano player in the lobby, and take in some great views of Disney at night -even without going into a park. If you really want an off-site villa, the Grand Vista is definitely nice, and can have advantages for a lengthy vacation. However, you do give up a lot by staying away from Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Huge property, with more than 900 rooms, suitable for families with children”
Reviews.Author: FrequentTraveller73
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from this hotel. It should be noted that this a Marriott Vacation resort (rooms are sold on a timeshare basis and when not occupied by owners or exchange owners, they are let out to paying guests ). Hence be prepared to be contacted by the Marriott timeshare team, whose object is to make you a timeshare sale. The property is huge and given its scale feels like a factory. If you are looking for peace and quite, do not chose this property. However, if you have children, who like lots of activities, then the property may be suitable. Although we are sure that Marriott would like to claim that the rooms are maintained to the same standard as their comparable hotels, they are not. The entrance to the property is well maintained. Also, we think given the scale of the property, getting any attention at reception/front desk, concierge, and a timely response to telephone queries from the housekeeping is impossible. Hence not suitable where you desire a fast response time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Jeorgieboy
Reviews.Content: We had a 1BR Villa on the West Side near the Copa Loca bar and grill overlooking the pool. The room was very clean and roomy. The furnishings were very updated. We had a few mishaps with maintenance issues, but all were resolved to satisfaction. Grand Vista is one of our favorite Orlando resorts. The grounds are fantastic, the pools were heated to a perfect temperature. Everything is clean and tidy. In close proximity to Sea World and not far from Disney and Universal. Nick's Grill restaurant is great. Good food, reasonably priced, greta service. Copa Loca has great food and service too. The coconut shrimp was fantastic. We will return next year and have another wonderful vacation. You just can't beat the villa vs. a regular hotel room. What a convenience.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a 4-generation family reunion”
Reviews.Author: WebWizards
Reviews.Content: We were delighted with the 3-bedroom villas that were homes-away-from-home for our family reunion. The villas are outfitted with every convenience, from refrigerator, full-size oven, dishwasher and washer-dryer, to toaster, and all kitchen utensils, dishes, etc. Lovely maid service, too. Our private banquet at Nick's Grill on site was tops. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: howebomber
Reviews.Content: I recently purchased a Marriott timeshare in Aruba but traded it in for a week at the Grande Vista. This resort was perfect. Check in was quick and easy. We had a 2 bedroom 2 bath villa and I traveled with my wife 2 year old son and my parents. The room was immaculate. I think I was in one of the more recently renovated rooms, bldg 85. We had a wonderful view of the lake and and fountains. the resort has plenty of acitivies for little ones as mentioned in previous reviews. Sea World is right down the block and the other attractions are only 15 minutes away. I rented a minivan from Dollar. I compared them to all other rental car agencies and they were the cheapest. About $300 for 7 days which included the tax. Plus they are located on-site at the airport. Some of the other rental car places require you to take a shuttle from the airport to their service desk. A little inconvienant when traveling with little ones. Anyway, I would highly recommend staying here. If I had one complaint it was that someone from Marriott called every other day trying to get me to attend another 90minute presentation. Not sure if you are a non-marriott owner that you will get this call.

Reviews.Title: “Grande Vista Was Perfect For Us”
Reviews.Author: bethgsimm
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Grande Vista for a non disney vacation with 2 adults and 2 kids 8 & 10 in February 08. Very comfortable room. We had a 1 bedroom which was more than enough room. Beautiful grounds with Lake .Lots of stuff for kids to do, fishing, crafts, canoeing, rock climbing. Great indoor play area for smaller children. Loved the location , just off International Drive, but a very quiet part of it. 2 miles to sea world/discovery cove. 10 minutes to Universal and 15 minutes to Disney . Highly recommend the Marriott Grande Vista

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: desal
Reviews.Content: We booked a timeshare exchange through Interval International and were very pleased with the Marriott Grande Vista. The rooms were nice, clean and roomy. I am very picky about sheets and theirs were good quality and very soft. The bed was also comfortable. The grounds, including the many pools, golf course and lake were beautiful. They had a bar and grill, a Pizza Hut, a small Starbucks, Krispy Creme doughnuts and barbeque grills on site. There was absolutely nothing that we lacked or needed. One night they had karaoke at the pool bar which was a lot of fun. They had an excercise room and recreation center that had air hockey, a pool table, dance revolution and several video games. My son and daughter took advantage of the rec room a few times and had it to themselves each time they did. The grounds are well secured and the staff was very helpful, friendly and accommodating. We took a red-eye flight and arrived at the resort at 7:00 AM. Check in time wasn't supposed to be until 4:00 PM but to our huge relief they were able to get us a room when we arrived. My entire family was very pleased with the accommodations. The resort is practically within walking distance from Sea World and a very short drive to all of the Disney parks and Universal Studios. We were very pleased with our choice of resorts and have nothing but good things to say about the Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Place - Didn't want to come home!”
Reviews.Author: octscotts
Reviews.Content: I can't stress enough how great this resort was to stay at. I had made several requests and they were all handled beautifully. We had 2 separate parties coming and I requested we be in the same building and near a pool. I also have a 1 year old and requested a portable crib. They not only had the crip waiting, but a high chair as well! I think the location is great. It's not right on the interstate, but it's located off International Drive where there is tons of shopping and restaurants. The landscaping was beautiful and everything was well-kept. Check-in was very smooth and everyone was very friendly. We had a 3 BR in Building 78. This is one of the newer buildings and I highly recommend it. All the furnishings were lovely and the beds were awesome. It's one of the first times I wasn't ready to get home and sleep in my own bed. The pools were beautiful and the one close to our building was very kid friendly with waterfalls, water canons and all sorts of spouts for the kids to run/swim through. We also took advantage of the swan paddle boats and the kids loved that. It was beautiful paddling around the "lagoon" and seeing the entire resort. Our teenagers in the crowd spent at least an hour in the arcade every night and couldn't stop gushing about the selection of games. My only complaint is that yes, everything shuts down pretty early. The Marketplace and Lighthouse Bar closed at 11pm everynight. Late by regular standards, but I would have thought they'd be open later at least on the weekends. All in all, we had a wonderful time. This was my youngest boys' first trip to Disney and since the parks close early this time of year, it was nice to go back to a great resort where there was no shortage of things to do.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for Orlando”
Reviews.Author: Spartacus_Mills
Reviews.Content: Great big hotel, brilliant room, obviously need a car to get around although hotel in great location for short drive to Sea World, Disney, Universal etc. Negatives of hotel - not much open at night in the hotel resort and the pizza hut that was there took ages! Also saw an armadillo sharing the resort :-) Looked a great golf resort, though we were there to do the parks so never played.

Reviews.Title: “lBig Family”
Reviews.Author: brianafitz
Reviews.Content: We own a week at the Grande Vista. This was our first visit. All 18 members of the family came for Christmas. The staff was more than accomadating. The pools were great, golf and dinner at Faldo's were fantastic. Spent time at Disney but could stayed at Grande Vista the whole week. Off the main road but secluded. Planning a reunion in 5 years.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: kadiv1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week with our 2 kids, aged 3 and 7. We were in Orlando for a Disney vacation. My only complaint is that the resort was too nice. My kids wanted to be there rather than Disney. They LOVED the kids center. I can not speak highly enough about the kids play center. I am truly considering a trip back just to spend a week at the resort and not go to Disney. My only slight complaint would be that it is a little farther from Disney than I would like. Last time we were in Orlando we stayed at the Marriott Imperial Palms which was much closer to the parks. As far as complaints about no housekeeping for a week, that seems to be standard practice for any timeshare that I have been to (Marriott or not).

Reviews.Title: “Little things mean alot”
Reviews.Author: Martin5501
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this resort for 3 nights. The resort grounds, landscaping, pools, and buildings were attractive. The room we stayed in seemed new but the bathroom was in need of repair. The HVAC unit leaked water across the tile floor and onto the carpet the entire time we were there. We complained several times, but they could not get it fixed. Apparently, this was not the first time the leak occurred as mold was growing in the crevices along the floor and the vanity cabinet was damaged. We stayed on a Marriott vacation club time share week and found out that you do not get maid service, fresh daily towels, coffee or other services that you would get if you just booked a room and paid the nightly rate. Why would anyone pay $20,000.00 for a timeshare and be treated worse than the the average guest??!! I had some interest in the Marriott Vacation Club, but I will just rent at this point, save $20,000.00, and get treated better. Other guests that paid nightly also complained that there were few amenities, such as lotion in the rooms and ice machines were available in only two out of approximately 20 buildings.
