On the bright side the staff was friendly, the pools seemed nice and were warm and the Nick Faldo Golf Institute on site was great. The difference in this resort and 4 or 5 star resorts comes down to handling the little things such as amenities and attentive service.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place!”
Reviews.Author: baltimoreraven
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Grande Vista for a work trip. Our conference was being held about a mile away at the JW Marriott (gorgeous property), but since is was sold out, we came to the Grande Vista instead and we couldn't have been happier! We pulled in around 5pm, and actually missed the entrance. The resort is situated pretty far off International Drive, so we didn't even notice it. It's a lovely little drive up to the security gate, a nice feature of the resort. Check-in went very smoothly, and they even offered to switch our room assignments so that the 3 of us going could have rooms in the same building. There are about 20 buildings on the property, so it's a large space. The main house holds not only rooms, but a large pool, a small market store, a pizza hut/ice cream stand as well as many other facilities (the gym is open 24/7!!!). Our building (#95) was lovely, towards the front of the property and had a great view over one of the golf tees. I stayed in a regular room, not one of the suites, but it was wonderful. I had a mini-frige, sink, microwave, dishes, toaster and coffeemaker. Perfect for me. The housekeeping staff even replaced my dirty cereal bowl every morning...even though they supplied me with dish soap and towels. The beds are wonderfully comfortable w/ nice linens and squishy pillows. Each room had either a screened in porch (first floors) or a balcony (upper floors) with a small table and 2 chairs. I loved having breakfast out there each day! The staff was very friendly with the exception of one security guard who wouldn't let my friend on the property until she could give him a room number. But I guess that might be a pro to some. I could literally see SeaWorld from my porch, and all other parks are no more than a 15 minute drive away. It is close to restaurants and other conviences. All in all, we loved our stay here at Grande Vista, and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay for New Years Eve”
Reviews.Author: KrissyTales
Reviews.Content: We feel as though this is a home away from home. You wouldn't even need to leave the property. The staff is very nice and will take care of your needs. The fireworks for New Years Eve were wonderful. I was very impressed. The food at the Copa Loca is great. You definitely wouldn't need to cook if you didn't want to. It's location is great as well. You are not far from Disney, outlet malls, and you are right down the street from Sea World. There is even a Blockbuster right around the corner, if you want to rent movies. You can't beat that. A+++++

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort but needs room maintenance; great location for parks”
Reviews.Author: dimples
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week stay at the hotel. Last year we stayed at Marriott Horizons which we all agreed we preferred - nicer facilities, themed pirate pools with a big slide for the kids and you don't have to hike a long way to get to everything. the Grande was nice but has sooo many people you have to wait forever to get a ping pong table etc. They advertise bike rentals but beware they only have quad bikes and they are only allowed on the road, therefore you are at the mercy of speeding cars and most of the riding you do is in parking lots! The lake is tiny so the boat rentals are nice but you can canoe around it in about 15 minutes at a leisurely pace (why do they say it's large with boats of all sizes?). The setting is lovely though. Rooms were nice and fairly well equipped in the kitchen. Just bring your own coffee filters as they don't have any available. We had multiple problems with the toilets, microwave and fridge. The washer/dryer were ready to pack it in too. They did arrive to fix things quickly although they ended up getting us a different (also old) fridge after three tries. It left us feeling they wait for guests to tell them what's wrong and then they fix it rather than scheduling any maintenance work. The setting is lovely though and we enjoyed being away from the highways. The staff who are supposed to be knowledgable about tickets and places to visit are really only interested in selling you a timeshare - all of their conversations edge towards this topic no matter where you start (e.g. gatorland) so be prepared. There are computers you can use though which take dollars. You won't be making a mistake staying here, especially if you want to go to the parks. Sea world is very close. There is a grocery store nearby too. Security is quite laid back - nobody stopped us or visiting friends anytime we came or went so I would make sure your doors and windows are locked - as they should be anyway.

Reviews.Title: “A heavenly place...”
Reviews.Author: NWgypsies
Reviews.Content: Incredible! We had a gorgeous view across the lake to the lighthouse, enjoyed the lighted fountain every night! The palm decor was gorgeous, scruptious drapery & carpets, granite slab counters, comfy beds, and a huge, heavenly jetted tub! Everything was very clean, we did have to ask for a vaccuum-- vital for a week-long stay. The kids loved the sandcastle themed pool, the kids play area, and the swan & duck pedal boats. A blissful week!

Reviews.Title: “If the Marriott Vacation Club calls on the phone, don't hang up!”
Reviews.Author: Folklorist
Reviews.Content: I got a great deal through the Marriott Vacation Club International for a 4-night stay in a nicely furnished one-bedroom villa (based on a sales call I received earlier in 2007). The location is excellent--near the major roads, but no noise from the highways. The mandatory sales presentation (to join a Vacation Ownership Program) was even somewhat pleasant, though it lasted 3 hours, even after I was told it would last only 90 minutes. One other complaint is that the resort offers no possibility for recycling. I had to take my newspapers, cans, and bottles to downtown Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “I loved, Loved, Loved this hotel. It had Everything you could imagine.”
Reviews.Author: cheringeo
Reviews.Content: I absolutely LOVED this hotel/timeshare. This hotel is SO close to Disneyworld. It was absolutely perfect. We loved it. The sales pressure was not really hard. We took the phone off the hook, and that was fine. I LOVED THIS RESORT!

Reviews.Title: “clean and safe-- would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: samuelandsarah
Reviews.Content: Know ahead of time it is a timeshare property so there are open, separate buildings. That said, I felt completely safe, you have to swipe a room key to enter the property. Our room was in a new building across the lake form the main building and although we can't directly compare, GET A NEW ROOM. Our building was called "Madrid" (can't remember its number). Near the new pool

Reviews.Title: “Had a fab time!!!”
Reviews.Author: sunshinegirl41
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd visit to Grande Vista, the first was in 2005, when we did the Disney parks. This time we decided to enjoy the resort more, and we are glad we did. We had a condo in the brand new building, which I asked for as the last time we had a tour round Marriott and they had showed us this new building, and it was so much better than the one we were staying in - updated and just gorgeous. I asked for the newer accomodation when we were checking in, and apparently we were given the last one. All I can say is, if you don't ask you don't get, so give it a try. The standard of Grande Vista is very high, we enjoyed the pools everyday, - there are lots of them! and ate at Nicks Grill, which was nice, they have daily specials. We walked there from our condo, so it was nice my husband to have a drink as we didn't have to drive. My daughter and I did a few of the activities - I did a step class and we tried latin amercan dancing!! It was fun. We went and enjoyed a Polynesian night around one of the pools, they had dancers and singers - it was fun - didn't cost us anything. We are members of Marriotts vacation club and own in Paris, France and we went on a tour with one of their reps. May buy their one day, it's such good quality! The surrounding area is a shoppers paradise and also fab for golfers. My husband played on several of the courses and he loved it. Lots of outlet malls nearby and International Drive is good for restaurants. There are also a few places offering buffet breakfasts which is great for families. We stayed a week at Grande Vista and then moved on to a beach resort - not Marriott - on Treasure Island. Have not yet found a resort to match up to Marriott, they know their stuff, our holiday was fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “Thumbs Up for Marriott Grande Vista”
Reviews.Author: LoveTravel
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the Grand Vista. The complex is huge with multiple pools and quick access by car to all of Orlando's theme parks. Disney was a short 20 min drive, Univeral about 15, and Sea World is only 5 mins. We rented a car- I'm not sure it makes sense to take public transportation but we didn't try. Our rooms were clean with a great view of the golf course and one of the pools- we had both a one bedroom suite and a connected studio. Parking at the facility late at night became an issue on Thanksgiving but they drove us to our building after we parked in registration. The only complaints were the pool towels were not readily availabile. I'm still not sure where they are or how we get them. The facility also does not recycle. We look forward to returning to the Grande Vista again.

Reviews.Title: “This place is Great!!”
Reviews.Author: V-Travels-7
Reviews.Content: I loved my stay here. We had a 3 bedroom villa and it was beautiful. I was nervous because of other reviews I'd read, but they were wrong. I'm used to the best and this hotel is one of the best. There were lots of amenties for the kids and the service was great. I am usually hard to please, but I didn't have that problem here. Your family will have a wonderful time at this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay at this really nice Marriott...”
Reviews.Author: ChaunceyGardiner
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights here, using the â€œphenomenal rate if youâ€™ll sit through a sales presoâ€� deal. Had Mrs. Gardiner and Kiddo on this trip. Check in was smooth, and everyone very friendly and helpful. It wasnâ€™t until I was given a map that I realized the sheer size of the place. Just enormous! Two very large pool areas, with lots to do. Our unit was in a recently completed building; a one-bedroom, with separate living room and really, really nice. Upscale furnishings, full size fridge, marble counters, washer/dryer. Marriott Revive bedding. Overall, frankly, a bit ahead of most mainstream Marriottsâ€¦ We were here to visit some friends and hit Epcot and Magic Kingdom, so didnâ€™t spend a lot of time on property. I walked to the lobby each morning to get some Starbucks and the WSJ, and employees in golf carts routinely picked me up and drove me. Walked out to the pool area and it looked very nice. Good location on a quiet stretch of International Drive, just beyond SeaWorld. The sales preso was very low key, as I would expect from Marriott. Not pushy, not uncomfortable. Actually, weâ€™re still considering this as an optionâ€¦ Note that restaurant service is very limited on property, so either have a car or be ready to depend on shuttle van to get places. Good stayâ€¦ a very solid four star property.

Reviews.Title: “They Made it easy to not have a car”
Reviews.Author: captianshade
Reviews.Content: I am notorious for getting lost. We traded for this hotel because we could either use the local bus system or hire drives. We were not disapointed. When we check in we were asked if we need a belman to drive us to our room. We did wait a few minutes (20), but the lobby seating was comfortable. When we needed drivers, we called the front desk and a drive was provided for us from a local company. This turned out to be cheeper than the local taxi service and the drivers were all exelent. When we wanted to go to the front of the resort and get a bus, the front desk sent a bellman to drive us. We always plan for a 15 to 20 minute wait in the off seasons, and longer when the hotel is busy. We also make sure we always have enough cash with us to tip. The staff of the hotel was helpful and friendly. the room was clean except for small had prints on all the door frames, my mother spent the first 20 minutes of our stay wiping them off. I would recomend this hotel to a friend and I would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Resort”
Reviews.Author: DLH1959
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of a time share presentation package we signed up for earlier in the year while staying at another Marriott-owned property in Orlando. Our sales person was good and also "hoped" we would rate him an 8-10, but we thought he deserved this rating even though we didn't purchase anything from him. We were in a one bedroom villa in building 95. We were told the property is 10 years old, so some of the rooms/buildings may be beginning to show their age. Cons ... there was mold around the picture window but it was covered by the curtains so guests and staff may have not been aware of it. There was a small hole in the screened in porch. A poor job was done patching the dry wall in the bathroom by the shower stall. A poor job was done re-caulking the baseboard tiles in the bathroom. A poorly designed kitchen made opening one of the drawers difficult since you had to hold the oven door closed at the same time. Several light bulbs were out. Surely any of these "flaws" can be found in homes all across the U.S. Pros ... we always found a parking space in front of our building entrance. Our view from the 5th floor was beautiful. The villa was spacious ... king bed, sofa bed, 2 televisions, full kitchen with counter and table seating, screened in porch, 2-sided bathroom with shower, toilet, and sink on one side and jacuzzi tub and double sinks on the other side. We received housekeeping each day ... trash removal, running of dishwasher, towels/sheets. We were at Universal Studios, IOA, and CityWalk each day/night, so we only utilized the "kids" pool and CopaLoca restaurant one day and were very pleased. We would recommend this resort to others. We would probably stay elsewhere since it offers amenities we don't use ... golf and tennis.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty Old and Stale!!!”
Reviews.Author: CanadaBonvoyage
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a dirty, run down and mildewy smelling room then this is the resort for you!!!! We just got back from our week long stay and to be honest I don't know where these other reviews are coming from. Our stay was absolutely horrible in this facility. When we checked into our 2 brdm the door was wide open. As I was travelling alone with my 2 small children, my husband was arriving the next day, I called the front desk to advise them of my safety concerns. They did send maitenance up to check the door but that was about it. The fridge was also dirty and the vents on the ceiling had mold on them. I did not feel secure or comfortable in the facility. They said they had no other rooms to move us to until the next day. We had a scheduled time share presentaiton the next day and explained our concerns to the sales person - who buy the way was more concerned about the rating we were going to give him on our survey than assisting us. We spoke with the sales manager who spoke with the Front Desk person who said he had made arrangements to have us moved to another room. When we came back the next evening to get to our new room they could not find anything in the computer. After 20 minutes of trying to find our room and 2 very tired kids from a day at Disney they finally found us a new room. Our next room was absolutely horrible and even worse than the first one. The smell of mildew was so incredible we had to sleep with the balcony doors and windows open to get some fresh air. The stove handle was also broken along with the cupboards. There was also black on the ceiling coming from the air vents. They only had 1 bellman on for 1700 units the evenoing we moved - Friday- so I had to help move our luggage and groceries we had purchased. I even went back into the marketplace refrigerator to retireve the groceries took the bell cart and moved these myself. After calling the front desk again to try and get someone up to the room to inspect it for themselves this was to no avail. After 2 nights of no sleep and countless hours of trying to get someone to help we gave up and tried to make the best of it and spent as little time as possible in our room and at the property. As there is no housekeeping service, unless you pay for it, no one checks the rooms and I mean absolutely no one. Finally on the last day of our stay I got to speak to one of the Facilitiy's operations managers but at this point it was too little too late. The time share presentation we attended on the second day was equally as bad. The gentleman giving the presentaiton asked us to give him 10s on the survey we will be receiving and after calling in someone else to assist with the presentation to advise us on the costs of any future purchases in the Marriott Timeshare program (part of the sales pitch I guess) she could not read her notes and had to borrow my husband's glasses. I truly cannot recommend this hotel. I did not feel safe with my family, the room was absolutely disqusting and with little empathy or concern for our wellbeing if this is what we are supposed to look forward to as a Marriott Owner we are hard pressed to even remotely recommend or utilize this "resort" to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely excellent!!!”
Reviews.Author: sammyhChesterfield
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from the Grande Vista and I could'nt wait to write this review! We took our parents and our two children (3 and 7) for a week, unfortunetly we could'nt stay longer. We arrived at 11:00pm and had a smooth and pleasant check in, our villa in building 94 was of excellent quality and there were no complaints from anyone. Three hours into our stay my son fell out of bed and cut his eyebrow on the bedside table, we called the front desk and within minutes a first aider was there, unfortunetly it meant a trip to the hospital and five stitches. The people at the hospital were way beyond good, he was stitched up and someone from the hotel came to pick us up. We had to return on Wednesday to have them removed and again someone took us and fetched us back, I can't imagine that happening in England! There were also follow up calls from the hotel staff to see how he was getting on. Anyway we only stayed a week so could'nt use the facilities as much as we would have liked. We did use all the pools though which the kids loved and saw some evening entertainment which was also excellent. We did'nt hire a car so made use of the I-ride which is really convenient as it stops outside the resort, we had no problems getting transport up and down the drive, and quite frankly I can't understand some of the bad reviews I've read on this website, all I can say is when you stay here you will LOVE IT!!! Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Beyond Expectations”
Reviews.Author: sprin23
Reviews.Content: Having not visited Florida for some 10 years or so I didn't really know what to expect but can honestly say I was very pleasantly surprised on arrival at this resort. The villas were enormous, particularly for the 2 of us, furnished with all modern appliances you would want. The surroundings were quiet, pretty and well maintained, exactly as I remembered Florida being from my last visit. The maids were very efficient, as were the staff at reception very pleasant and helpful. Even the guard on the gate was extremely friendly and soon recognised us. Ameneties were great. I can't recommend this resort enough.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT!”
Reviews.Author: okufanatic
Reviews.Content: We traded our week at our Branson timeshare for a week in Orlando at the Marriott Grande Vista. We stayed in a two bedroom condo. The unit we were given was absolutely beautiful and very spacious! All of the fine details were taken into account when this resort was made. Everything from the granite counter tops in the kitchen, the two person jacuzzi tub in the master, to the comfy beds with high thread count bed linens, all things were top of the line. The condo was so clean I felt like we were the first to stay in it. Not a spec of dust on anything or spec of soap scum in the shower. Impeccably clean! The resort personnel were very friendly. They also went above and beyond the call of duty. We were called the week before we arrived by the resort concierge. The swimming areas were large and beautiful. You could rent small motor boats and paddle boats to enjoy the small lake. They had a beach area where you could play volley ball. There was a great tennis court area. There was even a rock wall to climb. This area was built with the golfer in mind. Nick Faldo's Golf Institute was on property. Many activities were available for all age groups. This property had it all! I would recommend it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “beautiful and clean”
Reviews.Author: elizabethelia919
Reviews.Content: We exchanged our timeshare for a 2br/2bath. It was so clean, it looked like no one had ever stayed there.The condo was very well furnished and had everything you could think that a family could need. the store was a bit small, go to a local publix instead.it took about 20 minutes to get to WDW, but was only 5 min to Seaworld. we would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “A mixed review”
Reviews.Author: JaneEMorgan
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a 4-night stay at this hotel with our 4 year old daughter. We received a promotional rate of $299 for four nights in a 1BR unit in exchange for attending a 90 min. timeshare presentation. The grounds are very nice and well maintained. There are four pools that are good for little kids, paddle boats, fishing in the lake, a gameroom, etc. The room was a very good size. Unfortunately, it seemed a little worn. The appliances were old and the door on the oven was hanging crooked. A part came off the DW. And the cutlery was the cheapest imaginable and generally useless. It's a shame because these things are so easy to remedy. The new bedding package was excellent and the screened in balcony was a great place to have a meal or just relax. I did not not love the decor (red and gold) which was classic Marriott. Housekeeping was erratic. No one came the first full day at all and after that, we received limited service (bed made and new towels provided), but no vacuuming, etc. Finally, one elliptical machine in the fitness center was functioning but had a wobbly handle. Bottom line: This place has some good features and was fine for what we paid. I would not have been pleased if I had paid full price. The presentation was fine, and relatively low pressure. One slightly disturbing thing is that we left our daughter in the supervised playroom during the presentation. When we checked in on her after an hour, she was very upset, and later told us that the lady there said she could not talk to Mommy and Daddy. She's not always a reliable source of information, but I put it out there as what was reported to us.

Reviews.Title: “Great Holiday Resort”
Reviews.Author: polmiz
Reviews.Content: Was undecided if I should choose this hotel after reading some of the last reviews about this place. But after 4 weeks I was glad we stayed at this incredible hotel. We were allocated a villa really close to reception area and also to the pool and market. The Good: ALL Staff were very professional. On two occasions we had water leaking from the shower ceiling during our stay but the fault was repaired immediately (within 1hr-2hrs) with the least inconvenience. At the market you may find most of the essential things you need. If you want to spend the evening in after a tiring day at the parks Pizza Hut outlet is ideally situated in front of market. The pools, jacuzzis, saunas, gyms and games room are of really high standards. The landscaping is breathtaking and so are the views from the room we were in. We had a villa that overlooked one of the golf courses. Rooms are well kept and the full kitchen with laundry equipment are really useful to have especially if you are there for a long stay. Some minor refurbishing was needed in the room we had. The location is very close by to Sea World and also Disney/Universal Theme Parks. The Not So Good: The resort restaurants are only open till 21:00hrs - 22:00hrs so if you return late from the parks you might have to stock up on some food in your room. You might still buy something from the market up till 23:00hrs. Night time entertainment is lacking so you will need to head someplace else in the late evenings. The Bad: The resort advertises that the I-Ride IS SITUATED IN FRONT OF PROPERTY. If you need the I-Ride you do not have a car. To be fair the resort offers complimentary transportation by bell hop from/to the reception/front entrance and vice versa but to say that in the evenings (after 22:00hrs) the service is lacking would be an understatement. It is closer to non-existant. It is more than a two minute drive so I will let you think how long it will take you to walk it in especially after spending the whole day walking/running at theme parks like Disney or Universal. Overall: It is a remarkable resort to spend with your family and I would suggest it to anyone with one rule in mind. Definitely go with a car if you plan to stay at this resort!

Reviews.Title: “We love comming here”
Reviews.Author: wmn9
Reviews.Content: We have a week timeshare here and we love it. The kids love the pool and the Kids Zone. We love the space in the rooms and the central location to all the parks. Every year we sign up for the family photos.

Reviews.Title: “Great Facilities!!”
Reviews.Author: hbsprite
Reviews.Content: We arrived to the hotel at 11AM, fully not expecting to be able to check in until 4PM - the stated check in time. Much to our surprise they had a villa on the 4th floor ready for us. We reserved a 3 bedroom, as there were 7 of us traveling. The villa could not have been more perfect. The three bedroom units have 2 balconies, which came in handy. We found the pools to be very pleasant and the kids loved the fun water zone where they could squirt each other. When looking at a map, we were worried that we would be too far from Disneyworld. This ended up not being the case. Disneyworld was less than a 15 minute drive along the freeway. We never hit any traffic and didn't have to deal with the craziness of International Drive. I would definitely stay here again...especially with a large group.

Reviews.Title: “Great base for seeing the theme parks”
Reviews.Author: Bigmac40
Reviews.Content: We picked this property because we wanted two bedrooms and a kitchen and because of the good reviews on TA. We were very happy with our choice. The only reason I did not give it five stars was for the several things that kept breaking down in our room. They were quick to come repair the items but it got old having a repair man in your room. They are renovating most of the rooms so I think this should cure most of the problems. We stayed in building 80 and I would highly recommend this building for the convienance for the pool and market. The childrens activities were great and our 2&5 year olds could not get enough of the giant indoor play area. This was great for us because we could have a cocktail and watch them play indoors with A.C. The MGV is very close to Sea World and the Acuatica water park that should open in early 2008. The Disney parks were about 10 minutes away.

Reviews.Title: “In a Very Positive Nutshell”
Reviews.Author: Kayger12
Reviews.Content: Fresh back from a Disney mission, uh, I mean vacation, with the kids. Stayed in the two-bedroom room 8145. Room was beautiful, modern, and clean. Beds were comfortable, kitchen was great, no noise problems. Kids loved the arcade and pools, parents loved the Starbucks coffee in the village center store. Wish we had more time to enjoy the amenities, but with the Disney trips, it's pretty much sleep and go. Access to parking areas, pools, and buildings was protected by a locking or parking gate which your room key card opened. Never had a chance to try the bar or grill. Absolutely zero complaints about this place and will be trying to switch my December accommodations (wife and I heading to Discovery Cove)from Hilton Grand Vacations to this Marriott. As for the park travel times: Sea World/Discovery Cove- 2 min All Disney parks- 15-20 depending on parks (avoided I-4 at all costs) Checkout is normally a bright and early 10am, however, they gave us 11 oclock with no hassles. Very pleased with the whole experience.

Reviews.Title: “When you go make sure your villa is one of the new ones!”
Reviews.Author: Traveling-Gorillas
Reviews.Content: Arrived to our villa late Sunday night, couldn't shower because the shower drain was clogged couldn't go on the balcony do to a broken door, the sofa bed had dirty sheets and no pillows. The next day we complained to the front desk and we were placed in the exact room on a different building with other issues - now the bathroom sink is clogged and the refrigerator wonâ€™t close, we figured we are here just to sleep so we can live with this. A final note 80% of the staff is not friendly and not willing to go out of their way to help - you are on your own. If you need to stay at a Marriot try Horizons up the street.

Reviews.Title: “lovely big family resort with lots of great facilities”
Reviews.Author: nuttytart21
Reviews.Content: excellent resort with lots of facilities, close to all theme parks, right on international drive. golfing excellent both on the nick faldo 9 hole course and the 18 hole course across the road at grand pines. bars could have stayed open longer, both were shut by 11.00pm, which surprised us as the resort looked full. pool very welcoming and also chilled (refrigerated). racoons by bbq and bin area are a fab sight to see. 2 bed 2 bath apartment very spacious, enough room for 8 people comfortably, kitchen fully eqiped with crockery and excellent "white" goods.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at The Grande Vista!”
Reviews.Author: DeniseLINY
Reviews.Content: My family and I loved the Marriott Grand Vista in Orlando. The accomodations were divine! We had a two bedroom suite, full kitchen, dining room, living room, two baths, two bedrooms and a screened in patio with table& chairs and plants, really lovely. Each bedroom had a King Size bed and there was a sleep sofa in the living room. There were three TV's in the unit-one in each bedroom and one in the living room. The master bedroom had a huge jacuzzi tub in the bedroom, the room itself was spacious, clean and comfortable. And the bed was the ultimate in luxurious comfort! We enjoyed snacking and playing board games at night on the patio,and having our coffee there in the morning, where we had a beautiful view of the golf course. The pools are large, well maintained and the gardens surrounding them are beautiful-very astheically pleasing. There is plenty to do on site, an ice cream stand and a pizza hut as well as a general -deli type store. The week we spent there was relaxing, quiet and comfortable and we will be going back there next May.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort in a Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: DriveOrFly
Reviews.Content: My wife and I traveled here with our two teenage boys, ages 15 and 17, and we stayed here for 4 nights, August 5th â€“ August 9, 2007. CHECK-IN: We took the Auto Train from Lorton, VA to Sanford, FL, which arrived at 9:00 a.m. and we had our car by 10:00 a.m. The drive from Sanford to the Grande Vista was approximately 45 minutes, with no traffic, probably because it was a Sunday. Knowing we may get in early, I had requested early check-in. I requested a room on a high floor near main pool. When we arrived around 11:00 a.m., I asked if my room was ready, really not expecting it to be ready since regular check-in is 4:00 p.m. The very friendly lady at the front desk said the building I requested is very popular and probably would not be ready for a couple hours. She said other rooms are ready if we would like to take one not close to the main pool, but we declined (hindsight â€“ we should have taken one since we really didnâ€™t need to be so close to the main pool and Market Place shop as we thought originally). She offered to store our luggage and also informed us we were welcome to use the changing facilities if we wanted to wait near the pool. She also said she would call us on my cell phone when our room was ready. We ate lunch at one of the pool bar/restaurants, Copa Loca, and hung around by the pool until our room was ready at 4:00 p.m. ROOM: We stayed in a 2 bedroom timeshare unit in building 81 (or 83 â€“ I canâ€™t remember) on the 2nd floor in room numbers 1207/1208. Not the â€œhigh floorâ€� we requested, but it was in the building we requested and not on the 1st floor. This building overlooks the main pool area, near the Lighthouse pool bar, Market Place shop, and the ice cream and pizza shop. It really is a very convenient location. The pool closes at 11:00 p.m. so there is no noise and doubt there would be if your patio doors are closed, because the doors are thick and heavy. These 2 bedrooms are what Marriott Vacation Club calls â€œlock-offsâ€� because one side could be made into a studio and the other side a 1 bedroom. When you rent the 2 bedroom you can enter either side and open the adjoining doors between them. What struck me when I entered the rooms were the colors Marriott chose to use to decorate. Not your typical â€œFloridaâ€� pastels, but more â€œformalâ€� darker colors. Granted, the place was very clean and did not show any sign of wear. Both sides had the very comfortable new Marriott bedding, which is just wonderful! The studio side had a king bed, pull out queen couch, TV, balcony with 2 chairs and small table, small fridge, microwave, 12 cup coffee maker, small table and 2 chairs, servings for 4, and sink (no washer/dryer, oven, or dishwasher). It also had a full bathroom. The 1 bedroom side has an apartment size washer/dryer, full size fridge, oven and stove, dishwasher, microwave, bar/counter with 4 stools, table and 6 chairs, servings for 6, pull out queen couch, TV, DVD player (you can rent movies in the MAZE for $5), large screened in balcony with table and 4 chairs and ceiling fan, a ceiling fan in the master bedroom with king size bed, sitting chair, 2 person whirlpool tub with a single sink, and then a full bath with toilet, sink and shower. Knowing this timeshare rental does not come with daily maid service, and since we were staying 4 nights, we ordered a $23 â€œtidyâ€� service where they vacuum, take out the trash, make the beds with the same linens, and change all the towels. We thought it was worth it, since the unit looked nice when we got back from the parks that evening. My only complaint or shall I say â€˜annoyanceâ€™ because it really didnâ€™t affect our vacation, was with the maintenance staff. When we got there, a hair dryer was missing, the ceiling fan did not work, and two lights in the bedroom did not work and we immediately called them in on Sunday. After getting back from the parks on Monday, things still were not fixed, and you could only get hot water out of the shower on the studio side, so we called them in again and added the water problem. They immediately brought up a new hair dryer. Tuesday morning they called to check to see if everything was taken care of and we told them no. When we got back from the parks on Tuesday evening, the ceiling fan was fixed, but the water problem and the lights were not, and we just gave up since we were leaving on Thursday. POOL: There are 2 main pool areas, and both are usually crowded because both have access to bar/restaurant areas. There are other smaller pools scattered throughout the large complex. Part of the problem at the larger, main pool areas are the people that â€œsaveâ€� seats then go somewhere for hours while other people are looking for seats. I donâ€™t know how you prevent this because Iâ€™ve seen this at other places, not just here. OTHER AMENITIES: We did not get to use any of these because we did not have enough time, but I thought I would just mention them. The Nick Faldo golf course is right on property, they also provide lessons. There are tennis courts, bicycle rentals, paddle boat rentals, a rock climbing wall, a child care center and activities (MAZE), and an arcade with pool tables. LOCATION: The Grande Vista is in a great location. You are about 2 miles off I-4 and the entrance to Grande Vista is on International Drive (I Drive), 1 mile from Sea World and Discovery Cove, 2 miles from Publix grocery store and many restaurants, about 5 miles from Universal, and 10 miles from Disney World. If you are going to the Disney World parks, I would highly recommend having access to a car. Otherwise, there is a trolley/bus that makes the I Drive loop with a stop near the entrance to Grande Vista.

Reviews.Title: “The best of the best”
Reviews.Author: EgerTravler
Reviews.Content: OH MY GOODNESS! This is the best that you can get when it comes to a home away from home. We fell in love with our villa the instant we touched down on it. It is the greatest place to be for the best price. There was no hassle from check in to check out. All the staff was excellent (overly so). Our children enjoyed it so much that we will be returning in January 08" It was a pleasure to be here and though we did not get the opportunity to go paddle boating or bike riding (via the activities on premises). We still enjoyed our stay. Just wish it was longer. They keep your children entertained as well as adults. I would recommend this property to all. TRUST ME I AM HARD TO PLEASE and I WAS TAKEN AWAY! P.s. Did I mention they even load your dish washer! 5 stars........and then some!

Reviews.Title: “July Stay”
Reviews.Author: LifeIn
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week as a RCI trade. We always ask for the top floor, so that was nice to be able to get it upon request. We took pictures of our room and they are included in this review. We ran to the store for some essentials and when we got back we could hear about 4 boys in the room next door, it was very loud! I called immediately, not willing to hear that for more than the next 5 minute it woul take to pick up my stuff I had just brought in. The staff at the front desk were helpful and we were switched from building 83 to 95, top floor room again. One thing I don't care for is being in a lock-off room. Sometimes you can't hear anything, other times you can hear, which was evidenced by the first room. I felt bad for anyone who came along after us into that room. Our next room, we didn't hear too much except for some slight banging around when they would come back after a day out in Orlando. This Marriott seems to have 1-bedrooms with a studio suite lock-off as the only option for room choices. So we had the studio part, which is enough room for 2 adults for sure. So the first room had granite in the kitchenette, the second did not. The first had a pond and tree-line view, the second had a golf and other hotel buildings view. The rest of the room was nice and the same overall in both. Large king bed with very comfy pillows, sheets and bedding; a sofa; tv; kitchen with micro and small fridge; bathroom. We used the pools on the property and found them to be nice (lots of families with kids however if you do or don't enjoy that, take note). The hot tub near building 95 was very hot, but the jets did not seem to be working, so not much to actually massage us with. But the kids were in the other part of the pool area, so it was nice to have all to ourselves. There seems to be about 4 pool areas on the property, we hit 2. There is also a golf course, marketplace store (where you can get free large bags of ice) and some boat and bike rentals. We only got the free ice, didn't use the other things. There is a large lake and we were told you could fish in there, but we didn't bring equipment. This Marriott is right around the corner from Sea World, a grocery store and about 2 miles from Hwy 4, so easy on and off. Nearby, Downtown Disney is fun for people watching and the Rain Forest Cafe has a great Cobb salad, big enough for 2 to share (we suggest that!) Nice place, definitely family/kid friendly. We don't have kids so we would have enjoyed an adult only pool! Otherwise, nice enough place. Bed was very comfortable and the room seemed to be really clean. Having a fridge in the room is always a good thing too.

Reviews.Title: “Not Grande At All!”
Reviews.Author: robbw2b
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in nicer motels on the side of the highway! I excahnged this from an unused week at another time share and will not waste the effort to do so again! From the word go it was a mess: Upon check in I noticed the clerk switched the keys for the two rooms we had. When I suggested he check them he insted they were coded correctly. Of course after I drove all the way to the rooms and back we found out I was right. I had four keys for one room and none for the other. Got into one room and there was a puddle of water on the floor from something: AC? Toliet overflow? Freezer melted? Who knows, housekeeping did not! Got into second room and there was no AC! No sheets on or even in the room for pullout! No towels! When towels were delivered we had to make another request for washclothes! Thank goodness all we needed was a place to lay our head after day at the parks! Unfortunately it wasn't even good enough for that! We checked out a day early and stayed at real hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Love the Grande Vista More Each Time”
Reviews.Author: Mimi56
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grande Vista from July 14-July 21. We stayed in building 79 overlooking the Copa Loca Pool. Our room was beautiful in every way and convenient to the pool and grill area. This is a truly spectacular resort and eveytime we stay there we love it more and more. We can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Great 3-Week Visit!”
Reviews.Author: Jillypepper
Reviews.Content: This was our 4th trip to the Grande Vista in almost 3 years. We decided to do a nice, long family vacation since we had a lot of Marriott points to redeem. By staying almost 3 weeks, things are bound to go wrong at some point, and they did (for one, burned-out light bulbs not fixed after repeated requests) however, we did have a terrific time. My biggest disappointment with this hotel is that there are some things in need of major repair. Since we have been going here, we have seen the main pool decline. Many of the tiles are cracked, missing or moldy and the tower where there is a waterfall is very rusty. The other large pool is also falling into disrepair. The large rubber/plastic rings on the children's spray poles in this pool are also getting rusty and moldy. It would seem an easy fix to replace those. Definitely not what I would expect of a hotel/vacation ownership of this caliber. As mentioned above, certain things were not tended to after repeated requests. Also, we were on a first floor and for some reason, someone's underwear was on the grass in front of our patio. The day we checked out was day #4 of underwear on the grass. Yes, we could have called someone but other requests fell on deaf ears and we wanted to see how long before someone would attend to this. On the plus side, our 2-bedroom was very spacious and gave us our necessary space from our kids! The bed and furniture was comfortable and clean. Also, the staff is very nice. Everyone always had a smile on their face and seemed willing to help. The 4th of July parade they all put on (each department had a golf cart to decorate) was really cute and they gave lots of treats to the kids. The 4th of July carnival they had was also really fun. They really went all-out to make the holiday special for everyone. There is definitely a lot to do at this hotel. They added a rock-climbing wall (free) and their kid's activity area was great. There was an activity every morning for the kids and we took advantage of their Parent's Night Out where they watched the kids from 5-10 PM. My children loved it!! In my personal opinion, the activity staff is absolutely fantastic. They really enjoy working with the kids! Overall, a great place to stay in the Orlando area. Perfect resort for taking a day off from all of the theme parks and other endless activities in the area.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: lettergirl40
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay as owners at the grande vista. It is a beautiful resort with all the resort features. Our two bedroom condo was totally equipped with everything we needed including washer and dryer. The rooms were very spacey and clean. The surroundings were well taken care of. Did not eat at the restaurant on premises but did purchase from the market and the prices were reasonable. I would like it if they had an adult only hot tub it was annoying at night for the little ones to be running around and hopping in the hot tub. Other than that it was great. Very close to all the parks.

Reviews.Title: “This is a ten!”
Reviews.Author: travelmomTx_
Reviews.Content: We have never stayed in a better hotel. You have everthing you could want. and it is beautiful. I love this place. I have no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Resort!!”
Reviews.Author: nle
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a wonderful week at the Marriott Grande Vista and absoultely loved it! We stayed through an exchange with Interval International. Never having been to Orlando and trying to choose a resort, I did my research which included Trip Advisor. After finally deciding on The Marriott Grande Vista, once we arrived, I knew we had made the right choice. The entrance is a long curving driveway lined with beautiful trees and surrounded by a natural wildlife preserve. The staff at the front desk were very friendly and nice. We stayed in a 2BD Villa in the Ibiza Building and it was great. We were not to close to the pool which was fine because we spent almost every single day at the parks (Disney/Universal). We only spent one full day enjoying the main pool and resort ammenities. We rented a car which I strongly recommend and on the day we skipped the parks and stayed at the resort to relax, we just drove on over to the main pool and had no problem with finding a parking spot. In fact, we got back late each night and never ever had a problem with finding a parking spot by our building. I mention this as I read complaints about this from others here on Trip Advisor. Our 2BD had a full kitchen with granite countertops, a large pantry for all of our groceries, refrigerator, stove, dishwasher, etc. The kitchen was fully stocked with all the necessary appliances, cookware, dishes, etc. We were able to enjoy breakfast every morning out on our terrace with a very nice view of the lake. We had a washer and dryer which we used. It was nice returning home with fresh and clean clothes. Also, they only give you one detergent packet in your welcome package but the on-site Market Place sells more travel size detergent. The master bedroom had a VERY, VERY comfortable king size bed and a hot tub which we very much enjoyed at the end of our very long days at the parks. Keep in mind, this is a vacation club property, not a standard hotel, so we did not have regular housekeeping service. However, you can purchase a tidy up or a full cleaning. This was fine as we were only two couples and had no problem cleaning up after ourselves in general. We did decide to go with a tidy up halfway through the week. We ordered the tidy up the night before and were told housekeeping would come by the next day after 10 am. The next day, we left for the parks and returned to discover housekeeping did not come by. We called and complained (nicely) and they apologized. They assured us housekeeping would come by the following day for a full cleaning at no extra charge, which they did (Great Marriott Customer Service). It was great to come back to a fully cleaned villa. In fact, we realized it was worth going with the full cleaning halfway through the week regardless. In addition, we also did the Marriott timeshare presentation, got some Disney Dollars and felt the presentation to be very low pressure. The salesperson was very courteous and professional and did not make us feel uncomfortable after we declined and requested to take the information home to review. All in all it was a wonderful experience. I must mention that this is a family oriented resort, lots of families with children which was fine with us. We were a party of 4 (two couples) and really spent most of our time at the parks, but enjoyed coming back to the very, very comfortable Marriott accommodations. My only suggestion would be an adult only pool for those of us not traveling with children.

Reviews.Title: “Family Fun in the Sun!”
Reviews.Author: rchud
Reviews.Content: My family of four and I stayed at the Marriott Grande Vista from June 23 - 30th. This really is a wonderful place for families. The resort goes above and beyond to provide activities and treats for kids. Here are some specifics: Room & Rates: First of all, we got our reservations from EBay - the family who owned the unit was not able to use it this year. Fantastic deal - less than $900 for a 2 bedroom, 2 bath unit. Based on previous TripAdvisor reviews I asked for a renovated room - which I think is a good idea. I never saw any other rooms - but ours was delightful. We were in Building 80 on the second floor. Ask for this building... it is the building right above the MarketPlace, lobby, main pool, etc. The convenience was such a bonus. Not that the resort is so overwhelming in size - but we could literally run to our room in two minutes, run down for a coffee, ice cream, you name it. Also, the room itself was wonderfully furnished - fully stocked kitchen, two screened balconies, 3 TVs, tons of room. It really was such a nice place - we were thrilled. Activities for Kids: The list here could go on and on, but here are a few things we actually participated in and enjoyed. Free rock climbing wall, poolside temporary tattoos and hair braiding, kids club called MAZE - we tie-dyed tees, played on the playscape, participated in poolside games, bingo, and hula-hoop contest. There was soooo much more to do - we really did not scratch the surface. Every morning in elevators you could get a list of activities - most are free - a few cost a bit. There was also Kids Check-in most days beginning around 4:00 - free ice cream, face painting, and balloon animals. Most parents did tip the staff - but still for a few dollars the kids really get a kick out of it. Food and MarketPlace: We got poolside drinks once or twice - About $35.00 for two adults and two kids. So, a little pricey, but very yummy. You can bring coolers to the pool and snacks - most families did. We got the ice cream, Pizza Hut, and a wrap sandwiches at the store. All were good. Grounds: I thought the grounds were really nice - good condition & beautifully landscaped. Lots of water - just like the pictures. The pools were in great condition - I did see the occasional loose paver, but frankly with a resort even 24 hour maintenance could not keep up with everything. Overall we all really enjoyed the resort - would recommend to our pickiest friends, and will look to return in the future. Hope this helps!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Grandparent/Grandsons trip and stay at Grande Vista”
Reviews.Author: spengle1
Reviews.Content: We took 2 of our grandsons (ages 8 and 9) to Orlando for a week at Sea World and Discovery Cove. We exchanged our timeshare week for one at Grande Vista beginning on June 29 and ending July 6, 2007. In a word, terrific! The 2 bedroom unit was perfect for the 4 of us. The boys had their own room, own beds and own TV and bathroom. We, of course, had our own room as well. The full kitchen with W/D was just as we have come to expect from Marriott timeshares. We were in building 83 on the 3rd floor overlooking the lake - this was a renovated unit which we had requested when booking. The furniture had been newly recovered and the carpet was new. Bathrooms could use a bit of work and lighting was insufficient. Since the focus of our trip was Sea World and Discovery Cove, this was the best location - a very short drive. We were able to be at the parks when the gates opened, hit the best shows and rides before the crowds and come back for lunch in our home away from home. The boys enjoyed a respite in the air conditioned unit and explored several of the nearby pools. Fountains and waterfalls made the pool visits more fun. We enjoyed frou frou drinks by the pool while watching them swim and snorkel in the water. One night we ate dinner at Nick's near the Faldo Golf Institute. Not crowded, very nice service to the children and a reasonable children's menu. We did not feel that the adult food was particularly good, but adequate and the restful atmosphere was welcome at the end of the day. Service from the desk staff was excellent. Always a friendly smile and willingness to help out and answer questions. The night before we checked out, the desk clerk printed boarding passes for us! We would certainly stay here again if the location was where we wanted to be. We have also stayed at Marriott's Cypress Harbor and thought it was wonderful as well.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! Keeps getting better & better!”
Reviews.Author: Mommy0600
Reviews.Content: This is our 3rd visit to the Grande Vista since 2003 and it keeps getting better & better! We stayed in a two bedroom unit in the newest building overlooking the golf course. The unit was beautiful and spacious. The beds were so comfortable that it was hard to get out of bed in the morning. The villa has everything you need - full kitchen, cookware, jacuzzi tub, washer/dryer, etc. The resort grounds are very beautiful and well maintained. The pools are very clean. There are several baby pools and splash areas for little ones as well as deeper areas for the older children. There are activities at the pools everyday. My children loved the hula hoop contests and searching for alligators in the baby pool. We loved the Margaritas from the pool side bar! There are duck boats to rent, a man made beach beach area with a rock climbing wall and swings overlooking the water to relax on after a long day at the parks. There is a indoor kids climbing area and baby play area that is great on a rainy day. I can't say enough good things about the Grande Vista. We definitely will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Family loved the Grande Vista”
Reviews.Author: PSMinWV
Reviews.Content: We stayed from June 9th thru the 13th at the Grande Vista. We stayed in a 1 bedroom villa. It was great. The room was over sized. We had a complete kitchen, dining area, living area and a king size bed in the bedroom with a sleeper sofa bed in the living room area and it was comfortable. It offered a washer and dryer which we used. The resort offered alot. We stayed in buliding 99 which over looked the golf course. We used one of three pools on site. The only thing I could see that needed improvement was the debris in the pool in our area. The Vista is in a good location. We went to Universal Studios for 3 days.

Reviews.Title: “Great property”
Reviews.Author: cptguy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this property over the March break. The property was spotless and the rooms were immaculate. The property had a lush tropical feel. The pools were very clean and the kids had a terrific time. We rented a two bedroom suite and all I can say was wow. Huge liv/din area with a full kitchen and laundry with two bathrooms and a jacuzzi in the master. ALL of the staff were very friendly right from the front gate and desk to the landscapers who greeted you good morning everyday. The pool side bar was reasonable with their prices and being able to charge to your room was very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Rooms”
Reviews.Author: swils07
Reviews.Content: We were invited to stay at the Marriott as reward members for their timeshare presentation deal ($199 for 5 days, 4 nights). The Room: We stayed in a "studio" villa, which has a very comfortable bed with new, white down linens, a small kitchenette (small refrigerator, sink, microwave and dishes/silverware), and pull out sleeper sofa. It also had a large, separate bathroom. The room was very clean and had all the amenities to make your stay comfortable. We had a nice view of the lake and a balcony on the 6th floor. Our main complaint with the room is the water smells terribly like sulfur. Taking a shower, or brushing your teeth, caused the whole bathroom to stink horribly. The Resort: The resort has a total of 4 pools. We only visited 2 of them, the main one near the front desk building, the other next to our hotel. They had a grill/bar poolside to our building, which seemed overpriced. The pools were disappointing. Always crowded with tons of kids! It wouldve been nice to have an adults only pool. Also, the water smells of sulfur. There seemed to be enough lounge chairs for everyone. They had daily scheduled activities, and a marketplace and Pizza hut on site. The pizza was very good. Transportation/ Location: We did not drive down or rent a car. We wanted to save money not renting a car. At the entrance of the resort there is an I-Ride trolley stop (stop G13- you can find route maps online) and a Lynx stop (Orlando public bus transportation). To ride the i-ride is $1 per ride, $1.50 for the lynx. The Lynx route 50 will take you to Magic Kingdom where you can take free Disney buses to any park, as well as the airport (route 8 to route 42). To get to the Lynx route 50 stop, just get on the route 8 bus at the front of the resort to Sea World for the transfer. We were pretty happy saving money taking the buses, sometimes you have to wait up to a half hour, which is an inconvenience, but you can't beat the price! Also, the hotel offers shuttle service to Magic Kingdom. The price is $13 per person, roundtrip. It is a towncar service called "worldwide-something or another". BEWARE. We got took for a ride with them! The driver, named Steve, gave us his card the first day with his number in case we wanted to contact him directly for transportation. If booked through the hotel they will only pick you up for return from Magic Kingdom at 830pm, 1030 pm, or 1230 pm. We contaced steve the next day to get a ride to the park. Once he dropped us off at the gate he said the fare would be $26 for my husband and I ONE WAY- double the fare the day before. He did not notify us prior that contacting him outside of the hotel on our own would double the price. We really felt decieved as he did not notify us of a price difference. Then, the ride he arranged for us to come back that evening did not show up. We had to catch another cab after waiting for his other driver who was a no-show. I would not recommend using this company for your transportation needs. The location of the resort seems far away from everything without your own car. It took work and planning to get around anywhere, and the resort is huge, so walking all the way to the front to catch the bus is a hike. The bellman at the front desk can take you (tip expected), but we waited 45 min one day in the blazing sun, with groceries, to be brought back to our room- they never came so we walked. Overall: We thought the resort itself was OKAY. The timeshare presentation was very, very LOW pressure. Great presentation, great vacation club from what we could tell! The rooms were beautiful, besides the stench of sulfur water. All in all, the smell of the water and inconvenience of the location will have us staying elsewhere our next trip to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable”
Reviews.Author: PecosJoe
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Rooms 9223 and 9224 in building 89, second floor, in the back corner of the resort. The view in the back was golf course and pond. The guy in the room adjacent to us (9222) complained that his view was blocked by trees. We arrived and asked for a renovated room. We got building 89. We then asked for a ground floor room and got building 83. I asked if it was renovated and after some prodding the receptionist admitted it was not. So we stayed in building 89 which the receptionist said was renovated about 90 days ago (as of June 07). We then received a ticket for a "free gift" which turned out to be a Marriott t-shirt. The room layout was excellent and identical (down to the pineapple pattern on the chairs and pineapple painting on the wall) to the Marriott resort we stayed at in Ko'Olina Oahu HI. The Good stuff: functional kitchen (we ate supper there every night), great wireless (I'm writing the review from the hotel room), great beds, good laundry area in the kitchen. Helpful service (highchair, towels, etc) but give them about 1-2 hours to fulfill your request. The bad: the outlet in the kitchen didn't work, the water line to the fridge ice maker was unattached and leaked water -- which the ants loved but not us, the wrought iron furniture has sharp corners and glass tops (hazard for active children), and did I mention the CONDOM wrapper under the nightstand found by the 3 year old. DVD player failed. Almost no shelf space to store groceries (maybe they want you to eat at the restaurants?). The Marriott Grande Vista is an enourmous facility holding thousands of guests. The scale is almost incomprehensible. We stayed because we got a great deal and used it as our "base of operations" to explore Disney and Sea World. I think it is mainly a destination for Marriott timeshare owners doing the same thing. Overall, we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: cmak12
Reviews.Content: My wife and daughter and I stayed here for a week at Disney. A family member had a free week at a Marriott timeshare that they gave to us. We chose the Grande Vista over a couple of other Marriott resorts in the area and we couldn't be happier that we did. While I understand that everyone has different expectations when they first stay at a resort, I just cannot understand some of the negative reviews this resort received. We had a 2 bedroom villa on the 6th floor in the San Moreno (?) building near the main pool and lobby. The room had minor flaws (one lightbulb out in the dining area, weather stripping under one outside door was non-existent), but it was very clean and there were no major issues like the ones mentioned in previous reviews. The room was also had more space than 3 people need, but we like to have our space and we also like that our daughter (7) had her own bedroom (and so did she). It felt more like home than a hotel. We had breakfast in our room everyday before we hit the parks, which saved us some cash for dinners. On our first day, we got a feel for the property and we were impressed. It was well kept and it actually reminded us of some of the resorts we stay at in the Caribbean. I can't really comment on any of the activities or all of the restaurants since we didn't use the facilities all that much. We were at the parks virtually all day each of the 7 days we were there. The shop that they have where you can get food and drink items is limited and a little pricey. My wife forgot her toothbrush and they didn't sell them there. I would suggest going to Publix anyway which is only a few minutes away. It would be nice however if they sold the single packs of detergent for the laundry. They give you one when you check in, but if you wanted (needed) to do more than one load before you left for home, then you have to bring your own or get the smallest possible container at Publix and leave it behind. I can honestly say that if there were no theme parks in the immediate vicinity, we would have still been able to stay at this resort and not been bored based on the activities sheet that we saw posted in the elevator each day. We received the call to listen to the timeshare opportunity and we took advantage of it (free Marriott Rewards points). They knew that we were brand new owners at Marriott in St Kitts, as did our salesperson and rather than giving us the typical tour, we sat in his office and he gave us some great information regarding how to take full advatage of our timeshare and it's trading possibilities. This to me showed how professional Marriott is in their approach. Our salesperson knew he wasn't going to get a sale out of us, yet he still took the time to give us some very solid advice. I've been to other timeshare presentations and when you decide not to sign up some of them act like you are taking food out of their children's mouths if you don't buy with them. If this type of treatment and overall experience is what we can expect out of our St Kitts property and all the other Marriott resorts, then we made the right choice. We'd return to this property again next time we come to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful landscape/Rooms need an update”
Reviews.Author: SCTraveler29412
Reviews.Content: We traded our Marriott timeshare for a week at the Grande Vista with our family. The grounds are beautifully landscaped, but the rooms are in need of a deep cleaning and refurnishing. Our 2 bedroom unit was spacious enough to accomodate 5 people, but that only included 2 large beds and 3 foldout couches. The couches were old and the mattresses worn. The blankets provided for the foldouts were quite old. When we arrived, the unit had not been thoroughly cleaned. Mold and mildew were in the shower and had obviously been there for some time. The furnishings were old and worn. This is not nearly as nice as Marriott units in other locations. There was a problem with the sliding doors and that was taken care of immediately. The staff are polite and always willing to help. The location was great and the view from our balcony was wonderful. Parks, stores and restaurants are all close to the resort. A car is recommended for easier transportation. Some of our favorite restaurants were the Thai restaurant just down the street, Rangetsu(authentic Japanese) and Tu Tu Tango(tapas). All these restuarants had great food and entertainment related to the nationality of the establishment. The Grande Vista provides a nice break from the theme parks - usually quiet and relaxing. Pools close at 11pm. There was only one night that some guests decided to stay later than 11pm. I could not recommend purchasing a unit at the Grande Vista unless time and money are spent updating and cleaning the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay.”
Reviews.Author: AdAgencyWoman
Reviews.Content: I have to say that I was more than happy with this property. I received an invitiation to come on down and do a timeshare presentation. At first I was a bit hesitant but Marriott is a very popular name and I am sure that they stand behind their properties. We arrived on May 17th and stayed through the 21st. We were at the theme parks each day but returned to use the pool and relax in the afternoon. The grounds are spectacular and clean. The pool was relaxing and had areas for shade. Our one bedroom villa was modern and had a screened in patio areas which was good because it was lovebug season. It was spotless and had all of the up to date ammenities. Parking was easy. This property is huge but well maintained. No long waits at the front desk. Internet use is pay as you go in the lobby. A well stocked store is on site. We did not dine in the restaurant but hear that it's good. The presentation did not go longer than the 90 minutes and there was no pressure at all. Loved my stay..wish they would invite me back as the entire experience was wonderful from the accomodations to Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: mv68
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Marriott grande Vista May 15-19 on a promotion/ it is the second time we stayed at the resort/.We were there last yr for 7 nights when we bought a promotional stay( we had to attend a timeshare presentation) It is a beautiful resort, very large( about 20 buildings)/ very clean, beautiful grounds; The resort has a magnificent entrance ; you drive about 1/2 mile until you reach the main building/ there are beautiful white magnolia trees on both sides of the road. This year we stayed in a one bedroom unit( 4 of us/ my husband, my 5 yo daughter/ my mother and myself). the units are big/ confortable bed/ big kitchen equipped with everything you can think of; TV in each room/ terrace/ There are several pools at the resort , I don't think we saw them all; each group of 3-4 buildings has at least one pool close by; we prefer the main building pool area/ it has two pools( a lap/ pool/a horse shoe shaped pool with sprinklers for kids to play/ there is a kiddie pool( water is very cold in that one) and there are two jacuzzis. The main building has a deli/ convenience store/ a pizza hut/ an indoor playground/ Last yr we stayed in the main building, we had a two bedroom unit and it was very convenient to have everything downstairs/ this year we could not get a unit in the main building , we stayed in building # 80 which is right across the street from the main building. We had a great time/ we only did one park in 4 days; we spent the morning and early afternoon by the pool and then in the evenings we went to downtown Disney or the Boardwalk. We attended the time share presentation and we decided to buy a timeshare with Marriott/ because we travel at least twice a year and we like to have these kind of amenities at our resort.

Reviews.Title: “Waking up at Marriott Grande Vista”
Reviews.Author: Going2Graz
Reviews.Content: This is a huge complex of rooms and villas. Very nice grounds, the pools etc. looked great but I didn't get a chance to visit them. I was there on business and the room was ok. What elevates the experience was the incredibly great bed - some kind of memory foam, nice sheets and the the sunrise view over the green golf course on the patio. The downside was the unusual stains on the carpet, small/awkward room and the impressive acoustics from the shared entry way ( 2 rooms share a front door which is all ceramic tile and echoed quite clearly the banging of the door at 11pm on all 3 nights that I was there). I asked for early check-in in advance and they were very obliging. Overall it seemed nicer than the Wyndham where my conference was being held. Probably a better bet for families than for business travelers getting up early!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Resort”
Reviews.Author: PetefromRI
Reviews.Content: We just returned from an 8 night stay at the Grande Vista.My brother owns a 3 bedroom villa timeshare and invited my wife and I to stay with them.My wife and I originally planned on staying for 4 nights and then move over to Disney's Caribbean Beach for 4 more nights,we are real Disney fanatics.By day 3 we decided to stay for the whole week.What a beautiful resort,clean,great staff ,nice pools and hot tubs and plenty to do.The pool bar and grill made great drinks and decent food.We had lunch at Nick's one day and it was very good.The dinner menu looked great as well.We loved this resort so much that we may end up getting a timeshare there eventually.When I returned home I looked up the cost to stay there again and was surprised at how much cheaper it was compared to Disney,and the rooms and bedding were awesome.We never slept so sound in our lives.We will deffenitly return here soon.This resort gets an A+++.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic in every way”
Reviews.Author: florida2004
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in august 2004, arrived on thursday 12 august, just before huricane charlie. Had 2 bed/2 bath apartment. I have no bad comments what so ever, everything was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott's Grande Vista - A nice family timeshare resort”
Reviews.Author: MikeFM
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 4 nights as part of a package to tour the property. It is definitely a nice place. I was a liitle disappointed that the 1-Bedoom and Studio rooms only have 1 bed. There is a pull-out couch. This is OK if you're a couple, but no so hot if you're not. It seems a little over-kill to get a 2-bedroom unit (which is quite large), just to have 2 normal beds. The place is very, very clean, though in need of updating (i.e. 19 inch TV's). I liked the fact that it offers free internet. Most amenities (other than pools and sunbathing) are chargeable. When I go to a resort, I don't like to feels as though I'm being nickel and dimed. They should provide Non-motorized watersports and bikes for free (in my opinion). The pools were not crowded when I went there, but I have to wonder if they could be over-crowded during a spring break due to the high unit to facility ratio. As timeshare resorts go, this is definitely one of the best. Orange Lake is also nice if you want to be closer to Disney. The Marriot resorts is practically next to Seaworld and not far from Universal (about 15 minutes). There are no motorized watersports if you're into that kind of thing.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: debGR
Reviews.Content: my husband and i stayed at Marriott for 3nights and my son and his family stayed for a week. he traded his timeshare for his 2 bedroom suite while we booked a one bedroom. prior to our arrival, i followed another reviewer's advice and asked for rooms in the main building, which we got. size of rooms more than adequate. no problems with cleanliness. pool area is pretty with a little area that shoots up water for the kids as well as a separate kiddie pool. one night we had dinner at Nick's which is right on the grounds. wed. night is prime rib special for $19.99 and it was very good. paddle boats and surrey bikes also available for reasonable rates. very convenient to have Marketplace in main building providing sundries, Starbucks coffee, krispy Kreme donuts, sandwiches, icecream, pizza. Disney parks about 15 min drive away. lots of restaurants short drive away. we ate at Bahama Breeze and Houligans.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Grande Vista”
Reviews.Author: jwl55
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a great stay at MGV. We were in a one bedroom villa from May 3rd through May10th. We had recently bought a 2 bedroom timeshare through Marriott Vacation Club, and the MGV is our home location. We split our time into one week in the one bedroom villa, and we still have a week "in the bank" at Interval Intermational. The MGV is about a 20 minute drive from the Orlando airport. The long driveway into MGV is beautifully landscaped, and we were excited when we arrived at the office. Our check in was smooth and only took a few minutes. The room was great, and it looked very much like the model we had seen when we bought our timeshare (we made the purchase in Absecon, NJ) The property is beautifully maintained, and the rooms can overlook the lake, or one of the pools, or the golf course. Ours overlooked the lake, very quiet, with a nice screened in porch. The MGV has a great location. It is about 5 minutes from SeaWorld, and maybe 15 minutes from DisneyWorld (Epcot at least). There are six or seven pools, each with a few hot tubs nearby. Two of the larger pools have activities for kids, and one has lots of fountains and water cannons etc. Several other pools seem more attuned to adults; quieter, etc. In other words, there is something for everything. We agreed to attend the 90 minutes sales presentation, mainly to get $100 Disney Dollars to spend at Epcot. It lasted exactly 90 minutes, and once we told our sales rep we were new owners, he spent most of the time answering our questions, as opposed to trying to make a new sale. The $100 Disney Dollars came in handy, and were accepted everywhere in Disney. Can't say enough about the friendliness of the staff. My wife has some dificulty walking around, but whenever one of the ubiquitous golf carts drove by with an employee behind the wheel, they would stop and offer her a ride. We did not purchase any of the house keeping options. With just my wife and I, our room was fine for a week. There is a Publix supermarket nearby. We had most of our breakfasts and lunches in our room (we like to keep it simple!). The on site Village Market also has a Pizza Hut in it and serves Starbucks Coffee. I saw many families getting pizza for dinner. One pool had poolside waitress service, which is great. The drinks are pricey, but having a cool frozen drink delivered poolside is worth it! The resort was larger than I originally thought, 900 total units, but I never felt crowded ( I have no idea how full the resort was.) Overall, we had a great time, and can't wait to come back year with our two grown daughters. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place for families, especially with young kids!”
Reviews.Author: Traveling_Kim
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a one week stay at the Grande Vista, and we absolutely loved our stay! We went with our two kids (ages 2.5 and exactly 12 months), and they loved it as much as we did. We had a room on the sixth floor at the end of the hallway,and it was extremely quiet (we were not staying near either of the main pools). The views were nice although nothing spectacular. Our room was spacious although it looked like it needed a good cleaning (not dirty, just not extremely clean). For example, the kids uncovered a few hairballs behind some of the furniture.... granted they were behind the furniture but there were a few things like this. However we spent so little time in our room that those things did not matter (and the extra space, kitchenette, and washing machine/dryer more than compensated for those shortfalls)! Now onto the selling point of the resort - the grounds! The resort itself was absolutely beautiful, and the common area was very well maintained. They had two main pool areas, each with its own kiddie pool and fountains. I think that the resort has a total of five pools, but I am not sure about that. The satellite pools were not crowded at all during our stay. For families with little kids, they have an indoor playground (and a really nice one at that)! This may have been the highlight of our trip as we could take the kids over there for a little bit each day to help them spend a little extra energy. The also had planned activities each day (some free and some at a small cost), but we opted not to do any of those. One last note - the staff was extremely friendly. We greeted each time we passed any sort of staff member and frequently asked if there was anything they could do to help us. All in all, it was a wonderful experience, and we will definitely be returning!

Reviews.Title: “Large Family Timeshare”
Reviews.Author: planningzone
Reviews.Content: This property has large, clean, updated rooms. I have attached pictures. I was a little concerned when I checked in because the lobby is dated and a little worn-out. When we got to the room we were pleasantly surprised! We had a room overlooking the Copa Loca Pool so naturally there was noise from the pool in the morning. We are NOT owners.
