We booked our room from the hotel website. They were not shamelessly pushing their timeshare presentations, which was nice. Because it was a timeshare, we had no expectations for service. The front desk, however, upgraded our room and when we got there (at 1:00 AM) and when it did not have an extra set of sheets in it, they promptly brought some...... We have found in our extensive travels that the hotel staff really want to help their guests, ESPECIALLY if the guest is friendly and forgiving. There is a large supermarket called "Publix" about a mile down International Drive on the right. There are also a few moderate restaurants in the same shopping center. Across from the Publix is a "premium factory outlet" which my wife LOVED. I would recommend: 1. A room on a high floor to mitigate some of the noise. 2. Some rooms do not have screened-in balconies. If you care about having one, you had better request it. 3. Be nice to the hotel staff from the moment you arrive (not just when you want something). If we return to Orlando, we would definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Much better than a Disney hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jenjencc514
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the MGV so many times, I have lost count. But both me, my husband, and my parents (seniors) LOVE coming back to this resort! We only stayed one night before moving on to a WDW hotel, and I wish we'd stayed at the MGV for our entire trip. The MGV has great pools, nice amenities, and is just beautiful. It is much prettier than a Disney Value Resort. We stayed in a 2 bedroom, 2 bath villa. I had reqested a room very close to the main pool and they delivered! We had a lovely time for the day and a half that we were there for. Our room was clean, and had basic touches like ceiling fans, in-room coffee, etc. (Cannot say as much for our Disney hotel!) I needed to get boarding passes printed out, and Stephanie, the Front Desk Manager, printed them for me at no charge so I would not have to use the pay-as-you-go internet service. Pools are open until 11 p.m. which was great, because my 5 year old wanted to go swimming no matter what! This hotel is near International Drive and very close to Sea World. Also it is close to Outlet Shopping (including the Disney Outlet) and some decent restaurants. I will return to the Grande Vista in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Place”
Reviews.Author: PAOzzie
Reviews.Content: We stayed the week of 4/20 thru 4/27. Check-in was quick and painless. Our room was on the 4th floor overlooking the golf course, which made for a quiet visit. Our porch area was screened in, which made me feel at ease with our 2-yr old. I noticed that not all of the units have a screened in porch area, so you may want to consider this if you have young children. Some of them are open, and it is a far drop down. We booked our unit thru Interval International. Our room had a few little things wrong. The outside light at the front door was crooked, the foyer light was crooked, the refrigerator was crooked and the door would bang on the wall when you closed it. It really didn't make-or-break the trip, but it took away from the "wow" factor. Only two complaints. First, for such a large bathroom in our 1 bedroom unit, I wish the layout had a powder room set up for the toilet. We had a non-family guest with us, and she couldn't use the toilet when I was showering, and I couldn't when she was. It wasn't that big of a deal, but again, the bathroom was just huge. They easily could have partitioned the toilet off. I have seen this in other places. The other thing was the lack of a dedicated parking lot for the market section. The walk wasn't all that far from our unit to the marketplace, but far enough. At the end of a long Disney day, I just wanted to treat my kids to an ice cream cone, and didn't want them walking thru the parking lots. Unfortunately, there was no parking just for the market area, and spots were pretty hard to find in that area. We've been to the Orlando area about 6 times now in the past 10 years, and we've stayed at a different place each time. While I would stay here again, I have found all the resorts I've visited to be nice. The only place that I do want to make an effort to stay at again is the Marriott Cypress Harbour. That place was just gorgeous, and did have the "wow" factor.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a family getaway”
Reviews.Author: dlace93
Reviews.Content: Very nice place to stay, especially if you have kids. Pools are awesome with daily poolside activites for kids (w/prizes). Stayed in a one bedroom condo with lots of room. Full kitchen, laundry, separate dining area, living area and enclosed balcony. Lots to do on property including golfing, tennis, bike rental, paddle boat rental, dining and lots more. Safe and secure. Starbucks, Krispy Kreme, grocery store, Pizza Hut on site. Very friendly staff and helpful conciere's desk. If you go to the sale presentation, don't worry - it is not high pressured...

Reviews.Title: “Most Pleasant”
Reviews.Author: Danno5691
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at The Grande Vista by choice of a friend who recemended it. April 18th through the 23rd. We were not dissapointed in anyway unless you want to make an issue about not having coffee for the coffee maker. There is a gas station right around the corner, so $2.85 took care of that, plus I got what I wanted. Very clean rooms, and service exceeded our expectations. We used the Hot tub in the morning and evenings and they were always kept clean. The check in was short and uncomplicated as well as the check out. They are very good about security, as we were stopped everytime we came through the gate and provided out parking pass. Mornings were very quiet and allowed us to enjoy quiet wakeup overlooking the lake and golf course. For the biggest bang for your buck, by far you won't be dissapointed. This is probably the most secluded place to stay that is almost within walking distance of Sea World and all the activity near International drive. Yet, feels as though your deep off the beaten trail. We had the the pleasure of sitting through what was suppose to be an 1 1/2 hour timeshare presentation at Westgate. This turned into an unforgiving 6 hours of pure torture and they wouldn't even get us back to our car. we had to walk about 3/4 of a mile after we clearly told them this was not for us. They wouldn't take no for an answer. I finally told them (Westgate) that they couldn't hold a candle to Marriott Grande Vista. Dead serious! Stay at Marriott!

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Resort”
Reviews.Author: CTKnowItAll
Reviews.Content: Second time here even better than the first. A wonderful escape from the Disney circus. Freindly. Rented a 3-Bedroom Villa for 5 nights and could not have been happier. Clean, accommodating. Comfortable beds, fun pools, etc. Could use a few additional dining options on the grounds.

Reviews.Title: “Nice getaway from Disney area”
Reviews.Author: smnlefty
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at Grande Vista during spring break. We had a 2BDRM Condo that was great. The resort has replaced all of the beds with the Marriott beds and they are extremelly comfortable. Overall we were pleased with our stay. We have stayed at other Marriott Time share properties and they are consistently very clean and modern. The grounds, pools and whirlpools were very nice. There is a pool behind each grouping of buildings and a main pool by the activities building. Only drawback there were no water slides at any of the pools. This resort is approximately 10-15 minutes from Disney depending on Traffic. It is about 2-3 minutes from Sea World. The one complaint that we had was in regards to being called daily by a sales agent who wanted to invite us to a owners meeting. Fortunately we were not in the condo much and only had to endure listening to the message. We were asked to attend when we checked in and declined. That should have been the end of the discussion. We have not had this problem at other Marriott properties. We would gladly stay there again when in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Service”
Reviews.Author: sfv71
Reviews.Content: Front Desk staff was sub-par. We are timeshare owners at this property and booked our usual 3 non-smoking rooms one year in advance. When we arrived, they said they did not have our rooms available. After some discussion, they found us 2 rooms-one with no air conditioning. 2nd round: Two rooms-the first one was not cleaned and the 2nd was a smoking room. 3rd round: After meeting with the fd manager, they found our rooms--2 1/2 hours later. We requested to have the general manager call us 2x and are still waiting for a call.... Also, requested cribs and high chairs on arrival - took 2 hours to receive them

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: witraveler4
Reviews.Content: Booked a 2 BR, 2 BA villa through Expedia for Apr 10-15 and had no trouble with reservations though we arrived earlier than the 4 o'clock check-in and our room was not ready; it became ready about an hour later. Our villa was in bldg. 97 on the 3rd floor overlooking one of the pools. It had 2 balconies to sit out on and enjoy the weather and the view. The rooms were adjoining and for a family with 2 teenagers, it was good to have separate quarters. The kitchen was roomy and well-stocked with equipment. We shopped at Publix nearby and ate almost every meal at MGV. The rooms were clean, quiet, and the beds were comfortable. The walls and some parts of the kitchen were a little banged up, but nothing horrible. Bring hair conditioner and coffee--as there is none provided here like other hotels. MGV timeshare staff called to sign us up for a seminar, but we declined, no pressure at all to go. On the grounds of MGV, we had some time to swim every evening, play ping-pong, and took a paddle boat out on the lagoon. This was a Universal trip for us and we took the I-Line to a stop near Universal, walked to Sheraton Studio City hotel and took a $5 cab ride to Universal. The I-Line pass for 3 days was $5 purchased at Walgreens (one right near Sheraton, otherwise it was $1 per person/per ride). We had a car a day later and was glad to give up the long (but pleasant) rides on I-Line. Bought the on-line 2 park 7 day unlimited tickets for about $86 each. Preferred parking ($16) was only $5 more than regular parking. We would definitely stay at MGV again for any trip to Orlando; it was worth the money compared to renting 2 other hotel rooms without a kitchen.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: habs07
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night in March of '07, as we arrived in Florida a day earlier than planned. The staff at the Grande Vista was excellent, the property was maintained very nicely, and the room was both large and spotless. Overall a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort:)”
Reviews.Author: tts4093
Reviews.Content: The resort is very large, but beautiful. We requested a pool view room but got a lake view room instead which actually worked out better for us:) The lake view rooms are beautiful. There are 2 large pools which were very busy all week. The one thing that we did not like about this resort was that the people were putting towels and personal items on pool chairs VERY early in the morning to "save" them and then not returning until hours later. So, people who actually wanted to stay at the pool had a very hard time finding lounge chairs, especially the ones in the sun. We were there during Easter break for ALOT of the kids, so it was packed. There is alot to do for the kids and the staff is excellent. Everyone there was very nice and helpful-Good job Marriott! We own other timeshares, but where very impressed by this one. There is no mid-week free cleaning here though. If you want your room cleaned, you will have to do it yourself or pay a daily charge for it. The washers and dryers in the one and two bedroom units are definately a plus:) One thing that I would like to see at this resort is Marriott transportation to the Disney and Universal parks. The drive is only about 20 minutes, but after staying at other Disney area resorts who had transportation, I would probably look for that next time I stayed in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: Bradford_Mom
Reviews.Content: We stayed on a guest certificate / time share exchange and absolutely loved it. Would recommend this resort to anyone staying in Orlando. Lots to do by the poolside and plenty of room for a large family. Close to Disney but if you are staying here, don't hesitate to stay home for a day instead of doing the parks. Hope to be back again someday

Reviews.Title: “A Grande Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: chiller56
Reviews.Content: This vacation was another time-share exchange during college winter break. We brought our MSU student with us and decided to go to Orlando because our oldest son now works and lives in Orlando and we could combine some R&R with a visit with him. We had done the Universal/Disney thing several years ago, so this visit was a getaway from the cold, white north without the lines and cues of paid for amusements. We were there to relax and enjoy the warmer weather. We had a one bedroom suite. It was very nice with all amenities, full kitchen, whirlpool tub, shower, couches, table...etc. We stayed in the 'main' building. Our balcony/patio overlooked the large U-shaped pool and was spacious and comfortable for reading, relaxing and viewing. There was no daily maid service unless you want to pay for it. We declined. Below us was the Marketplace, with Starbucks, Pizza Hut, Eddies Ice Cream and a convenience store...which was very convenient for quick needs. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The grounds were very well manicured and kept very clean and organized. Parking was never a problem, occasionally you might have to walk a little but nothing dramatic...not a problem. You can take some nice stolls aroung the place, the ponds were nice and there was also a conservation area walking path. The people staying there were rather diverse...colleges students who were well behaved, families of all ages, older and younger couples...it appeared to a mixture of everyone. They had lots of activities for both adults and kids but mostly for kids. We rarely ventured far from our building while at MGV, so activities in other areas I can not comment on. Now for the nuts and bolts...Drinks were a bit expensive. We made most of our refreshments in our room and it was never a problem to carry them about. The Lighthouse bar made some good tropical concoctions which we did partake on several occasions. We never ate at Nick's Grill which is the MGV's nice restaurant, so I can't help you there, it looked very nice. The pool grill had a limited menu and was slightly overpriced but the food was pretty decent. A good place to go for a snack to hold you over before going out for your meals. We did buy some necessaries at the Publix grocery store, but it was mostly for snacking and drinks. We did the timeshare presentation, for 1.5 hours. No real hassles, we got $100 Marriot cash to close out our bills from the pool grill and bike rental. We were in a very nice location because we requested a room near one of the main pool areas. I highly recommend that you request this. Some of the buildings were a walk from the two main pool areas and although I think all the rooms overlook either the pools, golf course or lakes, we were in a prime location (for us). We called ours the 'Presidential Suite'. It appeared to be a very nice place to relax or rest from the amusement parks which we presumed many people were doing based on the abundance of Mickey stuff the kids were wearing. The MGV is a short drive from all the restaurants and putt-putt and other activities on I-Drive. We did go to Lakeland and watch the Tigers play Atlanta. We even got Gary Sheffield, Justin Verlander and Curtis Granderfield's autographs. We did a casino cruise and won some money. Went to the Science Museum to see the Our Body exhibit and we ate a many nice restaurants. Texas de Brazil was awesome. It was a fun time and a nice place to stay. You should be happy with it. The only reason I didn't rate it 5 Stars was because I have stayed in other places that had nicer rooms....more marble, tile, newer appearance. The MGV is very nice. My MSU student said it was nicest place he has ever stayed!

Reviews.Title: “Fun in Florida!”
Reviews.Author: hvtrust
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked our trip to Orlando at the end of February. It was a great time to go! We booked this trip to preview the Vacation Club. The presentation was very respectful of us and our decision...so if you are thinking about going, but are not sure about the presentation, it was interesting, non-pressuring, and tempting. We stayed in one of the spacious villas and we were very impressed! It made our experience home away from home with a full kitchen, washer and dryer, jacuzzi tub, living room (with pull-out queen-sized bed), dining room, bedroom, separate bathroom, and enclosed patio. If you want to make your own meals, a grocery store is not very far away and they have a little store on the property (you can get free bags of ice at the store). Really, if you have your own car, this is a great location for all attractions (Disneyworld 15 minutes, SeaWorld - within walking distance - 1/2 mile away, major mall - 7 minutes, Outlet stores - 5 minutes drive). They give you a map with very thorough directions to any attraction you want to go to. The property also has a person that can help you purchase attraction tickets...the one we purchased was 2 days at 2 different Disney theme parks plus a water park or Pleasure Island. Unless you plan on doing those things, it may be better just to buy your attraction tickets online or at the park. After doing 2 full days at theme parks, we were tired of being around a lot of tourists, bright lights, loud noise, and waiting lines and we decided not to use the Pleasure Island ticket...so we lost some value of the tickets. If you rent a car from the airport, make sure you have change because the major interstate is a toll. We went to Cocoa Beach (closest to Orlando - 50 minute drive) and had to pay up to $10 on tolls for the round trip. Bring your own hair conditioner (they provide mini shampoo) and buy bottled water (the water smells funny there). If you tire of the amusement park restaurants and atmosphere, we ate at a Japanese restaurant not too far of a drive away called Kobe. It was delicious!!! We were very satisfied with our stay; however, if you are a light sleeper, you may get frustrated. There were a couple mornings when we could hear the tvs from next door or little children running around (getting ready for Disneyworld, I'm sure). In addition, you will want to make sure you close your front door tightly because it does not close on its own. Other than those things, we really felt very comfortable. Also, the staff were very friendly!

Reviews.Title: “Just like home”
Reviews.Author: LakeCityArtist
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located just a few minutes from Sea Word and the Convention Center. The hotel complex consists of about 20-25 five story units around a lake, surrounded by the gulf coarse. There are 2 main activity centers with pools and cafÃ©s, as well as 2 or 3 other pools. This makes it so that a pool is by each unit and a food within a short walk. The units consist of 1, 2, and 3 room suits as well as a studio room. I rented a 1 bedroom suit which included a full kitchen, Dinning room, living room, bath with shower and Jacuzzi tub, and balcony with outdoor eating area. The room was furnished nicely and was very clean. The room was plenty big for just kicking back after a long day. Since the complex is designed for time share renters, it has a feeling of being a vacation home rather than a hotel. There are no bell boys, no valets (parking just outside the units), because of this approach, I felt very much at home. What and when you want to do some thing is completely up to you. I will definitely be booking here again

Reviews.Title: “Everthing was great”
Reviews.Author: kimbo-travels
Reviews.Content: Hubby, myself, two teenaged girls & grandparents stayed in a two bedroom unit for 9 nights at the beginning of Feb. Check in was a breeze with friendly service. Our room was great, clean, well stocked kitchen, & a great view of the lake from the patio's. As far as being approched by sales staff - they called and I was not in so they followed up later that evening about going to a time share presentation ( discount Disney tickets if you attend) I let them know I wasn't interested and I was never called or bothered again. I received only one message on the phone about a free 5/7 picture I could receive I was NOT contacted every day, as a matter of FACT I was never contacted again in any manner during our 9 nights at the resort. As far as noise in the rooms we did not hear a thing from our neighbours. My suggestion for people who like to stay in deluxe accomedations, the owners pay maintenance fees to keep everything so beautiful, the goal at any time owned propery is sell more time, so you should know going in you will be approched ( I have stayed in timeshare resorts all over North America and I have never been harrassed as the previous review suggests) it is a condo NOT a hotel with ugly vending machines on each floor "that is why you have a kitchen" buy a 12 pack of coke and you should be good for the week. If you like vending machines and under no circumstances want to be approached about buying in the property you are visiting then get a hotel ( 2 beds in a 200 sq foot room, one bath and if your lucky a mini fridge) So in a nut shell great resort, beautiful property, pools and suite.

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation!”
Reviews.Author: rcs249
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights this month at the Grande Vista and enjoyed it so much, we almost purchased a timeshare there. My husband keeps thinking maybe we still should. The rooms are spacious, especially when you have a full 1 bedroom or 2 bedroom suite. The pools are perfectly heated and well designed, plus there are 2 jacuzzis for each pool of the 3 pool areas that have a 3-leaf clover design so that you never feel crowded. While the resort had many children as it was the February vacation week, it was not just kids, the way the Disney resorts can feel. This resort had a more mature feel to it while still accomodating children well, having kids programming and nice pool options. There is a very reasonably priced market ($15 for 2 chicken ceasar salads, a grilled cheese and two large drinks), a Pizza Hut with Edy's icecream, the Copa Loca poolside grill which we ate several meals at, and Nick's Grille (more upscale but wonderful), and the Lighthouse Bar. We didn't fish, but the folks we talked to were having fun catching tilapia and bass. There were many families renting the paddle boats for the lake, or kayaks, or driving the 4-5 seater bicycles/scooters, we played volleyball and used the Har Tru tennis courts. There is a very nice 1.5 mile nature trail that abuts Florida conservation land. We loved it and may yet buy a timeshare there.

Reviews.Title: “We compare everything to the Grande Vista!”
Reviews.Author: ajamalsbury
Reviews.Content: Wow! My husband and I stayed here on our honeymoon and it was by far the best place we have ever stayed! If we could have bought a condo at the resort to live in full time, I think we would have. No other resort we've stayed at can hold a candle to this resort. The staff was great, the rooms and pools were very clean, and the on site dining was wonderful. We took the tour, and it was a bit pushy, but they are supposed to be and we knew that going in. I would highly recommend staying here. It was about 10 minutes from disney, and 5 minutes from sea world. Make sure you rent a car if you fly in as the grounds are very big!

Reviews.Title: “Lack of Security But No Lack of Noise”
Reviews.Author: CCMcC
Reviews.Content: I really wanted to like this property, but after two days here I really wanted to leave. The grounds are gorgeous and the "at your service" staff is well-trained to communicate empathy about your complaints. If only there were action behind the professional sympathy! Business travelers beware: This is not the facility for you. All rooms are adjoining rooms, meaning you can CLEARLY hear the little ones next door rise early anticipating Disney World. Because the doors open onto a cement verandah/hallway, you also hear every passerby, every slamming door, and every screaming kid on the way to the elevator. The tile floors and hard surfaces of the rooms make every sound reverberate. Female travelers beware: The room security is quite lax. I moved rooms twice and each time, the locks on the sliding glass doors were broken. Twice I came back to find my front door standing open, which is disconcerting. The front doors appear to shut here, but unless you slam them (thus adding to the cacophony), they don't actually shut and will eventually blow open. Maintenance took an entire day to come fix the back door locks--after assuring me they were "right on the way"--and housekeeping just decided not to show up at all one day. Yet, in the space of 48 hours here, I have already received numerous marketing voicemail messages FROM THE STAFF promoting this property as a vacation club. Not on your life. These "villas" are merely shot-gun studios. But I will give them this: They have upgraded to the Marriott "dream beds" and they are truly superb. If only one could STAY asleep, it would be a stellar experience. Also, business travelers, please note there is no room service here. It is truly a self-service resort. With the exception of this luxurious bed, the local Courtyard would have been the better choice for this convention traveler.

Reviews.Title: “All That And A Bag Of Chips”
Reviews.Author: CaptainAmerica
Reviews.Content: Wow. Stayed here 2 nites based on the positive reviews here on Trip Advisor and could not be happier. First off, they let me check in at 7:00 AM (!?!) with no problem- this is unheard of at most hotels. The staff here in fact were unusually pleasant and helpful. The complex is quite large with many amenities- golf, tennis,pool table, aerobics, etc. with a live band which plays by the pool most nights. A family could easily spend a few days here with all the activities and never even bother with the theme parks. The highlight in my opinion was the waterpark with faux-cannon towers, mini-waterfalls and a great waterplay area for toddlers. Extremely child friendly. The kids loved it and I don't even have kids. Almost all the other vacationers I encountered at the Grande Vista seemed especially happy and in a good mood. This place seems to have a wholesome, feel-good aura which is contageous. Close by, you also have Sea World practically across the street. Be sure to check out Thai Thanee right next to the Denny's on Internationational Drive- excellent Thai food in a resturaunt that is more like a museum stuffed with asian artifacts- great place. I believe this is largely a time-share type deal but I paid $140 a nite- an amazaing deal, especially considering Disney has the gaul to charge almost $400 a nite in high season for it's theme hotels which are hardly alot better than the Grande Vista. My advice- give the mouse a pass and make Grande Vista your theme park HQ in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “If You Can Find A Better Place - - Buy It!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Mr_Observer
Reviews.Content: The Flagship of Marriott's Vacation Club, Grande Vista is in a catagory by itself. This observer has frequented many other properties (Hilton, West Gate, Vistana, etc) and found the Grande Vista leads them all in pure hospitality and beauty. The staff is prompt and knowledeable as well as experienced. I first stayed here in 1996 while this resort was under construction and I saw that Marriott meant business for this resort. Presently, this property is done with construction and the place looks "grand". I met quite a few people who have bought here and they ALL say, " the're glad they did". You just "GOT TO" stay here (for a weekend) to see what I mean. You won't be sorry!

Reviews.Title: “Grand time at the Grande Vista”
Reviews.Author: boysmom2
Reviews.Content: We exchanged through Interval at the Grande Vista, and it was excellent. We had a 3 bedroom, and it was immaculate. We had a few issues with tiny ants around the sink, but they sprayed for us and it was fine after that. The rooms are very spacious, there were 8 of us (6 adults) and we all fit very comfortably. We own already in Aruba, and liked it here so much that we bought a week here, and so did the other 2 couples that we were with! The grounds are beautiful, the beds are the most comfortable hotel beds I've been in!! 10 minutes from Disney, and convenient to everything. Publix and Walgreens right up the road. We got there early, 10:30 and were happy to hear that our room was ready and we went straight in! Quick and easy check in, the staff was very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “A very satisfying experience”
Reviews.Author: hikingmaniac
Reviews.Content: The initial check in was not great as the lady at the front desk and particularly the concierge were not very warm and friendly. The concierge bordered on indifferent. Afterward, nearly everything went very well. This resort has four pools, tennis courts, a kids activity center, an arcade, several restaurants, and a fine grocery store which actually carries quite a bit. The grounds are immacuately landscaped with plenty of opportunity for walking. Although I don't golf, I would like this place even more if I did. We had a guest room which was everything we expected. Our package included two disney tickets and all in all was a great value. The people who work here did turn out to be quite warm and friendly after-all. I would not hesitate to stay here again. We stayed on the fifth floor of building 92.

Reviews.Title: “Grande Vista, What a resort.”
Reviews.Author: martmcgrgr
Reviews.Content: We had never stayed here, but exchanged thorugh Interval international and spent a fantastic 2 weeks on this resort.. This resort is right in the middle of I-Drive, so it is easy to get anywhere, from disney to universal and is almost right next door to sea world. We loved it. the staff were excellent nothing was too much trouble for them. the resort was clean, well kept and the rooms were very spacious. The hot tub in our master suite was bliss. We had one or two little teething problems, on arrival but these were resolved really quickly. The pools on the resort are fantastic. They are well up to the standard that I am used to in my home resort and, to be honest they realy surpassed my expectaions. It is close to a publix, but you are better off heading out to Walmarts for any groceries. Much cheaper and greater choice.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Marriott Grande Vista”
Reviews.Author: hausesa
Reviews.Content: I took my 4 year old daughter to the Marriott Grande Vista. The grounds are beautiful. There is alot of activities but some of the children's activities are only for 5+ so we couldn't take advantage of them. We are going back in 2007! It is close to SeaWorld and Disney and only a 1 hour drive to Cocoa Beach

Reviews.Title: “My favorite Orlando location...so far :)”
Reviews.Author: NannerFL
Reviews.Content: Have rented here at least 3 or 4 times and each time I love it more. As the last review stated the best new thing we found on our last trip was the new bedding. WOW! Have stayed in some pretty nice places in the past and this was the best of them all. Nice pool. Never was packed when we were there at various times of the year. Quite large but not too large I couldn't keep a good eye on my daughter. Paddle boats available for rent (ducks, swans and dragons) We're not golfers so can't comment on that. Small shop on property. Prices not bad. Deli inside is pretty good and they have all the little things you may have forgotten to pack. Only have boughten a few food items there but they do have nice small sizes of things so you don't have to waste regular sized things that you'd never use up on vacation. Limited gifty things but that's what the parks (or the outlets) are for! Friendly staff, never ran into a problem. One "no thank you" for a sales pitch always was enough for us although they do tend to call that first time when you are sound asleep. Nice and clean. In my opinion the best Marriott in the Orlando area. (Have stayed at 3 of them) Love the area. Great outlet mall on the way to the parks, near Sea World, easy to get to all the attractions. No housekeeping as with most timeshares but not a big deal. Just a hint...pack some garbage bags as the ones here are pretty small. I've always thrown some in my suitcase for dirty clothes so adding a few more isn't a big deal. Speaking of dirty clothes the stack washer and dryer are a nice size. Not full size but bigger than some of the really tiny ones. Our last trip we were able to get a room in the main building looking by the pool. Very short walk to anything on property. Just booked here again for May. Can't wait!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Rizza
Reviews.Content: Grande Vista saved our holiday. What a lovely place, cannot be faulted at all. Lovely setting and staff. 5 star resort!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Family Resort”
Reviews.Author: Cram425
Reviews.Content: This was our third vacation at the Grande Vista. There is so much activity at the resort you don`t have to leave. Golfing is great at the Grande Vista. The grounds are spectacular. The rooms blow away any hotel room. They also threw a great Halloween party for kids and adults. You will not be dissapointed if you book a stay at the Grande Vista. I already booked my trip for next year.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it so much, we bought a timeshare!”
Reviews.Author: grettasophia
Reviews.Content: My husband and I found the Grande Vista by accident on a business trip. While we were put up at the Gaylord Palms (also a very nice property) a cocktail event was actually held at the Grande Vista's main pool area, which is absolutely stunning. Even though several years had passed, we were SO impressed with our brief encounter with Grande Vista, that we booked our next stay in Orlando (Dec. 29, 06 to Jan 3, 07) at the Grande Vista. We didn't stay in a villa since it was just the 2 of us, but we voluntarily sought out a time share appointment, just to learn more about the property and villas, in case we wanted to rent one in the future. I'll highlight issues with both our rack rate room and the timeshare/villa fact finding... Our room stay: BEDDING: Is second to none!!! The upgrades Marriott have made to their bedding make leaving home a pleasure. The sheets are definitely a high thread count and the mattress pads make the beds feel like expensive pillow tops. LOTS of fluffy pillows and fluffy comforter. All snow white with no stains. Loved it. We slept like babies every night. Heaven! ROOM: For a non-villa, our room size was generous and we had a microwave, mini fridge, mini sink, dishes/flatware/glasses, paper towels, dish soap, sponge....really nice touches. We bought inexpensive beverages at the Market Place and always had something refreshing right in our room. Very convenient! The bathroom was average and a bit dated, but was freshly painted, very clean and functional. The fabulous bedding made up for it! HOUSEKEEPING: There was a mild dust ring clinging to the textured ceiling above the ceiling fan that should be cleaned. Not a huge issue. My only real complaint about the room was that on a few days we left the room late morning (10/11am) and returned late afternoon/eve (5-7pm) and our room hadn't been touched. Bed was still unmade, no fresh towels...nothing. However, when we phoned about it, we got immediate response. Don't know if housekeeping staff was just having a bad stretch? When they did come in, they did a nice job. TIMESHARE/VILLAS: Now, I've read about being pressured about timeshares here in other reviews and I must say that my husband and I sought THEM out. We phoned on our own to ask for an appt. We completely did not expect to buy, especially that very day. But, the sales staff was not a hard sell by any stretch and after our questions had been answered (and I mean ALL of them...the sales staff is very helpful and knowledgeable), we went to see the villas firsthand. They're absolutely beautiful. They're almost better than home with gorgeous granite counter tops, lovely tile flooring, luxurious jacuzzi tubs in the master bathrooms, the luxury bedding I fell in love with... The timeshare sold itself to us and the sales person didn't hard sell us in any way. I just wanted to mention our timeshare experience as others have mentioned it. I also wanted to point out how stunning and luxurious the timeshare villas truly are. My husband and I travel alone and our 2 bedroom villa will suit us fine, but they're perfect for traveling with friends and family. Overall, the Grande Vista is really an ideal resort for couples, families/groups alike. It has something for everyone. Inexpensive meals/sandwiches at Copa Loca ($8 or less!) that are huge and very tasty, Pizza Hut and Edy's ice cream are exactly what you'd pay at home, the Market Place has a huge variety of food items and more sandwiches to go, soft drinks, sunscreen, etc at very reasonable prices. We didn't have the time to eat at Nick's Grill, but heard over and over that it's outstanding and we found the menu prices to be comparable to decent restaurants at home. The views are lovely from every point at the resort, the pools are gorgeous, the grounds are meticulously kept, the villas are luxurious and the location can't be beat. This isn't a room service/white glove Marriott with columns, marble floors and koi ponds (don't get me wrong, I love those too!). It's a "kick back, have a great burger and "sneaky tiki" by the lovely pool" kind of place. Nice enough to be an upscale getaway and low keyed enough to leave you and your pocketbook relaxed. Enjoy the Grande Vista!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: natg1
Reviews.Content: Great location. We hired a car , but the bus service along I Drive was regular and cheap. It was easy to get everywhere you would wish to go....Disney about 20 minutes drive, seaworld 5 minutes, Universal 20 minutes etc. The rooms were clean, spacious and of a high standard. ....the two bedroom units are recommended. Lots for Kids to do - the pools are lovely.....you get a choice of secluded or in the middle of the action in the kids themed areas. Will definately return 2007!

Reviews.Title: “No need for a car”
Reviews.Author: Squits
Reviews.Content: I exchange my timeshare in UK for Grande Vista every year. We spend 4-5 weeks over Christmas in Florida and have stayed in many places BUT we still love the Grande Vista. We don't need a car we catch buses outside the property - on International Drive and go everywhere. We pick up a bus pass on our first day so do not need cash. We love the walk along the Vista Drive to the bus stop or if we are tired we get a lift from Marriott bus. We are trying the Hilton as well this yr so will keep you posted please if you have any queries email me I am always ready to help

Reviews.Title: “Very nice for a timeshare but you got to drive!”
Reviews.Author: BrassBryan
Reviews.Content: Used Timeshare and were not hassled by them to go to any talks for additional timeshare purchases. Maybe its my age(21) and i do not have a steady flow of income being a college student. It wasnt far from the major themeparks but we took taxis around due to the 25yr old requirements for car rental. It has a Pizza hut in its compounds and thats what we lived on for dinner.The room was pleasant.The concierge was also helpful and you are able to get tickets to the major theme parks here. Do not leave your garbage outside unecessarily because the squirrels would come and rip them up.That was our personal experience. It has a grill and is near several golf courses.I didn't like the Spa treatments as I realised the gym instructors,recreation centre caretakers and masseuse were all the same person. Decent hotel for a timeshare which is close to the themeparks.

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect”
Reviews.Author: Friday13th
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough positive things about our stay. The resort was beautiful. The staff was friendly. Our room was clean, very well kept and had a beautiful view. This was our first visit and we plan on going back. I n fact, we thought about buying a timeshare here. We went for our honeymoon and did not take any kids. The resort was perfect for us. The location is great and it was very convenient to get to Sea World, Disney, Tampa, Universal Studios and the Orlando airport.

Reviews.Title: “it was not as nice as i expected”
Reviews.Author: dljames29
Reviews.Content: The outside grounds of the hotel were very lavish and nice, however the 2 bedroom unit we got was in poor condition. The furniture was all chipped and worn, the kitchen cabinets were a mess, the floors and countertops were dirty. I had them come back and clean the first day since it was so gross. They dont provide any washcloths and the towels are scratchy. Overall the room was musty and appeared in dire need of cleaning up as well as upkeep of the furniture. all of the dining room chairs and barstools were terribly stained. The best part of the hotel was the pool area, and the beds and pillows were comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Like Bugs? Stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Marriottrewardsguy
Reviews.Content: As a 10 year Marriott Gold member (50+ nts/yr), I feel qualified to say this property does not reflect typical Marriott quality. I called the front desk during my first night to complain about bugs in our kitchen (small ants all over the kitchen counter/sink) and 2nd bathroom (larger black ants). The front desk assured me that their bug service would be there to service the room Saturday, the next day. Arriving back at the room the next day, I was glad to see the bug company's hang tag in the kitchen. I used it to kill several more ants. Again, I called the desk, was told it may take some time for the chemicals to work and that engineering would be back up the next morning. At breakfast the following day, I was greeted by more bugs. At least I got a call from the time share sales rep that evening and was able to laugh at the opportunity to buy a bug-infested unit of my own. The staff presented no solutions to the problem though quite aware of my displeasure and showed nothing but indifference throughout our stay. I believe the attendant at the rock climbing wall will need to have the cell phone sugically removed from her ear someday ("What did I say to him? Really! I don't remember. What did I say?"). Don't bother. There are more than a few better choices in the area, especiallyin the Marriott family.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort”
Reviews.Author: beb111
Reviews.Content: Our family (2 kids) recently stayed at the Marriott Grande Vista and had a fantastic time! The resort is beautiful and our 1-br unit was perfect for our family. It was spacious, clean, and well-furnished. We had a unit overlooking the golf course and a pond. The view was just beautiful. There were several pools in the resort but we only used the main pool and it was really nice, although it would have been nicer if the water was a little warmer. The staff was very courteous, cordial, and helpful, from the the front desk employees, concierge, to the housekeepers and maintenance people. The location of the resort is perfect. It is only a few minutes away from the theme parks and very close to Sea World. There is a grocery store not too far where you can get everything that you may need for your vacation. We only had one negative experience at the resort. We came back to the resort late one night and there was a group of men (maybe 8 or more) having drinks right by the entrance in our building. They were not drunk (yet) but I don't think it's the appropriate place to be drinking and partying. Aside from that, everything went well and we all loved the place.

Reviews.Title: “Great for families - excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: MrsLLL
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 3 bedroom apartment with other family members. The apartment was one of the newer ones and was superbly decorated and had everything to make it a home from home. If I had one concern it is that some of the furniture was not designed with kids in mind - sharp corners and edges etc., although this seems typical of Florida apartments. The resort itself is excellent. The surroundings, peaceful and attractive, with plenty of on-site, non-golf (!) activities for all the family. They even have organised, supervised activities for children as young as 2 years old free of charge. The pools are family orientated and clean, with enough loungers to go around and the on-site staff could not have been friendlier or more helpful. Really looking forward to my next stay at the resort.. having had such a 'grande' time!

Reviews.Title: “Great for groups!”
Reviews.Author: EHDEN
Reviews.Content: Rented a 2-bedroom. cleanliness was great. hskp was great as well. Lots of room for group travel. You have 1 King bed and king size sofa pull out as well. King bed and pillows VERY comfortable. Pull out sofa not so comfy. 1 was decent, the other felt like chicken wire. But nevertheless, it fit the whole group and we all had a great time! Pool facilities is nice as well. Enjoyed the pool more than the attractions during Horror Nights.

Reviews.Title: “It was a great get away!!!”
Reviews.Author: newbunny
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Marriott Grande Vista from July 2nd to July 8th. We stayed in a 1 bedroom. It was absolutely amazing! I felt like I was at a home away from home. Spacious kitchens... large rooms.. and we loved the jacuzzi tub. Plus, my hubby and I took advantage of the kitchen and cooked breakfast. We ate our breakfast on the balcony overlooking the golf course. There is plenty to do from paddle boating to the game rooms and dining at the restaurants. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Ok place to stay if rate is reasonable”
Reviews.Author: Carolf32
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 days after purchasing a package deal that included Disney tickets. We only booked a guest room, but we found the place to be equal to an average Holiday Inn. The bedding was dirty, the walls were dirty and scuffed and when we checked in were told we had a view of the golf course. In reality we overlooked a bunch of overgrown trees, weeds and brush. Having 4 pools for about 20 multi-story buildings is ridiculous. I'm not sure why anyone buys into their timeshare scam, but expect to be approached and called at all hours of the day and night begging to come to their presentation. They offered all kinds of bribes, from Disney money to Marriott points to free greens fees, but having come from the presentation at their Ocean Point resort earlier in the week, we weren't interested in that ordeal again. We finally just quit answering the phone. Overall, if you can get a good deal this is an ok place to stay because it's convenient to all three parks, but there are tons of these type resorts up and down International Drive and you can stay at any of them - this place really wasn't anything expectional.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place for a family visiting the Orlando area”
Reviews.Author: Ritsmer_Stormholt
Reviews.Content: We are a family of two adults and two children (8 & 11). Stayed at Grande Vista in July 2006. First one week, left for a week and came back for another week. We had a two bedroom apartment. Rooms are really nice, very spacious, well equiped and in good shape. Staff was very freindly and the place is clean. The pool areas, both the large central and the local ones have each their thing to offer. The large is very busy and lively, the smaller local one is more quiet and even a little private. The Faldo restaurant was ok, average. They tried to sell us an apartment and we were almost convinced due to quality of this place. When and if we revisit Orlando, the Grande Vista will be the place we will stay again. Family Ritsmer Stormholt / Copenhagen - Denmark

Reviews.Title: “Visit started out great but got worse”
Reviews.Author: Oasis29
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the MGV resort for a week with our 10 month old daughter. We stayed in a 1 bedroom villa. We initially were very impressed, but as the week went on some nagging things started to get to us. Here's our take: The Good: Very beautiful grounds area. Lots of greenery, trees, bushes. The staff was very helpful and friendly (except one of the concierge attendants). The rooms were well appointed and the furniture was in fairly good condition for a hotel/condo. The Bad: While the furniture was in good shape the walls of our room were well worn. The room was not excpetionally clean (I will get to that below). The resort is so big that if you get put in the wrong area of the resort, you can have upto a 7-10 minute walk to the pool. Due to the large amount of grounds they are always trimming trees or shrubs so there is always noise. Disclaimer: I am generally a very easy to please person so what is below is not an exageration. The Ugly: Room cleanliness: There was mold in the toilet and the shower. There was a cockroach on my daughter's stroller as well as many other assorted bugs in the room. We paid $30 for a full room clean mid week (cleaning is not included with the timeshares). The carpets were not vacuumed, the tables were not cleaned, and they did not leave us any kitchen towels. As someone stated below, this is definitely not a 5 star resort. I would say more like 3-3.5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Resort Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Luvtravel
Reviews.Content: My family and I spent 4 nights at the Grand Vista 8/21-8/25/06, We were in a 1 bedroom villa ; this place is fantastic. The villa was very clean and spacious, furniture and electronics, Kitchen, laundry equipment were in top notch condition, and my husband appreciated the complimentary wireless internet access. Our 2 young children loved the extra room to run around in plus they had their own TV/DVD. I appreciated the screened balcony, so I could appreciate the fabulous view without the bugs Florida is famous for. The Jacuzzi tub in the bedroom was a slice of heaven. The grounds were immaculate, very well cared for. The staff were very courteous , and responded quickly to requests as well as follow-up calls. Customer service was First rate. We attended a timeshare presentation, which was very low key and actually , was surprisingly pleasant. This place definitely makes us think twice about staying in a cramped hotel room for our next vacation. Also ,there are lots of planned activities for children , as well as a playroom, and around 3 large pools. I can't really comment on the quality of the activities, however, because we spent most of our time at the theme parks, but we did observe families enjoying themselves throughout the resort.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, bad service”
Reviews.Author: mamaknitty
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was very lovely. We had a good time in the pool and most of the staff were very nice. The room was excellent. But we had major problems with our bill and it has taken a long time to fix it. If I ever stay here again, I will have to be very clear about how they bill and charge for the room because they were not clear at all last time. But they made a good effort to clear things up so if I have to stay again I would.

Reviews.Title: “Always a great time.”
Reviews.Author: Skip3815
Reviews.Content: I'll state right up front that we loved this place so much that we did purchase a time-share. We are a family of five that loves Disney World and all the other Florida attractions. The Grande Vista couldn't be any more convienent. It's in the middle of everything. So far, it's out of the way, which makes for very little of the infamous Central Florida traffic. There are back roads to almost everywhere. Ask the staff, they will love to tell you the best way. These rooms are so very spacious. We travelled with eight in our party the last two years and no one was in the way. The full kitchen, three bed rooms and three baths make this place a large party destination. The washer and dryer in every two bedroom suite makes packing that much lighter too. The parking is free and plentiful. The grounds are secured by gates and there are patrols out, not that they need to do it. The two pools each have a bar and food. There is a grocery store on property that serves hot Starbucks coffee in the mornings. It was nice to be able to go in, pour my coffee, then head out for another day with my usual pick-me-up. The staff is friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “We liked it so much we bought it!”
Reviews.Author: alliebdive
Reviews.Content: We love Grande Vista and bought two weeks here back in 2001. Having said that, this was the first time we had ever been back, and we liked it so much, we bought another week!!! Must have been Yorkshire time there 11-18th August as we were also there then. Family of 2 adults and 2 teenage daughters. We had a 2 bedroom in the Golf villas. Lovely villa - very very spacious (so much better than our next week spent at the Vistana which was AWFUL), fully equipped, quiet and just lovely to come back to after a day out at the parks. The only fault I can find with our villa was that it was a long way to reception - you had to drive, no question. Having said that there was a pool next door which I used and enjoyed - it was much quieter than the main pool. Reception were always courteous and welcoming, there were no lines (quite unlike the Vistana) and my room was ready early. Internet access was good - plenty of pcs. Location is absolutely superb. You are perfectly situated between Disney and Universal and next door to Sea World. There is a brilliant Publix supermarket 5 minutes drive away. Certainly didn't spot any bugs! Wouldn't stay anywhere else in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Home from Home at the Grande Vista”
Reviews.Author: AmeliaT
Reviews.Content: My husband, son and I stayed 11-25 August. We were given a suite in the Alicante building, which housed all the facilities you would require for a home from home vacation. Only two complaints : the occupants of the suite next door were very noisy and because there was an adjoining door there was no sound proofing and the water stank of chlorine. We did complain about the noisy neighbours, yelling, scream and slamming of doors after midnight is a bit excessive. We were informed by the reception staff that security would have a quiet word, whether they did or not we don't know but after that it wasn't too bad. Regardless it didn't spoil our stay. Facilities at the resort were very good. Boating and fishing on the lake. Pizza Hut, Copa Loca Bar and Grill, The Lighthouse Bar and the deli were all good. The deli was a little bit pricey but on check-in you are given a guide with directions to the nearest supermarkets and also the resort's activity guide, considering this is not an all-inclusive facility there are loads to keep you occupied, the majority of which are free of charge and only a nominal cost for make and take craft items and some trips. We thought the drinks at the bars were quite expensive but our son made good use of his souvenir insulated cup which at an initial cost of $12.99 provided him with free refills for the whole of the vacation. Starbucks in the deli operates a similar deal. Whilst the bars operate a buy a smoothy/cocktail in souvenir glass for $8 and then refills at $6 same again for beers. We did not try Nick's Grill so cannot comment. The suite was tastefully furnished, with a full kitchen, washer/dryer and hot-tub/spa in the master bedroom. Although this was one of the newer rooms there were already some signs of wear and tear. We had to call maintenance once to repair the air conditioning and this was done in a matter of minutes. Don't be surprised - there is no housekeeping on a daily basis. We were lucky to have a screened in balcony with ceiling fan and saw no roaches or nasties the whole stay. The resort is located some distance from the hustle and bustle of I-drive but only a very short drive to Sea World and Discovery Cove. 15 mins tops to Disney and Universal. We certainly had a good time and would recommend this hotel to anyone, especially those with small children as the pools were very nice and not that deep. We did not see a playground however there were tennis and basketball courts. When we left it looked like they were preparing to put up some sort of climbing wall. Once a week, in the older of the two larger pool areas, they have a large screen showing fairly recent family movies. If you're lucky you can also see the firework display at Sea World. Overall its a very good place to stay and I do know that a lot of families were happy just to stay at the resort and felt no need to venture to the parks. I think if we weren't the typical Brits who feel it's not worth visiting Orlando unless you've seen Mickey, we would have done the same!

Reviews.Title: “this is a beautiful facility but,”
Reviews.Author: super9
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this resort with my four kids they loved it. For the most part it was clean and well kept, but..... they had roaches which prompted me to leave. They must of came through the pipes because we only saw them in the bathroom especially around the shower area. I suggest they invest in a exterminator!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant hotel alternative”
Reviews.Author: traveluser
Reviews.Content: We spent seven days in July at the Grande Vista while attending a conference at the Orlando convention center. This property is a very pleasant alternative to a hotel. The two bedroom unit was in one of the newer buildings. It was very spacious, clean and offered a lovely view of the lake. The kitchen was well equipped; the bathrooms were large, and the two screened porches were great in the evening. Pools were busy, but not overwhelmingly so. We found the staff to be friendly and generally helpful. This location is convenient to theme parks, restaurants and the convention facility, though a car is absolutely necessary. Look for a good rate (try AAA or M11) on the Marriott website.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice but...........”
Reviews.Author: cinema14618
Reviews.Content: My family just spent a little over a week at the Orlando Grande Vista. My perspective is from someone who has stayed at lower end hotels to the Ritz Carlton in Washington, the Southampton Princess in Bermuda, as well as the Marriott Canyon villas in Phoenix (three weeks ago). Our problem was with the bath water. It wreaked!!!!!! It wasn't subtle, it just smelled really bad and this is what prompted me to write a review. My feeling was that it was not a problem with my specific room's water but was a problem with the whole resort. I had a facility engineer inspect it and he verified my complaint and agreed with my theory saying that some resorts invest in osmosis or reverse osmosis processes to clean up their water but that this facility didn't. He also said that the water in Florida, in general, isn't very good. I later found that not to be true. We were going to move on to another hotel but we checked the Crown Plaza down the street and the water there, while slightly better, was still a problem. So we ended up staying at the Grande Vista except for the end of our stay. I know we're not crazy. We spent a night in a Holiday Inn Express in Tampa and the water was fine and later, moved on to the Crown Plaza in Orlando by the airport and the water there was fine as well. the only other time I smelled water like this was at a hotel in Mexico. As far as the other aspects of the stay, we stayed in a two bedroom villa. The rooms were very nice, the size of the rooms was generous, the furniture was in very good condition, the fact that there were two bedrooms was great and in general the grounds were also very well kept. It was a little older and a little smaller than the Grand Canyon Villas in Phoenix. The staff, for the most part, were very accomodating. I guess there is this corporate procedure where if you request some service, someone from another department calls you and asks if you were satisfied with the help you requested. I was very impressed with that. The only other criticism, though much more minor was that there seemed to be a lot more leaves, etc. in the pool water than there perhaps should have been. Though they bill this property as a 5 star property, no way is it in that class. I would say it's definitely 3.5 stars to maybe 4 stars. If you discount the bath water (hard for me to do), it was a very nice resort and we had a very nice time.

Reviews.Title: “Really Nice”
Reviews.Author: go4broke
Reviews.Content: I went to Orlando for work/vacation combination, and stayed here instead of the designated convention property. I was extremely happy with my decision. The rooms were nice and clean. I was in building 93, which overlooked the Golf course and was not refurbished, but it was still well maintained and comfortable with all the amenities. The resort property is gorgeous, and it is in a great location close to all the attractions. The vacation starter pack is a nice touch. I even went to a timeshare presentation, and it was professional and low key. All in all, a grand place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place to stay! Loved it!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Kfisher
Reviews.Content: We have visited Orlando several times, and have always stayed at Disney resorts. However, we were so disappointed with our accomodations last year at the Port Orleans, we decided to try something different. Best decision we ever made, particularly if you are traveling with children!!! I will never stay at another hotel on a vacation, and will always look for a Marriott timeshare whenever we are traveling! We rented a 2 bedroom 2 bath unit from an owner (found her on the internet), and paid an incredible price for the week! The rooms were amazing, exactly as pictured on the website, and were huge. We not only saved a ton of money by sometimes preparing meals for ourselves at the resort; but we saved our sanity by havng plenty of room to spread out. The staff was always pleasant and friendly when you saw them. There was no pressure to purchase a time share (although you can opt to attend a presentation if you would like, and the gift you receive just for attending is VERY nice). The kids really enjoyed the pools with all of the little waterfalls and the large hot tubs! (My only regret is that there wasn't a slide or diving board at one of the pools. My kids love those). It was a wonderful vacation, and I truly believe that our accomodations at the Marriott Grande Vista greatly contributed to this. Feel confident in choosing this resort. You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “What a Wonderful Place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from spending a week at Marriotts Grande Vista resort. This was our first vacation in over 15 years and we could not have asked for a more wonderful place. We had a one bedroom villa that was spotless. It had a washer and dryer, stove, fridge and all the pots and pans and utensils you could need. The bed was extremly comfortable,huge bathroom with a whirlpool tub in the master suite. We had a top floor corner view over looking the golf course. We could see the firework display at Seaworld everynight from our balcony. It was less than a mile away. MGV has 4 beautiful pools, again, very clean. The staff were excellent, very polite and helpful. There is a convenience store on site that stocks just about everything you would need, if not there is a Publix grocery store less that a mile away.Infact this resort is so conveniently located to just about everything. The Disney parks are only about 5-6 miles away. Staying at MGV was a wonderful experience and we can't wait to get back there again, hopefully next year.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Place to Stay in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: sapamire
Reviews.Content: We justed returned from a week vacation at the Grande Vista. I went on vacation with my wife, and two children aged 7 and 9 years. We own a Marriott Vacation Club in Palm Desert, CA and traded for this resort. We stayed in the Lido Building with 2 bedrooms. Here's the likes and dislikes of the resort: Likes: Great location. Close to all the resorts, outlet malls and major freeways. However, far enough from the highways so it was quiet. Less than 5 minutes to the SeaWorld ticket counter. Very quiet in the room. Many times at timeshares, it can be very noisy. However, we rarely heard our upstair neighbor or noise from people outside. Since we were close to SeaWorld and other resorts, you can easily hear and see the fireworks around 9 pm to 10 pm. Good size - about 1500 square feet. Full kitchen with flattop stove, microwave and dishwasher. Washer and dryer next to the refrigerator. Two pull out sofas - one in the living room and one in the smaller bedroom. Great HEATED pool at the main site. Water was about 85 degrees. It may seem warm, but the kids stayed in for hours and it was refreshing. Game room, including ping pong, pool and an indoor jungle gym. The jungle gym was great during one of the really rainy afternoon thunderstorms. Fishing and boat rides available for rental. Nine-hole Nick Faldo Golf Course on site. Decent workout room with ellipticals, treadmills, free weights and steppers. Dislikes: We obviously did not receive one of the newer rooms. There was a significant amount of mold in the air and visible mold on the baseboards, vent and parts of the shower tiling in the main bathroom. The main shower water control was not intact. The shower was not dirty, but it was not as clean as it could be. When we checked in, we our DVD player was not working correctly. However, they fixed it immediately. Then we found out we were missing the remote control. We did not have pool towels in the suite, but they promptly sent us towels. It may seem like "petty" dislikes, but since we have had many positive experiences with the accomodations in Palm Desert, the overall rating is above average and not excellent. However, my kids and wife really enjoyed our stay in Orlando and would return to a "newer" building to avoid the "petty" things. What we dd: We went to Busch Gardens in Tampa -- about 75 minutes from the resort. My kids and I had a fun time there. SheiKra and Kumba are worth the wait if you like rollercoasters. My daughter and wife saw all the animals while my son and I rode the coasters. Get the 2 day pass and save some money. We went to Cocoa Beach and watched the Space Shuttle take off from Cape Kennedy. The water was warm -- about 85 degrees with fun waves. We experienced a lot of kelp on the beach and in the water. However, a local stated this was unusual. We went to Lori Fischer Park in Cocoa Beach. We went to SeaWorld and enjoyed the Believe Show. We also really enjoyed all the animal displays and really spent our time with the animals and not with any rides. Believe it or not, we did NOT go to Disney. We use to live in LA and spent many days at Disneyland. However, if you do Busch Garden and SeaWorld, you probably don't have to do Disney's Animal Kingdom. You can definintely get all that at Busch and SeaWorld. We didn't do any water parks because my kids wanted to swim at the resort hotel. We went to Downtown Disney to buy my wife a new Mickey tee-shirt. I have never be fan of the So. Cal. Downtown Disney and can't say I'm a fan for the Orlando one either. There are many other places for you to shop in Orlando, such as the Orlando Premium Outlet Mall. However, my wife found a tee-shirt she liked, so I'm happy. My wife and daughter went to WonderWorks on International Drive while my son and I saw Pirates. The WonderWorks place has a lot of 3 D activities. I hope this is useful to you. Have a "Grand" time in Orlando and the Grande Vista resorts.

Reviews.Title: “La Quinta with Beautiful Grounds”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed here over the busy July 4th week. We stayed in an efficiency unit which was purchased on Ebay. My thoughts are mixed. The grounds are beautiful. The two pool areas are fantastic. There is all kinds of stuff to do without ever going to a theme park. They have tennis courts with rackets for rent for $2.50. Paddle boats for rent. Basketball court with complimentary basketball. Fishing poles for rent. Bicycles for rent. A gameroom with pool table and air hockey table. A small, for this size property, but very capable fitness facility. A play area for little ones that is indoor and nice. They have activities scheduled throughout the day including daily lessons at the Faldo Golf Institute. On a macro level, the property was great. However, we had enough complaints that I couldn't give it an excellent rating. When we arrived, the check-in facility was packed and pretty much stayed that way most of the time. For a property the size of this property, and this being such a busy weekend, I couldn't understand why they were so poorly staffed. The same was true with the concierge. After checking in, I went straight to the concierge desk to buy tickets to theme parks. The concierge desk was staffed by two people--one to do the concierge work, the other to offer discounted tickets if you scheduled a timeshare presentation. The problem was, it takes no time to schedule someone for a timeshare presentation, so you had this long line at the concierge desk with one person working and the other just standing there. We were put in one of the older units. I didn't understand this as you would think that if you were trying to show off your property to potential timeshare buyers, you would give them your best rooms. Our room was sorry. It was clean and well furnished, free of bugs and any foul odors. But, it had formica countertops and $20 faucets. I thought the whole property outside of the landscaping and pools looked more like a La Quinta than a Marriott. Staying in an efficiency was a bad idea. The room was too cramped to have never had maid service as our dirty towels kept piling up and piling up as did our trash. Even after asking for maid service, the front desk never bothered to inform us that we could leave our trash and our towels outside the door for pickup (Which we found out later when we complained). Also, you get messages throughout the day as to activities taking place on the property. So, after spending the day at a theme park, you come back and find you have a message waiting. You go out to eat in the evening and find a message waiting. This can be annoying when you are expecting a message from home as we were and kept having to check the message system and wade through the property's messages of the latest goings on at the pool or the golf course. We did the timeshare presentation and it was no pressure. In fact, we will give serious consideration to the purchase of a Marriott timeshare at this resort. There are timeshares everywhere in this area. When we first arrived, I was regretting not staying at the Hilton up the street as it looks much nicer. However, this is the only timeshare resort in the area that is set off well from the main road and had such beautiful grounds. The location is excellent. Just don't stay in an efficiency and don't stay in one of the older units or you might as well be staying in a La Quinta.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Service”
Reviews.Author: travelerdmooney
Reviews.Content: I normally don't read or bother writing reviews, because an individual's opinion can be very subjective, but you can't dispute good management service. The front desk manager, Bill Mullin, at the Marriott Vacation Club, Grande Vista Resort in Orlando, Florida, went the extra mile to address every reasonable request and concern we had while at the resort. I travel usually six weeks a year, (all over the world and normally only 5 Star resorts), and this was by far, the best professional service we have ever experienced. If your planning a trip to the land of Mickey and Minnie, definitely consider staying at the Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Solid B+ or A-”
Reviews.Author: BernieG
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 2 nights in one of the renovated 2 bedroom units. Quite a nice stay overall with a couple of very minor issues that are not even worth mentioning. Check in and out was efficient. The resort itself is well maintained and you likely could find enough to do for a few days without really having to leave the property. But if you must, we found travel times to be 5 minutes to Seaworld, 10 minutes or so to Universal and about 15 minutes to Disney. Would certainly consider staying here again if we return to the Orlando area.

Reviews.Title: “a fun family-oriented resort”
Reviews.Author: ChinaKat
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed here during the peak season in April (2006). The first thing that you'll notice driving in is that the resort is more like a condo village than a hotel. People zip around on golf carts and there are several large clusters of time-share condos. This gated condo resort is well back from the main road which give it an exclusive feeling. We were greeted at the desk by very friendly and well trained hotel staff but had to wait for our room even though it was 5 PM. Even so, we were very impressed with our spacious suite complete with tasteful furnishings, a full kitchen, hot tub and washer/dryer. It is basically a small apartment. The reason this resort ranks as a five-star (in my opinion) is that you really never have to leave the premises to enjoy your vacation! There are several nice pools, a man-made beach, a very nice golf course, bikes and paddle boats for rent, a kiddie climbing maze, a big game room, several bars, and a small store. We found the other guests to be very friendly and always had a smile for our small children as they ran across the bridge over the lake that serves as the scenic backdrop for the resort. Our oldest son (age 6) decided that one day at the overwhelmingly crowded Disney World was enough so we spent the next 3 days at the resort. The timeshare pressure is there but it is not obnoxious. Probably the best feature is that the resort was totally sold out and it seemed busy but not crowded. I highly recommend this over the traditional hotels provided you are willing to shell out some cash.

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: Jason118
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Marriottâ€™s Grande Vista (MGV) from June 10 to 17, 2006. The unit assigned to us was a two-bedroom condo located on 4th floor in Building Number 85 â€œChristobalâ€� facing the lake. MGV is a timeshare property rather than a regular hotel, so our unit is equipped with a full kitchen (with tableware and cookware), living room, dining area, and washer/dryer. Our party consists of four adults and one two-year-old child. During our trip, we encountered Tropical Storm Alberto and it rained heavily at times for a couple of days. We utlized the kitchen to make a few meals together and played some games in the living room. If we have stayed in a regular hotel room, it would not be possible. Our experience with MGV was positive on the whole with a minor annoyance as described as follows. 1. Location: MGV is located next to a golf course on International Drive. It is 12 miles away from Walt Disney World and right next to Sea World. We tried both I-4 and State Route 536 to get to Disney. We would recommend State Route 536 since it is more straight-forward (just two turns) and faster (never congested). 2. Check-In and Check-Out: Both went very smoothly. It took us less than five minutes to check in and one minute to check out. Since the check-in time was 4pm and we arrived at 12pm, the room was not ready. The staff helped us store our bottled water and apple juice that we bought at local supermarket. When we returned to the hotel close to mid-night, the bell service personnel retrieved all the stuffs for us. We were pleasantly surprised that they have put the apple juice in the refrigerator although it was not necessary. 3. Rooms: The rooms were equipped with nice furniture and screened-in balcony. The rooms, especially the guest bedroom, were a little bit smaller compared to other Marriott timeshare properties we have stayed before, but they were still spacious enough for five of us. The rooms look clean as the building is new. However, while I was busy putting the stuffs into the refrigerator right after we first got into the room, I heard my wife calling for help in the master bathroom. There was a two-inch long cockroach in the shower stall. I killed it with my shoe. Three days later, my wife found another one in the closet, but this time it got away. I placed a phone call to the front desk. The staff apologized immediately and asked us whether we want to change to another room. Since I knew that our room probably was located in the best section of the entire hotel, I declined. Then the staff told me that she would tell the maintenance department to spray the room. I did not really know if indeed anything has been done, but we did not encounter another bug problem inside the rooms. Since the main purpose of this trip was to attend a conference, I also went to Disneyâ€™s Contemporary Resort. I saw a two-inch cockroach crawling on the floor just outside the convention area. So I guess bug is a common issue in Orlando during the summer season. 4. Maid Services: Since we exchanged our stay from one of the timeshare we own rather than paying for it, we did not receive daily maid services, which was a standard practice in timeshare industry. However, we did place a phone call asking for fresh towels while we were in Magic Kingdom. When we got back to our rooms, a pile of towels was placed on our couch with a note telling us if we need anything else, just give them a call. 5. Facilities: There were a few swimming pools, whirlpool spas, paddle boat/bike rental, lighthouse bar, a couple of restaurants, convenience store â€œMarket Placeâ€�, and Activities Center on site. There were many planned activities such as fishing competition, paddle boat racing, etc. We did not use any of these facilities as we spent most of our time in Disney except one morning my wife brought our daughter to the playroom, and she has lots of fun there. 6. Noise: We did not notice any noise from the construction of the two more buildings at Grande Vista. 7. Wireless Internet Access: MGV offers free wireless Internet access. The connection was excellent throughout our stay. We would go back to Grande Vista and recommend it to others. We also have taken some photos. Hopefully they would be helpful to you.

Reviews.Title: “It's the small things that make a vacation great”
Reviews.Author: drugcop4
Reviews.Content: My family (2 adults, 3 teen children, Mother in law, and family friend) exchanged our time share to stay at MGV 06/11-06/18/2006. We were placed in a nice 3 bedroom condo (9301-9302) and I must say the grounds and the rooms were perfect. I was also nice to find on site ativities to attend for those who are not theme park goers. The pools were nice and well located throughout the property although I must say that the maintenance on the pools were lacking.
