There were always an abundance of bugs and critters swilling about to make you swin the other direction. The service on the other hand was greatly lacking. After reporting that a soap dish in the shower was broken and that there were jagged edges apparent, the maintenance staff never made an appearance. The first trip to the bar, they were "out" of wanted items. There was plenty of time to ask to see the sales pitch, but no time to do other things. The rooms have a dust pan and no broom. The staff is polite, but could care less about you. We asked to obtain a volleyball to play on the beach and the staff member advised us that the one ball they had was checked out and they had no idea where it was. It surprised me that a resort of this size and caliber, had only one ball. Everything had a charge to go with it, kinds of makes me wonder why someone would pay for ownership, and what comes with it. Come on folks $6.00 to rent a fishing pole is ridiculous. The final straw for me was on Friday night I purchased a beer in a souvenier glass at ne bar, and when we decided to sit by a pool near the other bar I attempted to have it refilled, and the bartender told be they had no beer, and had none all day. It is Friday night and a bar has no beer, and none all day. The lack of attention to this type of detail is inexcusible. I did make a call to managment and spoke with Mr. Mullin who was wonderful to talk to and could not apologize enough. I had the true feeling that he would immediately recitfy the problems mentioned so that other guests would not have to deal with it. I can recommend the MGV only if you only plan on staying in the room. The general staff, although friendly and courteous, could care less about your stay and comfort.

Reviews.Title: “The best place I've ever stayed!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have traveled a lot in my years and I must say that this was one of the most beautiful and immaculate resorts I have ever stayed in. I thought I would get online and check out the comments about this place after we got back (since I didn't look before). I cannot believe the terrible times that some people on this comment board had at this resort! I was greeted by the manager as I walked in the door and never went without a thing the entire visit. I felt like a VIP the entire vacation and everyone else did also. This place must have new management from the previous years because we stayed in the 9400 building , which is one of the older buildings, and it was wonderful. I hope the people who read the bad reveiews will read this one because it really is a resort that you do not have to leave the whole week to have a great time. We're going to keep going back!!!!

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay- marriott grande vista”
Reviews.Author: christicbo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott Grande Vista for a week from May 26 to June 2, 2006. Our stay was very enjoyable. I made a special request for a room, and the staff did everything they could to accommodate this. Everyone was very friendly during check-in. I called to ask for the free starter pack of coffee and some extra towels on our second day, and two people showed up within an hour, one with towels and one with the coffee!!! The concierge was helpful in giving us information about restaurants- he even made a reservation for us, and gave us a coupon for a free drink. To me, the accommodations here were great. There is a new pool and and bar/restaurant called copa loco. THey have decent food and you can get a drink right by the pool, with waitresses walking around right to your chair to bring your drink/food order as you sit in the sun. There is a heated pool and one for kids. Then you walk across a beautiful bridge and go to the old pool. It is nice as well. Over here, you have a lady sitting selling drinks in a large wooden coconut-shaped souvenir, or beer on tap, as well as hairbraiding. The marketplace store is right there, with snacks and suntan lotion, etc. Beside this is a pizza shop. The man made lake, with the bridge, is really nice. You can rent paddle boats shaped like ducks or swans for ten dollars for a half an hour. There is enough in this resort that you could probably stay here the whole week and not even go anywhere! You could swim, get a massage, rent a paddle boat, fish, eat at one of three places, shop in the marketplace, etc. There is a great ambience to the whole place. We were in building 85, near the new pool, but any building you stay in would be okay. The resort is set off from a highway, so there isn't much noise. They are constructing two new buildings, but there was nothing loud going on while we were there, even in the day. The location is beautiful, and all the buildings are in good shape and look like spanish villas. Building 85 did have some elevator problems. I read all the reviews to this place, and what I say to these is that some people will have problems with anything. I think if you are courteous and decent when making your requests and dealing with the staff, they will treat you the same way. I found that anything they could do to help they were willing to do. I didn't see inside all the rooms, so I don't know what the condition would be of those. However, our room was quite nice. We had an efficiency, and it had enough room for two of us. There was a bed, sofa, and ample closet space, as well as refrigerator and microwave. When I saw the pictures online, I thought it would be s maller than it was. I was pleasantly surprised. The greatest thing is that each room has a balcony. This was quite enjoyable. Here are some other tips about orlando- The shark restaurant in seaworld is really nice, with a great view from any table, however I had some problems getting my steak cooked medium well. They did apologize and try to remedy the situation. Also, the restaurant at downtown disney called fulton's crabhouse is supposed to be incredible. The food was very pricey, and they tried twice to cook my steak medium well- once it was burnt and the next time it was medium at best. The waiter was also somewhat rude. The manager did deal with this and deeply apologize. I tend to have bad luck with steaks on vacation- maybe try something else on the menu. At epcot in disney- get a fast pass and go back to the rides that have along line- just go to the entrance of the ride and do the fast pass. If you are going to seaworld or busch gardens- join southwest(--) rapid rewards- you can get a card and it entitles you to 20% discount to each park!!!! Or, buy at least seven days in advance on their websites to save $6 per ticket. There is also a combo ticket for $95 on some websites. If you go to Kennedy Space Center, plan to have all day available. We went at noon and had trouble seeing everything. Triple A has discount tickets to most parks including kennedy space center as well. Hope you all have a wonderful trip!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay despite few issues”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the MGV from May 26-06/1 in a 3B/3B. I was traveling with a group of 10 - 7 adults, 3 children ages 3,4,5. We came a long way to stay at this resort and I have been reading the past reviews hoping I would have a positive experience. I requested in advance for a refurbished room however, Maggie at room control said the new refurbed rooms are reserved for Marriott timeshare owners. We were assigned to the Lago building, 4th floor. The 2 bedrooms were nice however the 3rd bedroom had an odor of mildew/mold. The appliances/tableware were dated, the kitchen floor & fridge was sticky, the dirt was visible in the grout in all the restrooms, and the tub drain in the 2nd bath was rusted. During our first 2 nights, cockroaches were discovered on the floor of our villa. At this point, I went to the registration and requested that we move to another building. They could not accomodate another 3B/3B in a newer unit, so our party seperated to 2 different buildings, Ibiza and Magellan. The two newer units were definitely nicer, new appliances/tableware, cleaner, without any odor. The overall ground of the property was really nice. There are many activities on the property for the entire family. While the kids were swimming, I went for a massage. The one hour swedish massage I had was not worth $85. The massage room was in the workout facility so while I was getting my treatment, I could hear the treadmills and music in the next room. Another disappointing factor was the lack of parking. If you arrived late night, you were lucky to find parking near your building. The Marketplace had everything you could possibly imagine, Krispy Kreme donuts and Pizza Hut at reasonable prices. I would stay at the MGV resort only if I was guaranteed a new refurbed room. Note: The staff mentioned that this resort is the largest of all Marriott resorts in the world.

Reviews.Title: “The best place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at the Marriott's Grande Vista from May 5th to the 19th 2006. It is one of the best Time share places I have stayed at so far. It is an ideal place for families as there are many activities for all ages (including adults) going on through out the day and night. We stayed in a 2 bedroom, 2 bathroom apartment in the Ibiza building which over looked the golf course with lovely views. The accomodation was lovely, clean and very comfortable. It had everything you needed for your stay. The bedrooms were very spacious, and both had their own private bathrooms balconys. I am very 'picky' when it comes to holiday accommodation. Everything has to be to a high standard when I go on vacation. At the Marriott's Grande Vista everything was perfect and we had no cause to complain about anything. If I return to Orlando in the near future I would stay here again and again, no doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: sunshinewillis
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mrriott Grande Vista from May 7-12, 2006. We stayed in a 2 bedroom/2 bathroom villa. I fell in love with this resort, and it will be my first choice for any trip to that area from now on. The room we stayed in (7414) was on the fourth floor, overlooking one of the quiet pools. It was within walking diatnce of the main lobby, store, and kids pool. It was also within walking distance of Nick's Grill. The villa was absolutely lovely. It had a full kitchen, with full sized appliances. The furniture was very pretty, and in excellent shape. The master bedroom had a huge king sized bed, with sliding glass doors onto a large balcony. The balcony held a table for 4, and even had a ceiling fan. Some of the balconys are screened in, but ours was not. The master bedroon had a huge jacuzzi tub. Great "perk" if you like that kind of stuff, but it was basically used as a clothes hamger while we were there. The second bedroom had 2 queen sized beds, a large closet, plenty of storage and a tv. The grounds are by far some of the most beautiful I have ever seen. Everything is well manicured, and the flowers, and water gardens are so nice. The golf course is huge, and it's a nice addition to the landscape. The pools (there are 4 I believe) are all very nice. We spent most of our time at the big pool. My kids wanted to use this pool because it had fountains, and water sprays. This pool is located at the Copa Loca Grill. The Copa Loca Grill was good, standard grill type food. Burgers, chicken fingers, sandwiches, etc. They also have a bar here which serves the yummiest frozen drinks! Try the raspberry chocolate frozen mudslide, and their signature frozen drink as well. You won't be disappointed. My kids loved the frozen Chocolate Monkeys! We did eat at Nicks for dinner one night. Maybe because the prices were so high, I was expecting alot, but the food was pretty blah. Not worth the prices for sure, but it's a nice place. The lunch menu looked better, but I couldn't convince the kids to leave the pool for lunch. The staff is superb! I encountered a few very minor problems (dvd player wouldn't work, and one of the beds was out of it's frame when I arrived) and all of the problems were fixed very quickly, with a big smile and follow up phone calls from a manager to ensure all was taken care of. At one point in our travels, we got very lost getting back to the hotel, and someone took the time, and stayed on the phone with me until I pulled into the resort entrance! Excellent! We did not participate in the onsite activities that went on each day and night, as this was a Disney vacation, but let me tell you....you could spend a week at this resort, not ever leave, and not be bored for a minute! The have a fantastic kids club there. There was a playplace for the little ones, and big arcade/game room for the older kids. They had kareoke parties, movie nights. There is a beach volleyball court, paddleboats, bikes to rent...it's endless! We loved this place so much, we are thinking about buying a timeshare here. Don't hesitae for a minute to stay here. I am a very picky person, especially when it comes to customer service, and this place is TOP NOTCH!

Reviews.Title: “A great resort for a great price!”
Reviews.Author: QueenAlice
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are actually writing this review from the Marriott Grande Vista... We stayed here for a night earlier this week, and loved it so much that we came back for two nights towards the end of our vacation! The Marriott Grande Vista is a really beautiful resort, and it's at a really great price. We reserved a regular guest room for three different nights for $116 plus tax a night... It's really a reasonable rate, considering that even the smallest guest rooms are very spacious, with a large queen size bed, full size sofa, and kitchenette area. The beds have down pillows and some have down featherbeds. In terms of decor, the Grande Vista is perfect for romantics or families... My husband and I are actually on our honeymoon, and the Grande Vista has been perfect for us! There's no ugly 80's decor here. Everything in the rooms is very clean, and it's nice to have the mini-fridge for storing wine coolers or what have you. Hubby and I decided not to go the Disney route in Orlando, so it was really nice to be at the Grande Vista. We had plenty of stuff to do. Our first night here, we grabbed our swimsuits and went to the Copa Loca grill and bar area. The food at the grill was pretty good... I recommend the coconut fried shrimp. The mixed drinks were DELICIOUS. It was so relaxing to swim all evening in either the spa or heated pool and to sip pina coladas. When we decided to return to our room, we walked the grounds and saw tons of lizards, frogs, and even an armadillo! It's in a beautiful area with lush grounds, and it was really neat to see so much life. We did not see an abundance of insects, thankfully. We brought our laptop from home, and are right this moment using the Grande Vista's free high speed wireless internet. It's great... The connection is very fast, and we've been able to upload our pictures to show our friends and family our vacation. There are only a few tiny negatives about the Grande Vista; like other reviewers have said, you must bring your own conditioner and lotion, because the resort does not provide these. Also, breakfast is not included, and their shop the Marketplace doesn't offer all too many healthy options. During this particular stay we have had some rather noisy neighbors, but they aren't so noisy as to make us alert the resort staff. The check out time is 10am and the resort staff knocked on our door at 8:30am to make sure we were awake; that may have been a problem if we weren't awake already. But these things are insignificant compared to all the good things. It is a great family resort, and we wouldn't hesitate to come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Grande Time and Grande Vista”
Reviews.Author: poppasquash
Reviews.Content: My mother and I took my 3-year-old daughter for a trip to Orlando this past week, and stayed at the Grande Vista. I'll make the review short and sweet... BEAUTIFUL grounds, with palm trees and tropical foliage everywhere. We had a beautiful room overlooking the village center pool. This pool was perfect for my small daughter, who enjoyed the gentle spouter fountains and gecko pool for toddlers. If you have older kids (ages 5 to teen) the bridge across the lagoon takes you to another pool, adjacent to the CocoLoco bar. This pool has water cannons and spray fountains that are perfect for the big kids. The Marketplace was perfect for grabbing Starbucks coffee in the morning, Krispy Kreme donuts, Pizza Hut Pizza, and Edy's Ice Cream! They have a fairly good selection of groceries and health and beauty items, in case you run out of anything. They make breakfast and lunch sandwiches, as well. Good selection of alchoholic and non-alchoholic beverages in a large cooler. Free bags of ice, as well. The Grande Vista is located off International Drive, so it is centrally located to all parks. The one negative about the place - - no shuttle service to the parks. I would have gladly paid for this service, rather than renting a car. For now, a car is a must here. The rooms are nicely furnished, and very comfortable. Kitchens well equipped. Bring hair conditioner if you use it - they only provide soap and shampoo. Lots of activities each day for little to big kids and teens. GREAT Nick Faldo golf course and restaurant. (Wished there was another "real" restaurant on property, however). Paddle boats in the shapes of ducks and swans were cute. Bike and surrey rentals, game room, and a great indoor childrens play area with climbing structures saved a rainy day. Staff were pleasant and helpful all around. We'll definitely consider staying at Grande Vista again for our next trip to Orlando! Very relaxing place to come back to after a long day at Disney. Feel free to email with any questions!

Reviews.Title: “poor customer service....can ruin a vacation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel could be fantastic if their staff was a little better. On the last night of our stay we noticed that our ipod was missing from the wall it was recharging from. Hotel said we must have misplaced. Well we knew it was charging when we left, only a small time had passed.Only person in our room was housekeeping. So they obviously stole it from our room.Upon checkout I was told not to worry problem would be taken care of.Well after fighting and chasing them for 3 months they finally rectified the problem only after threatening them to go to corporate.And they never did give me full value for the ipod. Not even a free nights stay or something not that I would ever go back there. I guess I trusted marriott to much to not have theives working for them. My advice SKIP THE HOUSEKEEPING!

Reviews.Title: “We concur, great place!!”
Reviews.Author: jsherwood26
Reviews.Content: The review from May 2 just about says it all. Our experience was just as great and they gave so much detail about the resort I can't add much more. We were there from April 29-May 6 and we have nothing but praise about Grande Vista. We visited with our 21 month old daughter and two friends who stayed in the lock off portion of the two bedroom unit. We were in a building not too far from the main pool and a short walk over the bridge to the other pool and we made just about equal use of both. The staff members at this place are so accomodating and friendly. They took care of all of my requests from a pack and play and high chair for our daughter to a VCR for me to record American Idol so I didn't miss it!!! They followed up all of these requests with phone calls to confirm that everything was to our satisfaction. We got asked a few times if we wanted to attend the timeshare presentation, but didn't feel pressured. They actually offered $100 to attend that could be either cash or basically a credit for the bars and restaurants at the Grande Vista, so not a bad offer. We ended up not attending because our daughter would never cooperate and we aren't comfortable having strangers watch her. The wireless internet is superb, we were checking our email and sending all of our vacation pics back to our families at a very fast connection. The facilities are clean and plenty of towels to go around. There are also plenty of activities going on, although we didn't end up attending most of them. I just can't say enough about the staff here. Everyone we encountered clearly cares about how satisfied their visitors are and it shows. Don't hesitate to stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Vacation Disaster!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We went for a romantic getaway without the kids, only for my husband to be mistaken as a man who stole a golf club in the pro shop (which by the way is open to the public). After an afternoon spent by the pool, we were greated at our door by two orlando sherrif's and two resort security guards. They had a picture of the robber who was obviously not my husband but still questioned him, searched our room and our car. It was humiliating, embarrinsing and drew attention. When we complained to the management we were told that "they were only doing their job" It was a horrible experience and really put a damper on the rest of our stay. Horrible customer service!

Reviews.Title: “wow !!! great for visitors from UK”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I read up about this resort before arriving. As a Marriott owner at Village I'sle de France near Paris France my wife myself and 2 daughters (8 and 7) exchanged our week and arranged 2 weeks at beginning of April 2006. I can't say enough about the resort. Arrived on the first day and checked in at 11.30 am. I know others have had problems on this but arrive early and take the chance of getting in early - don't get uptight and stressed if you can't - chill around the pool !!!!!!!!. We had unpacked looked around , stocked up at Publix just down the road and were in Seaworld by 4 PM. !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! . We did have a coupe of odd first days and ended up swapping rooms as we had a couple of maintenaance problesm with the first one ( no blackouts in Kids room - they woke at 05.30 am !!), flyscreen missing and that it was on ground floor with no sun - made it a bit chilly early evening. Changing rooms was no problem - reception staff were extremely keen to help and there was no problem in chnaging. Help was offered but we were so keen to move we just got on and did it. Had a fab room in the main bulding on the 3 rd floor overlooking the main pool area which was great. I have to say that for guests from the UK or Europe the resort is fantastic. Most people from Europe come for Disney / Seaworld/Universal and Busch Gardens so Grande Vista provides a home away from home, away from the hustle and bustle of I-Drive in what is 5 start surroundings sngd yert close to Disney and Seaworld - a great place to sleep in before hitting theparks, relaxing round the pool before hitting theparks in the afternoon / evening and generally just relaxing in. We spent 3 happy days in the 2 weeks just relaxing round the pool in the sun - the kids loved the pool and spent a lot of the time in it.The film around the pool from 8pm on Thursday was excellent - beer and popcorn for the adults while the kids swam was great!!!!!. Did find it strange people claiming sun loungers and s[pots around the pool very early in the day before turning up at 10 or 11 am Facilities onsight are good as are the two bed apartments - what more do you want on holiday?. Only slight criticism is the lack of daily housekeeping - this is standard in the 4 vacation club resorts in Europe. With young kids it was great having the full kitchen - kids are fussy eaters and just being able to feed them cheaply, easily and quickly helped - on days out breakfast was easy before hitting attractions. Onsite facilities are great - Marketplace, pedal boats, bikes (although more are needed as you need to wait a bit) Pizza Hut, gym, sauna, indoor kids play area. etc. Only really checked them out rather than using them all - spent time out and about really. One thing to note - prices are very reasonable - from Starbucks coffee in the marketplace to frozen cocktails, kids drinks, and food from the Copa Loca bar - all very good. If you want somewhere that is away from the hustkle and bustle, somewhere that you can return to after hectic days out and relax and recover ( with all the facilities ) go here - Grande Vista certainly lives up to its name !!!! Will be back the next time we come to Florida

Reviews.Title: “A Fabulous Time had by all! Awesome place!”
Reviews.Author: crazyka
Reviews.Content: We just got back from an amazing week at this resort. I traveled with my husband and two kids, 14 & 11. We stayed in the lock-out unit attached to the main 2 bedroom unit that my sister and husband and their children (ages 3,5,& 7) shared. They are owners. We all had a fabulous time. The room was very beautiful with hardwood cabinentry and granite countertops and nicely decorated. Because we had a two bedroom and the attached lock-out, we had two balconies. The corner balcony had a table with four chairs. Ours had two chairs. We looked out over the Copa Loca pool area. This area had two pools, a child's play area with shootable water cannons and fountain sprinklers, a baby pool and two 18 person hot-tubs. There are 3 additional pools in the resort but we really didn't venture too much. We went to the main pool one day for a few hours as some of the kids wanted to get hair-wraps and air-brushed tattoos. We loved being at the Copa Loca pool area. First of all, their are pleny of lounge chairs for everyone. It wasn't a problem finding a few together anytime of the day. There also is a poolside bar and restaurant at this pool (which we fully took advantage of.) I thought the food and drinks would have been expensive and was very happily surprised to find out this wasn't the case. A large hotdog and fries was $4.75 and a chicken finger platter with 3 large breast meat chicken tenders and fries was $5.50. We actually could share the chicken tender meal among a couple of kids. This is like McDonalds prices. Sodas were $2.00 and included one free refill. The "drinks" were all made with top-shelf liquor and were 12 oz each. The first frozen drink is $8.00 and includes a souvineer glass, each refill during your stay is $6.00. Double drinks were $2.00 more. Beers were $4.00. They also offer kids virgin drinks, chocolate monkey, strawberry surprise and virgin daquiris for $5.00 but if you ask they will put the kids drink into two smaller cups, which we found to be just fine for the smaller ones. We went to the local walmart (not far) and got two rafts and two blow-up toys for the kids. They were a big hit and I have to admit, I loved floating some of the afternoon away on occassion. (buy ahead and pack or go when you get there) Our weather was in 85-92 degree range all week. Just wonderful! We got some groceries and beer at the Publix which is right down the street. Warning, don't buy too much. We bought extra loaves of bread and kept them in the freezer so that they were fresh and we didn't need to make another trip. They do have a store called the Marketplace onsite and the prices again aren't too high, but not as good as the grocery store. It is like a little Walmart, with groceries, sunglasses, towels, cigarettes, wine and just about anything you might need. I believe they also serve breakfast sandwiches, have crispy Kreme donuts and brew Starbucks coffee. Sunglasses were $12.00 - about the same as you'd pay at Walmart. We spent the mornings at the pool and went to Universal/Islands of Adventure in the afternoons or just went exploring the Orlando area. My kids did this thing called the SlingShot on INternation Blvd. They loved it. It is kind of like a reverse bungee jump. It pulls you below ground and slings you 385 ft at 100 miles per hour. You can get a DVD of you riding it. Two people go together. They had a ball and we got the DVD. I would reccommend it for the adventurous! It normally cost $25 per person, the DVD is $20. They have a special that includes two riders, two (nice) Tshirts and the DVD for $75.00. A great time! Evenings at Grande Vista always have activities. There was a solo guitar guy, a steel drum band and Karoke at our pool during our stay. These events are from 6-9pm or 7-9pm so that if your not into that sort of thing the noise is over by bedtime. There were also events at other pools on different nights. Pool area is open till 11:00 each night. I went for a dip in the hottub at 10:30 one night. So relaxing! The staff was very nice and professional. The grounds were well beautiful and clean. A few other things to mention. Towels: They provide shower and pool towels. If you want a fresh set delivered, just call housekeeping. Dishwasher detergent is provided. The pizza hut delivery was very good. Medium pizza are $12.99 each. What a bargain! Everyone loved the wireless internet provided (if you have a laptop). The beds were soooo comfortable! I think I said enough! Can you tell I had a good time? Hope so! Hope you have a Great Vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Just Got Back! Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Sandra1859
Reviews.Content: Thank you to all the Trip Advisor members for great input and suggesstions. It PAID OFF BIG TIME!.. I am a Marriott Timeshare owner that exchanged a week from Vegas to Orlando and stayed 7 days at the Orlando Grande Vista property. I read tons of reviews and got a real mixed bag of comments. The biggest & best tip was to RESEARCH the property for the best building/units and make a request w/notification that I was tripadvisor member and would be doing a revew. Now on to the good stuff! I asked for building #86 the Ibiza building with a high floor and goodview. We were assigned the #86 Ibiza building room# 6526 with a view of the property and the 7 hole of the Faldo Golf Institute there on the property. The sunrise and sunsets were stunning! Our room accomodations were a "10" and the customer service was A++! Everyone working at the resort was extremely friendly and volunteered great information on how to make our trip even better than expected. From playing volleyball on site in the evenings, to fishing in the A.M. at the properties man-made lake that was a catch and release; to the steam room and sauna health club.. There was something for everyone and any age. There was three pool areas and all were in immaculate shape including our room and appliances. Construction operations is still ongoing but was not an issue in our building. Best of luck to you!! I would LOVE to return to this resort time and time again~

Reviews.Title: “An excellent family getaway!!”
Reviews.Author: sjoyr
Reviews.Content: Just got back from another great week at the Grande Vista! This is our second stay here since purchasing our Marriott timeshare in 2004. This is a beautiful resort. It has everything our kids enjoy (ages - 13, 12,10) The kids played basketball(daily!) and made lots of friends, swam in the pools, sunbathed, played beach volleyball, rode the quad bikes, played ping pong and pool, and did some fishing and gecko hunting., As for us, (mom and dad) we enjoyed the relaxing time spent at the pools and the occational tropical drink from the lighthouse bar. The kids made daily trips to the lighthouse bar for smoothies as well. We dined at Nick's Grill - had excellent meals and the Copa Loca is great for sandwiches as well! We have not had a chance to golf here yet, but the course is beautiful! Maybe next year! This resort is close to every attraction! Ten to fifteen minutes to Univeral Studios and Disney World. Sea World is almost within walking distance. We really enjoyed the villa because we were able to eat breakfast in and prepare sandwiches to take by the pool. This is a great way to save a little $ and still be able to eat dinner out. The staff here are VERY friendly and helpful! We were locked out of our studio part of our villa and the staff was there within 3 minutes to let us back in! We were contacted shortly after registration to go to the timeshare presentation. Since we are already owners we welcomed the opportunity to discuss where we can benefit even more from our Marriott properties. We also own at the Surf Club in Aruba. We were very appreciative of the help and there was NO pressure to purchase anything! If you are looking for a great place to take your kids, this is it! If you are looking for a quiet place, perhaps you should look elsewhere - or at least not here during springbreak.

Reviews.Title: “We love Marriott's Grande Vista!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Grande Vista 6 times since 2003. We love it! They have most of the villas updated with beautiful granite countertops in the kitchen and beatiful carpeting, furniture and window coverings. Even the sofa bed is comfortable! We have also stayed at Marriott's Horizons and Cypress Harbour in Orlando. They are all beautiful, well run and lots of fun. I think Horizons is more for families with young children, but it is still a nice place to stay. We have also stayed at Parkway International, Wyndham Palms, and Liki Tiki in the Orlando area. They don't even come close to the Marriott properties. Other Marriott Vacation Club properties that we have stayed at are on Hilton Head, Palm Beach Shores, and the Island of Kauai in Hawaii. Our grandchildren love Grande Vista for all the fun things they have for kids to do. They love the Play Place (as they call it, an indoor jungle gym), all the activities for families, the big white sand beach, the fun kid's pool with all the things that squirt water, the paddle boats and bike rides and I understand they have a new outdoor play area which the kids are anxious to try. They'll soon get their chance as we are going back the first of June! We are counting the hours! We have never found any fault with Grande Vista. The staff is always bending over backward to help any way they can.

Reviews.Title: “The Only Place We Want To Stay!”
Reviews.Author: jkwedding4
Reviews.Content: Granted, this review is a bit late, but it's written with reservations for our third stay at Grand Vista already made! My husband and I first stayed here in May of 2004 and fell in love with this place at first sight. When it came time to plan our honeymoon, it was a no-brainer.. we wanted to come back to Orlando and stay here again, which we did in May of 2005. Now, we are anxiously awaiting May 2006 so that we can stay again! Granted, as much as we LOVE Grand Vista, we were originally going to exchange into Wyndham Palms Resort. However, due to falsehoods told to us about the resort's accomodations (or lack thereof!!) we immediately knew we'd be back here! We highly recommend setting some time aside for a massage. It was reassuring to have the same masseuse two years in a row, as it shows they value their employees and they want to stay. Can't wait to see if I'll receive the same wonderful massage this year! Location is PERFECT. Close enough to everything, SeaWorld practically walkable, and far enough from everything to have that peacefulness that is craved on a vacation. Really can't say a bad thing about the place, as the staff and service are top notch. Even if you need to call housekeeping or maintenance for anything (as we did with a toilet issue) there were there within minutes. And I literally mean minutes. No more than 5! As long as Grand Vista exists, my husband and I will vacation here. Sure hope you enjoy your trips as well!! Kerry Ward Cromwell, CT

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Marriott Grande Vista was the perfect resort for my family. Located only about 10 to 15 minutes form the Walt Disney World theme parks, we enjoyed our stay. We stayed in the suites, and we enjoyed every part of it. You get the wonderful accomadations of a regular hotel room, and then you also get a full-size fully-equipped kitchen, dining area, two porches, living room, master bedroom and bathroom equipped with a jacuzzi. Because of the full-size kitchen, we cooked almost every night and went out to dinner only a few times. The pool area was wonderful. There were many pools, and each of them was gorgeous. We chose to hang out by the pool some days instead of going to the parks, because it was just as pleasurable. Everyday after we came back from a long day in Disney, we went to the pool every night until it closed. The kids loved staying up until 11:00 PM swimming! Our group consisted of a widely varied age group, from toddlers all the way up to senior citizens. The adults enjoyed the frinks at the lighthouse/bar. The paddle boats were a fun thing for the whole family to do, and we enjoyed the beautiful scenery we over looked. My husband, my brother, and my brother-in-law went to the Gym/Fitness center every morning and when they came back on the first night they replied, "it was excellent." My parents loved watching the kids "take a dip" in the pool as well as going to the Disney Parks with us. We never arose in the morning with cramps, sharp pains, or back issues because the beds were extremely comfortable and fitting. We enjoyed watching TV in bed before bed. GReat stay.

Reviews.Title: “It was great!”
Reviews.Author: amidgette
Reviews.Content: My family and I (including grandchildren, sister, brother-in-law, their children and grandchildren) visted in December (23-30) 2005. We had three two-bedroom units and one one-bedroom unit. We were thoroughly pleased with the accommodations, staff, and location. We were in Florida to visit Disney World, so of course, every night we all were exhausted from trying to do everything we could at the parks during the day. We all slept well, and there was plenty of room for everyone. The rooms were nice, its not a fancy, fancy room, but had everything we needed. We did not get to enjoy the pools or much of the onsite accommodations, (except the Pizza Hut and the convenience store), but you could very easily spend your vacation on site with plenty to do. Everyone on staff was pleasant, and we had no problems at all with regard to that. I had read about check-in problems, but we also had no problems with that either. They were very busy, but that was to be expected and they accommodated us very well, as we all arrived at different times. I would recommend this resort to anyone, just don't go to Disney World at Christmas time! It was crazy and crowded. But we still had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Grande Vista is Grand”
Reviews.Author: DTHBNY
Reviews.Content: Well, it had to happen. One of my so called "friends" put me on a timeshare presentation list, and I received a postcard from Marriott, inviting me to their timeshare presentation of the Marriott Grande Vista in Orlando; in exchange, I would get a great rate for a four night stay, plus $100 in "Marriott Money," whatever that is. I was able to get a great airfare on Allegiant Airlines, so my wife and I decided to make it a quickie vacation. And so ... Simply stated, this was one of the most luxurious properties I have ever stayed at, regardless of price. The grounds are beautiful, all of the staff was polite and courteous, and the room was top grade. The multiple pools are clean and inviting, with entirely too many children, though... You could practically walk to SeaWorld, while Disney is about ten minutes away. There are literally thousands of restaurants within five minutes or so, all willing and able to take your cash... And in case you were wondering... The timeshare presentation went well, only taking about two hours of our time. You're basically buying into the world of Marriott, which isn't all that bad, but we respectfully declined. The numbers justifying the purchase came on hard and fast, but in the end the wife & I decided not to purchase. No big deal, with no hard sales pitch, and we were soon on our way to enjoy Orlando. All in all, we had a great trip, and would love staying at the Marriott Grande Vista again.

Reviews.Title: “Room works if you don't get stuck in an efficiency during your stay.”
Reviews.Author: TheTravelFactor
Reviews.Content: I like this resort/timeshare. Push to get a newer room and the upgrade from an efficiency. The rooms are renovated every few years, so make sure to think through the "new" buildings that you want when you make reservations or appear at the fronk desk.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful grounds- room was-Eh, not so beautiful”
Reviews.Author: paws101
Reviews.Content: A friend let us use her timeshare at this resort, unfortunately on the day we went we could only get a studio (she has a 2 bedroom/2 bath unit) although we booked 5 months in advance... The grounds are great - really top notch, gorgeous pools and golf course, front desk very attentive... we were feeling pretty good as we drove into the resort and checked in. Our mood changed a little once we got a look at our room. I had researched this hotel and knew from others on Trip Advisor to request a refurbished room, which I did. The room's decor looks like it had been refurbished but in the core areas, such as the bathroom, it did not look like it was gutted and refurbished. The tub leaked when you take a shower the bath mat on the floor got saturated- not for lack of my closing the curtain - there was a leak in the tile grout which poured water out when you showered- I notified them of this condition after our first use- someone came in (while we were out) and looked like they caulked around the tub but this did not fix the problem. The bathroom floor showed the many months/years of leakage as there were water stains in the corners and up the wall. It was not as clean as I expect a 4-5 star resort to be - As evidenced by the bathroom door which had a dozen or so hairs from previous guests sort of "glued on" with various layers of hairspray-funk. The room did not smell fresh and clean. We asked for towels every day(you have to call and ask) and were promptly acommodated. I guess the worst part of staying in the studio unit is the fact that the room ajoins a larger unit and is only blocked by a double door. So let me see, in our week there I heard the 5:00am wake up call and the subsequent arguement by the couple staying there as they got ready to go to the airport, then after they left a family w/ some really boisterous kids who liked to watch a lot of tv - LOUD. What can I say, we really only used the hotel to sleep and we had a bit of a time trying to do even that. I'm sure for those that are able to get a large 2 bedroom unit that has been totally refurbished the experience would most likely be more positive. I, however, won't be visiting again.

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our vacation at Grande Vista. The Grande Vista from the outside is absolutely beautiful. The check in was smooth and fast, everyone was courteous. But i was not impressed with the room at all, it had a really bad smell, like it had been a smoking room a long time ago. Not pleasant. The air conditioning didnt seem to really work. we left it on the whole week we were there and it never cooled down in the room. The rooms were not clean by my standard, i noticed this easily on the tiled and linoleum floor. The bed was very worn out and soft and so were the pillows. We had an adjoining room (they all are)and the people who rented the other unit were very noisy. As another reviewer mentioned owners get the refurbished rooms. Not so. We were listed as owner and got a very tired old room. The pools and grounds looked magnificient and its located way off international drive so its very private. I dont know about the pool but the hot tub wasnt very warm and had alot of dirt on the bottom. We had breakfast at Nicks where there was a family of four adults eating with their four kids, the kids were screaming and running around the restaurant, into the bar and the kitchen. The manager was very upset but didnt have the guts to tell this family (who looked like they had alot of money)to keep their kids corraled. We didnt go back.

Reviews.Title: “Grande Vista Great for Golfers!!!”
Reviews.Author: Mayhem
Reviews.Content: We are very satisfied Marriott timeshare owners at Ocean Pointe in Palm Beach Shores, FL and have been staying at the Grande Vista Resort in Orlando annually for quite a few years for the PGA Golf Show every January. The convenient proximity to the convention center, fine apartment style timeshare units and beautiful pools have been well documented here at Trip Advisor. I have not seen much commentary about the golf ammenities which are first rate. One of the nicest practice facilities anywhere is on the resort grounds. There is a huge driving range and numerous practice putting greens though some of them are reserved for instruction only. Individual and group lessons are available through the onsite Nick Faldo golf academy. A very fun and well maintained 9 hole "short course" meanders around the living units--although the final hole is over 400 yards so it is not that short--there are no par fives. Finally, the Grand Pines Golf Club is located right across the street on International Drive. Marriott purchased the existing International Golf Club and closed it for a year as architect Steve Smyers and his team turned it into a real gem. The greens fees are a bit pricey but you can get two free greens fees by attending the Marriott timeshare sales presentation--way more valuable than $100 Marriott dollars or even 15,000 MRewards points--if you are a golfer! FYI: The timeshare presentations are very informative and low pressure per Marriott's professional standards.

Reviews.Title: “Best Marriott property ,so far, for us!”
Reviews.Author: sandrita
Reviews.Content: We went Jan. 8-15 for Home Builders Show and Disney. Of course, I read all the posted reviews first, for all the Marriott properties. We own at the Grande Ocean on Hilton Head Island and so we were looking for a similar resort to trade into. This seemed the most up to date and in a great location for us, with the Convention Center just down the road on one end, and Disney on the other end. Entering the driveway, which is long , we were very impressed with the grounds, gated entry and buildings....so spread out and yet, walkable. This resort has many amenities...golf, pools, kids' activites, food store, 2 restaurants...beautiful well maintained grounds...what more could you want? We called a couple months in advance and requested an upper floor unit in a new building by the new pool. Then, to back that up, I faxed a copy of our confirmation with a 2nd WRITTEN request the week prior to our arrival. Upon arrival, the lady at the desk acknowledged they received both the phone call and my fax. She said she could put me in bldg. #84...a new building by the new pool...but not on an upper floor...she only had a 2nd floor unit....(somewhat annoying since I thought I had done my homework and we are Marriott owners)...but I agreed to it because she assured me it had nice water views and it was new, after all...so that sounded good and off we drove to the Alicante building..an L-shaped building with one side facing the lake...the other side facing the pool...ours was an end unit on the 2nd floor...Upon entering, we were very happy with the villa itself...all new carpet, furnishings...in a Mediterranean theme with granite counters in kitchen and baths...spacious... and then I walked to the window and balconies...the view was not what the lady at the front desk had told me...glimpse of the lake if you went out on balcony and leaned to the left....and a partial view of the pool...most of our view was of the Coco Loco restaurant which was a few feet in front of us...well...all our luggage had been brought up by now...and after a 9 plus hr. drive, we were wiped out and I did not feel like driving back to the front desk at this point over the "view"...the villa was great...and I figured we would be at the theme parks most of the time anyway. But I have to say I was a bit disappointed that we could not have a good view to see the lovely resort features . Future advice: when faxing your request, tell them you are a Trip Advisor member and will be posting a review of your service and experience ....if you are Marriott owners...tell them this too....they are supposed to grant requests to owners if you give them notice. After unpacking, we went to the pool, and then ate dinner at the open air Coco Loco restaurant...very close, as I said, and it was great... big Plasma tv on wall behind the bar, which had nice tall bar chairs and granite counter...enjoyed this area very much...service was good and friendly...we were glad we made this trade in spite of our "view"...looking around I would give this time share 5 stars on appearance....our villa too...I only saw the UN- renovated units in the older section from a window view...but they looked fine to me...just a bit dated...soft greens and coral colors with light wood furniture...certainly ALL the grounds and pools were in exceptionsl shape......with 22 buildings on the property, it will take some time to refurbish all the units...the refurbished ones do not have granite counters like the new ones...there was one building separating us from the new construction, but we did not hear any noise at all during our stay....only noise I heard were delivery trucks pulling up to the Coco Loco next to us. We crossed a walking bridge over the lake to go to the main lobby, MarketPlace grocery store (a convenience store that also serves hot coffee and pastries), the on site Pizza Hut/ Edy's ice cream (across the courtyard from the store), indoor childrens Play Maze, video game room and fitness room...all a 3 or 4 mintue walk from our building....a daily newspaper was delivered to our door daily (USA Today), which was nice (except on weekends) The villa was not quite as big in the living/dining area as the Grande Ocean, but I was very impressed with the guest lock-out suite, which was even larger than the master suite...it had a little kitchenette and a private separate entrance, bath and nice sitting area with queen sleeper sofa, table and chairs and private balcony. The living room also had a queen sleeper sofa and housed drawers in the armoire where the tv was in there...the master had a large circular balcony....ours was not screened...some were....a large jacuzzi tub for 2 with a granite counter/vanity area and wall mounted hair dryer across from the tub area...private bath with 2 doors...one to the entry hall...double sinks and shower...very spacious...the beds were very comfy foam...both king sized...kitchen was great too...nice granite counter with 3 bar chairs...washer/dryer in a closet...they provide you with little bottles of dish soap and powder for dishwasher, sponge, paper towels and coffee samples and enough Tide for one wash load. If you exit the resort and turn left...go a mile...there is a nice Publix and Walgreens in a strip mall...Subway and Chinese takeout here as well...Disney parks are just a few miles further past the Marriott World Center...if you turn right exiting the resort, Sea World is only a stop light away, and the Convention Center and Peabody Hotel a bit further. (that's the hotel where the ducks walk through the lobby each day). Best overall ride at Disney right now: "Soarin" over Califoria...located in Epcot in The land...kids will love it too....you really feel like you are flying like an eagle..over the state. Most fun restaurant: Rain Forest Cafe in Animal Kingdom best production show: Lion King in Animal Kingdom tip: when going to Magic Kingdom with small kids, go to Fantasy Land FIRST...it fills up by 11:30....and lines can be long....from 9-10 is the best time. Try to leave Magic Kingdom before park closes...it is a hassle to get on Monorail or boats to parking lot late at night...unless you are very patient... We plan to stay at the Grande Vista next year again, when we go to the Builders Show, if possible...my 2nd choice would be Cypress Harbour, as it is in same general area and has similar amenities...got very good reviews...but get a refurbished unit ...those villas are even larger in the main living areas, but does not have the lockout feature. We caught a glimpse of Marriott Horizons when going down I-4...it is very close to the freeway and in a congested area...I would not want to stay there.....International Drive is a much more tranquil area... All in all, we were very happy with this trip.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely Stay again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our family returned from a Saturday-Saturday stay at the Marriott's Grande Vista in Mid-November. I had read the TripAdvisor reviews religiously and wanted to add our experience as well. After spending most of the day at Epcot we arrived at the Grand Vista at around 4:30 on Saturday. No lines, no waiting at check-in. Gentlemen that checked us in was VERY nice. I told him I had called a few days before with requests (although I somehow don't think those request were ever recorded). He gave me 2 options. A 2 bedroom that is close to the Original pool and 'village' area (Magellan building), this would be an 'older' unit that had been refurbished within the last 2 years. OR a new unit in a building (Ibiza) that would be about a 3 minute walk to the 'new' pool that has a better kids play area, Ibiza also supposedly has flat screen TV's and graninte counter tops etc. I let the family decide and they wanted to be closer to the village area so we ended up on the 2nd floor of the Magellan building. This was an 'older' unit but we found it to be nice and perfectly adequate for our family of 6. (After the fact..I do think either would have been perfectly acceptable to us.) It had the 'lockout' suite as one bedroom. So we had a kitchen area, dining area and living area in one room. The Master bedroom with a large jacuzzi tub and separate sink area. Master bath had glass shower and sink. (Hairdryers in both bathrooms worked great.) The 'kids' bedroom (lockout) also had a mini kitchenette area with fridge, cabinets, sink. A regular bathroom. An open balcony area of this room. There was also a little screen porch area off the master bedroom and also access to this through the living room. Washer & Dryer in the kitchen area in a closet. (Used this a lot...so nice to have this!) There was some minor wear and tear...some dings on the fridge and some rusting type spots on the inside of the microwave. Two pillows on the couch had some minor fringing. There was a dent in the drawer at the bottom of the stove. The TV's reception in the living room and the kids bedroom wasn't as good as could be. We never ended up calling them on it though as we just didn't spend that much time there and I forgot all about it. We found the beds to be very comfortable. And throughout our stay we did NOT hear one single noise from above us or next to us. We took them up on their time share offer of $100 (we took them in Disney Dollars) to take the tour one morning. We found it to be pretty low pressure. It does seem like a pretty good deal for our family. For about what we pay to stay in a 'dumpy' little cabin up in Maine we could stay in locations that are much nicer and have all the amenities we want. We did not buy..but we may sometime down the line. We felt the sales rep got a teensy bit abrupt with us at the end because we didn't sign. But he wished us well and we had no problem getting the Disney dollars. We did stay for the 90 minutes..it seemed to go by quickly. (BTW..they were offering us a resale at Cypress Gardens for $13,900 with like 12.9% financing. I picked up a flyer at the Publix Grocery store a few days later with resales in the same are for 8-$11K...don't know what the difference is.) I definitely think we would lean towards Marriott if we did purchase a time share. As we are probably not the Disney-every-year types..if we were than I definitely would look into the DVC program. The pools were very nice. We did find ourselves walking over the bridge to the 'new' pool with the water cannons though. It seemed warmer than the pool we were closest to. It wasn't a bad walk though...2 or 3 minutes. There is a bar area and hot tubs/spas near both pools. At the old pool area there is also a lap pool with handicap access...a few large 'spa/hot tubs' and a sauna. After we arrived the kids wanted to spend the next day just at the resort (and this was our first time down to Disney with them...LOL.). There is also a children's indoor playground area. Climbing structure type thing like what is in a Chuck E Cheese. We were there about 9pm, only a few other kids and my kids had a blast in it. Also is a sandy beach area with volleyball nets. Basketball area/tennis area. Golf of course. They offer some daily activities..some for a fee..some not. We did not partake in these as our week was full with Disney stuff. There is a little Pizza Hut onsite as well as a small store. Oh and arcade area and pool tables. We did not eat at their restaurant onsite..Nick's. We would definitely stay there again. We used a family member's timeshare week through Interval International. We only wish we had had more time to just lounge about the resort. Oh...I found it was about 10-15 minutes to get to most Disney parks. Not bad at all. Another nice plus is that they have free wireless internet access. I took my laptop and was able to download my pics and than share 'trip reports' with my family back home. Hubby was able to check in with work. I know a lot of people were looking for names of buildings to request. I took home a map and there are 22 buildings. I won't list them all..but the buildings that are near the pools: Near the Older or 'Village/Actitivities Center and on either side of the Village Pools: #80: Plaza De La Vida (which also houses the front desk area) #81: Marbella #94: Magellan which only has the parking lot and the road way seperating it from the pool/village area. (We stayed in this and were very happy with location.) The next two are on either side of the 'new' pool that have the water cannons and the gradual entry with water sprinkler type things for the kids. Pool water seemed warmer here. #79: Madrid #84: Alicante #85: Christobal is on the other side of Alicante and is not a bad walk to the new pool area too. There are some other more 'quiet' pool areas. I did not see these pools so I don't know what the pools are like. Our week was pretty quiet...plenty of chairs and not too hectic around the pools at all. Now if I can figure out pictures..I will post them. Enjoy your upcoming trip!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Resort!”
Reviews.Author: GracieC00
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Marriott Grande Vista from December 4th through the 10th. We shared the three bedroom unit with two other couples and had a fabulous time. The room was beautifully decorated and very spacious. The grounds were visually stunning as were the pools. The resort was decorated for Christmas so everything was festive and bright. Upon arriving the staff was extremely pleasant and accomodating. We requested a new unit and were extremely pleased when we walked into the room as it had granite countertops and comfortable, clean furniture. Coming from someone who is extememly critical of hotel rooms, this unit was great! Also, the location of the resort was close enough to all of the attractions, but it was far enough away to avoid the traffic and bustle of many of the heavily populated areas. I would definitely reccomend this resort, and I will try to stay here the next time we visit Walt Disney World!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Grande Vista”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grande Vista from Dec 1-6 in a 2 bed 2 bath villa. We were happy when we got placed in the new building the Ibizia (86) and even HAPPIER with the room we got. It was one of the niceist rooms we have ever stayed in. Everything was new and beautiful in the room. Granite counters everywhere including the bathrooms, a two person jacuzzi hot tub with seats built in and 3 flat tube screen tvs. My 3 year old loved having his own room and bathroom and asked if we could live there! The building was in a quieter location and we had two balconies one of them was screened and looked over part of the golf course and woods. We had breakfast out on the porch every morning. There are two massive pools that my son and husband loved, and we enjoyed lunch at one of the pools restaurants. We also ate at the hotel restaurant and though it's pricey, the food is great! the grounds were beautiful and hidden from the major roads by the woods. We found the staff very friendly and couteous and had no problems. Santa even came to visit the kids at the pool a few times. We did sit in on the timeshare presentation that does run longer than 2 hours, but it is very low pressure and we got $200 off our hotel bill even though we didn't buy. It was also nice having a washer dryer in the room so we could come back home with all clean clothes! We definately will be back, we like the fact this is away from Disney property so you can get a break from the Disney park! Which my husband and I liked! We love Disney, but after a few days it does get tiring!

Reviews.Title: “Decent place to stay with children”
Reviews.Author: Slamar
Reviews.Content: My 2 children (son,11 and daughter, 3) visited Disneyworld over Columbus Day weekend in October, 2005. We stayed at the Marriott VCGV for a special rate, as I attended a 3+ hour sales pitch on purchasing into the timeshare resort. I must say, the pitch was good and the benefits were presented very well. They presented various options in a non-threatening and acceptable level of sales pressure. When I didn't purchase, they were still very nice and hospitable. In terms of the property itself, it was nice. Gated with a welcome check-in lobby. We stayed in an efficiency which meant one king bed and a pull out sofa, a microwave, small refrigerator and one bath and small patio. Our location was right by the pool on the 1st floor. Good location but the room smelled musty - due primarily to the humidity. I checked another 1st floor room and smelled the same. They brought in a large air cleaning machine that helped but, humidity in carpet etc. is hard to deal with. The pool area was very nice with a sprinkler fountain and pool for smaller children. We did not eat at any of the restaurants on site as the location was excellent - about 15 minutes, at most from anything. Good time and great getaway! Would recommend, particularly if you are looking for a timeshare feature.

Reviews.Title: “It's not Disney Vacation Club”
Reviews.Author: o2bmmw
Reviews.Content: I would like to note at the outset we recently purchased at the Disney Vacation Club Boardwalk resort, but had previously agreed to a timeshare presentation package through Marriott. After we purchased DVC we tried to tell Marriott we were not interested but they insisted on charging us $200 to cancel. So we went for the package and the presentation. The sales person at the presentation was horrible, rude, and belittled me out of the presence of my husband, but that is a review I will post on the TUG web site. Needless to say we are happy with our DVC purchase and would not consider a purchase here. That said, we would definately stay here again if the price is right. On the presentation package you get maid service daily, plus USA Today McPaper delivered to your door. The 1 bedroom unit was spacious, was recently renovated, had new furniture, a sofa bed that was actually pretty comfortable, a comfy bed, washer/dryer and, because it was on the 1st floor, a screened in porch. The washer/dryer worked well but was the small, apartment sized version. Certainly not big enough to do wash for 8 people (which I would have had if we had the lockout next door). It was also reasonably clean. The grounds are massive with 2 massive but nice pool areas. The pool areas are very Marriott, and remind me of the pool at the Marriott San Juan where we stayed 2 years ago. My kids were not happy that there was no water slide. There was lots of family activities day and night, but my kids were not interested in going to them at all. The kids really did not like the resort because I think they were expecting that "Disney Magic" but there isn't any here. The grounds are immense but sterile. The buildings all look the same. Landscaping is ok but nothing out of the ordinary. The bathrooms in the unit, though nice, are very bland like "Courtyard by Marriott" decor. Services at the hotel are limited. There are bell services but you have to "find" someone to help you. We prefer to stay in a resort with some hotel services (bell services, room service etc) like Disney offers. The apartment type lifestyle here is just not for us. Bugs are a problem here. When we first looked into our unit we were greeted by a dead roach just inside the door. One night, I woke my husband up to kill a bug the size of a field mouse in the bathroom(he called it a palmetto bug, I called it a huge roach). Also, though renovated, the unit was not in terrific condition. Dishes were not very clean. The stove was rusted on the bottom and the microwave was rusted as well. The countertop is formica and was peeling. If you go on the tour they show you a spiffy unit with granite countertops and nice cabinets. People wanting to stay here should know that is not necessarily what you will get in your room. It is only about 10-15 minutes to Epcot or MGM, a little further to Disney Magic Kingdom if you take I-drive. Traffic to Disney and back was never a problem. We spent all our time at the Disney parks because the kids did not want to use the facilities here. Again, I would stress I think Marriott provides a good product and this is a nice resort. I would stay here again if the price was right. I just would not buy a timeshare here.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: LoveVacations
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott Grande Vista for a couple of nights at the end of our Disney land/sea vacation. What a wonderful end to a vacation! We didn't want to leave. Seven of us (4 adults, 3 children) shared a two bedroom ground level unit in building 81 which is by the main pool and a short walk over the bridge to the other pool which is heated. Our only complaint was that the A/C unit had a musty/moldy smell which we notified the front desk about. It wasn't extremely hot, so we didn't mind turning off the air and opening the doors that led to the screened in porches.

Reviews.Title: “Great family hotel..”
Reviews.Author: Liza23
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed in a 2-bedroom suite 10/17 - 10/21. My father traveled with my husband and our 2 year old son. The suite was clean and service was excellent. We had daily maid service that was wonderful. I forgot my purse in the room and wedding ring one day...oops... but nothing was missing. The resort was very quiet in the evenings and we would eat dinner on the balconly looking onto the lake. The rooms were very big and clean. I would certainly return again... Oh, for the best rate go directly to marriott's website you can usually get a 2 bedroom suite for under $200 per night...good luck and happy travels everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: LindseyCulley
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a week, 8-15 October 2005, having booked the accommodation through Interval International Timeshare (we own in Tenerife). We were extremely impressed with the complex and the accommodation. The location is excellent at the bottom of International Drive, around a mile from Sea World. The view from our room was spectacular, and is now my screen saver on my computer! A little disappointed not to have the room cleaned at all during the week, European timeshares are cleaned daily, and we were not offered an option for cleaning at check-in even for an additional fee, so I am not sure if this would have been available? I would definitely recommend this resort to anyone and WILL be returning at some point in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Good Quality Resort - Excellent facilities”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week in July for the second time. Previously stayed in 2003 and was pleased to see that the standards had been maintained. Stayed with my husband and children 10 and 6. Location excellent for theme parks, shops, other activities and interstates. We were located in a refurbished room near to the Village Centre which was an excellent location. You do need to keep on at the front desk staff for a good location, despite requesting a location near the main pools we were located in one of the blocks on the far side of the golf course initially. I said that I was not happy with this and got a room were I wanted immediately and this was 10pm Saturday night. The facilities here are excellent. There is so much to do you need to stay in for a few days just to fit everything in. Kids really enjoyed the Kids activities, particularly Dive In Movie and the Play Area. Used the on site restaurants. Although not huge choices and you can get chepaer outside the quality and service were good and the convenience is superb after a long day. Facilities in the Villa excellent as with other Marriott resorts. Although as an owner at a European MVCI resort I do miss the daily inclusive maid service. Have visited 7 MVCI resorts and after the Marbella resort would say I liked this second best.

Reviews.Title: “second time not a charm!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed a short 2 days at the tail end of an awesome 7 day stay at Disney's Vero Beach Resort. This was our second stay at the Grande Vista. We came to the realization on this trip that this resort just isn't for us. The Disney Resorts are just so superior. We are Disney Vacation Club members and we usually stay at Disney Resorts Sunday to Thursday using the cheap points for midweek stays. We then spend the weekends at a cheap cash resort. That is right, Grande Vista is cheap to stay on cash and you get the daily maid service. WHY WOULD ANYONE BUY INTO THIS RESORT? The first time here we paid $169 for a 2 bedroom and this time we paid $229 for a 2 bedroom. Do you know how long the break even point would be to cover the buy in and the annual dues at this place? Trading power here is minimal as well because there are so many places to stay in Orlando. If considering Marriott Vacation Club ( which is a good program by the way) look at Aruba or Hawaii. This gives you the ultimate trading power as well as a good home resort. Marriott is practically giving the rooms away and I can get a reservation here anytime even last minute. Try getting a Disney 2 bedroom for less than $500 ANY SEASON. Try getting a reservation to begin with. Marriott just misses the little things that add sooooooo much to your vacation experience. First, where is the waterslide? Well there isn't one. The pools are very boring and not that imaginative. They do have a splash area for kids but these don't appear to be big hits with the kids. Adults and kids alike would get so much enjoyment from the slides. We love the slides at the Disney Resorts and my son gets hours of enjoyment out of them. Second, Marriott does not heat the pools. The splash area pool on the side with the restaurant is FREEZING. THe upper section here was better but still cold. The pool on the other side was freezing as well. How can the pools be freezing when it is 90+ degrees every day? Disney heats there pools and they are always a comfortable 84 degrees, even in January. You just can't put a price tag on comfortable swimming water. Marriott seems to have few people swimming because the water is so cold. I'd hate to feel them in January. What good is a pool if the guests aren't enjoying them. Marriott seems to be into appearances. Things look nice but it doesn't add up to an enjoyabel stay. Grande Vista isn't the only Marriott we've found to be this way. Virginia Beach the water was freezing as welll as the Marriott Ocean Club in Aruba. HEAT THE POOL PLEASE. Last but not least the service at the Dsiney Resorts blows away the Marriott. I will say service has improved at the Grande Vista since our last visit in May 2005. The Pizza Hut guys and the store employees are still terrible. They are slow, dumb and not friendly. Many staff members were friendly this stay including the activities people and the bartenders. Another bummer here is the shear size of this resort. Marriott seems to keep building. They seem more interested in the almighty buck than maintaining a manageable resort. We had to drive to the pools each day we were so far out. This was after requesting main building. Who wants to drive on vacation, especially within there own resort? The room was dated and very worn as well. Total opposite of the newly refurbished room we had here last time. This resort is gorgeous and has so much potential. It just doesn't have that magic we seek on vacation. No room service, no waterslide, no heated pools all equal not returning for us. We wil "spend" the high points and stick with our wonderful Disney Resorts from now on. If anything this just showed us once again how good we have it with DVC. Look for my earlier review of MGV on this site. Second time was not a charm for us. You won't get me a third time. Email with any questons.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this place and crave our return”
Reviews.Author: AlbertInvasion
Reviews.Content: Three generations of us stayed here for the first time during the last two weeks of September. We shared a 3 bedroom apartment and we could not have wished for anything more. OK - so things were not perfect on the day we arrived. It took three goes before we got a room located where we were happy (but we were very fussy) and then the room had some things in need of attention. HOWEVER the quality of service was quite literally perfect. 100%. Every single imperfection we highlighted was dealt with immediately. We were thanked for bringing the issues to their attention and we were made to feel like royalty. This place is a respectable family resort. People are generally considerate of others and the facilities are there to make for a highly memorable stay. The apartments are huge and very well appointed - offering excellent value for money. We have been to the Orlando area several times before - and the Grande Vista is the place that, now discovered, we will return to again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 including 2 children ages 2 and 4 stayed in a 2 bedroom villa from Spetember 4-11 and I will say that we were extremely satisfied. We transferred our home week in Aruba and we liked it so much we plan on alternating years between the two now. We spent the second leg at the Vistana Villages and although it was a nice property, could not help being dissapointed by it. The Marriott just pays much more attention to detail, quality and the little things which make the difference in the end. As an example, while neither offer maid service (you may have it for an additional fee), you may request as much linen or towels as you need at the Marriott, and it was at our room in 10 minutes. When I requested towels at the Sheraton I was told there would be a FEE! The appliances, overall unit appearance, space, cleanliness (hair in tub at Vistana) and TV's were all superior at the Marriott. I also had to remove three salamanders from the Sheraton. The staff were extremely courtious and were always a phone call away. I had the misfortune of having to call for an ambulace due to a gallbladder attack, and they checked in on my wife daily to see how both she and I were doing. We did request a refurbished room and were placed in one the new buildings, so I would recommend doing the same, as the room was beautiful. As you can tell, were were very happy here and the kids had a great time as well.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious,convenient and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family of 4 (kids 8 and 6) visited Florida for a week and chose this place primarily for the extra space. The 2 BR suite was very affordable and clean and well maintained. After reading a few reviews I was nervous about the housekeeping but it was superlative. Our room was located near the elevator so even though we were on the 4th floor loading and unloading was not a hassle.We were lucky to have housekeeping done every day and there were extra towels etc. placed whenever needed. The only time I had to call them was to have the VCR adjusted but even that was resolved before the maintenance person arrived. The kids enjoyed the pools. Only thing which could have been added were extra Umbrellas for the sunny days. Overall a very satisfying and relaxing place. Will definitely return. Great value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and our two children ages 2 and 5, were accommodated at the Marriott's Grande Vista from August 21 - August 28 2005. My aunt and uncle offered us their time share for the week and we readily accepted. However after doing some research on the net and reading some bad reviews, I began to have second thoughts regarding my stay there. My second thoughts were unwarranted. I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at the hotel. My one bdroom villa was clean, big and comfortable with all the amenities one requires. The room was equipped with washer and dryer, Jacuzzi and a welcome pack to get your vacation started, which included detergent, coffee, Advil, snacks etc. Even though it was an owners used room, housekeeping came daily to tidy the room, put any dishes in the dish washer, clear garbage, change towels if required, fix bed etc. Our room was located quite a distance from the main pool, but there was a smaller pool and heated Jacuzzi nearby and the hotel offered varied activities along with a kids club. Due to my packed scheduled I never got to experience meals at the hotel other than from their Pizza Hut which was delicious. Marriottâ€™s Grande Vista exceeded my expectations and I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Orlando but not wishing to stay in Disney. Kathy B. Barbados

Reviews.Title: “Nice Property”
Reviews.Author: AmyGT
Reviews.Content: I have to give this place an average review only because our check-in was a nightmare. We arrived at 2:00 pm and were told our rooms were not ready and they didn't know when they would be. So, we went and hung out by the pool, had lunch and then waited and waited. We waited 3 hours for our room. So, at that point we were not too happy and the front desk clerks were no help and acted like they could care less that we waited for 3 hours in the blazing hot sun. The rooms were good, nice comfortable bed, big bathroom, nice full kitchen with a washer and dryer. No complaints with that. The pools were nice and the market and restaurants were good as well.

Reviews.Title: “not as grand as it seems”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
