Reviews.Content: We visited the grand vista as part of a three week vacation in july and august of 2005, after spending a week at ocean pointe in palm beach we were all happy and excited to be in orlando again and at grand vista, what a let down, the room we first went to in the Seville building was extremely dirty, it looked like it had NEVER been cleaned properly, it smelled had a leak on the kitchen floor, a mouldy shower, and hair everywhere, I was reduced to tears, we phoned down to reception who were very quick to relocate us to the very last building, the Madrid which was much nicer and much cleaner. We are Marriott owners and must admit we were very surprised at the lack of qualityat this accomodation it was just building after building and not as nice as we expected,around the pools was not very clean or nice and to be truthful we have been to much nicer marriotts even in England than this one. We will not be visiting Grand Vista again but will be visiting America again as we really love it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Resort, Not Perfect”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Marriott Grande Vista was a nice property. The service at the front desk was prompt if you were there at off times. We checked in on a Thursday, which was quiet and organized. We had a question during our stay (on Saturday) and the front desk was crazy. Obviously they'll be lots of people checking in, but the staff didn't handle it well. Their were three employees at the desk, with 15 people in line! Many people were rude and cut the line, which the employees seemed to "look the other way". We were in Building 83, and the room needed some upgrading. Plenty of space with screened in balcony, but decor was dated. The property was very nice, and the pools were great. At the main pool area, there was a lap pool, children's pool, two jacuzzis, and a sauna. The restaurant Nick's located at the golf center was very good, and pricing was reasonable. The concierge was very helpful with dining reservations and park information. They signed us up for a timeshare presentation, however they sent us to Horizons, another Marriott Vacation Club about 5 minutes away because their breakfast was full. We didn't have much of an intetion of buying, but went for the $200 DISNEY DOLLARS, if you're a renter (meaning you don't own a Marriott timeshare, be sure to get your $200 in Disney or Marriott Money), they try to give you $100!! Horizons is brand new, and much nicer than the Grande Vista. It features a high-end miniature golf course, pools with play areas, and all the amenities of home. Horizons is only 15% completed. The total number of rooms is expected to be capped at 700, much smaller than Grande Vista's 1600. We ended up buying a timeshare at Horizons. Given we live in California, we don't get to Orlando more than about once every 5 years. We prefer Hawaii and other destinations. With Marriott Vacation Club, you can trade very easily. In conclusion, Grande Vista is very nice and the pools are great. Just be prepared for OK service and dated rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort...”
Reviews.Author: minnieandmickey55555
Reviews.Content: I just got back on Sunday (August 14). Our family stayed at the MGV for one week in a two bedroom villa with two bathrooms. We have seven people (3 adults and four kids aged 5, 7, 14 and 10 months old). When we arrived on Sunday August 4, we asked for a refurbished room, on the higher levels and near the pool. They gave us building 83 on the 4th floor which was very close to two of the four pools in the resort. We were also very close to the Marketplace (variety store), pizza Hut and boat/bike rentals. The villa was definitely refurbished and very clean. There was a little welcome package in the kitchen. In the package were detergents, paper towel, candies, coupons etc... I called the front desk for a pack-and-play crib and a high chair and it took two phone calls (that was okay because I read on a previous review that it takes two phone calls and we expected it). There was also a very big play area (like the ones in McDonalds) in the Activity Centre which the kids really enjoyed (5 and 7 yrs)! There is definitely a lot to do at the resort. When you arrive at check-in, they will give you the week's schedule of activities for everyone in the family. Welcome cocktail, kids face painting, teens karaoke ect.... We had no housekeeping but that was okay because our villa had a washer/dryer and a dish washer so we did laundry everyday (with four kids, we have to): ) Overall, we had a great time at the MGV and will definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “a wonderful resort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: just got back from grande vista and had a great time. the pools were beautiful, well manicured grounds, and very pleasant staff. the marketplace downstairs was perfect and affordable. they had sandwiches, pizza hut, edy ice cream, chips, snacks sodas, beer, wine, etc. the prices were great and we were happy we didnt need to go to the grocery store the entire week. we like to have a few things for our room and they made it very convenient. the pool was open til 11 pm which was great after a long day at the parks and nice dinner out you could get back in time to take a dip in the pool and unwind. our room was beautiful. clean, well appointed, and had everything we could possibly need. we own a timeshare at westgate lakes in orlando and we will never stay at a westgate again if there is availability at the marriott resorts. blew westgate away by far! next time any friends or relatives travel to orlando we ill definitly recommend marriott grande vista. we truly had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, spacious rooms but rooms needs to be renovated”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Grand Vista July 29 for 7 nights. Front desk staff was courteous, nice grounds and the hotel was centrally located to amusement parks. Our 3 bedroom villa in building 92 was spacious, but the room looked tired and furniture was worn out. The plastic on the sofa cushion was sticking out, walls were marked up. Dish washer was very noisy. There's no maid service unless you pay extra. I was told there are renovated rooms, but those rooms go to the owners of Grand Vista. We stayed at the Marriott Cypress Harbour 2 years ago, the living room and dining room area was bigger and we prefer it more than the Grand Vista.

Reviews.Title: “Great pools, beautiful resort, poor maintenance and cleaning”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights in Orlando our first time with Marriott Resorts. Loved it other then a few problems with the bathroom. Toilet run all the time, so my husband fix it. Tub and sink did not drain well AT ALL. And we had MOLD in our room on all the lamp shades. I got sick on our last day(I think, due to mold) and was unable to go to Magic Kingdom, therefore my 2 grand daughters could not go. Very disappointing. I think it would be a great resort if the maintenance and cleaning were alot better. We will probably use Marriott again, only with a better villa. Thanks

Reviews.Title: “Had a grand time at the Grande Vista”
Reviews.Author: sueleo11
Reviews.Content: I originally made a reservation on EasyClickTravel.com for the SpringHill Stes and through a serious of unfortunate events and a wonderful rep by the name of Barbara, I ended up with reservations for the Grande Vista. Well, these events ended up being a blessing in disguise. We were able to secure an amazing rate for 10 nights for a 2BR-2BA villa. One major downside was that our flight arrive in Orlando at 9am, which left us with several hours to kill before the 4p check-in. A very sweet young lady at the front desk had mercy on us and let us check in around 2-3p. I had called twice to ask for a refurbished/new building (based on the suggestion from other reviews I read on this site). My husband was convinced that we did not receive one, but given our rush to checkin as early as possible it was a sacrifice I was willing to make. The villa was beautiful and very spacious. More than plenty of room for 2 adults and 3 kids (ages 15, 10, 6). The three tvs were a total blessing. The kitchen was amazing with the granite island/breakfast nook, garbage disposal, dishwasher, full stove and refrigerator. What was really awesome is that the cupboards were full of all necessary appliances, cutlery, place settings, etc!! It was like a little home-away-from-home, rather than a feeling like just a hotel. Our villa was always very clean. I know a lot of people complained about bugs, but we found that came from the front door being left open. This is Florida afterall. My only complaint with housekeeping is that over the 4th of July weekend, the cleaning person was very lax about replacing towels. After the second day of this happening, we had to call the front desk to get things moving. (Our guess is that the folks working the weekend were not the regular staff.) The resort had so many different activities for the family every night. We even received messages on our phone informing us of what was on the agenda and notifying us if there were any changes to the schedule due to the inclimate weather. We LOVED the pools. At night the pools were heated which felt great after a long day at the parks. As for the timeshare presentation, my husband and I did attend. The salesman, John, was awesome. He was not pushy and actually very helpful. We given the option to end the presentation at anytime we saw fit. We did end up buying a week, but not for the Grande Vista, but rather at the sister resort Cypress Harbour. Had it not been for this purchase, we defintely would've returned to the Grande Vista.

Reviews.Title: “Grande Vista - Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We bought our timeshare at Grande Vista last year while staying at the JW Marriott. This was our first time using the facilities. We have a 3 bedroom villa which was more that spacious. We should have invited more people down to stay with us. The grounds were kept clean, the staff was very helpful and the view from our balcony was so relaxing overlooking the lakes. I would recommend having more restaurant choices onsite. We did manage to cook a few of our own meals which was a moneysaver. We had a wonderful time at the pools. CopaLoca Grill had great food and drinks and Karaoke night was so much fun. Can't wait to go back again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Ok but we weren't by the pool...”
Reviews.Author: SJOwens
Reviews.Content: The rooms were nice, we found a roach in the connecting villa. We had a 3 bedroom suite, they were decorated nice but the hot tub in the room didn't work. We didn't spend a ton of time in the room so we didn't complain. We were staying in an owner's villa, they gave it to our family as a gift, we requested to be by the pool and they didn't put us anywhere near it, they said there might be a problem with parking and the lots were empty spots by our room. The place is in a good location right by Sea World and near rt4, so it was easy to get around. I would stay there again but I would make sure they gave us a room by the pool. Overall it was fun!

Reviews.Title: “Get a studio rather than a one bedroom”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were really glad we decided to get a studio with a kitchenette rather than spend more money on a one bedroom with a kitchen. Come on, there are so many different places to eat on the doorstep are you really going to cook other than making toast or heating soup or making a sandwich. A studio has cutlery, cups, plates, glasses, ice bucket, fridge, toaster, coffee maker and microwave. We probably would have preferred a kettle but who's stopping you boiling water in the microwave. Kitchen roll, washing up liquid and a scrubber is provided so you don't need to pick that up at Publix (2 miles away near the Premium Outlets) We were really lucky both times we stayed during our two week holiday (we took some time out for a Bahamas cruise and a trip to Miami. Cruise, amazing, Miami, overrated) We were given refurbished rooms on the requested 4th floor. Once we had a lake view (watch out for the fishermen and the turtle) and once we had a golf view. The houskeeping were excellent and were definately not seen or heard by us!! Which is exactly what you want. A daily newspaper is delivered to your room on weekdays. We got a fantastic rate on findorlandorooms and the hotel were happy for us to book with this website then phone the hotel direct with a booking reference number and make requests such as a pool view, whatever floor or a refurbished room. My husband was very impressed with the TV channels offered as was his brother who lives in Orlando! The rooms have individual thermostats for the air conditioning as well as an overhead fan. Each room has a safe. Each room has a balcony which is something hard to find in Orlando. There are smoking and non-smoking buildings. There are ice machines in two buildings. We never ate at Nick's Grill or Pizza Hut. We ate at the poolside cafe which was excellent and had a few drinks which were reasonably priced. A Denny's is within walkind distance as is Sea World but you will probably drive. I think this hotel is excellent value for money. I also recommend booking a treatment at the Ritz-Carlton Spa. Now that is worth the money. Talk about being pampered. The valet parking is complimentary as is the use of the pool, sauna and jacuzzi. The changing rooms and showers are out of this world, with every product you will need provided including razor and deodourant. If you are having a holiday with your children and want some time alone while they spend the day having some quality time with Dad, trust me, book a massage and spend the day relaxing around this pool being provided with iced towels, cold bottled water and lunch and wine served at your sunbed (reasonably priced). My future sister-in-law (I hope) and I did this and we were the only people there all day. It was amazing. Hopefully this has been helpful to all, and I hope you have a wonderful time in Orlando. The food is great, the service is second to none and there is so much to do for everyone.

Reviews.Title: “It was OK”
Reviews.Author: tlc85
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 just returned from a 7 night stay at the Grand Vista. At first I was disappointed as I requested a new room. They indicated to me that this room was refurbished only 2 months ago. I found that hard to believe. We had a one bedroom. It was very spacious but the furniture was outdated. The couch was worn, the mattress on the pull out couch had no support. I did find the unit clean and it was close to one of the pools. The location was great. It was a short drive to Walt Disney World and Universal Studios. Although it was nice to have a kitchen, we only used it for breakfast and to store drinks. I do not consider this a 4 star resort. This is a 3-star resort. The Disney resorts we have stayed in the past are far better but you also have to pay at least double what we paid. The only thing that would make it better is if they put a slide at the pools.

Reviews.Title: “Good time at Grande Vista”
Reviews.Author: jjc666
Reviews.Content: Family vacation to Orlando, July 8-15. We stayed at the Grande Vista on exchange from II. Check-in was very smooth. We arrived at 12:30pm and were given our room immediately. We were given a one bedroom with full kitchen on the ground floor of Bldg. 93. The size was great, plenty of room. Room itself was a little worn, carpet was ok, appliances need to be updated. There was a screened-in porch off the bedroom that looked out onto the golf course. Sink and large vanity were off of the bedroom with a two-person jacuzzi. Bathroom had a shower stall and another sink with a smaller vanity. Plenty of towels. For the amount of time we stayed in the room, I was happy. The ammenities at the resort were really great. The two large pools kept the kids (11, 9, and 6) entertained for hours. My husband and I liked the poolside service. And we never had a problem finding chairs. We went to the gameroom, played golf, tennis, rented the surrey bikes, used the store at the Marketplace, PizzaHut, soft ice cream, paddle boats, and my husband used the fitness center every morning. (He did say it gets crowded) We did not use the Kids Club or participate in any of the organized activities, the parks kept us too busy. This was the 4th visit to Florida in 8 years, until now we have always stayed at one of the Disney resorts and never left Disney property. I really enjoyed doing other activities this time, Universal Studios was very fun (We payed the extra money (37.00/person) for the express plus pass and never had to wait more the 5 minutes to get on a ride). The resort was conveniently located between Disney and Universal, and you could practically walk to SeaWorld. I would definitely return to Grande Vista.

Reviews.Title: “The best”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Seven of us just returned from staying at the Marriott Grande Vista in Orlando and it was the nicest and most accomondating place I have ever stayed. I had read several reviews of the Grande Vista and even though most were good, I was really worried about the few negative ones I read. They must not have stayed at where we stayed. I am 63 years old, took my wife, two sons, daughter-in-law and granddaughter and there was something for all of us there. The rooms were spotless, the swimming pools beautiful and fun and the service was perfect. The grounds were beautiful, the things to do while there were so much fun and the people could not have been nicer. I wrote them a letter (first time I have ever done that), and just want to say if you stay there,you will have a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Grande Vista was grand!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: stayed there with my family over the 4th of july weekend. the staff were very friendly. getting tickets to the attractions was painless! close to the orlando scene on international dr. lots of buffets, so its easy to budget the days spending. defintely would stay again. already planning for next year!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Vacation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at the Marriott Grand Vista for our first vacation. The stay was excellent. View had beautiful vista views. The amenities were great. Room services was there any time of the day. They have a few diffrent pools along with a hot tub and sauna to enjoy. Convient store was very stocked. This hotel is near from most attrations, like Sea World is less than a mile away. This place was the best. We plan on coming again with our family one day.

Reviews.Title: “You won't be disappointed.”
Reviews.Author: TinyTexan05
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Grande Vista June 17-21, 2005. Check-in took about 10 minutes (check in is at 4:00), and they have express check out, so all you have to do is call and tell the concierge that you're leaving. I didn't charge any incidentals so I had no balance to settle. The property was beautiful. We (2 adults, 2 kids) had a studio (king bed and queen pull-out sofa), and were more than comfortable. There was a screened-in patio, and a kitchenette that was more than sufficient (small fridge, microwave, coffee pot, sink). The bathroom was a nice size. I suggest that you rent a car (we had a van). The van was very convenient to drive to Publix for coffee, breakfast food, snacks and drinks, and to the nearby restaurants. There are MANY places to grocery shop, eat out, and shop along International Drive. Sea World is down the street, and Disney is a short drive away. I could not get a refurbished building since I was a guest, using the $199.00 Continental time-share presentation special. However, my room was great, and we had maid service every day. We got fresh towels every time I asked for them (which was often), as well as ice. The staff was accommodating, and every time I made a request for something, I received a follow up call from the front desk making sure that I got what I asked for. The kids stayed at the pool area when they were not at Disney. The main pool area is very nice. I requested a room near the main pool and got building 94, which is directly across the way. The BEST thing was that I did not have to endure the 90-minute time share sales pitch. I went to my obligatory presentation appointment and told the salesperson up front that I was NOT interested in buying a timeshare; that I was simply there because I had to be. He quickly showed me a model and let me go; no pressure. Short and sweet. You can't beat this resort for $199.00. It was great! I have very high travel accommodation standards and I was not disappointed. Orlando is NOT Hawaii, so you will not have the same Hawaiian luxury experience, but you WILL have a GREAT time at Grande Vista.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous resort; great for kids; be sure to rent a car!”
Reviews.Author: AllieKate_mom
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed here from June 11-17, 2005 and we all loved it! We had 3 units in Building 98, the Conquistador, 2nd floor. We had a 2 bedroom, a 1 bedroom, and a studio under 3 separate reservations (I got 2 through Interval International and the studio through a timeshare presentation offer) and they were able to get us all on the same floor in the same building. I did request refurbished rooms and was not disappointed. All units were spacious, clean and nicely, tastefully furnished, although you could tell the bath and kitchen fixtures and tile weren't brand new. Still, they were very nicely maintained, so no complaints. The location we had was perfect: away from the noise of some of the pools so it was quiet, overlooking the golf course, but close enough to a smaller pool to allow a quick dip before dinner. We dined only in our units or at the theme parks, so we did not enjoy the reasonably priced Nick's Grill, but would definitely try it on a next visit. The housekeeping works like this: daily if you are a renting guest, once a week for Marriott owners, and only if you request and pay for it for Interval exchangers. They did bring extra towels or paper towels/toiletries if you ask them to, free of charge, although sometimes it took a while. The resort is absolutely kid-friendly, but doesn't compromise for the adults, either. The kid activities are plenty and many are free, although with our busy schedule of trying to get in all 4 Disney theme parks in one week, we were not able to partake in the resort activities. We did hit the pools- the Vista del Sol pool is definitely a can't miss with the kids, as is the Village Center pool. The pool near our building was a hit with my daughters, 6 and 2, because it was quieter. The true highlight for the kids was the amazing playplace climbing structure- WAY better than a McDonald's or Chuck E Cheese and cleaner, too! The things that looked amazing but we didn't have time for: golfing, tennis, duck and swan paddleboats, four person bicycles, free family photography for guests, aerobics, smore's night. When you check in, they give you a weekly schedule of all activities, and it's extensive. The grounds are large and sprawling, and that is one of the things I liked about the resort....it's gorgeous and spread out. None of the buildings are much taller than the palm trees and all direct you to golf course or pool views, with no parking lot views. All the resort amenities are either a short walk from each other or a slightly longer, beautiful walk away. The buildings are a way off of International Drive, through a protected forest area, so no road noise at all. You feel secure having to pass through the gatehouse before entering the resort buildings area. While they have a free shuttle to get you from different areas of the resort, you are out of luck getting beyond the front drive without a car. Renting a car was pretty cheap (one week full-size for $131 through Dollar) and Disney has $8/car parking with in/out privileges so you can come back after a nap and not pay again. The resort will call a taxi (about $30 to Disney) or the Mears Shuttle (about $15 per person roundtrip- a crime!) but both were lots more expensive than piling everyone in the car and driving yourself. The local Publix was a short, easy drive away. Also, no one tells you this but there are two $.75 tolls from the airport to the resort and back, so have some change or small bills! The timeshare presentation was fairly painless, and definitely no pressure. Ours took a little over 2 hours, but mostly because we were talking with our salesperson who was very nice and an ex-semiprofessional English football player (Mark Bulmer). If you have kids, bring 'em, as they can give you your presentation in the kid's play room. They had two rooms with videos, Nintendo, coloring and toys, so it was nice not to have to worry about the kids. They like riding the golf cart to see the model, too. Coming to Orlando in June is a hot and sticky proposition, with thunderstorms daily, so we used the washer/dryer every day. Be sure to buy one bottle of cheap detergent at Publix the first day. (Publix was a lot cheaper than the Marketplace store on site for almost everything). We would definitely stay again, next time to also fully enjoy the resort amenities instead of just the theme parks.

Reviews.Title: “First Time But Not The Last”
Reviews.Author: tuffy
Reviews.Content: My friend owns a timeshare at the Marriott GV and invited me and another friend for a mini-reunion. We had 6 children w/us (ages 2-10) and a 3 bedroom villa. The villa was on the ground floor - great for the kids but it was musty and dark. There weren't any screens on the windows to allow us to open them. We turned up the AC when we left the room to sort of dehumidify the place and it helped. But the floorplan was great and it never seemed crowded even w/9 of us! All of the employees we encountered were helpful and very accomodating w/our lg. group. They seemed to really like kids and weren't just tolerating them! We had lunch at Nick's on the first day and our children, although well-behaved, were pretty chatty and the staff noted that it was a nice change from the quiet. The bellman - Michael drove us to Nick's in the hotel van and when we called him for a ride back to the room, we showed up in a big golf cart. The kids loved it. We especially loved the main pool - it had something for everyone - a small wading pool for the under 3's, a fountain, and a large pool. Nearby was a convenience store w/snacks, ice cream and pizza. There are other pools, I think, but we never went there. We also had plans to put the older kids in the kids activities but we never got to. We were so busy that it wasn't necessary! They told us about the Publix supermarket and we stocked up on water and breakfast food and sandwich fixings. I'm glad we did because there were a couple of days when we got back late and we were too tired to go out for food. There are restaurants nearby on International Drive. A car was necessary to get around to Disney World and stores but they weren't too far of a drive. One tip: I was quoted $330 to rent a minivan for 5 days from Budget and when I asked if that was their lowest rate, the reservationist asked me if I had a Costco card. I did and the rate went down to $130. Amazing. Overall, our experience was an excellent one. I'm even tempted to look into buying a timeshare there myself. I would, however, make sure I request a more updated room and maybe on a second floor.

Reviews.Title: “Different then a realk hotel, but very good”
Reviews.Author: DutchyCan
Reviews.Content: Since this is a timeshare resort, you should not expect a hotel. We have stayed at other Marriott timeshares before and have learned that it is handy to have a car. This is more like a mixture between a hotel and renting a house. If you did not book it as a hotel, you will not have a maid cleaning the room daily (unless you pay for it). Checking in went quickly, checking out even quicker (no need to go to the lobby, what you spent will be deducted from the credit card, and the keys from the room you leave at the security gate). Lots of people think the Publix supermarket is great. We did not think so. Okay, there are many options, but prices were very high compared to the 24hr Wal Mart. There are 2 Publix supermarkets in the area, neither one is in walking distance for shopping and carrying groceries. Ask the lobby for driving directions to Wall Mart (it is basically very simple, just about 10 minutes driving). Since it is better to be with a rental car (or van, as that seems the most popular car over there), the parks are not too far away. The rooms look nicely decorated, everything was basically clean when we arrived. The batteries from the remote were taken by the previous occupant, but replaced the next day when we asked (we arrived in the evening and didn't bother then). We stayed two weeks in the same room, and it was not cleaned when the new week started. I mentioned that, and it seems management can improve here. The pools are nice, but can be crowded at sunny days. In May there were enough seats to sit around the pool. There are plenty of activities to do, so you do not get bored at the resort. We were mainly gone (which was basically a shame, since the hotel deserves it to stay more there). If you have a room with kitchen and dining room, it is very sufficient. A room with just a small kitchen will also cater most of your needs. The washingmachine and dryer make more noise then ours in europe. This resort does not excel in (hotel)service, but it makes up for it in view, amenities and space. We'd go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Our 3 year old cried when we had to leave...”
Reviews.Author: pnutbutter
Reviews.Content: and it had nothing to do with Disneyworld! We loved this hotel. Stayed for five nights and only went to Disney for one day. Rest of the time we were on the property. Our three year old found plenty of things to do and we were able to relax too! There are two great pools with lots of kid friendly activities, an indoor climbing tube structure, paddle boats and fishing gear to rent, and a kids club. Our room was great. We got a one bedroom 700+ square foot room with a full kitchen, washer and dryer, and whirlpool tub and deck. The room was very clean. When we left, our daughter started to cry. We asked if it was because she'd miss Disneyworld, and she said she was going to miss her hotel. My husband and I enjoyed our stay too. Just the right mix of kid friendly/adult fun type of place. Definitley recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: KatieWManchester
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my boyfriend last September and loved it. This is a very large resort on the quieter side of I-Drive. The hotel is very clean, the staff are very helpful and the rooms were spacious and had everything you would expect from a Marriott hotel. The decor and furniture was like new. My only complaint would be the location as there are no bars/restaurants nearby.You definately need to hire a car. I certainly could not fault this hotel. The pictures shown on expedia are very accurate and I cannot understand why people are complaining about it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Resort for Families. We Will Be Back”
Reviews.Author: oldbokers
Reviews.Content: This is was my second visit to the Grande Vista. We stayed May 24-31, 2005. My wife and six year old daughter enjoy this place. The entrance is beautiful. Plenty of free parking and a security station at the front entrance. The pools are fantastic. There is one pool area that is zero entry with lots of splash fountains for the young ones. We had a one bedroom unit in the Denia building. We had nice vistas of the golf course and the one of the quiet pools directly below us.. The indoor play ground (huge jungle gym) is a big hit with my daughter. I only have two complaints. The furniture was starting to show wear in our unit and the maid service was non existent for a couple of days. The unit is very clean and the whole complex is very tidy. I highly recommend this place. I will be back in October.

Reviews.Title: “First Rate!!!”
Reviews.Author: BOS_TO_MCO
Reviews.Content: My wife and I arrived here for a 2 night stay on May 29-30. We had spent the prior week at a different resort on a timeshare exchange, and I wished that we had been able to trade into the Grande Vista for our entire stay. This is a beautiful resort! The location is on International Drive, just south of Seaworld. It is convenient to, not only Seaworld / Discovery Cove, but also situated about halfway between Disney and Universal / IOA. We arrived shortly after 4:00 pm check-in time, and, having had a horrible check-in at our prior resort, decided to time the duration of the check-in process here. From our entry into the lobby until we left with keys in hand was a whopping 4 minutes!!! The young lady at the front desk was polite, cheerful, helpful, extremely competent and professional. She explained about the resort's offerings and gave us concise directions to our accommodations. We traveled to our building which was on the other side of the lagoon from the front desk. One minor complaint here was that the signs indicating the building numbers were sometimes hard to see. Our unit was a one-bedroom located on the sixth (top) floor of Bldg. 82. It was beautiful. The porch and windows overlooked the pool area and lagoon and the view was awesome. The decorating inside was tasteful and pleasing. The kitchen was well-stocked (even had coffee filters in the coffee-maker) with all we needed. There was a door from the living room onto the porch, and the slider from the bedroom opened onto it as well. From our porch at night you could see the fireworks from the Disney area. The living room had a DVD and TV concealed in an armoire. HBO was available on both this and the bedroom TV. The bedroom was large enough to be comfortable, with an in-room jacuzzi for two and a vanity opposite it. The closet was of adequate size with a wall safe with a key lock (not a combination). The bathroom was spacious, with a double sink vanity, corner shower unit and toilet. Plenty of towels were provided, as well as some specifically for the pool. If I had one other complaint here, it would be some noise from either the elevator or air-conditioning equipment in our unit. However, it was not enough to be a bother to me. The pool area below us had two pools (one a zero entry for kids that had squirting cannons and other kid-friendly features in a pirate theme, the other more for adults, without the water toys). There was a pool bar (Copa Loca) with snack dishes available at this location. Drinks were $8 in a souvenier cup that could be refilled for $6. Waitstaff checked the pool areas to serve food and drinks or you could go to the bar if you didn't wish to wait. From this pool area a bridge connected the resort to the front desk / marketplace / second pool area. The harbormaster is there as well, where you can rent paddleboats and such to use on the lagoon. Also, the Faldo Golf Institute is onsite and the Marriott's Grande Pines just across the street. There are basketball and tennis courts available, as well as numerous other activities. We did not have the time to enjoy all of the offerings of this resort. I did enjoy the pool area by the Copa Loca and enjoyed it immensely. I will definitely be looking to stay at this resort again. Having stayed at three of their Orlando area properties, I have to say that Marriott really does it right!

Reviews.Title: “The children's activities were awesome!”
Reviews.Author: FLBeachLover
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grande Vista May 20-27, and thoroughly enjoyed our stay! We just stayed in a studio unit, but it was fine for us because we were only in our room to sleep. The resort is gorgeous the only thing that could possibly make it more perfect was if it were on the beach! This was our second time staying there and my four year old son asked when we were going to be able to go back as we were checking out. Several posters have talked about their pools and they are nice, but our children ages 2 & 4 enjoyed all of the scheduled activities (lots of the activities were FREE) and the indoor play area and toddler area. The activites staff (which we had the most contact with) were super with the children. I agree with another previous poster in that some people posting reviews were highly critical. We had a wonderful time!

Reviews.Title: “Orlando all in One”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Best VAcatioon Ever! Tennis Courts, Restaurant, Bikes, Pools, Beautiful Rooms, Lake Activities, and Parks nearby! BEAUTIFUL HOTEL!!!

Reviews.Title: “The Grande Vista is above all”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was completely shocked when I saw a few negative reviews about the Grande Vista. Obviously that will happen because this is selective response and usually people who respond will have a very strong view for the subject whether it is liked or disliked. My parents own a few timeshares, one at the Grande Vista in Orlando and another of Marriott's in Kauai, Hawaii. I have stayed at other resorts in Orlando, such as Cypress Harbour, but i have yet to stay at a resort, anywhere that compares to the Grande Vista. I have been to the Grande Vista every year for the past five years and have NEVER had one thing to complain about. The rooms are excellent, along with every other aspect that is sought out after by vacationers. I highly recommend you looking into the Grande Vista for your next vacation to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Sub Par is Correct Description for Grande Vista”
Reviews.Author: balti_less
Reviews.Content: The previous reviews describing this resort as sub par perfectly describes this resort. We own a Marriott timeshare in Ko'Olina Hawaii and the resorts are like night and day. While Ko'Olina is almost perfect in every way ( staff, resort and amenities). The Grande Vista is lacking in almost every category. Housekeeping staff at Grande Vista is almost surly and disinterested in providing a service to the customer. The front desk and concierge was OK, but the concierge was hell bent on selling some other timeshare or attraction tickets. We had to keep saying "No, but we already own a Marriott timeshare in Hawaii!" The only time we went to the market place store was to get Starbucks coffee, but the place only had one person working ringing up all the items as well as making the coffee. It did not take too long for a long line to form. Not good for a Sunday morning on a Florida vacation. Understaffed is an understatement. The place was OK, nothing to write home about. Like the other poster said there are too many better Orlando timeshare resorts. Believe it or not, I got this studio/hotel room directly from Interval International as a "getaway week" for $250 for 7 days. Dime a dozen indeed.

Reviews.Title: “Good Time at the Grande Vista”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Returned May 21 from a week at Grande Vista. We are an extended family of 10, ranging in age from 8-72, and had 3 2-bedroom villas in building 91, which overlooked a quiet pool. Some reviews had me worried, but here's what we found. The grounds are just beautiful - well-kept and extensive. There are many pools (7?), loud ones, quiet ones, shallow for little kids, deeper with shooting cannons for older kids. All were clean, none were huge. We didn't mind walking around, it's only 5-10 minutes to get anywhere and the weather was perfect. We liked being in the quiet area, able to walk to louder places when we chose. We played tennis and ping pong, used the exercise room, ate everywhere but Nick's Grill, and swam in every pool. An order placed from our room to the Copa Loco was ready before we could walk over to get it. The front desk staff were not great - they forgot to give us our keys, to take our credit card #s, to tell us we were already checked in. It took 1 1/2 hours to get more swim towels as the maid hadn't replaced ours. They were not 4- or 5-star responsive. But this was a few minutes out of our week. Once we saw how they were we just tried to have little contact. Our unit was spacious (a priority for us with kids) and nice, not unacceptably worn. It was not top-hotel quality, but then it cost less than a single 5-star hotel room as well! There was a cobweb (big deal) at the ceiling, and my daughter's mattress seam was unsewn, exposing the springs. This was completely unacceptable to her Grandma, but as our daughter decided to sleep on the fold-out anyway, we didn't report it as we couldn't be bothered. The sheets and blanket on the bed were cheap and thin, but again, a small part of the whole experience. None of us had cockroaches. As we sat with our cool drinks on our screened porch watching the sun set on another 86 degree day, we all agreed that we were happy with our choice of resort.

Reviews.Title: “Grand time at the Grande Vista”
Reviews.Author: IndianapolisINLori
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week at the Marriott Grande. May 13-20. We had a 1bedroom 1 bath villa and it was spacious and very nicely decorated. After pouring over many reviews here I learned to request the newly refurbished unit. We are a family of four and our 2 sons 5 and 7 slept on the brand new Flexsteel pull out sofa. The kitchen was very nice-a granite countertop new appliances, ample pots, cups, and dishes. We recieved 1 phone call inviting us to attend the presentation and declined. We were never bothered again. The intention of our trip was to enjoy Disney World. It was a close 10 minute drive. On our off days we enjoyed the nice Vista Del Sol pool. This pool had water sprayers, cannonballs, and children's pool games. There is also a nice pool bar that served a great Copa Lopa Pina Colada. My husband thought it was the best concoction he had ever tasted. The lunch menu had children's meals that far surpassed quality and price of any disney resorts that we've dined at. They also make excellent grilled chicken and grilled fish sandwiches. Children's activities are plentiful and well scheduled here. There's also a Harbour Master area where you can rent paddle boat swans or bikes, or surreys. The prices were very reasonable. We purchased this huge inflatable alligator for 10.00 and they blew it up for us right at the Harbour Master area. The kids had a ball playing with that on our rest days. This really is a top notch resort. I would agree with others on the bug issue. We did see 1 large roach--however, every other hotel that we've stayed at in florida has them as well. I wouldn't let that stop me from staying again. The decor was Tahitian/French very well coordinated and beautiful. Everything in our villa was brand new, including the carpet. We really enjoyed all of the activities and services that were offered. In some ways we were disappointed to spend so many days at Disney and not enough rest time at the resort. In conclusion, I am a very picky individual when it comes to selecting hotels. I read review after review, after review before deciding on whether to stay at a specific place. I can assure you--you won't be disappointed. We spent our last night at Disney's Polynesian and were much more disappointed with the accomadations there than at the Marriott Grande Vista. Good Luck in your decision! Remember to request a newly refurbished unit. It's my understanding that all of the villas will be refurbished in about 5 weeks.

Reviews.Title: “People are too critical!”
Reviews.Author: HawkeyeGoose
Reviews.Content: The Grande Vista is a beautiful, well maintained resort with all the amenities one would need and more. The only difference between this resort and Mexico is the beach. This is a great place for families with kids. If mom or dad enjoy golf, they have this here as well. It's in a great location. You are less than a mile away from Sea World and close to everything else. The ground are very pretty and scenic. It is what it is. This is not a five star resort with impecable service. It does not claim to be. It's a vacation rental resort. People drive, cook and look after their own room. If you want to be pampered, go to the spa or stay at the four seasons. This is a great resort for what it is and where it is located. People who have reviewed this resort are way too critical.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Grande Vista”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I really don't understand the negative reviews on this resort. I admit they made me a little nervous in choosing the Grande Vista, but luckily I just got back and had a wonderful stay in a very nice room. I did not have a villa as it was just my wife and I and we were only there 5 nights. The mini fridge and microwave were adequate in the King room. We arrived at the resort at 3:30 pm 30 minutes prior to check in and got right in to our room. The grounds were spotless. The resort is quite large. We were in building 83 very close to the main pool and lobby. All buildings here are near a pool as they have three on site. I only saw two of them. The main pool is awesome and I regret I didn't get a picture of it. At the main pool there is a bar adjacent to it and a marketplace which has everything you could ever need. They also have a window that sells Edy's ice cream and Pizza Hut. The Pizza Hut also delivers at night. At the other pool there is a bar/restaurant called Copa Loca I think. It was pretty good and has a sandwich type menu. The pool by this area is pretty cool and much more illuminated at night. It is shaped like a pirate ship and if you have kids, I think they would love this pool the best. The lobby also has a great concierge area that you can get attraction tickets and restaurant reservations. There is also a small man made beach with a beach volleyball net there. They also have flamingo and duck shaped paddle boats available to rent near the main pool in the lake there. I did not see the cost, but they seemed very popular to the kids. I also saw clay tennis courts, a basketball court, and golf course there, but was not there long enough to enjoy them. As for my room, I have attached pics so you can judge for yourself. I found the room to be very clean and very nice. This is a great resort to stay at. It is very kid friendly and very convenient to all the parks. SeaWorld is only a mile away and Universal and Disney is about 5-10 minutes away. A big thumbs up for the Grande Vista

Reviews.Title: “Great room..what more do you want?”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I went as an exchange and expected an older room with problems. Instead we got a two bedroom villa in a brand new building. Everything was clean, and bug free. We had a very enjoyable week. The location is perfect and we found that even though it's a very large resort it felt small because the buildings are spread out.

Reviews.Title: “Not The Best”
Reviews.Author: Billyz11
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 24-27 April 2005 in a 2 bedroom villa. Checked in at 3.20pm only to be sent away with the promise of a phone call as soon as a room became available. Returned at 4.15pm (no call received) to queue for a further 30 mins. The supposed 2 bedroom villa was a 1 bed with an adjoining studio. The studio room was similar to a Motel 6 and the 1 Bed Villa bedroom was cramped with minimal wardrobe space. The apartments have been cheaply finished and not really worthy of a 4.5 star rating. We were booked in for 3 nights and the front desk advised after 2 nights that we would have to change villas....needless to say we didn't and firmly told them where to get off. Wouldn't rush back here.

Reviews.Title: “Was nice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 nights at the vista april 10 thru april 13. It was a beautiful place on the outside but I wasnt impressed with the rooms at all.

Reviews.Title: “Villa great but”
Reviews.Author: leop
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Grande Vista for three nights in early april....the one bedroom was priced right(package through marriott) and included a nice screened in porch overlooking one of the man made lakes.....we were on the 6th floor....we requested one of the renovated villas since we had been tipped off by a tripadvisor review that some of the villas need refurburshing....the unit was very nice, very clean, excellent value, full kitchen, dinning room, living room,bedroom with jacuzzi and full bath, quiet, good mattress.....location of the resort which is quite large, is on the quiet side of international drive, yet close to the parks.....there is a nice golf course and the restaurant at the golf course was very nice for lunch.....our only disappointment was with the swimming pools....... there are at least three of them and they are very nice but......too many kids.....if you want to just sit and relax and read a book, forget it....wall to wall people, wall to wall kids......... you would also not want to stay in a unit close to the registration area, I am sure it is very noisy in that building.....other than that, I would recommend the resort, and after a relatively low key timeshare presentation for 90 minutes, you can save $200.00 on your room costs.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel”
Reviews.Author: goldfish21001
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott Grande Vista for a week and were given a two bedroom villa in a new building overlooking the golf course. The villa had everything we could need for a self catering vacation, which was great as we have a baby and a four year old. It's lovely here, very relaxing and quiet considering it's a large hotel. We were never bothered by maid service or by timeshare calls. There is so much to do here when you're not at the parks, great pools, bike rental, pedal boats, an indoor jungle gym, kids programs etc. We could have stayed longer. We only had a couple of problems. The registration process was very slow and we had to ask twice for a high chair, which I had already called them about weeks prior to arriving. It eventually arrived an hour later. We would stay at this hotel again if we could be sure of a new villa as overall it was a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “It is all about the sale!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Please read this!!!! If you are looking for a cheap way to stay in Orlando I strongly urge you to take Grande Vista up on there 199.00 for four days deal. Plus if you talk to the people that check you in they will allow you to stay for additional nights for only $99.00. Now, lets talk ownership. Do not purchase this vacation ownership scam at this resort. First off this property is not worth $22,000 plus 800.00 a year in condo fees. They admitadly only upgrade there rooms every five years. These places are used and abused 365 days a year. People do not respect things like they do at there own house, so after several years of use things in a timeshare have a tendency to began looking worn. Plus everything they do purchase is cheap. The mattresses are hard and have no pillow top, the ceiling fans rattle at high speeds, and you have to stand on the bed to adjust the speed(no wall control). The porch furniture is made out of plastic, like the ones they sell at walmart. I could go on and on. The point is that they want you to purchase a condo at top price then maintain it like a second class motel. Like I said they want $22,000 plus $800.00 a year condos fees for one week a year. If you were purchasing a cheaper unit these problems would be acceptable but not at these prices. Think about $22,000 x 52= $1,144,000.00 per unit for Marriott plus $800.00x52=$41,600 a year in condo fees per unit. That kind of money deserves first class quality. On a side note. Due to them sending invitations to anybody and everybody and renting out units to none owners most guest are not owners. This means that the caliber of neighbors is not always the greatest. People allowing there kids to use the lap pool as a kiddie pool, and the sauna as a play fort. Every time we have been there the pool is more like your local city swimming pool than a 4 1/2 star resort. Away from the pool we have had neighbors that party all hours of the night and the staff does nothing hoping to sell a timeshare. Please, before saying yes to the purchase shop around for better priced resorts. Grande Vista is not worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “"Loved the property"”
Reviews.Author: TheBlueWaterBreeze
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel property 12 miles from Disney and 12 miles from Universal; only a half mile from Sea World. New buildings, excellent grounds, great pools, outstanding service. Being an experienced Marriott customer, I had high expectations and the property overall met them. Staying in a villa is very different than staying in a hotel. However, the small trade offs are well worth the extra space and added functionality that you receive. We had a two bedroom standard villa that had a pull out queen sofa in the living area. There were 2 private patio sitting areas off of each bedroom. 2 baths, 1 with a jacuzzi tub. 3 televisions with a one having a DVD/VCR combination. Full service kitchen area and a dining table for six included. Everything seemed new. There are several outdoor swimming pools on the properly, one an excellent one for kids of all ages. Since this is a village of villas, there is no main lobby just an elevator away. Need to walk (or drive) to the Marriott Marketplace shop for Starbucks, groceries, Krispy-Kremes, etc. The only small negative is that the only room service available is Pizza Hut (made on the property). The only true conventional resturant is Nick Faldo's Grill House which is a bit upscale. No standard Marriott "American Grill" type eatery available. The on property conceriege was very helpful in describing ticket packages for the theme parks and we were able to buy everything right from her (and charge it to the room - more Marriott points!). This properly is located on International Drive, just five minutes away from the conventional Marriott World Center Hotel, but in my opinion, a much better option.

Reviews.Title: “A great place for families!”
Reviews.Author: spookykennedy
Reviews.Content: We just returned from spending 3 nights at Marriott's Grande Vista and have nothing (ok, almost nothing) but positives to say about it! We had just left the Hyatt Regency Grande Cypress, and the Marriott was a breath of gorgeous, tropical, fresh air! We had a refurbished 2 BR/2 BA Villa in the Magellan building, which to us was a perfect location near the main pool and lobby. We had gorgeous views of the golf course as well. The villa was just huge and honestly we used about 25% of the space! It is so great for families and so convenient as you can park right outside your villa. We loved the washing machine in the room and it allowed us to pack less clothes. The way the room is designed it is SO quiet - never hear one peep from anyone else, not from above, below, outside or anywhere! The grounds are beautiful and the staff is great. We did have a grumpy, cold staff member at check in who wasn't the least bit helpful, but then Patty at the front desk helped us and made several calls to arrange for our villa to be ready early! She was awesome!!! We would have been off on a bad foot if it were not for her! We loved the location too as it is set apart from everything else but still relatively convenient. My husband loved that it was far from Disney stuff. I loved having a new Publix up the street yet still quick access to fun restaurants on International Drive. I would highly recommend this hotel. You can book directly through Marriott Vacation Club even if you aren't a member (we got a great rate!) or rent from a member by the week. We checked out to go to Disney's Polynesian and we were all a little sad to leave our heavenly villa! We can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “A very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: rvstauff
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grande Vista 3/29 to 4/2(Easter week). We are not owners and got the room agreeing to a timeshare presentation. Room was nice and clean. We were far from the pools, but used the car and could always find a space to park near either of the main pools. Could hear the neighbors in the next room. They had kids that stayed up a little later than our kids. Did have an issue getting enough bath towels and there was just 4 of us. We had maid service every day. We started off with 4 towels, but returned to 2 towels every day. A call to the front desk and we would eventually wind up with 2 more towels. This might have been an Easter week issue. The resort was pretty full, but the towels seemed to be the only issue. Timeshare presentation was very low key. There was no high pressured sales pitch. We appreciated this. We own one timeshare and we think the next one that we buy will be a Marriot. We think highly of Marriott and after the sales presentation, we still think very highly of the Marriott name. We had great weather and loved how close the Disney parks are and the day we stayed at the Grande Vista was very relaxing. Seems like they have a lot to do for everyone. The onsight market, grill, and pizza hut made it nice to have coffee, donuts, and food in a pinch.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A beautiful, well organized resort. Our first stay in Orlando, and we could not have picked a better spot. Our one bedroom unit with balcony overlooking the main lake area was beautiful, very clean, updated everything, and the bed was comfortable. My husband and (8 yr. old ) son enjoyed fishing the entire week. Our son did not even want to go to Walt Disney World, just fish, swim, bike and paddle boat. Watch out for the bugs at night along the lake area, coat yourself with plenty of bug spray. Even though it rained most every day, we still enjoyed a very relaxing vacation. Resort is less than a mile from Sea World and Discovery Cove, which were the only two parks we went to anyway. Good food on site, lots of activities. We will return.

Reviews.Title: “Unclean and frustrating!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Upon checking into our room at the Grande Vista we found it not cleaned at all after the previous occupants! Dirty linens, wet towels, garbage piled on the floor. Took over an hour for someone to come clean. They didn't speak English and hadn't been told to change the linens! Asked to have a supervisor check the room after cleaning. It had been cleaned and the linens replaced but still found many, many problems including burnt out lightbulbs, previous occupants food left in the refrigerator, patio doors left unlocked, garbage left in drawers, broken faucet in kitchen. Blankets were stained, didn't have enough sheets for sofa beds, carpeting stained. Was given a resort credit and a free mid week cleaning, but that didn't make up for living for a week in such sub par conditions. Management kept apologizing and offering to fix everything, but the last thing I wanted to do on vacation was to supervise repairs. I can do that at home! The final straw was calling for a wake up call and having the phone ring at the front desk for over 20 minutes before it was answered, then the person who answered rudely confirmed a 6am wake up call. It came well after 6:30 with a cheery "here's your 6:30 Wake Up call!" They can't get anything right!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice resort. I bought a timeshare at this location and have been very pleased with it. I would not hesitate to recommend this resort for anyone to stay at. It's great for families, couples, etc. The resort is in great shape and is a wonderful place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Worn and Horrible Registration”
Reviews.Author: ProudMarineMomNJ
Reviews.Content: We are discovering that Marriott has a great presentation for ownership but beware once you purchase. We bought timeshare 3yrs ago and this was our 2nd stay at Grande Vista. We had a 3bdrm villa and had requested bldg near main pool area (traveling with elderly and autistic child), sent a fax to confirm and were told no problem. After waiting 5hrs for room told someone had given it away and there was now nothing near pool area. The unit was worn, washer and dryer sounded like they were on there last leg and unit defintely needed better cleaning (we were told this unit had been refurbished). Pool areas and grounds are lovely, but staff and service not worth the price of admission.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from staying @ the Marriot Grande Vista for a couple of days last week. Hotel was beautiful and there is so much to do @ the hotel. If we had children they would have loved all the activities offered. I would plan on staying there again, if we go back to Orlando, for sure. Most of the other hotels we saw there were really junky but Marriot has really kept this hotel nice. The only problem we encountered was it seemed we could hear everything in our neighbor's room. Was not so bad as we will really were not in our room so much. Thanks Marriot for a nice couple days away.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Go Travel Europe
Reviews.Content: As a former Orlando resident we were very picky about which resort we stayed in since we are familiar with many. We had a beautiful one bedroom suite that looked and smelled new, and was spotlessly clean. The resort location on International Drive is perfect because it is more secluded, quiet, and has much less traffic but is still conveniet to all attractions. Also there is a new outlet mall 1-2 miles south of the resort off of International Dr. The resort has 4 clay tennis courts, paddle boats and buggy style bikes for rent at reasonable rates. The work out room is decent and they have a large playroom for kids. It was fun, and so relaxing we hated to leave!

Reviews.Title: “Another great Marriott property”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Grande Vista and happy to report that the property met and exceeded our expectations. We did our homework in advance and requested to be placed in one of the new buildings, with lake view, high floor with 2 queen beds in the second bedroom. All requests were granted and we loved our villa. The walk to the pool was very easy and we did not encounter any trouble with the elevator, although we chose to take the stairs up five flights just for exercise several times. We enjoyed the pool bar/grill very much, that is a nice touch which the older side does not have. (Keep your souvenir glass handy to receive $2 discount on any refill drink--all were very tasty too!) Enjoyed the walk around the lake and there are shaded swings & benches placed around the property to enjoy. All Marriott employees were friendly and accomodating, even the grounds workers smile and speak as you pass by. We only participated in one activity (the beach campfire & smores) because we just couldn't fit it in our schedule, although we would have liked to. There are many buildings on this property but it never seemed crowded, even at the pool. If I was looking for something to complain about, it might would be that the speakers were not working around the newest pool because I really enjoyed the music around the main pool area. One week here is probably not long enough if you're doing the parks because there is a lot to enjoy at the Grande Vista property itself. Next time we return we will be sure to play beach volleyball, take our tennis raquets, take the paddleboats out, and rent bikes. My husband and son used the Faldo golf practice areas but did not have a chance to play the course although it looked very well kept. Next time we will allow more time for golf as well as it is very handy and reasonable to play there. Looking forward to going back someday.

Reviews.Title: “Had a nice time”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a week at the Grande Vista. Although I did not find it as outstanding as the previous reviewers here, it was very nice, and made for a nice vacation with the two kids. The room itself (a two bedroom villa) was very big, and very clean for the most part. I did find some dust bunnies behind the bed and some mold up top in the bathroom, but nothing too outrageous. I did not see any palmetto bugs at all, which I had been afraid of after reading the reviews on this site. I only saw two small bugs, nothing unlike I would see in my own house, but other than that never had a problem. The room was more than big enough for my husband and my two kids, ages 5 and 3. Could have easily fit one or two more people. Having two bathrooms was great, plus the master bedroom gives you an extra vanity and sink so really three people could get ready at the same time. The water pressure from the showers was great. However, the whirlpool tub was much too big for me to sit in, and I am 5 foot 7. It was a six-foot, 2 person tub, and I had to strain to reach the jets at the opposite end of the tub. None of the jets hit any part of my body, and again I had to strain to even feel the bubbles. The washer and dryer are quite small, could only do 3 or 4 outfits (including kids' clothes!) at a time. So it's like doing half of a normal load, which makes it time consuming to get the laundry done. However it was very convenient having the laundry right there in the room. I noticed that the laundry facilities that they do have at the resort are somewhat spread out, they are not in every building so someone who did not have a washer and dryer in their room would have to walk a little ways. One thing I noticed that the hotel did not have was vending machines. It would have been nice to be able to get a quick soda, snack, or ice, without having to walk to the marketplace store. The mattresses in the rooms were nice, they felt like Tempur Pedic or something. Everyone in my family slept like logs at night, especially after long days walking the parks. However, the bedspreads were a little pilly and didn't seem like the cleanest linens you could have. Maid service was daily, however the maids never put a bottom (fitted) sheet on the bed. So it was just a waterproof liner on top of the mattress with two flat sheets on top of that. The bed kept getting unmade very easily. I had read in other reviews that everyone loved Nick's Restaurant. I thought it would be a pub style, family place, but it is very upscale and expensive. I brought my kids, (5 and 3), and they were the only kids there. It is mostly for the golfers to eat and drink after their game is done. Lots of older folks dressed up and people coming in off the golf course. The cheapest entree on the menu was around $15. The food was fine, but we could not afford to go there every night. Never mind the fact that it was not family friendly at all, which I thought was odd in a family oriented resort. The game room is very small, maybe only 15 machines plus two air hockey tables and a pool table, although not much room to play pool. The fitness center is small as well. The indoor kid's playground is small as well, although the kids enjoyed climbing through the big structure. I was surprised that they did not have an outside playground as it seemed a shame to have the kids playing inside on a beautiful Florida day. The pool areas were fine, although they could have done a better job cleaning out the leaves. Nice music piped in through all the pool areas. No lifeguards or anything so you must be extra vigilant with your kids, of course! I know how I devoured every bit of info on the hotel before I made my reservation, so hopefully this fresh insight helps someone else with their decision, either way. Overall, it is a fine hotel, no major complaints. However, my family concluded that we had not found THE Disney hotel for us, so next year we will try something else.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our family just returned from a stay at the Grande Vista. Our family included our sons 22, and 24. We were all extremely satisfied with our accomodations, a one bedroom villa. The villa was spacious, clean, very accomodating, with all the supplies you would need to cook a meal, if you were so inclined. The grounds are beautiful and were well maintained. It has many buildings and it appeard full from the parking lot, but it never felt crowded. The washer and dryer also was a nice perk. We stayed in a ground floor unit with a a screened in patio. We attended a presentation as part of the package, and I will say it was tempting to purchase the ownership. This is a place we would all look forward to going again, and i would highly recommend it to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Vista during our Honeymoon in late September. The service, the villa, and the grounds all led to a fantastic trip and a most memorable experiance. The room was spotless - no smells, no bugs, no stains and large enough to accomadate a great many people, not to mention that all esentials were provided. The grounds are fashioned in way that gives one the ultimate feeling of relaxation, either by the pool or soaking in the hot tubs, or enjoying the tropical bar that rests just moments from the rooms. The services provided by the front desk were top notch. Not only were we provided maps of the area, but we were updated on flight information, theme park attractions, and given fantastic recommendations on local dining, events, and shopping. Further, what we found most impressive is the fact that received a one bedroom villa, complete with Living Room, Dining Room, Kitchen, Bathroom with Hot tub, balcony with chairs and table all for the price of a basic hotel room. We give props to the Marriott Grand Vista for completing a perfect Honeymoon

Reviews.Title: “Hmmmm.....On the fence”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are owners having purchased through The Grande Vista five years ago....Very nice resort and the new decor is tasteful and pretty, however......We have returned once as owners {three years ago} and we were dis-appointed as to the cleaniness of our room......{The first room we were given was home to many ants and not a non-smoking as requested, that problem was corrected promtly} After a thorough cleaning by me, we felt comfortable in the re-assigned room. As owners, we attended a sales presentation with the hopes of selling us another week......The experience was pretty low key however, when we expressed our concern that we were not being serviced in regards to items that were not working properly in our room, our salesperson laughed and basically said, "Yeah, frustrating, huh?" Needless to say....We still own just our initial Two Bedroom! We went to The Horizon Resort in Orlando, also a Marriott resort, this time and the vacation was perfect........To compare the two my husband and agreed that management is far above that of the Grande Vista and the best part was that I did not have to clean upon check in! We may own at the Grande Vista, a more posh environment, but we will be visiting Horizon's until "The Vista" can get it together!

Reviews.Title: “sweet!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: the parties on the beach r sweet. u get drunk and gurls wanna hook up. it helps to look like a nascar driver's brother

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice Accommodations”
Reviews.Author: ScrabbleNut
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Marriott Grande Vista Resorts from Jan 21 - 28, 2005. We had a one-bedroom junior suite, which was fine for two people. The room was clean, decorated nicely and no "funky-hotel" smell. It is in such a private and secluded location, yet convenient to I-4 -- which is the main road to all the theme parks (Disney and Universal and others). It is also up the road from Sea World. I also like that it was close to a Publix supermarket for quick shopping needs. What you get from this resort is peace and quiet....no noisy children running in the hallways like in a hotel, and no road noise.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I am currently staying here at the MGV. Before booking, I did extensive research, checking Trip Advisor etc. for reviews of all the hotels I was interested in. The bug issue scared me, but I decided to go ahead and book - and am I glad we did! The hotel is absolutely GORGEOUS. We asked for a newly refurbished room - and it is great! Yes, is there room for improvement - of course there is. But there ALWAYS is.... I find the staff to be INCREDIBLY nice, accomodating and in NO WAY were we badgered to attend any kind of seminar (although, we are going to before we leave). We are renting the 2 bd villa and find it to be very spacious. I could tell you of some small, insignificant things that aren't good - but why??? You'll get it anywhere you go... I highly recommend this resort - Very conveinently located as well!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased with our Marriott's Grande Vista stay.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband, our 5 year old daughter, and myself stayed at the MGV from 1/2/05 through 1/9/05. I relied very much upon the weekly reviews I received from Tripadvisor, which seemed to be on key. We rented a deluxe room - this is not a one-bedroom villa. It is the smallest rental unit they have, but it was plenty of room for the 3 of us. The room also had a kitchenette with all the necessary amenities (small fridge, microwave, coffee maker, toaster, etc.) The room was very clean and we did not encounter any bug issues, which some of the reviews had mentioned. We also had a very nice view of one of the pools and golf course. The resort itself had many ammenties to offer and the grounds were very well maintained. The multiple pools and hot tubs were very clean and kept at a nice temperature. We stayed at this location for our first trip to Disney and we thought it was very, very convenient to all the parks. We did not encounter any traffic problems/delays getting to and from the parks (approximately 10 minutes or so to each). Overall, we were very happy with our experience at the MGV and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dstew
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a one bedroom. I loved being able to make breakfast each morning and do my laundry before going home. The weather was beautiful, so sitting on the screened porch at night was very relaxing. The jacuzzi tub was a great way to end the day. I will book this property again.

Reviews.Title: “Fun but not the best!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We came down from Maine to visit with my father. My husband, and three kids (7, 2, & 1), myslelf and father in a three bedroom. Was very spacious. My husband and kids spend most of the time in the arcade, that was a great feature. But the inside of the room wasn't that great. The coffee table was rusted and the couch stunk. The whirlpool wasn't clean either. But overall was a really comfy place. The place overall wasn't huge like some of the other places we've been. The pools were smaller too. The best part, will sound crazy, was the bike for four we rented. My husband and I paddled the bike, two of the kids sat in the back and our daughter sat in the basket on the front. We never laughed so hard! DO IT! Next time we are going to try Marriott's Cypress Harbour. Like to try them all!

Reviews.Title: “I JUST LOVE IT!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just have to say Thank you to the Marriot team, My husband and I try to take at least a week off for our self every year, We have an exchange service with Interval world and They locate us at the Marriot Grande Vista, We just love it, We are even planing to buy a time share with them, the staff was always friendly, It was clean, and the view was just out of this world , I am sure We will be back with the kids , they will be so happy with all the activities that the resort offer , the resort is very close to the parks and shops wich make it very easy to move around. The marriot Grande Vista is the perfect place to go with your family if you want to have the ultimate vacation time. THANK YOU GRANDE VISTA !!!

Reviews.Title: “Orlando's Best”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a wonderful Christmas vacation at Grande Vista. It was huge....much bigger than any resort that we have every stayed at. Very nicely decorated. The resort is on beautiful manicured golf resort. Our granddaughter loved the indoor playground . We only wish that they had an indoor pool as she was a little stuffy and couldnt swim outside. We would highly recommend this resort. It is quiet, laid back and exactly what our family was looking for.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome stay”
Reviews.Author: Athens123
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the MVG from December 12 through December 26th. We had a small unit at the San Marcos Building. The room had just been refurbished and was pleasant. We had a nice view of the lake. Our experience is a very positive one. We found the staff to be very friendly and helpful. Our requests were handled almost immediately. The resort is beautiful. The area and the grounds are well maintained and clean. During the first week of our stay it was not very crowded so we enjoyed the peace and tranquility. The resort has many amenities for all ages to enjoy. I think we met the the purpose of our vacation. Our goal was to enjoy peace and quiet to relax from our busy working schedules. In one word: awesome! The location of the resort is convenient to parks, malls and the airport. We recommend this resort to all who will visit Orlando in the near future. We will definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: gbplans
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at a 2 bedroom villa with our 20 month old twin grandbabies and their parents. We are Marriott Vacation Club owners elsewhere and traded this week for one of ours through Interval International. We were more than pleased with the accomodations. The 2 bedroom villa was very spacious and well appointed. It included 3 TVs with 2 VCRs as well as a full dining area, complete kitchen with utensils and a washer and dryer. We had a very nice view of a lake with two patios one of which was screened in. The on-site Marketplace had most everything one could need but with a limited selection. We were only a few minutes away from a Publix supermarket and a drug store so this was no big deal. On our first day we received a phone call inviting us to take a timeshare presentation tour in return for a $100 credit or 15,000 Marriott Rewards points. We politely declined and were not bothered with this again. The staff was friendly. However, we honestly have to give mixed reviews because of several problems that we encountered. Our daughter and son-in-law arrived aboyt 15 minutes after us in a separate car. Although I had specifically asked the front desk to advise them where our villa was located, they did not do so and refused to direct them to us.
