They had to call me on my cell phone so that I could meet them at the front desk, arrange for them to get keys, and show them where we were staying. This was avoidable had the front desk clerk taht I spoke to instructed the others as to my simple request. Since we were travelling with two 20 month old toddlers I had called and pre-ordered two cribs and highchairs. Upon check-in I again confirmed this with the front desk and was assured that they would be in our room. This was not the case. It took several phone calls and nearly an hour and a half of waiting before they were delivered. Meanwhile, the children were unable to get to sleep until much later than originally planned. This meant that we got a much later start the next morning than we otherwise would have. We subsequently had some problems with a faulty toaster and coffeemaker as well as with our dishwasher. These were not resolved until we had made several phone calls. It seemed that making just one request was not sufficient. After I complained to the Front Desk Manager, he gave us a $50 credit for our trouble and things went more smoothly. One night my wife and I had dinner at Nick's Grille. The dinner was well prepared but pricey. Our daughter and son-in-law also ate there later that evening but with less satisfactory results. Both ordered filets which came out less well done than requested. Both were sent back. My son-in-law's then came back the way it was originally ordered but my daughter's was still undercooked. It went back another time but came back tasting like fuel oil. I doubt that they use fuel oil to cook it so the chef may have "doctored" it to express his dissatisfaction with the second return. My daughter then told the waitress that it was inedible and that she would share my son-in-law's steak. Although they were not charged for her order, no one apologized much less offered them a complmentary dessert. We had much better service and food off premises so I don't know if this was an isolated instance or not. There were lots of activities for children including daily morning activities for real little ones. However, the plastic balls in the play area were grimy and some had food and gunk on them. My wife, who is a children's activities director, had to tell the staff that our local health department would not have tolerated this lack of sanitation and then had to instruct them in the proper way to clean these balls. This was very dissappointing for a Marriott. Since we had traded a timeshare week instead of renting directly we were not entitled to daily housekeeping. We learned that if we wanted complimentary fresh towels every day we had to ask for them. We also paid $35 to have housekeeping clean our unit and change our linens in the middle of our stay. This required 24 hours advance notice. In summary, a nice place to stay but with really mixed reviews for service.

Reviews.Title: “Just awesome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband, our 2 kids ages 8 and 10 and myself stayed at the Grande Vista in February 2004. It was absolutely awesome, we stayed in a corner suite with a Jacuzzi and a full kitchen and 2 bedrooms. It was beautiful and the service was amazing. I will stay there when I go to Disney again. My son thought the playroom was the best place to play and wanted to end every evening in there. They play area has an enormous inside jungle gym and the pools were wonderful. It was a dream vacation!

Reviews.Title: “disappointing”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have to concur with the previous reviewer- We have just stayed in Marbella (Oct-Nov)and it was impeccable. On the other hand, Grand Vista is poorly managed. We are owners, we bought there last year and we were exspecting something wonderful. They must have put us in the same old tatty building. The couch was dirty and worn and when we pulled it out for my son to visit--on his way to Iraq- well he is likely to find it cleaner there. They never replaced the mattress even with numerous complaints. The best I could get was a mattress pad. There were ants in the kitchen, the floor was greasy and there was no mop or broom. Broken hair dryers, enough dust to write a novel in and it was just plain dirty and tatty everywhere. The handrails, the doors--dirty dirty dirty. They did finally send someone to clean and he cleaned some things and the promised spots on the rugs---not...they really do not care. And the worst part we had brought friends who were considering buying. I have never been so embarassed- they were not impressed and management seemed to not care at all. They offered to move us on wednesday--we were settled, thanksgiving the next day and it was simply not worth it-- they had long worn us out. We also own at the Royal Palm and although it is older it is cleaner and the kitchen is better equiped. That is where I will opt to stay when we go to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “love the resort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: i stayed at this hotel and i thought it was the greatest thing in the world. My family stayed in one of the nicest rooms i have ever been in. i would suggest going there to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Very good, BUT”
Reviews.Author: clintaughjl
Reviews.Content: Normally we stay at Disney Boardwalk resort, as we are DVC members. However we had already used our points in May so needed to find an alternative for this additional break in Orlando. We chose the Grande Vista partly on the back of the Tripadvisor reviews, which in the main are very positive, and partly because in August we had a week at the Marriott Marbella Beach resort in Spain. The Spanish resort was of a high standard and I think comparable with Disney's better resorts. It also helped that we were able to get a very good weekly rate through Interval International. Due to a delayed flight we did not check in until after 11pm. The one bedroom apartment was sited on the ground floor, backing onto the golf course. First impressions on entering the apt were positive. It was large and appeared well furnished and equiped. As it was late we fell into bed, hoping for a good nights sleep. Sadly the mattress was so worn it made sleeping uncomfortable. In the morning we found that the toilet cistern was broken, and had to use a saucepan to fill up the cistern. Looking around the apartment it was clear, in daylight, that we were in an older block and much of the furnishings/decor were a bit scruffy and frayed. Given that we hadn't paid a great deal for the apartment I was prepared to put up with the minor faults in decor but of course wanted the toilet repaired and the mattress replaced. Both of which I reported to reception. If at that point reception had said "sorry and of course we'll get the problems fixed immediately, and in the meantime have a free drink at the pool bar" I would have been quite happy. Instead there was no apolgy, and I was casually told that the matter would be reported to maintenance. When asked when I could expect the toilet to be fixed, and what about the mattress, I was told that it would be added to the maintenance schedule and they "should" get round to it that day. This wasn't acceptable and I asked to be moved to a different apartment Initially I was told the complex was fully booked etc etc but after some argy bargy with reception and housekeeping we were eventually allocated an apartment in one of the new blocks (Alicante) which was sited across a bridge from the main reception and overlooked the lake. The decor & furnishings were exactly like the previous apartment but much newer and in good condition. No bugs and the one dificulty we had with the safe was resolved within half an hour of reporting the problem. We were close to a nice pool area, which was cleverly designed to provide a play area for children and a quieter area for adults. Plenty of beds and a nice snack bar at pool side. Importantly the pool area and grounds were very well maintained and clean. I cant' say the same for the walkways and stairs leading to the apartments as these, for long times, were quite grimy and littered with trash, cigarette butts etc. We had read mixed reports abot the restaurant, Nick's Grill, but decided to have an evening meal. A wee bit pricey but both the food and service were excellent, and we would certainly eat there again. The complex is large and set in extensive grounds around a lake and golf course, very picturesque. Accommodation is in Spanish style six storey blocks, with new blocks going up.Location is good. Close to Disney, Sea World and International Drive. There is a good supermarket (Publix) 5 minutes away, quite handy as I felt the on site store was lacking in some basics, particularly fresh bread/rolls. Certainly if you are allocated a newer block you should have no complaints. Refurbishment of the older blocks needs to be improved. Another concern is that as more and more blocks go up will the facilities keep pace? Whilst I still prefer Disney, I do think the Grande Vista has a lot going for it and would be happy to return, providing I could chose my apartment.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice!”
Reviews.Author: lhs1
Reviews.Content: We rented a two bedroom villa. Children on one side , living area in the middle (pull out couch if you wish to use), our bedroom on the other side. Full kitchen and nice dining table. Three TV's. Very spacious. Grounds are kept clean. Main pool was heated. Staff very helpful. Even some activities in the evening. Supervised childrens club. Convenience store on site , even a Pizza Hut. Close to Seaworld but only a short ride to Universal or the Disney parks. Main golf course worth the $, the 9 hole was only $30.00 to play - if you had enough time you could play twice in the same day. Can't say enough about the Grande Vista. Would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Beware”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just wanted to let others know about our experience with Hotelopia. We booked what was suppose to be a 2BR, 2Bath Villa At the Marriott Grande Vista in Orlando... We called Marriott day before our departure to confirm our reservation, only to learn that what was really booked was a Studio Room (very small 1 BD and sofa bed). After spending whole day on phone trying to correct problem with no results, we had to leave for Fl... When arriving at Marriott, problem still persisted. They called Hotelopia and finally got us a 1 BR, 1Bath suite(still not what we paid for) After 90 minutes talking with Marriott's manager, we were able to add an additional BR and Bath, giving us what we were suppose to have reserved... Of course this cost us an additional $459 for the 4 nights we had booked. Just BEWARE of what you are really getting when you book... after this experience will NEVER use Hotelopia again!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A GREAT VACATION STAY!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I along with another couple stayed at this resort from October 23rd until October 30th and enjoyed it very much. The entire staff was very friendly and the prices did not bring tears to your eyes as you paid. The resort was very well maintained and very clean. We would come back in a heartbeat. Mal Eckert Lee, Massachusetts

Reviews.Title: “Stress free hotel”
Reviews.Author: Seth
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 10/23 thru 10/29/04 Wonderful hotel, the pools and grounds are beautiful. Stayed in a new unit, large rooms, very nicely decorated and very clean. Staff friendly. Would go back in a heartbeat. Close to attractions.

Reviews.Title: “I will never stay on Disney Property Again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First, a little background...this is like our 8th or 9th trip to Disney in 18 years. This will be the 5th trip with children. In all the previous visits with children, we stayed on property at at Disney moderate resort (Carribean Beach or Coronado Springs). When I went to make the Disney reservations, the best price I got was $159 (previous years were like $80 or so). That's when I started to look around... I've been a Marriott rewards member for some time (Silver Elite status) and was poking around their web site at about the same time I got a promotional email that indicated a discount code. I tried it and got a fantastic rate: a 2 bedroom unit for $141. I booked it immediately. Kept looking around still, but never found better. Was a little worried about some of the negative reviews (bugs, disrepair, etc), but when we got there, all that was put to rest. First off, the grounds were just beautiful. Tip top. Immaculate. As good or better than any disney property. When I checked in, I asked for a renovated room. We got our room, but it was on the 1st floor (had requested a high room). Went back, and were given a room on the 5th floor, in bld 97, which is right next to one of the 4 pools. The room was great. There were a few nit-pick items such as a worn carpet threshold and a missing piece of base tile in the bathroom. Other than that, it was perfect. Staff was wonderful, made a few phone calls to the front desk (dead batteries in a remote and something else) and they were taken care of immedately. I did not see any bugs, dead or alive. We went to the main pool area (pools is more like it) at the village center. lets see: there's the big pool, a lap pool, one 'cool' hot tub, and one 'hot' hot tub, and one kids pool. Also went to the other pool area across the lake: 'play pool', pool near the bar, hot tub #1, hot tub #2, and a kids pool. All the pools were in top condition. The onsite pizza hut was great. did take out twice there...friendly staff. the small grocery store was well stocked and reasonable. didn't spend much time in the kids areas or kids activities. In summary, it's a fantastic resort. I won't every stay on disney property again.

Reviews.Title: “We will be back I hope soon!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our vacation at the Grande Vista was awesome. (September 19-October 3, 2004) The room was awesome. Good taste with decor!!! We felt like we were at home. Our son loved this place. Lots of children's fun activities all day. The play room was fun and very nice. You can rent (fairly new release) movies. Nice work out room! Nice arcade room. Free popcorn. We love having pizza hut on campus. A small little market also (bag of ice is free). We loved all the pools although we did spend most of our time at the Copa Loca pool side. This pool is huge with fountains, basketball goals, volleyball net (balls are free to rent at the Copa Loca). There are cannon guns in towers that you may spray into the pool. Two nice hot tubs and a kiddie pool. The Copa Loca food was pretty tasty! There are nice porch swings by the lake. They are wonderful after a day at the pool and go relax! We surrvived Jeanne. Our room did get some water damage. But we were accomadated immediatly! We felt very safe with our stay during the hurricane. The staff were happy to answer any questions we had. We recieved several voice mails updating us about the hurricane. I cannot say enough about the friendly staff they were always helpful and friendly. I have read some negative reviews about the Marriot Grande Vista...but I am here to tell you it is a 5 star stay! We did see a dead roach. But hey it wasn't the first time we saw a roach in Flordia. We were a little shook but did not see anymore (it was dead). We sure thought our room was very clean. All the beds, linens, pillows, bath towels etc... were above and beyond clean! We were accomadated each day with bath and linen needs upon request and a voice mail with feed back if there were any problems. The beds and pillows were very comfy! We can't say enough about this place. We have stayed at two different deluxe Disney resorts we were much more impressed with the Marriot Grande Vista! Downtown Disney is only 5-10 minutes away! We will be back in May!

Reviews.Title: “ok stay, but not grand”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 stayed at the grande Vista the week of 9-26 thru 10-3-04. We arrived and were given a room that looked like it had been cleaned, but had a box of cereal on the counter and newspapers on the coach. This room also had wet carpeting in the living room and a ripped screen on the patio. We requested another room. Staff was very accomadating and we switched rooms. This room had more wet carpeting, we were told at this point that most of the rooms might due to the hurricane that weekend. We also found a dead cockroach in our bathroom which we were told was also from the hurricane. We asked for yet another room, climbed 3 flights of stairs since the elevators were still down from the hurricane to a room that finally did not have wet carpeting or dead cockroaches. The set up was nice and the whirlpool was great. The room it self was a bit worn.It was not as nice as i expected, and we enjoyed our stay at Horizons much more.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend!”
Reviews.Author: MFB68
Reviews.Content: We had a very nice stay here! The suite was very clean and spacious. Great amenities, the suite even had a washer/dryer. Wonderful pools, enjoyed the golf course, good food at Nick's Place. Very friendly staff, would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “This resort is outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a stay at the Grande Vista resort and it was an excellent place to stay. Our trip was delayed by two days due to hurricane Jeanne. We arrived the day after Jeanne had gone through Orlando and the staff were already cleaning up the resort and it was all done by the next day. Our room had some water damage so we asked for another room and we were immediately moved. The staff are extremely friendly and accommodating. The resort is gorgeous and the one bedroom suite we had was beautiful with all the amenities. All the Orlando attractions were within a fifteen minute drive. I would highly recommend this resort and we plan on returning!

Reviews.Title: “Garbage!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Dirty, Old, Bugs in my room, Palce is just like a motel 6!!! Very Dated! This place is JUNK!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at Marriott's Grand Vista for three nights. I about backed out and booked another place because I was a little skeptical about staying at a "timeshare" property. The reviews I read on this website made me stay with my original decision, and boy am I glad we did. These people NEVER even mentioned the timeshare to us. It was like staying at a regular hotel. We did have to pay full price, which was $179.00 per night for the 2 bedroom suite. It was worth the extra money to be able to just focus on our trip and not worry about people bothering you. This resort is beautiful! I wished I had more time to stay there. My children didn't mind leaving the parks early because they had several pools to choose from when they got back. The rooms were very neat and clean. The beds were so comfortable. The staff was very nice and helpful. I would recommed this place to anyone, especially those with children. Next time I go to Flordia, I know where I will stay!

Reviews.Title: “Dream Vacation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed from August 8-21st. The rooms and adjoining suite were designed beautifully and with excellent views. The palm theme in the all the details throughout the resort from fabrics, art, and plantings were tasteful. The landscape planting was better than the adjacent resorts and the high maintenance of the grounds made the place sparkle. The clean up crew did a remarkably quick job after the hurricane. The emergency hurricane prep by the staff included extensive messages to the guests as well as water jugs and light sticks. The hurricane was not traumatic for the kids and after 24 hours the pool was cleaned and the fountains flowing. The Hawaiian shirts on the staff and crew added to the relaxed atmosphere. I found the employees to be very helpful and pleasant. We lived at the main pool complex and used the exercise room and game room extensively. We came home feeling relaxed and happy. My nine-year-old and thirteen-year-old want to do it again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Facility but...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got back today and overall we had a great vacation! The property, golf course, activities for children and pools are spectacular! The villa that we stayed in was very nice... clean and well kept. My only complaint and the one thing that kept me from giving an Excellent rating was the VERY poor service experiences that we had with both the Concierge (on more than one occasion) and at Nick's Grill (also on more than one occasion.) I'd go into details, but this review wouldn't become that helpful... My only two suggestions would be to have an alternate or backup dining plan if you want to try Nick's Grill AND don't bother with the Concierge desk...its a joke!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Grande Vista for 3 nights. Upon arriving to our unit we found it had not been cleaned from prior guest. Towels on the floor, bathtub filthy, etc. Called the front desk and a new refurbished unit was provided immediately. The unit had nice new furniture, layout was great. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice resort in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: travelsalot65
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott Grande Vista recently and had a wonderful time. The resort is very convenient to the theme parks and the grounds are absolutely gorgeous! They had construction going on while we were there but honestly we didn't hear (or see) any of it. We were worrried about that too, but it is way off in the distance in another phase they are building. The pools are nice and the traffic is not bad around the resort or on the way to the theme parks. The rooms were nice but in need of some minor maintenance - grout & caulk in bathrooms showing age but everything else was clean and functional. There is a brand new shopping center less than a mile from this resort with a few retaurants and a Publix grocery store. We would go back to this resort again when we return to Orlando. Great location and very pretty resort.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: luv2travel1005
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Marriott Grande Vista July 17th - July 24th, 2004. It was a wonderful vacation! You know your're in for a treat when you drive down the long drive and see the magnificent manicured lawns. We stayed in a 3 bedroom that had 2 balconies. The one off of the master bedroom was screened in. That bedroom also had a jacuzzi. All of the bedrooms had their own bathrooms. It was very spacious and clean. We were in building 93 "The Lago". It overlooked the golf course. We went on walks and all the employees we met while walking would say "hello" or "good morning". My parents attended a timeshare presentation, but didn't buy because they already own a timeshare with Marriott in Branson, Mo. They were so wowed with the resort that they said if they didn't own one already they would have bought there for sure. They have many many kids activities and exercise classes. The fitness room was nice with very up-to-date equipment. They have an awesome children's playroom with supervised sitting. They're awesome views of the lake and the swimming pools are very nice. I have to comment. I've read reviews where people complain about big bugs. This resort does a fine job of being clean. Florida has bugs, big ones. You cannot avoid it. Northerners are sometimes appauled at these insects, however the South does have big bugs. I'm from the North and am not fond of them at all and not used to them. You see a bug or two at night outside in the street once in awhile, they aren't crawling all over the place in the rooms. I would have never stayed there if that were true. All in all we travel a lot, so there is experience behind my opinions. This Marriott is a great place to stay and we will return.

Reviews.Title: “Yuck”
Reviews.Author: logan57907
Reviews.Content: This hotel was absolutley horrible. Our room was disgusting. Everything from the spiders to the peach colored toilet paper made the room sick. The room was ugly and cheap. There were bugs all over our balcony. Also, our main door, there was a big gap between the door and the floor so bugs could come in. Engineering always failed to come and fix it. How irratating is that? House Keeping only came once during the 4 days we were there. The bathroom smelled like mildew and was just gross. Also, that resort area is in a sucky area and has HORRIBLE cell phone reception. You had to stand outside to use your cell phone and didn't really get any signal. It always cut out ( for both, Verizon and Nextel). Next time, we're sticking to a Ritz-Carlton.

Reviews.Title: “Was Great until...”
Reviews.Author: cutedisney
Reviews.Content: We were at this resort from July 6th to 11th. It was great until the 3rd night when we came home and turned on the light and saw a 2 inch ROACH! We live in NY and have not seen anything like that. We called the front desk and someone came 10 min later. He did take care of the problem but from then on we were scared of what else would come out. And we kept the kitchen area spotless too! Other than that the resort was very nice.. But they should take care of this issue!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it - Purchased week”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The week of June 28 was our 2nd stay at the Grande Vista. Our 1st stay was in January and at that time we purchased a 2 bedroom timeshare. The grounds and lake area are beautiful and well maintained. The staff, especially the front desk, are friendly and willing to help. The activities are numerous for every age. My 3 year old daughter loves the indoor play jungle area, although at times some parents let their kids get out of control. The staff should probably try to maintain a little more order in this area. The one bedroom with full kitchen was very spacious and well maintained. The one bedroom with limited kitchen was comfortable with the kitchen area large enough for preparing snacks and small meals. The staff have always gone above and beyond to assist us with any need. It is unfortunate to have a negative experience, but from our experiences and from conversations with others at the resort, negative experiences are the exception and not the norm. We enjoy our stays at this resort. We have stayed at other resorts in the Orlando area and this one is definitely our favorite.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott's Grande Vista Going Downhill”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family and I just completed 13 nights at this resort. The grounds leading up to the check-in area are beautiful(well kept for timeshare sales presentation area). This was our 4thstay at this resort and most likely our last. Our villa was trashed by a prior guest and in dire need of some TLC: 2 outlets in the DR were kicked in, the light above the front door was used as a basketball hoop, there was a hole in the MBR makeup area the size of a man's fist, the silverware drawer took 2 adult hands to open, our NS villa had been used by a cigar club, MB shower stall was moldy, trash left on grounds and in parking lots. The new pool is loud and children were there without supervision. What once was a pristine resort was not so special this visit. After notifying management about these conditions, repairs were made to the villa, but we never heard a word from the staff inquiring about our less than acceptable villa. Prior stays always resulted in my kids wanting to go back, not so this time.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel....loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Suezee101
Reviews.Content: We just got back from three nights at the Marriott Grande Vista. This is a gorgeous hotel! When we drove in the long driveway and manicured grounds, I knew it was going to be a special place. We had a one bedroom villa that included a kitchen and washer/dryer, which was wonderful after ten days away from home! We enjoyed the pools and never had a difficult time finding a lounge chair to relax in. The hotel has activities for everyone. I just wish we had more time to utilize all of the amenities. I would definitely recommend this hotel. I hope we can visit Orlando in the future and stay again at this wonderful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our family recently visited the Marriott Grande Vista and it was wonderful. The rooms were very clean, spacious and beautifully decorated. The staff was helpful and very polite. We really enjoyed the whirlpool in the room. The pool area was very nice, there were a lot of chairs and the water was nice. You had a lot of activites for young and older kids. Our family reunion was perfect thanks to Grande Vista.

Reviews.Title: “Great Times at Vista”
Reviews.Author: disneydiva17
Reviews.Content: Let me just say that Grande Vista is a wonderful resort. We've stayed there at least 4 times and have loved every minute of it. If you're looking for a resort to stay at to visit the parks, look no further. This resort caters to almost any family, big or small, young or old you'll enjoy grande vista. The pools are wonderful and abundant. Rooms spacious and clean. Property well upkept and service immpeccable. My favorite part is the balcony/porch that you can sit out on at the end of a long day and relax or enjoy your morning paper. There is a full kitchen in every room, so you can cook some of your own meals. (I highly reccommend the Publix supermarket right down the road for your groceries) You can even do your own laundry. So, what are you waiting for??

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Big Place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I went with my family to Florida to go to Universal and Disney World. We stayed at Marriott Grande Vista. The hotel was huge and the hotel rooms were just like your own House!! It was beautiful I mean B E A Utiful. I am going to live there or just go there every year.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding property”
Reviews.Author: owensboroKentucky
Reviews.Content: This resort is pure Marriott luxury. We stayed in a two bedroom villa near the main pool area. Our building had just been redecorated, so everything was brand new. Our children loved the pools. There are several to choose from: the main area has a freeform pool with a waterfall and fountains to play in, another had all kinds of fountains and squirts, and volleyball/ basketball. Our rooms were large and well appointed. The daily maid service was great. Easy access to Sea World/ Discovery Cove and a million restaurants. Disney parks were about a 7 minute easy drive. This is our 4th trip to Orlando in 5 yrs. We will stay here if we come back. It was the best!

Reviews.Title: “great atmosphere, very relaxing area”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband, our 3 y/o, my Mom and myself stayed at the Grand vista resort in a 3 bedroom Unit. It was wonderful. We were about 7 minutes from disney. We had cleaning serving everyday, everything was at our fingertips. It had a full kitchenette, dining table, washer and dryer, 2 balconies with nice views. 3 bathrooms and a jacuzzi tub. If one should stay there, just know to ask questions. There were some negative reviews and I believe that questions were not asked prior to booking their stay. Here are some questions: Where are the renovated units, are they adjoining interior doors (if a 2 or 3 bedroom unit), which units have smoking, what amenities are available in the units, which ones have views of the pool and/ or golf course, which units have parking lot views. This can suade people to see this resort on the negative side. I didnt agree with some of the negative reviews.. I hope this review helps future guests of this resort area to have a nicer stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: #1Cubsfan
Reviews.Content: Grande Vista is a wonderful place to stay when vacationing Orlando. The staff was helpful and friendly from check-in through check-out. They were always available to help. Need extra towels? No problem; they'll send someone right away. Need advice on where to eat? Their concierge service is helpful. Need something faxed to take care of business back home? The front desk will fax for free. Plenty of activities for kids. The rooms were nice and clean. Around the corner less than 1/2 mile away is strip mall with a grocery store, a couple fast-food restaurants, a pizza joint, a Thai restaurant, gas stations, and movie rental store.

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: RTR6
Reviews.Content: We originally came down here for a time share presentation 2/03 and we bought!....Have been here now 1/04 and for 4 days 5/04. This last time we paid the Marriott web site rate of only $104.00 per night from 5/13-5/17/04, for a deluxe guest room that was about 400sq ft. with a king bed, sleep sofa, and small kitchenette with refrig. coffee maker, sink, dishes etc. all rooms have a balcony and our ours had a view of the pool and golf course in building 92, room 1429 (4th floor out of 6). The pools are fabulous, with bar's and a deli and pizza hut! The location is perfect. You are about 2 miles or so from the big "strip" on International Drive without having to live with the crowd and noise that area inherently has. there was a publix 2 miles in the opposite direction where you can by your food supplies etc... Parking is right in front of your bldg, for no cost. There is construstion going on, but it isnt in anybodys way. The place is growing, with a major additional water play area to be added. So far we are very satisified.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: takingamoment
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 4 night stay. The hotel was just like we read about on this sight. We had the deluxe room, which was quite spacious for 2 adults and 1 child. The hotel staff was very courteous, the room was extremely clean and the grounds were beautiful. The hotel is situated in an ideal locale along International Drive. Less than 1/2 hour to all attractions and to the airport, but in a nice quiet area away from too much traffic. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful 3BR/3BA”
Reviews.Author: overnightraveler
Reviews.Content: Just back from 5 nights at MGV. Our group was 2 fiftysomethings, 3 thirtysomethings, 1 toddler and 1 baby. All three of the bedrooms were very large and all had their own connecting bathrooms. Loved the bed mix (1 king, 1 queen with sofabed, 2 doubles) and the fact that each bedroom had its own television. Condo was very nicely decorated and clean. We got the housekeeping service which was excellent. We were in building 83 which was very convenient to the central hub and main pool. Could both hear and see construction across the lake, but it didn't start early and wasn't intrusive (nephew able to nap each afternoon). With two small children we spent a fair amount of time at the resort versus the parks. Main pool was nice with waterfalls, an interactive fountain kids could play in and gated baby pool. Was somewhat crowded, but could always get seats. Overall we loved the resort. Great quiet location midway between Disney and Universal. Only negative I would list was limited dining options if you choose not to cook. Small convenience store with snacks and subs and the pizza window are fine for a meal or two but wouldn't want to be stuck here without a car.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the resort!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott's Grande Vista for 1 week in end of April and it was great! We were 2 couples with 3 two-year olds. We went to SeaWorld one morning and Animal Kingdom another morning, but the rest of the time was spent at the resort. The accomodations were excellent and great for kids, especially with a full kitchen and washer/dryer in the unit. We were in building #81 overlooking the main pool area- a great view on the screened-in balcony. We ate most of our meals in, since 3 toddlers are hard to handle at restaurants. This saved us a lot of money, and we were able to have nice quiet dinners after the kids went to sleep. There is a big Publix down the road for grocery shopping. We even bought a small cooler and packed drinks down to the pool with us. The pools were great- there is a children's pool that is about 1 foot deep throughout, so the kids can go in and play pretty much on their own. The main pool is huge, there was never a problem with getting chairs. There is also a beach in front of the lake, where the kids can play and run in the sand- you can check out pails and shovels, etc. at the activities center for free. There is also an indoor gameroom and children's play area with a ball pit and one of those climbing mazes and slide. This was great when it rained and when we needed to get out of the sun. Overrall this was the best resort we have stayed in for families, and we will definitely come here again!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Nice Stuff”
Reviews.Author: flfddy
Reviews.Content: Overall the Mariott Grande Vista was very nice. I must preface this by saying that we did not spend a lot of time there as we were running to the parks quite often. A couple tips to keep in mind. Definitely request to be in the main area/pavilion. We were in one across the way from the main area, and we never used anything. Not even the really nice looking pool. It was just too far and we're lazy. Second, we were put in a handicapped room, which was fine really, but the bathroom was definitely different. I would have liked to have been in a different room, but it was still very nice. Other concerns are that there was no maid service, so your towels are what you get for the week. Of course you can wash them yourself with the Washer/Dryer unit in there. The property was gorgeous adn the room was very nicely appointed. Overall definitely worht the transfer fee for the time share in the Poconos.

Reviews.Title: “The Grandest Resort You'll Ever Find”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: When we stayed at this resort for two weeks in Februrary of 2004, it was a dream come true. Many people on this website claim that their stay was disappointing. I simply canoot understand how they can possibly say that! The Grande Vista was the BEST resort my family has EVER stayed at. We had a corner 3 bedroom unit on the top floor of one of the buildings. Our building's poowas never busy. The room was absolutely stunning (and HUGE! biggest and lovliest villa of all time I tell you!) and the facilities were perfect. There were a million activities to do. I loved the lakeside campfire. It was very far out of the way of high traffic areas which was nice. If you're going to Sea World, you can practically walk! Disney is a short drive. If you have never stayed at this resort, you are really missing out! It is truly the experience of a lifetime.

Reviews.Title: “Just Great!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I stayed at Grande Vista in January 2004. We had what we consider, to have been a wonderful time and plan to go again next year. Everything about the resort was first rate all the way. I would recommend Grande Vista to anyone, that would like to experience the best that Orlando has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family and I visited the Marriott Grand Vista on April 17, 2000 to April 24, 2000. We had a wonderful time during our stay there. The Marriott is a great place to stay in Orlando. The Marriott Grand Vista was well organized, the rooms were clean & had a beautiful pool or should I say pools. If you stay at the Marriott Grand Vista, try to get a room near the lobby because if you are far from the front you will have to walk a long way to go to the main pool. The other complexes have pools too but all the activities are at the main pool which is an amazing pool. At lunch time they played games in the pool for the little kids and there were sometimes shows at night. The Pina Coladas and Strawberry Daquiries were great there. We were there for Easter so there was an Egg hunt for the children. They also had little motorized boats for a relaxing ride and view. For activities they had bicycles for two or four people which were a lot of fun. The staff and the animators were really friendly. The grounds & exterior buildings were beautiful. So enjoy your stay and hope I helped!!

Reviews.Title: “The Trip advisor reviews were bang on! Wonderful family resort.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our stay at the Grande Vista and felt compelled to write a review. Want to say firstly, many thanks to all those who take the time to write in and relay their opinions. We relied heavily on the reviews of the Grande Vista before deciding on accomodation. This resrt is absolutely fantastic! From the winding palm tree entrace to the immpecable customer service our stay was everything we had hoped for. We stayed in building #80 which is the main building on the resort. we have three kids (8,7 and 3) and wanted the convenience of the ammenities close buy as well as close access to the main pool. In building 80 is the Marketplace store (offers everything you would want from grocery to drinks (kids and adults) as well as a Pizza Hut and made to order sandwiches. Everything can be paid cash or billed to your room. The other services are located close to the main building as well (Lighthouse Bar, kids activites etc). The main pool is wonderful and the kids enjoyed it as much as the parks. The chairs around the pool fill up quickly however and my advice would be to have someone from your room head down with towels (which you can get from the front desk free of charge) early ( i went at 7:30 to 8 and wasn't the first there) to reserve some chairs around the pool. They also have large , portable umbrellas that can be rolled to your desired location (highly recommended if you have young kids in the pool and want to stay at poolside but also want some shade.) Also, you do not have to buy drinks from the poolside bar (at bit pricey even at happy hour 3- 6...5-7 $ for a frozen drink). I took a cooler down in the morning loaded with juice, water and drinks for the adults :) Bags of ice are free from the Marketplace (beside the pool). Ours room was exceptional with newly appointed paint and furniture. We had a two bedroom unit which offer plenty of room for our party of six (parents, kids and grandma). Check out the planner of activites they give you at check in. Anyway, great time had by all and plan to retunr next year. Please email if you have any questions at jarms@rogers.com.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Getaway!”
Reviews.Author: eventslady
Reviews.Content: My husband & I recently spent 4 days here without our kids & had a fabulous time. It is centrally located and is within 5-15 minutes to every theme park attraction. The golf course is beautiful & very well maintained. The main pool is wonderful and even has a "sandy beach" area overlooking the lake. There are two other pools on property, we only went to the one near our building and it was very pleasant with a great hot tub area. The resort gave us a complimetary portrait as a souvenier and even though they made us aware of the vacation ownership opportunities available (by voice mail message) they never "pushed" the issue to go through a presentation. We had a studio room which consisted of a king bed & a pull out sofa area w/compact supplied mini kitchen (Microwave & refrigerator) and it was very clean. The staff was extremely friendly and this included everyone from housekeeping to the gate attendants. They had many recreational items available for rentals, we saw swan & duck boats, paddleboats, tandem & double tandem bikes etc. Families were enjoying them everywhere. When I return to Orlando with my children I will certainly stay here again as well as to suggest this facility to all my family and friends.

HotelInfo.Name: Marriott's Grande Vista
HotelInfo.Address: 5925 Avenida Vista, Orlando, FL 32821
